text.ori_cn: 是其一分一合之间，而未免已启学者心、理为二之弊。
text.man_en: It is between one division and one integration, but it has opened up the disadvantages of the scholars' mind and reason being divided into two parts.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is between one and the other, but it has not avoided the ills of the scholars who have been enlightened that the mind and reason are two.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is between one division and one integration, but it has opened up the disadvantages of the scholars' mind and reason being divided into two parts.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the division and unification of these concepts, it inevitably leads scholars to perceive mind and principle as two separate entities.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 它介于一分与一合之间，却开辟了学者的心智与理性被一分为二的弊端。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 它介于一分一合之间，却打开了士人心智一分为二的弊端。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这既是一个分裂又是一个整合，它却揭示了学者们的思想和理智被分成两个部分的劣势。

text.ori_cn: 此后世所以有“专求本心，遂遗物理”之患，正由不知心即理耳。
text.man_en: This is the reason why later generations have the trouble of only seeking their original minds and consequently neglecting the principles of things. This is precisely because they do not realize that the mind is identical with principle.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is the reason why the later generations have the problem of "concentrating on the original mind, and then losing the physics", precisely because they do not know that the mind is the reason.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The reason why later generations have the problem of "focusing on the original mind and leaving behind the physical world" is precisely because they don't know the mind and understand the ears.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The reason why future generations suffer from 'focusing solely on the original mind, thereby neglecting external principles' is precisely because they do not understand that the mind itself is principle.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是后人只追求本心而忽视事物原理的原因。这正是因为他们没有认识到本心与原理是一致的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是后人只求本心而忽视事物道理的原因所在。正是因为他们没有认识到心与理是同一的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是后代只寻求本心而忽视事物原理的原因。这正是因为他们没有意识到心即是理。

text.ori_cn: 夫外心以求物理，是以有誾而不达之处：此告子义外之说，孟子所以谓之不知义也。
text.man_en: The idea that if one seeks the principles of things outside the mind there will be points at which the mind is closed to the outside world and cannot penetrate it is the same as Kao Tzu's doctrine that righteousness is external. This is the reason why Mencius said that he did not know the nature of righteousness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the external mind seeks physics, it is the place where there is yen but not reach: this is the saying outside the righteousness of the suzi, and this is why Mencius said that he did not know the righteousness of it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The husband's external intention is to pursue physics, which is why he fails to achieve it. This is why Mencius said that Gao Zi has an external meaning and does not know the meaning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When one seeks external principles with an outward mind, it leads to superficial and incomplete understanding. This is the reasoning behind Gaozi's concept of external righteousness, which is why Mencius claimed that he did not truly understand righteousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人在心外寻求事物的原理，就会有一些地方使心对外部世界封闭，无法深入其中，这与高子的义在外的学说是一样的。这就是孟子说他不知道义的本质的原因。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若求心外之理，则心有封闭于外而不能参透的地方，与高子的义外之说是一样的。这就是孟子说不知道义性的原因。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人把事物的道理看作是心外之物，那么在某些时候心就会对外界关闭，无法渗透，这是与告子的义外说相同的道理。这就是孟子说他不知道义的本性的原因。

text.ori_cn: 心一而已，以其全体恻怛而言，谓之仁，以其得宜而言谓之义，以其条理而言谓之理。
text.man_en: The mind is one, that is all. In terms of its total commiseration, it is called humanity. In terms of its attainment of what is proper, it is called righteousness. And in terms of its orderliness, it is called principle.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart is only one, and in terms of its entirety compassionate, it is called benevolence, in terms of its appropriateness it is called righteousness, and in terms of its organisation it is called reason.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heart is just one. In terms of its overall compassion, it is called benevolence. In terms of its appropriateness, it is called righteousness. In terms of its order, it is called principle.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is merely a matter of the heart; when it is expressed through empathetic care in its entirety, it is called benevolence; when it is expressed appropriately, it is called righteousness; when it is expressed with coherence, it is called reason.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心灵是一个整体，仅此而已。全心全意，谓之人性。就其达到适当的目的而言，它被称为正义。就其有序性而言，它被称为原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心是一，仅此而已。就其彻底的慈悲而言，这就是人性。就其达到正当而言，就称为义。而就其秩序而言，则称为原则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心一也，是则一也。其全体而怜悯之，谓之仁。其得所宜之谓之义，其理之条理谓之理。

text.ori_cn: 外心以求理，此知、行之所以二也。
text.man_en: Knowledge and action have been separated because people seek principles outside the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The external mind seeks reason; this is the reason why knowledge and action are two.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Seeking truth from the outside is the reason why knowledge and action are twofold.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Externally seeking principles, thus knowing and acting are two different things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知行之所以分离，是因为人们追求的是心灵之外的原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知识和行动之所以分离，是因为人们在心灵之外寻求原则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知行分离，因为人们在心外寻求原则。

text.ori_cn: 朱子以尽心知性知天为物格知致。
text.man_en: Chu Hsi considered that exerting the mind to the utmost, knowing one's nature, and knowing Heaven were equivalent to the investigation of things and the extension of knowledge;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Zhu Zi takes knowing nature and heaven with all one's heart to be the materialistic knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Zhu Zi believed that knowing the nature with all his heart and mind was the basis of knowing the nature of things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zhu Xi considered the exhausting of the mind, the understanding of human nature, and the understanding of Heaven as the extension of knowledge and the attainment of truth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 朱熹认为 "尽心"、"知性"、"知天 "等同于 "格物"、"致知"；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 朱熹认为，用心致志，知性知天，相当于格物致知；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 朱熹认为，尽心知性知天，相当于格物致知；

text.ori_cn: 以存心养性事天为诚意正心修身。
text.man_en: that preserving the mind, nourishing one's nature, and serving Heaven were equivalent to the sincerity of the will, the rectification of the mind, and the cultivation of the personal life;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To keep the heart and nourish the heart to serve Heaven as a sincere and correct mind and body.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Cultivate your character with sincerity and cultivate your character with sincerity and integrity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Cultivate sincerity and integrity in serving Heaven, nurture the mind, and cultivate one's virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他认为，存心、养性、奉天等同于诚意、正心、修身；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 守心、养性、事天，相当于志诚、正心、修身。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 保存心灵、养护天性和侍奉上天等同于意志的真诚、心灵的端正和个人生活的修养；

text.ori_cn: 以殀寿不贰修身以俟为知至仁尽，圣人之事。
text.man_en: and that not allowing any doublemindedness regardless of the longevity or brevity of life but cultivating the personal life while waiting for fate to take its own course were the perfection of knowledge and the complete realization of humanity, all of which are matters pertaining to the sage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To die young and not to be two to cultivate one's body in order to wait for one's knowledge to the end of benevolence, the work of the saints.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is the work of a sage to know that the most benevolent thing is done by not cultivating one's character even if one is young and long-lived.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By preserving oneself and waiting with unwavering efforts to attain supreme benevolence and ultimate wisdom, one follows the path of the sages.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无论生命长短，都不允许三心二意，而是修身养性，等待命运的安排，这就是知识的完善和人性的彻底实现，这些都是与圣人有关的事情。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不论生命的长短，不容许有任何二心，而修养个人生活，等待命运的安排，这就是知识的完善和人性的彻底实现，都是圣人的事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 而不允许任何的三心二意，无论生命的长短，但在等待命运自行发展时培养个人生活是知识的完美和人性的彻底实现，这一切都是圣贤所追求的事情。

text.ori_cn: 若鄙人之见，则与朱子正相反矣。
text.man_en: My humble views, however, are diametrically opposed to those of Chu Hsi.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If my humble opinion, it is the opposite of Zhu Zi.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In my opinion, it is exactly the opposite of Zhu Xi.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In my humble opinion, it is exactly the opposite of what Master Zhu has said.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然而，我的拙见与朱熹的观点截然相反。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 然而，我的拙见与朱熹的观点截然相反。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，我谦卑的观点与朱熹的观点截然相反。

text.ori_cn: 夫尽心知性知天者，生知安行，圣人之事也。
text.man_en: Exerting the mind to the utmost, knowing one's nature, and knowing Heaven are matters known from birth and are practiced naturally and easily. They are matters pertaining to the sage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man who knows heaven with all his heart and soul, who is born to know and act in peace, is also a saint.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who know the heaven with all their heart and soul, will be born with knowledge and safe conduct, which is the work of a sage.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who fully understand their own nature and the nature of heaven are endowed with innate knowledge and move with ease; this is the endeavor of sages.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 尽心、知性、知天，这些都是生而知之、自然而然的事。这些都是与圣人有关的事情。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尽心，知性，知天，是与生俱来的事，自然而容易地实行。这些都是圣人的事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 极尽心智，认识本性，了解天道，是自出生就知道并且自然而轻松地实践的事情。这些事情属于圣人。

text.ori_cn: 存心养性事天者，学知利行，贤人之事也。
text.man_en: Preserving the mind, nourishing one's nature, and serving Heaven are matters learned through study and practiced for their advantage. They are matters pertaining to the worthy
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who keep their hearts and nourish their natures to serve heaven, learn to know and act in a beneficial way, and the work of the wise.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are dedicated to cultivating their nature and serving heaven will learn knowledge and benefit from their actions, which is the work of a wise man.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who nurture their mind and nature, and perform their duties to heaven, learn to benefit their actions; this is the endeavor of the virtuous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 存心、养性、奉天，这些都是通过学习和实践而获得的好处。这些都是与值得
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 养心、养性、事天，是学而行之事。它们是与有价值的人有关的事情
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 保心养性，事天之道，乃学修之利事。皆所属于贤者之事。

text.ori_cn: 夭寿不贰，修身以俟者，困知勉行，学者之事也。
text.man_en: Not allowing any doublemindedness regardless of the longevity or brevity of life but cultivating the personal life while waiting for fate to take its own course are learned through hard work and practiced with effort and difficulty. They are matters pertaining to the student.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The scholar's work is also to be done by those who live young and cultivate their bodies in order to be able to do so.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you are young and live for a short period of time, those who cultivate themselves in time will learn and practice diligently. This is the work of a scholar.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To cultivate oneself and await the right time without deviating from one's principles, diligently seeking knowledge in adversity and striving to act accordingly, is indeed the duty of a scholar.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无论生命长短，都不允许三心二意，修身养性，等待命运的安排。这些都是与学生有关的问题。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 无论生命的长短，不容许有任何二心，而修养个人的生命，等待命运的安排，是在努力中学会的，是在努力和艰辛中实践的。它们是与学生有关的事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不论生命长短，都不能允许任何三心二意，而是在等待命运自行发展的同时，修养个人生活，这些都是通过艰苦努力学习，用心练习并克服困难所掌握的。这是学生应当关注的事项。

text.ori_cn: 此惟圣人而后能然。

text.ori_cn: 故曰，此生知安行，圣人之事也。
text.man_en: For this reason I say that they are matters known from birth and can be practiced naturally and easily, matters pertaining to the sage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is said that this birth of knowledge and safety is also the work of the saints.

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，我说这些都是与生俱来的知识，可以自然轻松地实践，这是属于圣人的事。

text.ori_cn: 存其心者，未能尽其心者也。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 能够保全心志的人，是那些还没有把心志发挥到极致的人。

text.ori_cn: 故须加存之之功。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is necessary to add the work of storage.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the merit of saving must be increased.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, it is necessary to make efforts to preserve it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，他们必须付出额外的努力来保护它。

text.ori_cn: 必存之既久，不待于存，而自无不存，然后可以进而言尽。
text.man_en: As the mind is preserved for a long time, it will be completely preserved without any effort to preserve it, and then one can go a step further and exert it to the utmost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It must be stored for a long time, not waiting to be stored, but since there is nothing not to be stored, and then we can advance to say all.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when it has existed for a long time, ceasing to rely on our efforts to preserve it and naturally remaining in existence, can we advance further and discuss thoroughly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心智保存得久了，就会不费吹灰之力地完全保存下来，进而可以更进一步，发挥到极致。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心久存，则息息自然而存，然后可进而尽其用也.

text.ori_cn: 盖知天之知，如知州知县之知。
text.man_en: The knowledge of knowing the heaven is like knowing the state and the county.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The knowledge of knowing the heaven is like knowing the state and the county.

text.ori_cn: 是与天为一者也。

text.ori_cn: 事天则如子之事父，臣之事君。

text.ori_cn: 致吾心良知之“天理”于事事物物，则事事物物皆得其理矣。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当我心中与生俱来的知识中的 "自然原则 "扩展到万物时，万物都将获得其原则。

text.ori_cn: 致吾心之良知者，致知也。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To the conscience of my heart is to know.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To the innate knowledge of my heart, it is to attain wisdom.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 扩展我心的固有知识，就是知识扩展的问题，

text.ori_cn: 事事物物皆得其理者，格物也。

text.ori_cn: 是合心与理而为一者也。

text.ori_cn: 合心与理而为一，则凡区区前之所云，与朱子晚年之论，皆可以不言而喻矣。
text.man_en: As the mind and principle are combined into one, then all my humble opinions which I have just expressed and my theory that Chu Hsi arrived at his final conclusions late in life can be understood without discussion.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart and the reason to be one, then all the district before the cloud, and Zhu Zi's theory of the late years, all can be self-evident.

text.ori_cn: 〔7〕来书云：“人之心体，本无不明。

text.ori_cn: 而气拘物蔽，鲜有不昏。

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但由于人的心灵受到物质力量的限制，又被外在事物的遮蔽，所以很少有心灵不黑暗的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但由于人的心灵受物质力量的限制，并且被外界事物所蒙蔽，很少有心灵不被蒙蔽。

text.ori_cn: 非学问思辨，以明天下之理，则善恶之机，真妄之辨，不能自觉，任情恣意。
text.man_en: Unless one studies extensively, inquires accurately, thinks carefully, and sifts clearly so as to understand the principles of things, he cannot recognize the activating power of good and evil or the distinction between truth and falsehood.

text.ori_cn: 不可以不辨也，夫学问思辨行，皆所以为学。

text.ori_cn: 如言学孝，则必服劳奉养，躬行孝道，然后谓之学。
text.man_en: Take the learning of filial piety. One must relieve his parents of the burden of toil, serve and care for them, and personally put the principle of filial piety into action before one can be said to be learning filial piety.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If we talk about learning filial piety, then we must serve and feed and perform filial piety, and then it is called learning.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For example, if you want to learn filial piety, you must work hard and support yourself, practice filial piety, and then you can call it learning.

text.ori_cn: 学射，则必张弓挟矢，引满中的。

text.ori_cn: 尽天下之学，无有不行而可以言学者。
text.man_en: In all the world, nothing can be considered learning that does not involve action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are no scholars in the world who can't do what they want to do.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Of all the learning in the world, there is no one who can talk about learning without practicing it.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 世界上没有什么是不付诸行动的学习。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在这个世界上，任何不涉及行动的事物都不能被认为是学习。

text.ori_cn: 则学之始，固已即是行矣。
text.man_en: Thus the very beginning of learning is already action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Then the beginning of learning, is already that is line.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Then the beginning of learning is already done.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Indeed, the beginning of learning is already the commencement of action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，学习的最初阶段就已经是行动了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，学习的开始就是行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，学习的开始本身就是行动。

text.ori_cn: 笃者，敦实笃厚之意。
text.man_en: To be earnest in practice means to be genuine and sincere.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The word "Duk" means "solid and generous".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Du means solid and solid.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The word '笃' implies solidity and steadfastness.

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在实践中要真诚，就是要真实和诚恳。

text.ori_cn: 已行矣。
text.man_en: That is already action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It has been done.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It’s done.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It has already been done.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这已经是行动了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这已经是行动了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那已经是行动了。

text.ori_cn: 而敦笃其行，不息其功之谓尔。
text.man_en: It is to make the action sincere and the effort continuous without stop.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And the saying goes, "Don't rest on your laurels".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: But you should be diligent in your actions and never rest in your achievements.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Steadfast in your actions and relentless in your efforts, that is the essence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 就是要让行动真诚，让努力持续不断。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 就是行动要真诚，努力要不间断。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是要使行动真诚，努力不断停止。

text.ori_cn: 盖学之不能以无疑，则有间。
text.man_en: In learning, one cannot help having doubts. Therefore, one inquires.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The cover cannot be learnt with no doubt, but there is an interval.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no doubt that Gai Xue cannot be certain, and there is a gap.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Since learning cannot be without doubts, there are uncertainties.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人在学习的过程中，难免会有疑惑。因此，人们会产生疑问。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在学习中，不免会有疑问。因此，有人询问。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在学习中，人不能没有疑问。所以，人要不断求问。

text.ori_cn: 问即学也，即行也。
text.man_en: To inquire is to learn; it is to act.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To ask is to learn and to act.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Asking means learning, and acting means doing it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To question is to learn, to act is to understand.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 探究就是学习，就是行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 探究就是学习；探究就是学习；就是行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 询问就是学习；也是一种行动。

text.ori_cn: 又不能无疑，则有思。
text.man_en: As there is still doubt, one thinks.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And if you can't have no doubt, you have a thought.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is no doubt, then there is thought.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If there is any doubt, then one should reflect.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既然还有疑问，人们就会思考。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 既然还有疑问，人们想。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为仍有疑虑，所以会思考。

text.ori_cn: 思即学也，即行也。
text.man_en: To think is to learn; it is to act.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To think is to learn and to act.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Thinking is learning, and doing is action.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thinking is learning and acting at the same time.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 思考就是学习，就是行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 思考就是学习；就是行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 思考就是学习；也是行动。

text.ori_cn: 又不能无疑，则有辨。
text.man_en: As there is still doubt, one sifts.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And if there is no doubt, there is discernment.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is no doubt, then there is a distinction.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If there is any doubt, then there should be discernment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既然仍有疑问，那就进行筛选。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 既然还有疑问，那就筛选一下。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于仍存在疑问，人们会仔细筛选。

text.ori_cn: 辨即学也，即行也。
text.man_en: To sift is to learn; it is to act.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To discern means to learn as well as to act.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Soku Gakuya, Sokugyoya.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Discernment is both learning and action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 筛选就是学习，就是行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 筛选就是学习；就是行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 筛选就是学习；筛选就是行动。

text.ori_cn: 辨既明矣，思既慎矣，问既审矣，学既能矣，又从而不息其功焉，斯之谓笃行。
text.man_en: As the sifting is clear, the thinking careful, the inquiry accurate, and the study competent, one goes further and continues his effort without stop. This is what is meant by earnest practice.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Discernment has been clear, thinking has been prudent, asking has been examined, learning has been able to carry on, and thus do not stop its work, this is called Ducheng.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The distinction is clear, the thinking is careful, the questioning is careful, the learning is capable, and the result is that the work is not stopped. This is called practicing diligently.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When discernment is clear, thought is cautious, inquiry is meticulous, learning is proficient, and one continually strives without ceasing, this is called steadfast practice.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 筛选清楚了，思考仔细了，探究准确了，学习得力了，就会更进一步，马不停蹄地继续努力。这就是认真实践的意义所在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 筛得清，思得缜密，问得准，学得精，就走得更远，继续努力，永不止步。这就是认真修行的意义。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于筛选的清晰，思考的仔细，查询的准确，以及学习的得当，人们不断努力向前。这就是所谓的认真实践。

text.ori_cn: 非谓学问思辨之后而始措之于行也。
text.man_en: It does not mean that after study, inquiry, thinking, and sifting one then takes steps to act.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It does not mean that after learning and thinking and discerning, one begins to put it into action.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It does not mean that we should start to take action after studying and thinking.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is not after theoretical study and intellectual debate that action is taken.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这并不意味着经过学习、探究、思考和筛选之后，人们就会采取相应的行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这并不意味着经过研究、探究、思考和筛选之后，我们就采取步骤去行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这并不意味着在学习、调查、思考和筛选之后就采取行动。

text.ori_cn: 是故以求能其事而言，谓之学。
text.man_en: For this reason I hold that in seeking to acquire the ability to do things, we call the seeking study.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, to seek to be able to speak of its affairs is called learning.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, in terms of seeking to be able to do something, it is called learning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, to seek the ability to accomplish a task and to articulate it is called learning.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，我认为，在寻求获得做事能力的过程中，我们称这种寻求为学习。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此我认为，寻求获得做事的能力，我们称之为求学。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 基于这个原因，我认为在寻求获取做事的能力时，我们称这种寻求为学习。

text.ori_cn: 以求解其惑而言，谓之问。
text.man_en: In seeking to dispel doubts, we call it inquiry.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is called questioning, in the sense of seeking to solve its perplexities.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In terms of solving the confusion, it is called asking.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In order to resolve their doubts, it is termed as asking.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 为了消除疑虑，我们称之为探究。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为了消除疑虑，我们称之为探究。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我们为了消除疑虑，称之为探究。

text.ori_cn: 以求通其说而言，谓之思。
text.man_en: In seeking to understand an idea of a doctrine, we call it thinking.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To seek to make sense of what is said is called thinking.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In order to explain it clearly, it is called thinking.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In order to convey their ideas clearly, it is called thinking.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在寻求对某种学说的理解时，我们称之为思考。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在寻求理解教义的想法时，我们称之为思考。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在试图理解一个教义的概念时，我们称之为思考。

text.ori_cn: 以求精其察而言，谓之辨。
text.man_en: In seeking to examine the idea carefully, we call it sifting.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In terms of seeking to refine their observations, it is called discernment.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In terms of observing carefully, it is called discrimination.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To seek accuracy and clarity in words is called discernment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 为了仔细研究这个想法，我们称之为筛选。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为了仔细检查这个想法，我们称之为筛选。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在仔细研究这个想法时，我们称之为筛选。

text.ori_cn: 以求履其实而言，谓之行。
text.man_en: And in seeking to carry the idea out in actual practice, we call it action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In terms of seeking to fulfil the truth, it is called a line.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In terms of pursuing reality, it is called action.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In terms of seeking to put principles into practice, it is called action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 而将这一理念付诸实践，我们称之为行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为了将这个想法付诸实践，我们称之为行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在实际实践中，我们将实施理念称为行动。

text.ori_cn: 盖析其功而言，则有五。
text.man_en: Speaking from the point of view of separate efforts, they are five,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are five.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In terms of analyzing their merits, there are five.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To analyze its achievements, there are five aspects.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从各自努力的角度来看，它们有五个、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从各自努力的角度来说，他们是五个，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从各自的努力角度来看，他们是五个。

text.ori_cn: 合其事而言，则一而已。
text.man_en: but speaking from the point of view of a combined affair, they are one.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If we put it all together, it's just one thing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As far as the matter is concerned, it is just one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When considering the matter, it is essentially one.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但从综合事务的角度来看，它们是一体的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但从合并的角度来看，他们是一体的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但从综合事务的角度来说，它们是一个整体。

text.ori_cn: 此区区心理合一之体，知行并进之功，所以异于后世之说者，正在于是。
text.man_en: This is precisely where my humble views differ from those of later scholars, that in substance mind and principle are a unity and in our effort knowledge and action advance simultaneously.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is the body of psychological unity and the work of knowledge and action, which is why it is different from what the later generations say.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This mere psychological unity is the result of the simultaneous progress of knowledge and action. The reason why it is different from those of later generations is precisely because of this.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This idea of the unity of mind and body and the practice of integrating knowledge and action is precisely what sets it apart from the theories of later generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这正是我的拙见与后来学者的不同之处，即在实质上，思想和原则是一个统一体，在我们的努力中，知识和行动同时前进。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这正是我的拙见与后人不同的地方，即实质心义是统一的，知行并举。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这正是我的浅见与后来的学者们不同之处，即在本质上，心与理是一体的，在努力中，知与行是同时进步的。

text.ori_cn: 今吾子特举学问思辨以穷天下之理，而不及笃行。
text.man_en: You have mentioned only study, inquiry, thinking, and sifting as ways to investigate the principles of things to the utmost and have not included earnest action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Now my son has specially raised learning and thinking and discernment in order to poor the world's reasoning, but not as good as the practice.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Today, my son is devoted to learning and speculation in order to understand the world's principles, but not to practicing them diligently.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Now, you focus solely on scholarly investigation and dialectical thinking to delve into the principles of the world, but you neglect earnest practice.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你只提到了学习、探究、思考和筛选，这些都是最大限度地探究事物原理的方法，却没有包括认真的行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你们只提到学习、探究、思考、筛选，以最大限度地考察事物的道理，而没有包括认真的行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 您只提到了学习、探究、思考和筛选作为深入研究事物原理的方法，而没有包括认真行动。

text.ori_cn: 是专以学问思辨为知，而谓穷理为无行也已。
text.man_en: This means that you regard study, inquiry, thinking, and sifting alone as knowledge and feel that the investigation of the principles of things to the utmost involves no action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is exclusively learning and thinking as knowing, and it is said that poor reasoning is no action.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is only based on learning and speculation as knowledge, and saying that exhaustion of principles is no practice.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is to focus solely on scholarly reasoning and to regard the pursuit of principles as devoid of practical conduct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这意味着，你们仅仅把学习、探究、思考和筛选看作是知识，并认为对事物原理的深入研究不涉及任何行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 就是说，你只把学习、探究、思考、筛选当作知识，觉得对事物的道理的探究到极点是没有行动的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这意味着你认为只把学习、探究、思考和筛选当作知识，并认为穷尽事物原理的研究不涉及行动。

text.ori_cn: 明道云，“只穷理便尽性至命”。
text.man_en: Ch'eng Hao said, “By merely investigating the principles of things to the utmost one simultaneously fully develops one's nature to the point of fulfilling one's destiny. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mingdao Yun, "Only the poor reason will fulfil the nature to the end."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ming Dao says, "As long as the reason is exhausted, the soul will be exhausted to the end."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mingdao said, 'Only by thoroughly investigating principles can one fully understand essence and destiny.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 钱镠说："穷究事物的原理，同时充分发挥自己的天性，以完成自己的使命。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 程浩说：“只要探究事物的道理到极致，就可以同时充分发挥自己的本性，从而完成自己的命运。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 程颢说道：“只要穷尽事物的原理，同时就能充分发挥自己的本性，达到完成自己的命运。”

text.ori_cn: 故必仁极仁，而后谓之能穷仁之理。
text.man_en: Therefore, one must extend the humanity in one's action to the ultimate of humanity, and only then can one be said to have investigated the principle of humanity to the utmost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is necessary to be extremely benevolent, and then it is said to be able to exhaust the rationale of benevolence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, benevolence must be extremely benevolent, and then it is said that benevolence can be exhausted.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, only by embodying benevolence to the fullest can one be said to comprehend the ultimate principle of benevolence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，一个人必须将自己行动中的人性延伸到人性的极致，只有这样，才能说他将人性的原则探究到了极致。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以，一个人必须把自己的行为中的人性延伸到人性的极致，才可以说是把人性的道理考察到了极致。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，人们必须在行为中将人道精神发挥到极致，只有这样才能说已经探究了人道精神的最高境界。

text.ori_cn: 义极义，而后谓之能穷义之理。
text.man_en: One must extend the righteousness in one's action to the utmost of righteousness. Only then can one be said to have investigated the principle of righteousness to the utmost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Righteousness is extremely righteous, and then it is said to be capable of infinite righteousness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The principle of maximizing righteousness is called the principle of being able to limit righteousness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To the utmost extent of righteousness, and then it is called the ability to comprehend the principles of righteousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个人必须将自己行为中的义扩展到义的极致。只有这样，才能说是将义理探究到了极致。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一个人必须将自己的行为公义发挥到极致。只有这样，才可以说是把义理考察到了极致。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个人必须在行动中将正义发挥到极致。只有这样，才能说这个人已经彻底探究了正义的原则。

text.ori_cn: 仁极仁，则尽仁之性矣。
text.man_en: When humanity is extended to its ultimate, the nature of humanity will be fully realized.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are extremely benevolent, you are as benevolent as you can be.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If benevolence is extremely benevolent, then the nature of benevolence will be fulfilled.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ultimate benevolence, as the epitome of benevolence, fully embodies the nature of benevolence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当人性延伸到极致时，人性的本质将得到充分实现。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当人性延伸到极致时，人性的本质就会得到充分的认识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当人性被推向极致时，人性的本质将会完全实现。

text.ori_cn: 义极义，则尽义之性矣。
text.man_en: When righteousness is extended to its ultimate, the nature of righteousness will be fully realized.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When righteousness is extreme, the nature of righteousness is exhausted.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When righteousness is extremely righteous, it fulfills the nature of righteousness.

I have never warned people against investigating the principles of things to the utmost nor urged them to live in deep seclusion, sit erect, and do nothing.

text.ori_cn: 彼顽空虚静之徒，正惟不能随事随物精察此心之天理，以致其本然之良知，而遗弃伦理、寂灭虚无以为常，是以要之不可以治家国天下。

Instead they abandon human relations and get used to a life of silence, annihilation, emptiness, and nothingness. Thus essentially speaking their way cannot be used to govern the family, the state, and the world.

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart is the master of the body, and the heart's virtual spirit and clear consciousness is the so-called original conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heart is the master of the body, and the spiritual awareness of the heart is the so-called natural conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The heart is the master of the body, and the heart's innate clarity and awareness is what is referred to as the innate knowledge of goodness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心是身体的主宰，心的纯净智慧和清晰意识是与生俱来的知识或原始知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心是身体的主人，心的清净智慧和清明意识是与生俱来的或原始的知识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心灵是身体的主人，心灵的纯粹智慧和清晰意识是先天或原本的知识。

text.ori_cn: 其虚灵明觉之良知应感而动者，谓之意。
text.man_en: When this innate knowledge which is pure intelligence and clear consciousness is influenced by things and events and responds to them with activity, it is called the will.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Its virtual spirit and bright consciousness of the conscience should feel and move, is called the intention.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is the meaning that the conscience of the empty spirit and enlightenment moves in response to the feeling.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The inherent luminous and perceptive conscience, responsive to stimuli, is called intention.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当这种与生俱来的知识，也就是纯粹的智慧和清晰的意识受到事物和事件的影响，并以活动的方式对其做出反应时，它就被称为意志。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当这种纯粹的智力和清晰的意识的固有知识受到事物和事件的影响并以活动对其做出反应时，它被称为意志。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当这种纯粹智慧和清晰意识的天赋知识受到事物和事件的影响并以行为回应时，就被称为意志。

text.ori_cn: 有知而后有意，无知则无意矣。
text.man_en: With knowledge, there will be the will. Without knowledge, there will be no will.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Knowledge leads to intention; ignorance leads to no intention.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When there is knowledge, there is intention; when there is ignorance, there is no intention.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With knowledge comes intention; without knowledge, there is no intention.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有了知识，就有了意志。没有知识，就没有意志。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有了知识，就会有意志。没有知识，就没有意志。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有知识，才会有意志。没有知识，就没有意志。

text.ori_cn: 意之所用，必有其物，物即事也。
text.man_en: For the will to function, there must be the thing in which it is to function, and the thing is an event.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The use of the mind must have its own thing, and the thing is the thing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The purpose of the intention must have its object, and the object is the thing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wherever intention is applied, there must be an entity, and that entity is the matter itself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 意志要发挥作用，就必须有它要发挥作用的事物，而事物就是事件。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为了使意志发挥作用，必须有它在其中发挥作用的事物，而这个事物就是一个事件。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为了使意志发挥作用，必须有其作用对象，而该对象就是一个事件。

text.ori_cn: 如意用于事亲，既事亲为一物，意用于治民，即治民为一物，意用于读书，即读书为一物，意用于听讼，即听讼为一物。
text.man_en: When the will functions in the service of parents, then serving parents is a thing. When the will functions in governing the people, then governing the people is a thing. When the will functions in study, then study is a thing. When the will functions in hearing a law suit, then hearing a law suit is a thing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If one's intention is to serve one's relatives, then one's intention is to serve one's relatives as one thing; if one's intention is to rule the people, then one's intention is to rule the people as one thing; if one's intention is to study, then one's intention is to study as one thing; if one's intention is to listen to litigation, then one's intention is to listen to litigation as one thing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ruyi is used to serve relatives, since serving relatives is one thing, it is intended to be used to govern the people, that is, governing the people is one thing, it is intended to be used to read, that is, reading is one thing, and it is intended to be used to hear lawsuits, that is, hearing lawsuits is one thing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If Yu is used in serving parents, then serving parents is treated as one entity; if Yu is used in governing the people, then governing the people is treated as one entity; if Yu is used in reading, then reading is treated as one entity; if Yu is used in listening to cases, then listening to cases is treated as one entity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当意志在侍奉父母中发挥作用时，侍奉父母就是一件事。志于治民，则治民是事。志于学，则学为事。志于听讼，则听讼为事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当意志发挥作用为父母服务时，侍奉父母就是一件事。当意志发挥作用来治理人民的时候，治理人民就是一件事了。当意志在学习中发挥作用时，学习就是一件事。当意志在审理诉讼时发挥作用时，审理诉讼就成了一件事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 意志在侍奉父母时，侍奉父母就是一件事。意志在治理人民时，治理人民就是一件事。意志在学习时，学习就是一件事。意志在审理案件时，审理案件就是一件事。

text.ori_cn: 凡意之所用，无有无物者：有是意即有是物，无是意即无是物矣。
text.man_en: Wherever the will is applied, there cannot be nothing. Where this is a particular will, there is a particular thing corresponding to it, and where there is no particular will, there will be no particular thing corresponding to it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Where the intention of the use, there is no no matter: there is the intention that there is a thing, no is the intention that there is no thing to carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wherever the meaning is used, there is no such thing as "being" or "nothing": "yes" means that there is such a thing; "wu" means that there is no such thing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wherever intention exists, there is no thing that does not exist: if intention is present, then the thing exists; if intention is absent, then the thing does not exist.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只要有意志，就不可能什么都没有。有特定意志的地方，就有与之相应的特定事物；没有特定意志的地方，就不会有与之相应的特定事物。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 意志所到之处，不可能一无所有。凡是有特定意志的地方，就有与它相对应的特定事物；没有特定意志的地方，就不会有与它相对应的特定事物。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 凡意志所及，必有其事。在某个特定意志存在的地方，就有一个对应的特定事物，而在没有特定意志的地方，就不会有对应的特定事物。

text.ori_cn: “格”字之义，有以“至”字之训者，如“格于文祖”，“有苗来格”，是以“至”训者也。
text.man_en: The meaning of the word "ge" is that it is taught by the word "zhi", such as "ge Yu Wenzu" and "you Miao Lai Ge" are those who are taught by the word "zhi".
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The meaning of the word "格", there are to "to" the word of the training, such as "格于文祖", "有苗来格", is also to the The meaning of the word "格" is also taught by the word "至".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The meaning of the word "ge" is that it is taught by the word "zhi", such as "ge Yu Wenzu" and "you Miao Lai Ge" are those who are taught by the word "zhi".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The meaning of the character '格' is sometimes interpreted as '至' (to arrive), such as in '至于文祖' (to pay respects to the ancestor of literature) and '有苗来格' (the Miao people came to pay tribute), both of which use the interpretation of '至'.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "格 "字的意思是受 "之 "字的教导，如 "格于文祖"、"幽妙来格 "就是受 "之 "字的教导。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “格”字的意思是受“治”字教的，如“格于文足”、“游妙来格”就是受“治”字教的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “格”字的含义是它由“知”字教导，比如“格于文祖”和“由苗赖格”是由“知”字教导的人。

text.ori_cn: 然“格于文祖”，必纯孝诚敬，幽明之间无一不得其理，而后谓之“格”：有苗之顽，实以文德诞敷而后格，则亦兼有“正”字之义在其间，未可专以“至”字尽之也。
text.man_en: However, "modeling on Wenzu" must be pure, filial and sincere, and nothing in the world is unreasonable. Then it is called "model": there is Miao's stubbornness, but it is actually based on Wende and then the model, which also has "righteousness". The meaning of the word "Zhi" lies in the middle, and cannot be exhausted exclusively by the word "Zhi".
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, the "frame in Wenzu", must be pure filial piety, sincerity and respect, no one between the ghost and the Ming can not be reason, and then called "frame": there are seedling of stubborn, really to Wende Xuan Shixi and after the frame, there is also the meaning of the word "correct"! In between, can not be exclusively "to" the word to the end of it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, "modeling on Wenzu" must be pure, filial and sincere, and nothing in the world is unreasonable. Then it is called "model": there is Miao's stubbornness, but it is actually based on Wende and then the model, which also has "righteousness". The meaning of the word "Zhi" lies in the middle, and cannot be exhausted exclusively by the word "Zhi".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, when one speaks of 'imitating the ancestor of literature,' one must exhibit pure filial piety and sincere respect, understanding everything between the visible and invisible realms, and only then can it be called 'imitating.' The stubbornness of the Miao people, in fact, was transformed by the spread of literary virtues, thus the word 'correct' is also implicitly included in it; it cannot solely be explained by the word 'utmost.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然则 "以文祖为楷模"，必纯、孝、诚，天下无不理者。则谓之 "模"：有苗裔之顽，实以文德而后模，亦有 "义 "也。"之 "字之义在中，不能专以 "之 "字尽之。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但“效法文祖”必须是纯洁、孝顺、真诚的，世间没有不合理的事。则曰“范”：有苗之顽，实乃以文德而后范，亦有“义”。 “止”字的意义就在中间，不能单靠“止”字来穷尽。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，「以文祖为楷模」必须纯正、孝顺和真诚，世界上没有什么不合情理的事情。然后才称为「楷模」：虽有苗的固执，实在是根据文德才成为楷模，这里面也有「正义」。 「知」字的意义在于中庸，不能单独用「知」字完全表达。

text.ori_cn: 如“格其非心”，“大臣格君心之非”之类，是则一皆“正其不正以归于正”之义，而不可以“至”字为训矣。
text.man_en: In such sayings as “rectifying the evil of his heart” and “A great minister rectifies what is wrong in the ruler's mind” the idea is that of rectifying what is incorrect so it can return to its original correctness, and cannot be interpreted to mean reach.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Such as the "frame its non-heart", "ministers to frame the heart of the king's non-" and so on, is a "correct its incorrect in order to return to the correct" meaning, and can not be "to the The word "to" is not to be taken as an instruction.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For example, "check the wrong heart of the person", "the minister checks the wrong heart of the king", etc. These all have the meaning of "correcting the wrong and returning it to the right", and cannot be used as a precept with the word "to".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Expressions such as 'correcting one's own heart's falsehoods' and 'a minister correcting the ruler's heart's falsehoods' all imply the meaning of 'rectifying the incorrect to return to what is correct,' and should not be interpreted using the term 'to reach.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所谓 "正其心之邪"、"大臣正君心之不正"，意思是纠正不正确的东西，使其恢复到原来的正确状态，不能理解为达到目的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所谓“正其心之恶”、“大夫正其君心之不正”，其意思是指纠正不正确的事物，使之恢复原状，不能解释为“抵达。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在诸如“正其心之邪”和“贤臣正君之不正”这些说法中，正是指纠正错误，使之恢复到原来的正确，而不能解释为达到。

text.ori_cn: 如以“至”字为义者，必曰“穷至事物之理”，而后其说始通。
text.man_en: If it must be interpreted in the sense of reaching, it would be necessary to say “investigating to the utmost until you reach the principle of all things, ” in order to make sense.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the word "to" for the meaning of the word, it must be said "poor to the reason of things", and then it is said to be through.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For example, if the word "zhi" is used as its meaning, it must be said to be "the ultimate principle of things", and then the explanation will begin to make sense.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one construes the term 'zhi' (to) as 'reach,' it must imply 'exhaustively reach the principles of things,' only then does the interpretation become coherent.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一定要从 "达到 "的意义上解释，那就必须说 "穷究至极，直至达到万物之理 "才有意义。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果一定要从“达”的意义上来解释的话，就必须说“究极，达万物之理”才有意义。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果必须解释为达到目的，那就有必要说“穷究事物的道理直至明白事物的原理”，才能说得通。

text.ori_cn: 是其用功之要，全在一“穷”字，用力之地，全在一“理”字也。
text.man_en: In that case, the importance of the task lies completely in investigating to the utmost and the object of the task lies entirely in principles.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the essence of its work, all in a "poor" word, the place of exertion, all in a "reason" word also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The key to learning is all in the word "poverty", and the place to exert effort is all in the word "reason".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The essence of effort lies entirely in thorough investigation, and the focus of exertion is entirely on principles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在这种情况下，任务的重要性完全在于最大限度地调查，任务的目标完全在于原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那么，任务的重要性就完全在于探究到底，任务的目的就完全在于原则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在这种情况下，任务的重要性完全在于尽最大努力进行调查，而任务的目的完全在于原则。

text.ori_cn: 夫“穷理尽性”，圣人之成训，见于系辞者也。
text.man_en: The accepted teachings of Confucius on the investigation of the principles of things to the utmost and the full development of one's nature are found in the “Appended Remarks” of the Book of Changes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The "exhaustion of reason and nature", the saint's training, is also found in the dictionary.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Husband "exhausts reason and nature", which is the sage's training, and can be seen in those who make remarks.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The principle of ‘exhaustively understanding natural principles and fully developing one's nature’ is a revered teaching of the sages, as found in the appendices.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孔子关于穷究事物之理、充分发挥人的天性的公认学说，见于《易经》的 "附言"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孔子所公认的格格不入、成性的教义，见于《易经》的“附言”。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孔子关于穷尽事物的原理和充分发展人性的公认教义，见于《易经》的《系辞》篇。

text.ori_cn: 盖《大学》“格物”之说，自与“系辞，”“穷理”大旨虽同，而微有分辨：“穷理”者，兼格致诚正而为功也。
text.man_en: Although the idea of the investigation of things in the Great Learning and that of the investigation of the principles of things to the utmost in the “Appended Remarks” are fundamentally in agreement, there are slight differences. By investigating the principles to the utmost is meant that the task includes the investigation of tilings, the extension of knowledge, the sincerity of the will, and the rectification of the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Cover the "University" "Ge Shi" said, since the "Department of rhetoric," "poor reason" although the same purpose, but there is a slight distinction: "poor reason The "poor reason" is also a function of sincerity and righteousness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The theory of "Gewu" in "Great Learning" is naturally related to "Xici". Although the main purpose of "poor principles" is the same, there is a slight difference: "Poor principles" are both meritorious and upright.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The doctrine of 'investigating things' in the 'Great Learning' is, in essence, the same as the overarching principle of 'exploring principles' in the 'Appended Statements,' yet there are subtle distinctions: 'exploring principles' involves not only the investigation and understanding but also the sincerity and rectification of one's intentions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 大学》中 "格物 "的思想与《附 论》中 "致知 "的思想虽然基本一致，但也有细微的差别。所谓格物致知，是指格物、致知、诚意、正心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《大学》的求物思想与《附注》中的极求物理的思想虽然在根本上是一致的，但也有细微的差别。究其理，就是要考察瓦片、广博知识、诚心志、正心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 尽管《大学》中的格物之义和《系辞传》中尽物之理的理念在根本上是一致的，但仍有些许差异。尽物之理意味着这一任务包括格物、致知、诚意、正心。

text.ori_cn: 故言“穷理”，则格、致、诚、正之功皆在其中，言“格物”，则必兼举致知、诚意、正心，而后其功始备而密。
text.man_en: Therefore whenever we talk about the investigation of the principles of things to the utmost, we include in it the task of the investigation of things, the extension of knowledge, the sincerity of the will, and the rectification of the mind; and whenever we talk about the investigation of things, we have to mention the extension of knowledge, the sincerity of the will, and the rectification of the mind at the same time. Only when it includes these can its task be complete and thorough.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, when it comes to the "poor reasoning", the work of grasping, dedication, sincerity and correctness are all included in it, and when it comes to the "grasping of material things", Zhi Zhi Zhi, sincerity and correctness of mind must be taken up at the same time, and then its work will be complete and dense.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, when we talk about "Qiu Li", the merits of grid, Zhizhi, sincerity, and righteousness are all included in it. When we talk about "studying things", we must also develop knowledge, sincerity, and righteousness, and then the merits will begin to be prepared and dense.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, when we speak of 'exhausting the principles,' all the efforts of understanding, achieving, being sincere, and being upright are included therein; when we speak of 'investigating things,' it must encompass the cultivation of knowledge, sincerity, and uprightness, only then can the efforts be complete and thorough.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，每当我们谈到格物致知的时候，就包含了格物、致知、诚意、正心的任务；每当我们谈到格物的时候，就不得不同时提到致知、诚意、正心。只有包含了这些，它的任务才是完整和彻底的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故凡讲究理之事，皆有格事、致知、诚志、正心之事，故谓之究其理也。而每当我们谈到格物的时候，就不得不同时提到知识的广度、意志的真诚、心灵的正正。只有包含了这些，它的任务才算完整、彻底。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，每当我们谈到穷理尽性的时候，我们包括了格物、致知、诚意、正心的任务；每当我们谈到格物，我们同时不得不提到致知、诚意和正心。只有包括这些，任务才算完整和彻底。

text.ori_cn: 今偏举“格物”而遂谓之“穷理”，此所以专以“穷理”属“知”，而谓“格物”未常有行。
text.man_en: To mention only the investigation of things and dogmatically to say that is the investigation of the principles of things to the utmost is to regard the latter as belonging entirely to the sphere of knowledge and the investigation of things as involving no action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is why the term "poor reasoning" is used exclusively as "knowledge", and "grasping things" is not always practised. This is the reason why the term "poor reason" is used exclusively in the context of "knowledge", while the term "grasping things" is said to be infrequent.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Today, we prefer "investigating things" and call it "exhausting principles". This is why "exhausting principles" belongs to "knowledge", and it is not always practiced to "examine things".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Now, singling out 'investigating things' and thus calling it 'understanding principles,' is why 'understanding principles' is exclusively attributed to 'knowledge,' while 'investigating things' is perceived as never having been practiced.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果只提到对事物的探究，并教条地说这是对事物原理的最大探究，那么就会把后者视为完全属于知识的范畴，而把对事物的探究视为不涉及任何行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只提格物，教条地说这是格物的极致，那就是把格物完全属于知识的范畴，格物不涉及行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 仅仅提到格物致知，并武断地说这就是尽全力探究事物的道理，就是把后者完全看作是知识的范畴，而将格物看作不涉及行动。

text.ori_cn: 非惟不得“格物”之旨，幷“穷理”之义而失之矣。
text.man_en: This is not only to fail to understand the idea of the investigation of things but also to fail to grasp the meaning of the investigation of the principles of things to the utmost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Not only is the purpose of "grasping things" not possible, but also the meaning of "poor reasoning" has been lost.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Not only does it miss the purpose of "investigating things", but it also misses the meaning of "improving principles".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Not only do they fail to grasp the essence of investigating things, but they also lose the meaning of comprehending principles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这不仅是没有理解 "格物 "的思想，也没有最大限度地把握 "格物 "的意义。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这不仅是没有理解格物的思想，而且是没有最大限度地把握格物的意义。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这不仅是没有理解格物的思想，而且也没有充分把握格物至理的含义。

text.ori_cn: 此后世之学所以析知、行为先后两截，日以支离决裂，而圣学益以残晦者，其端实始于此。
text.man_en: This is the reason why later scholars have separated knowledge and action into two sections and have been daily involved in fragmentary and isolated details and broken pieces, and this is really why the doctrine of the Sage has been gradually declining and fading away.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is the reason why the studies of later generations have been separated into two parts, namely, knowledge and behaviour, and have become increasingly fragmented and fragmented, and why the Sacred Learning has become more and more obscure, and this is where it all began.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The reason why the learning of later generations divided knowledge and behavior into two parts gradually became fragmented and fragmented, and the sacred learning became more and more obscuring. It actually started here.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The subsequent dissection of knowledge and action into two separate parts, leading to increasing fragmentation and disintegration day by day, and the further obscuration of the sage's teachings, actually began from this point.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这也是后世学者将知行割裂为两部分，日日涉及零碎、孤立的细节和断片的原因，也确实是圣人学说逐渐衰落、消逝的原因。

I am afraid this is also wrong. ”

text.ori_cn: 盖鄙人之见，则谓意欲温清、意欲奉养者，所谓“意”也，而未可谓之“诚意”：必实行其温清奉养之意，务求自慊而无自欺，然后谓之“诚意”。
text.man_en: My view is that when the will desires to care for the comfort of parents in both winter and summer, and to serve and support them, the will exists but not yet the sincerity of the will. Before the will can be said to be sincere, there must be the actual practice of caring for their comfort and of serving and supporting them until one is satisfied and has no selfdeception.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Cover my humble opinion, it is said that those who want to be warm and clear, and want to be nurtured, the so-called "intention", but can not be called "sincerity": it must be implemented to warm and clear and nurtured, and strive to be dissatisfied without self-deception, and then called "sincerity". text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In my humble opinion, the intention to care for and support one's parents is merely an 'intention,' and cannot be called 'sincerity.' Only by putting this intention into practice, and by striving to be content without self-deception, can it be considered 'sincerity.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我的观点是，当一个人希望无论冬夏都能照顾父母的舒适、侍奉和赡养父母时，他的意愿是存在的，但还不是意愿的真诚。在 "志诚 "之前，还必须有 "虑父母之安"、"事父母之养 "的实际行动，直到心满意足，不再自欺欺人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我的看法是，当意志想要冬夏双休地照顾父母的舒适、侍奉、赡养父母的时候，意志是存在的，但意志的诚意还没有达到。在可以说意志是真诚的之前，必须有实际的实践来照顾他们的舒适，服务和支持他们，直到一个人感到满意并且不自欺欺人。

text.ori_cn: 知如何而为温清之节，知如何而为奉养之宜者，所谓“知”也，而未可谓之“致知”：必致其知如何为温清之节者之知，而实以之温清，致其知如何为奉养之宜者之知，而实以之奉养，然后谓之“致知”。

text.ori_cn: 温清之事，奉养之事，所谓“物”也，而未可谓之“格物”：必其于温清之事也，一如其良知之所知当如何为温清之节者而为之，无一毫之不尽，于奉养之事也，一如其良知之所知当如何为奉养之宜者而为之，无一毫之不尽，然后谓之“格物”。
text.man_en: The mere facts of caring for the parents' comfort and serving and supporting them are things and should not be regarded as the investigation of things. Caring for the comfort of parents must be carried out entirely according to what the innate faculty knows to be the regular details of caring for them, without the least bit left undone. Only then can things be said to have been investigated.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The matter of warmth and clarity, the matter of consecration, the so-called "things", but not yet can be said to be "grasping things": it must be in the matter of warmth and clarity, as its conscience knows how to do for the section of warmth and clarity, without the slightest incompleteness, and in the matter of consecration, as its conscience knows how to do In the matter of support, as his conscience knows how to do for the sake of support, there is not the slightest incompleteness, and then it is said that "to make things".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The matter of warmth and purity, the matter of service and support, are so-called "things", but cannot be said to be "objects": they must be done in the matter of warmth and purity, just as one's conscience knows how to do it for the sake of warmth and purity. text.ori_cn: 故曰“物格而后知至”：致其知温清之良知，而后温清之意始诚：致其知奉养之良知，而后奉养之意始诚。
text.man_en: Therefore, it is said that “when things are investigated, knowledge is extended. ” Only after the innate knowledge that knows how to care for the parents' comfort is extended can the will to care for them be sincere, and only after the innate knowledge that knows how to serve and support them is extended can the will to serve and support them be sincere.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is said that "the object is grasped and then the knowledge is attained": to the conscience of knowing warmth and clarity, then the intention of warmth and clarity begins to be sincere: to the conscience of knowing to be nurtured, then the intention of nurturing begins to be sincere.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故曰 "格物致知"。""知之者不如好之者，好之者不如乐之者。

text.ori_cn: 故曰“知至而后意诚”；此区区“诚意、致知、格物”之说盖如此：吾子更熟思之，将亦无可疑者矣。
text.man_en: Therefore it is said that “when knowledge is extended, the will becomes sincere. ” These are my humble views on the sincerity of the will, the extension of knowledge, and the investigation of things. If you think them over thoroughly, you will no longer have any doubt.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, it is said, 'Only by perfecting knowledge can one achieve sincerity in intention.' This humble understanding of 'sincerity of intention, extension of knowledge, and investigation of things' is as such. If you contemplate it further, you will find no room for doubt.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故曰："知之广，则志诚。以上是我对 "志诚"、"致知"、"格物 "的一些浅见。若能深思熟虑，便不会再有疑问。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故曰：“知之广，志则诚。 ”这是我对志诚、学问、格物的拙见。如果你仔细想一想，你就不会再有任何怀疑了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此有人说“当知识得到扩展，意志就会变得真诚。” 这些是我对意志真诚、知识扩展和格物致知的拙见。如果你仔细考虑，你就不会再有任何疑问了。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 至于那些细微的细节和不断变化的情况，其中在开始时的微不足道的错误可能会导致最终的巨大错误，它们需要在我们了解之前进行研究。

text.ori_cn: 至于舜之不告而娶，武之不葬而兴师，养志、养口，小杖，大杖，割股，庐墓等事，处常，处变，过与不及之，必须讨论是非，以为制事之本，然后心体无蔽，临事无失”道之大端易于明白，此语诚然。
text.man_en: But in such cases as Emperor Shun's getting married without first telling his parents, King Wu's launching a military expedition before burying his father, Tseng Tzu's nourishing the will of his father while his son nourished his mouth and body, Tseng Tzu's bearing his father's heavy beating or light beating without complaint, a filial son's cutting his own thigh to make medicine for his sick parent, and the crown prince of T'eng's building by the grave a shed in which to mourn his father, the question of what to do under normal conditions or under an emergency, and what is too much or not enough, must be deliberated with reference to right and wrong so as to provide a basis for handling affairs in the proper way. Only then can the substance of the mind be free from obscuration and one's will not be at a loss when things happen. ” It is quite true, as you have said, that the foundations of truth are easy to understand.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: As for Shun's not to tell and marry, Wu not buried and the division, raise the will, raise the mouth, a small staff, big staff, cut the stock, Lushu tomb, etc., at the usual, at the change, too much and too little, we must discuss the rights and wrongs, as a system of things, and then the body of the mind is not obscured, no loss of things, "the Road of the end of the big easy to understand, the words are true.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As for Shun's marrying without telling him, Wu's raising an army without burying him, raising his ambitions and raising his mouth, using small sticks and big sticks, cutting his legs, and huts and tombs, etc., everything is the same, everything is changing, and everything is over and under, we must discuss right and wrong. The foundation of managing things, then the mind and body are unobstructed, and there are no mistakes in dealing with things." The big end of the Tao is easy to understand, and this statement is true.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for Shun's marriage without informing and Wu's mobilization of troops without mourning, as well as matters like nurturing ambition, nurturing the mouth, minor reprimands, major reprimands, cutting flesh, tending to graves, and so on, one must discuss right and wrong in dealing with the ordinary and extraordinary, the excess and the deficit. Only then can the principles of handling affairs be established, ensuring a clear mind and no mistakes in handling matters. The major principles of the Way are clear and easily understood; this statement is indeed true.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，舜帝瞒着父母娶妻，武王未葬父而出兵，曾子养父之志而养子之口与身，曾子忍父之重打、轻打而毫无怨言、孝子割自己的大腿给生病的父母做药，太子在坟前搭棚悼念父亲，这都是在正常情况下或紧急情况下应该做什么，什么是多，什么是少的问题，都必须以是非为标准来思考，这样才能为正确处理事情提供依据。只有这样，才能心无杂念，遇事才不会手足无措。"正如你所说，真理的基础是容易理解的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但舜帝不告父母而成亲，武王先征兵，埋葬父亲，曾子养父志，子养口身，曾子承受父亲重打。或轻打无怨，孝子割断大腿给生病的父母做药，滕太子在墓旁搭建棚子悼念父亲，正常情况下该怎么办的问题情况或紧急情况，过多或不足，都要斟酌是非，为正确处理事情提供依据。只有这样，心体才能没有障碍，遇到事情时才不会手足无措。正如您所说，真理的基础确实很容易理解。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但是在像舜帝没有先告诉父母就结婚，周武王还没有安葬父亲就发动军事行动，曾子在父亲去世后自己养志而儿子养身，曾子承受父亲的重打或轻打而无怨言，孝子割开自己的大腿为生病的父母制药，或滕国的太子在父亲墓旁建棚守孝这样的情形中，究竟是在正常情况下还是紧急情况下，该怎么做，什么是过度或不够，都必须参考对与错来进行审议，以提供处理事务的正确依据。只有这样，心灵的实质才能免于被遮蔽，事情发生时，意志才不会陷入迷失。确实如你所说，真理的基础是容易理解的。

text.ori_cn: 顾后之学者忽其易于明白者而弗由，而求其难于明白者以为学，此其所以“道在迩而求诸远，事在易而求诸难“也。
text.man_en: However, students of later generations neglect what is easy to understand and do not follow it but seek what is difficult to understand and make it their object of study. This is why “truth lies in what is near and men seek for it in what is remote and the work lies in what is easy and men seek for it in what is difficult. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The scholars of the future neglected those who are easy to understand, and sought to learn those who are difficult to understand, which is why "the way is far away and seeks far away, and things are easy and seeks difficult".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Scholars who care about later generations tend to ignore things that are easy to understand and don't understand them, and look for things that are difficult to understand as a way to learn. This is why "the way is near but seeks things far away; things are easy but things are difficult to understand".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who study the classics neglect the easy-to-understand aspects and instead pursue the difficult-to-comprehend ones, considering this as scholarly pursuit. This is why 'the Way lies nearby, yet they seek it from afar; the matter is simple, yet they seek the complex.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然而，后世的学生却忽视了易懂的东西，不去追随它，而是去寻求难懂的东西，并把它作为自己的研究对象。这就是为什么 "真理在近而人求之于远，功业在易而人求之于难"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 而后世之学者，忽视了易懂的东西，不去遵循它，而追求难懂的东西，把它作为研究的对象。故“道在近处，人求在远处；工在易处，人求在难处”。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，后代的学生忽视了容易理解的东西，不去追随它，而是寻求难以理解的东西，并将其作为研究对象。这就是为什么“真理在于近处而人们却在远处寻求，工作在于容易而人们却在人难处寻求。”

text.ori_cn: 人病不由耳。”
text.man_en: The trouble is that men do not follow it. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People are sick by the ears."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People's illnesses cannot be caused by their ears. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Illness is not controlled by the ear.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 问题在于人们不遵守它。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 问题是人们不遵循它。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 问题是人们不遵循它。

text.ori_cn: 良知、良能，愚夫、愚妇与圣人同：但惟圣人能致其良知，而愚夫、愚妇不能致，此圣愚之所由分也。
text.man_en: In innate knowledge and innate ability, men and women of simple intelligence and the sage are equal. Their difference lies in the fact that the sage alone can extend his innate knowledge while men and women of simple intelligence cannot.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conscientious knowledge and virtuous ability are the same as those of the saints: but the saints are able to attain their conscientiousness, while the foolish men and women are not, and this is the reason why the saints and the foolish are divided.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Conscience and good ability, fools and women are the same as saints: but only saints can achieve their conscience, but fools and women cannot. This is the reason why saints are foolish.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Conscience and innate ability are the same in both the unlearned and the sage: but only the sage can fully realize his conscience, while the unlearned cannot. This is what distinguishes the sage from the unlearned.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在先天知识和先天能力方面，具有简单智慧的男人和女人与圣人是平等的。他们的区别在于，只有圣人能够扩展他的先天知识，而具有简单智慧的男女则不能。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在先天知识和先天能力上，愚人与圣人的男女是平等的。其不同之处，在于圣人独能扩展其先天知识，而愚人则不能。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在天赋知识和天赋能力上，普通智力的男女和圣人是平等的。他们的区别在于，只有圣人才能扩展他的天赋知识，而普通智力的男女做不到。

text.ori_cn: 节目时变，圣人夫岂不知，但不专以此为学：而其所谓学者，正惟致其真知，以精察此心之天理，而与后世之学不同耳。
text.man_en: Programs change from time to time, don't saints know, but they don't specialize in this as a study: and the socalled scholars are just to achieve their true knowledge, to carefully observe the heavenly principles of this heart, and they are different from the learning of later generations.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saints were not aware of the changes in the programme, but they did not study exclusively in this way: and their so-called scholars were only trying to achieve their true knowledge in order to observe the heavenly principles of this mind, which were different from the studies of the later generations.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Programs change from time to time, don't saints know, but they don't specialize in this as a study: and the so-called scholars are just to achieve their true knowledge, to carefully observe the heavenly principles of this heart, and they are different from the learning of later generations.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Times and circumstances change, as sages surely understand, but they do not focus solely on this in their studies. What is meant by their learning is to attain true knowledge, by meticulously examining the natural principles of the mind, which differs from the learning of later generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 纲常时变，圣人不知，但不专此为学：而所谓学者，不过欲得其真知，细观此心天理而已，与后世之学不同。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 纲目时时变化，圣人岂不知，但不专此为学：而所谓学者，只是为了成就真知，细心观察此心天理，而已。与后世之学不同。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 程序时常变化，圣人岂不知，但他们并不专注于此作为研究：而所谓的学者只是为了达到他们的真正知识，仔细观察这个心的天理，他们与后世的学习不同。

text.ori_cn: 吾子未暇良知之致，而汲汲焉顾是之忧，此正求其离于明白者以为学之蔽也。
text.man_en: You devote no time to extending innate knowledge but unceasingly worry about details and circumstances. This is exactly the trouble of seeking what is difficult to understand and making it the object of study.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: My son had no time for the attainment of a good knowledge, but drew on his own worries, and this is what he seeks from those who are not in a position to understand to think that the study of the blind is also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: My son has no time to think about the consequences of his conscience, but he is busy studying and caring about this worry. This is because he is seeking to stay away from understanding and thinks that it is a shield for learning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: My son has not yet had the opportunity to fully understand innate knowledge, and he is already preoccupied with these worries. This is precisely the obstacle in learning, seeking something obscure instead of clarity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你没有时间扩展先天的知识，却不停地担心细节和环境。这正是寻求难以理解的东西并将其作为研究对象的麻烦所在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你没有时间去拓展先天知识，而是不断地担心细节和环境。这正是寻求难以理解的事物并将其作为研究对象的麻烦。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你不致力于扩展天生的知识，却不断地担心细节和环境。这正是寻求难以理解的东西并将其作为研究对象的麻烦之处。

text.ori_cn: 使舜之心而非诚为无后，武之心而非诚于为救民，则其不告而娶与不葬而兴师，乃不孝、不忠之大者。
text.man_en: If Emperor Shun's mind was not sincere about having no posterity, and King Wu's mind was not sincere about saving the people, then the former's marrying without first telling his parents and the latter's expedition without first burying his father would be cases of the greatest filial impiety and disloyalty.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If Shun's heart is not sincere to be without a queen, and Wu's heart is not sincere to save the people, then his marrying and burying without telling them is the greatest of unfiliality and disloyalty.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If Shun's heart was not sincere and he had no heirs, and if his heart was martial rather than sincere in saving the people, then he would marry without informing and raise an army without burying him, which would be a great act of unfilial piety and disloyalty.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If Shun's intention was truly to avoid having no descendants, and Wu's intention was genuinely to save the people, then his actions of marrying without informing and mobilizing the army without conducting a proper burial are, indeed, the greatest acts of unfilialness and disloyalty.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果舜帝之心不诚于无后，武王之心不诚于救民，那么前者娶妻而不告父母，后者出征而不葬父，就是最大的不孝不忠。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若舜之心不诚于无后，武王之心不诚于救民，则前者嫁人不先告父母，后者出征不先葬父，便是大不孝。和不忠诚。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果舜帝沒有真心相信不留下後代，而武王沒有真心相信拯救百姓，那麼前者在未告知父母的情況下結婚，後者在未安葬父親的情況下出征，將會是極大不孝與不忠的例子。

text.ori_cn: 而后之人不务致其良知，以精察义理于此心感应酬酢之间，顾欲悬空讨论此等变常之事，执之以为制事之本，以求临事之无失，其亦远矣。
text.man_en: People of later generations do not devote themselves to the extension of innate knowledge in order carefully to examine the moral principles in the mind's contact with, response to, and dealing with things, but want to discuss these unusual deeds in a vacuum, hold on to them as a basis for handling affairs, and hope not to be at a loss when things happen. They are far off the mark!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And after the people do not work to achieve its conscience, in order to fine understanding of righteousness in the heart of this induction entertainment, Gu want to suspend the discussion of these changes in the air, the implementation of the system as the basis of the matter, in order to the matter of no loss, and it is also far away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Later people do not bother to pay attention to their conscience, and carefully observe the principles of justice in this heart. They are willing to discuss such abnormal things, and regard them as the foundation of making things happen, so as to avoid any mistakes in the matter. Far away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Later generations failed to cultivate their innate knowledge by meticulously examining the sense of duty and reason in the responses and interactions of their minds. Instead, they sought to engage in abstract discussions of extraordinary matters, treating them as the fundamental principles for governing affairs, hoping to achieve infallibility in their actions. This approach, however, is quite distant from the truth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 后人不是致力于先天知识的扩展，以仔细研究心灵接触、回应和处理事物时的道德原则，而是希望在真空中讨论这些不寻常的行为，并将其作为处理事务的依据，希望在事情发生时不会茫然失措。这就大错特错了！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 后人不致力于先天知识的延伸，以仔细考察心灵接触、反应、处理事物中的道德原则，而是想在真空中讨论这些不寻常的行为，坚持以此作为办事的依据，希望事情发生时不要手足无措。他们离目标还很远！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 后代人不专心于扩充天赋之知，以审察心与事接触、反应和处理中的道德原则，却想空谈这些不寻常的行为，把它们当作处理事务的依据，并希望在事情发生时不至于无所适从。真是大错特错！

text.ori_cn: 其余数端，皆可类推，则古人致知之学，从可知矣。
text.man_en: It can be shown through inference by analogy that the same is true of the other cases you have mentioned. From the above we can know the ancient doctrine of the extension of knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The rest of the several ends, all can be analogous, then the ancients Zhi Zhi Zhi learning, from can be known.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The rest of the numbers can all be deduced by analogy, and the knowledge gained by the ancients can be understood.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All other cases can be inferred by analogy, thus the ancient scholars' pursuit of knowledge can be understood.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 通过类比推理可以证明，你提到的其他情况也是如此。综上所述，我们可以知道古代的知识扩展学说。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 触类旁通，你提到的其他案例也是如此。由上可知古代的知识延展学说。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 通过类比推理可以证明，你提到的其他情况也是如此。由上述内容可知，这是古代知识扩展的原理。

text.ori_cn: 〔11〕来书云：“谓《大学》“格物”之说，专求本心，犹可牵合：至于六经、四书所载“多闻多见”，“前言往行”，“好古敏求”，“博学审问”，“温故知新”、“博学详说”，“好问好察”，是皆明白求于事为之际、资于论说之间者，用功节目固不容紊矣。”
text.man_en: Your letter says, “To say that the theory of the investigation of things in the Great Learning means to seek the original mind may be accepted as an arbitrary combination of the two ideas. But the Six Classics and the Four Books contain sayings that teach ‘hearing and seeing much, ' ‘remembering the words and deeds of former men, ' ‘love of antiquity and earnestly seeking it there, ' ‘learning extensively and inquiring accurately, ' ‘reviewing the old so as to know the new, ' ‘studying extensively and discussing thoroughly, ' and ‘taking delight in questioning and examining. ' All these clearly show a search within the realm of events and a reliance on deliberation and discussion. It is clear that no confusion should be allowed in the details to which one's effort is devoted. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [11] The letter said: "The University" "material" said, focusing on the original heart, can still fit: as for the six sutras, the four books contained in the "hear more and see more", "the previous words to line ", "Being ancient and sensitive", "Being knowledgeable and inquisitive", "Learning from the past", "Learning from the past", "Learning in detail ", "good questions and good investigation", are understood to seek at the time of the matter for the occasion, the capital in the discussion between the person, the use of the programme can not be disorganized."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔11〕 The letter says: "It is said that the theory of "investigating things" in "The Great Learning" only seeks the original intention, but it can still be related: as for the "learn more and see more", "preface and practice", and "good practice" recorded in the Six Classics and Four Books "Gu Min Qiu", "Learned to interrogate", "Review the past to learn new things", "Learned to explain in detail", "Love to ask questions and observe", all of them understand that seeking is based on the situation of doing things and being able to discuss and explain, so the learning program must not be disrupted. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [11] The letter states: 'As for the theory of 'gewu' in the Great Learning, which focuses solely on understanding one's own mind, it might be somewhat plausible. However, the concepts of 'hearing and seeing much,' 'reflecting on past teachings and actions,' 'cherishing antiquity and eagerly seeking knowledge,' 'broad learning and careful inquiry,' 'reviewing the old to understand the new,' 'broad learning and detailed explanation,' and 'being inquisitive and perceptive' as recorded in the Six Classics and the Four Books, are all evidently about seeking knowledge from practical affairs and deriving understanding from discussions. Hence, the structured effort in these aspects cannot be denied.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："说《大学》中的格物致知之理是指寻求本心，这可能是对两种思想的任意组合。但'六经'、'四书'中有'多闻'、'慎思'、'好古'、'博学而笃志'、'温故而知新'、'博学而慎思'、'审问而近思'的说法。'"这些都清楚地表明了对事物内部的探求以及对思考和讨论的依赖。显然，在努力的细节上不允许有任何混乱。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 来信中说：“大学格物论说求本心，可以说是两种思想的任意结合。而六经四书则有“多闻多见”、“记前人言行”、“好古而求之”、“博学而求准”、“广博求问”等说法。温故知新，“博学深议”，“乐于质问”。所有这些都清楚地表明了对事件领域的探索以及对审议和讨论的依赖。显然，不应允许一个人所致力于的细节出现混乱。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说，“将《大学》中的‘格物致知’解读为发掘本心，这种观点也许可以被认为是将两种想法随意结合起来。但是，《六经》和《四书》里包含了许多关于‘多闻多见’、‘记前人言行’、‘爱古求知’、‘博学审问’、‘温故知新’、‘博学深讨’、‘乐于质疑和检验’的教诲。这些都明确显示出在事件范围内的探求，并且依靠思考和讨论。显然，在细节上不应该有任何混淆。”

text.ori_cn: “格物”之义，前已详悉，牵合之疑，想已不俟复解矣。
text.man_en: The meaning of the investigation of things has already been fully explained. I believe your suspicion of arbitrary combination requires no further answer.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The meaning of "material" has been detailed before, and the suspicion of the linkage, I do not think it is necessary to re-explain.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The meaning of "Gewu" has been explained in detail before, and the doubts about its connection will not be solved soon.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The meaning of 'investigating things' has already been elaborated in detail earlier, and any doubts about its relevance should now be cleared up.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们已经充分解释了事物调查的含义。我相信，你对任意组合的怀疑无需进一步回答。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 考察事物的意义已经说得很清楚了。我相信你对任意组合的怀疑不需要进一步的答案。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 对于事物调查的意义已经完全解释清楚了。我相信你对随意结合的怀疑不需要进一步回答。

text.ori_cn: 至于“多闻多见”，乃孔子因子张之务外好高，徒欲以多闻多见为学，而不能求诸其心，以阙疑殆，此其言行所以不免于尤悔，而所谓见闻者，适以资其务外好高而已：盖所以救子张多闻多见之病，而非以是教之为学也：夫子尝曰：“盖有不知而作之者，我无是也。”
text.man_en: As for "hearing a lot and seeing a lot", it is because Confucius wanted to learn more by hearing a lot and seeing a lot, but he could not seek his heart, so he was doubtful. text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for 'broad knowledge and extensive observation,' it is because Confucius, noticing Zizhang’s external focus and lofty aspirations, merely desired to engage in broad knowledge and extensive observation as a form of learning, unable to seek it within his own mind, thereby meeting uncertainties with danger. Hence, his words and actions inevitably led to regrets, and the so-called knowledge and observation merely fueled his external focus and lofty aspirations: This was aimed at remedying Zizhang’s issue of broad knowledge and extensive observation, rather than teaching it as a method of learning. The Master once said: 'There are those who act without knowing; I am not one of them.'

text.ori_cn: 君子之学，何尝离去事为而废论说：但其从事于事为、论说者，要皆知、行合一之功，正所以致其本心之良知，而非若世之徒事口耳谈说以为知者，分知、行为两事，而果有节目先后之可言也。
text.man_en: When has the learning of the superior man departed from practical affairs and discarded discussions? However, whenever he is engaged in practical affairs or discussion, he insists on the task of knowledge and action combined. The aim is precisely to extend the innate knowledge of his original mind. He is unlike those who devote themselves to merely talking and hearing as though that were knowledge, and divide knowledge and action into two separate things as though they really could be itemized and take place one after the other.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The study of a gentleman has never been separated from deeds and abolished discourse: but those who are engaged in deeds and discourses must all be united in knowledge and action, and are aiming at the conscience of their own hearts, and are not, as the world's people who are engaged in talking and talking as if they knew, divided into the two things of knowledge and action, and there is a sequence of programmes to speak of.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: How can a gentleman's learning be separated from actions and explanations? But those who are engaged in actions and explanations must understand and perform the same work. This is why they have the conscience of their own minds, rather than just talking about things in the world. The ear talks about those who think they know, and they distinguish between knowledge and behavior, and if there is a sequence of events, there is something to be said for it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The learning of a virtuous person never abandons practical action or overlooks discourse; but when they engage in actions and discourse, they always aim to unify knowledge and practice. This is precisely to realize their innate moral understanding, rather than like those in the world who only focus on superficial discussions and consider knowing and doing as two separate things with distinct precedence and order.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 高人之学，何曾离实务而弃议论？然而，每当他从事实际事务或讨论时，他都坚持知行合一。其目的正是为了扩展其本心的先天知识。他不像有些人那样，只知道说和听，好像那就是知识，把知识和行动分成两件独立的事情，好像它们真的可以分门别类，一个接一个地进行。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子之学何时离实而弃议？但每当他从事实际事务或讨论时，他都坚持知行合一的任务。其目的正是为了扩展他本心的先天知识。他不像那些只专注于说和听的人，仿佛那是知识，并将知识和行动分成两件独立的事情，好像它们确实可以逐项列出并相继发生。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君子的学习何时离开了实务，摈弃了讨论？然而，无论他从事实务还是讨论，他都坚持知行合一的任务。其目的是为了扩展他本心的先天知识。他不同于那些仅仅沉迷于谈论和听闻，仿佛那就是知识的人，把知识和行动分割成两个完全不同的事物，好像它们确实可以分别进行，依次发生。

text.ori_cn: 故《论语》曰“生而知之”者，义理耳。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 昔与贺的学识可能不及高与谢、禹与稷，甚至尧与舜，尽管他们的智慧并不通晓一切。然而，直到现在，世代相传仍遵循昔与贺的方法并实践他们的技艺。即使是知识有限、智慧浅薄的人，浅显的占星家，也能制作天文历法并准确预报天气。

text.ori_cn: “封禅”之说尤为不经，是乃后世佞人谀士所以求媚于其上，倡为夸侈，以荡君心而靡国赞：盖欺天罔人无耻之大者，君子之所不道，司马相如之所以见讥于天下后世也。
text.man_en: The theory of "Feng Chan" is particularly unreasonable. It is the result of the sycophants of later generations seeking to flatter the scholars, advocating it as an extravagance, in order to sway the emperor's heart and ruin the country's praise: to cover up the shameless great person who deceives heaven and ignores people, the place of a gentleman is Ignorance, the reason why Sima Xiangru was ridiculed by future generations in the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "Feng Zen" is particularly unorthodox, is the later sycophants toady so seek to flatter on it, advocating for the exaggerated, to swing the heart of the king and the country praise: cover the big one who deceived the sky and ignored the shamelessness of the gentleman's way, the reason why the Sima Xiangru to see ridiculed in the world later also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The theory of "Feng Chan" is particularly unreasonable. It is the result of the sycophants of later generations seeking to flatter scholars and advocating it as an extravagance, in order to sway the emperor's heart and ruin the country's praise: to cover up the shameless great man who deceives heaven and ignores people, the place of a gentleman is Ignorance, the reason why Sima Xiangru was ridiculed by future generations in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The notion of 'Fengshan' is particularly absurd; it is something later sycophants and flatterers employ to ingratiate themselves with their superiors, promoting extravagance to delude the ruler and squander the nation’s resources. It is a grand act of deception and shamelessness, unmentioned by gentlemen, and hence Sima Xiangru has been criticized by all generations thereafter.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "封禅 "之说，尤为不合理。它是后世奸佞之徒为求谄媚士大夫，鼓吹为奢靡之风，以动摇帝心，败坏国誉的结果：掩盖欺天罔人的无耻伟人，君子之位，无知者无畏，司马相如之所以被后世讥笑于世，其原因就在于此。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “封禅”之说尤其不合理。这是后世阿谀奉承读书人，鼓吹为奢靡之事，以动摇帝心，败坏国誉的结果：掩盖欺天不理人的无耻伟人，君子之所在于无知，所以司马相如才被后世所嘲笑。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “封禅”之说尤为不合理。乃是后世的谄媚之徒为了讨好士人，竟搞得如此奢靡，意在动摇帝心，毁国之美誉：遮掩了那些欺天罔人、无耻之大者，君子所在之地唯有无知，正是司马相如被后世讥讽的原因。

text.ori_cn: 夫圣人之所以为圣者，以其生而知之也。
text.man_en: A sage is a sage because he is born with knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason why a saint is a saint is that he is born knowing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The reason why a saint is a saint is because he is born with knowledge.
