text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人之所以为圣人，是因为他生而知之。

text.ori_cn: 而释论语者曰：“‘生而知之’者，义理耳。
text.man_en: But a commentator on the Analects said, “What is known at birth is moral principle only.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And the interpreter of the Analects said, "'Born to know' is the ear of righteousness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The interpreter of the Analects of Confucius said: "Those who are born with knowledge are Yi Li Er.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The commentator on the Analects says: 'To be born with knowledge pertains to principles and reasoning.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但《论语》的一位评论家说："人之初，性本善。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但《论语》论者却说：“生而知者，唯道德理也。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但是有一位《论语》注释者曾说，“生来知晓的只有道德原则。”

text.ori_cn: 若夫礼乐、名物、古今事变：亦必待学而后有以验其行事之实；”夫礼乐、名物之类，果有关于作圣之功也，而圣人亦必待学而后能知焉，则是圣人亦不可以谓之“生知”矣。
text.man_en: As to the changing events of past and present and the names and varieties of ceremonies and music, they surely require study before their validity can be verified in practice. ” If the names and varieties of ceremonies and music and the changing events of past and present really had anything to do with the effort to become a sage, and a sage had to depend on study to obtain knowledge, then a sage cannot be said to have been born with knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the rites and music, name and things, ancient and modern events: also must be learned and then have to test the reality of their actions; "the rites and music, name and things, and so on, there is about the work of the saint, and the saints must be learned and then can know, then the saints can not be said to be "born to know" carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you have rituals, music, famous objects, and events in ancient and modern times, you must learn them before you can test the reality of their actions. "Rituals, music, famous objects, and the like are all related to the merits of being a saint, and a saint must learn them before you can know them." , then even a sage cannot be said to have “knowledge”.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for rites and music, the nomenclature and the events of ancient and modern times: these must also await learning before their true practice can be verified; if rites, music, and such matters indeed contribute to the achievement of sagehood, and sages must also rely on learning to understand them, then sages too cannot be said to possess innate knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 至于古往今来的变迁，以及礼乐的名称和种类，肯定需要研究才能在实践中验证其正确性。如果 "礼乐名数 "和 "古今之变 "真的与成为圣人的努力有关，圣人必须依靠学习才能获得知识，那么圣人就不能说天生就有知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 至于古今之变迁，礼乐的名称、种类，固然需要研究，才能在实践中验证其有效性。 ” 如果礼乐的名称、种类和古今变迁，确实与成圣有关系，而圣人必须靠学习来获得知识，那么圣人就不能说是圣人了。生来就有知识。

text.ori_cn: 谓圣人为“生知”者，专指义理而言，而不以礼乐、名物之类，则是礼乐、名物之类无关于作圣之功矣，圣人之所以谓之“生知”者，专指义理而不以礼乐、名物之类，则是“学而知之”者，亦惟当学知此义理而已。
text.man_en: When a sage is said to be born with knowledge, it means moral principles only and not such things as the names and varieties of ceremonies and music. It is clear that such things as the names and varieties of ceremonies and music have nothing to do with the effort to become a sage. Since by a sage's being born with knowledge is meant his possession of moral principles only and not such things as the names and varieties of ceremonies and music, then to know through study means to study and know these moral principles only,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Saints are said to be "born to know", specifically referring to righteousness, but not to rituals and music, names and things like that, it is rituals and music, names and things like that are not about the work of the Saints, the reason why the saints are said to be "born to know", specifically referring to righteousness but not to rituals and music, names and things like that, is that the "learning to know" is also only when learning to know this righteousness only. Those who "learn to know" should only learn to know this righteousness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When we call a saint a person who "generates knowledge", it refers specifically to principles and principles, rather than rituals, music, names and objects, etc. This means that rituals, music, names and objects have nothing to do with the merits of being a saint. The reason why a saint is called "generates knowledge" Those who specifically refer to principles and principles without referring to rituals, music, names, objects, etc. are those who "learn to know them", and they only need to learn to understand the principles.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the sages are referred to as 'knowledgeable from birth,' it specifically pertains to principles and reasoning, not to rituals, music, or other worldly matters. This means that rituals, music, and such are irrelevant to the attainment of sagehood. The reason why sages are called 'knowledgeable from birth' is solely because of their understanding of principles and reasoning, excluding rituals, music, and other worldly matters. Consequently, those who need to 'learn to know' should also focus on understanding these principles and reasoning.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人 "生而知之 "指的只是道德准则，而不是仪式和音乐的名称和种类。很显然，礼仪和音乐的名称和种类与成为圣人的努力毫无关系。既然 "生而知之 "指的是圣人只掌握道德准则，而不是礼仪和音乐的名称和种类，那么 "学而时习之 "指的就是只学习和掌握这些道德准则、

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 既然你已经理解知行合一的原理，这可以用一个词来解释。

text.ori_cn: 尽心知性知天，是生知安行事。
text.man_en: As to exerting one's mind to the utmost, knowing one's nature, and knowing Heaven, these are the acts of those who are born with such knowledge and practice it naturally and easily.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To know heaven with all one's heart is to be born knowing to act in peace.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing the nature with all your heart and soul is the way to live knowingly and safely.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To fully comprehend human nature and the way of heaven is to be inherently wise and to act with serenity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 至于 "尽心"、"知性"、"知天"，则是生而知之者的行为，自然而然，信手拈来。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 至于尽心，知性，知天，是生而有知，而自然而容易实行的人的行为。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 至于尽心知性知天，这是天生具有这种知识并自然轻松地实践它的人的行为。

text.ori_cn: 存心养性事天，是学知利行事。
text.man_en: Preserving the mind, nourishing one's nature, and serving Heaven are the acts of those who learn them through study and practice them for their advantage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To store up the heart and nourish the nature to serve heaven is to learn to act with knowledge and profit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Cultivating one's nature and serving Heaven with intention is to learn knowledge and act profitably.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nurturing one's temperament and serving the heavens is an endeavor that combines knowledge and practical action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 存心、养性、奉天，是学而优则仕者的行为。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 养心、养性、事天，是学而行之者的行为。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 保养心志，涵养本性，奉天行事，是那些通过学习获得这些知识并为自己利益而实践的人所为的行为。

text.ori_cn: ‘夭寿不贰，修身以俟’，是困知勉行事。
text.man_en: To maintain one's singlemindedness regardless of longevity or brevity of life, and to cultivate one's personal life while waiting for fate to take its own course, are the acts of those who learn through hard work and practice them with effort and difficulty.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 'To live young and to cultivate one's body in order to do so' is to be troubled to know and to do things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "You will not live long before you die, so you can cultivate yourself before it is too late."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 'Maintain an unyielding integrity and improve oneself while awaiting the inevitable,' is the principle of diligently seeking knowledge and striving to act.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无论长寿还是短命，都要保持一心一意，在等待命运的安排中修身养性，这些都是勤学苦练者的行为。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 无论生命的长短，保持一心一意，在听天由命的同时修养自己的人生，才是苦学、苦练的人的行为。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不论生命长短，保持专注，修养身心，静待命运，是那些通过努力学习并艰难实践的人们的行为。

text.ori_cn: 朱子错训格物。
text.man_en: But Chu Hsi wrongly interpreted the doctrine of the investigation of things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Zhu Zi wrongly lectured on the Ger.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Zhu Zi made a mistake in studying things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zhu Xi misinterpreted the concept of 'investigation of things'.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但朱熹错误地解释了格物致知的学说。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但朱熹错误地解释了格物论。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但朱熹错误地解释了格物致知的学说。

text.ori_cn: 只为倒看了此意，以尽心知性为物格知至，要初学便去做生知安行事。
text.man_en: Because he reversed the above order, and thought that the higher attainments of exerting one's mind to the utmost and knowing one's nature are equivalent to the investigation of things and the extension of knowledge, he required the beginner to perform the acts of those who are born to know and who practice naturally and easily.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing is to see this intention, to know the nature of the mind as a matter of knowledge, to learn to go to the beginning to do the birth of the knowledge of an action.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I just read this meaning backwards, and use my whole heart and mind to understand things. I want to do things with knowledge and safety as soon as I learn.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only to understand this meaning backwards, to fully comprehend and embody the nature of things, it is necessary from the beginning to learn by doing and to naturally practice what you have learned.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为他颠倒了上述顺序，认为 "尽心 "和 "知性 "的更高境界等同于 "格物 "和 "致知"，所以要求初学者做出 "生而知之"、"自然而然"、"信手拈来 "的行为。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为他颠倒了上述顺序，认为用尽心性、知性的更高境界，相当于格物致知，所以要求初学者做天生的行为。知道谁练习自然而容易。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为他颠倒了上述顺序，并认为用尽心力和了解本性的高层次成就等同于格物致知，所以他要求初学者执行那些天生知晓并自然轻松地实践之人的行为。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰:"性是心之体。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, "Our nature is the substance of the mind
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman said: "Sex is the body of the heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The teacher said: "Xing is the body of the heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said, 'Nature is the essence of the mind.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："我们的本性是心灵的实质
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老师说：“我们的本质是心的本质。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“我们的本性就是心的实质。”

text.ori_cn: 天是性之原。
text.man_en: and Heaven is the source of our nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Heaven is the origin of sex.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Heaven is the source of nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heaven is the source of nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 上天是我们本性的源泉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天是我们本性的源泉。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地是我们本性的源泉。

text.ori_cn: 尽心即是尽性。
text.man_en: To exert one's mind to the utmost is the same as fully developing one's nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The exhaustion of the mind is the exhaustion of the nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To do your best is to do your best.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To devote oneself wholeheartedly is to fulfill one's nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 尽心竭力就等于充分发挥自己的天性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尽心竭力，就等于充分发挥性性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 尽力发挥一个人的思想就等于充分发展自己的本性。

text.ori_cn: ‘惟天下至诚为能尽其性，知天地之化育’，存心者，心有未尽也。
text.man_en: Only those who are absolutely sincere can fully develop their nature and ‘know the transforming and nourishing process of Heaven and Earth. ' Those who merely preserve their minds, on the other hand, have not yet exerted them to the utmost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 'Only the world's utmost sincerity is capable of exhausting its nature and knowing the transformation of heaven and earth', and the one who keeps his heart has not yet exhausted it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Only the most sincere people in the world can fulfill their nature and understand the transformation and upbringing of heaven and earth." Those who have a heart have some unfinished hearts.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 'Only the utmost sincerity under heaven can fully develop one's nature and understand the transformation and nurturing of heaven and earth.' Those who harbor intentions still have incompleteness in their hearts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有那些绝对真诚的人才能充分发挥自己的天性，'知天地之化育'。'反之，仅存其心者，则未尽其性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有至诚者，才能充分发性，“知天地之化养”。 ’而那些只守心的人，还没有发挥到极致。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只有那些绝对真诚的人才能完全发展他们的本性，并‘知道天地的变化滋养过程’。而那些仅仅保持他们心智的人，却还没有把它们发挥到极致。

text.ori_cn: 知天如知州知县之知，是自己分上事。
text.man_en: Knowing Heaven is the same as knowing the affairs of a district or a county, which is what the titles prefect and magistrate mean. It is a matter within one's own function, and it means that one in his moral character has already become one with Heaven.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To know heaven as one knows the state and the county is one's own business.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing the sky is like knowing the state and the county. It is your own responsibility.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Knowing Heaven is like knowing a governor or a county magistrate; it is a matter within one's own responsibilities.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知天 "与 "知县 "同义，"知县 "和 "知府 "就是 "知县 "和 "知府 "的意思。这是一个人自身职能范围内的事情，它意味着一个人在道德品格上已经与上天融为一体。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知天，就等于知区县之事，太守、县令就是这个意思。这是一个人的职责范围内的事情，说明一个人的品德已经与天合一了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知天与知一郡一县之事相同，这就是太守和县令的意义所在。这是自己职责范围内的事，意味着一个人在道德品性上已经与天合一。

text.ori_cn: 己与天为事天如子之事父，臣之事君。
text.man_en: Serving Heaven, on the other hand, is like the serving of the parents by the son and the serving of the ruler by the minister.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He and Heaven are serving Heaven as a son serves his father and a minister serves his ruler.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Oneself and Heaven serve Heaven as a son serves his father, and a minister serves the king.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One serves Heaven as a son serves his father and a minister serves his king.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 事天，则如子事父母，臣事君。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 事天则如子事父母，臣事君。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 另一方面，事奉上天就像儿子伺奉父母和臣子侍奉君主一样。

text.ori_cn: 须是恭敬奉承，然后能无失。
text.man_en: It must be done seriously and reverently to please them if it is to be perfect.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: One must be respectful and flattering, and then one can do no wrong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It must be respectful and flattering, and then there will be no mistakes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One must be respectful and flattering, only then can one avoid mistakes.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果要做到尽善尽美，就必须认真、虔诚地取悦他们。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果要做到完美，就必须认真、恭敬地去做，以取悦他们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 要做到完美，必须认真和恭敬地完成，才能令他们满意。

text.ori_cn: 尚与天为二。
text.man_en: Even then, one is still separated from Heaven.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Shang and Heaven are two.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Shang and heaven are two.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Yet, it remains distinct from the heavens.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即便如此，人还是会与天堂分离。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即便如此，人仍然与天堂分离。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即便如此，人依旧与天堂分隔开。

text.ori_cn: 此便是圣贤之别。
text.man_en: This is the difference between a sage [who exerts the mind to the utmost and knows Heaven] and the worthies [who preserve their minds and serve Heaven].
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is the difference between sages and sages.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is the difference between sages and sages.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is the distinction between the sage and the ordinary person.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是圣人[尽心知天]与贤人[存心事天]的区别。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是圣人和贤人的区别。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这是贤哲[尽心知天]和圣贤[存心事天]之间的区别。

text.ori_cn: 至于夭寿不贰其心，乃是教学者一心为善。
text.man_en: "As to allowing no doublemindedness regardless of longevity or brevity of life, it is to teach the student to do good with singlemindedness,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: As for the premature life, it is the heart of the one who teaches that it is good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As for Yaoshou not caring about his heart, it means that the teacher is dedicated to doing good.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for unwavering integrity despite imminent disaster, it solely reflects the educator's steadfast commitment to righteousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "至于无论长寿还是短命都不允许三心二意，是为了教导学生一心向善、

text.ori_cn: 不可以穷通夭寿之故，便把为善的心变动了。
text.man_en: and not to allow success or failure, longevity or brevity of life, to shake his determination to do good,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you do not want to be poor and have a short life, you will change your mind for the good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is not possible to change the heart of doing good because of the premature death.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One should not change their good intentions due to the circumstances of wealth, fortune, or longevity.

text.ori_cn: 是去其心之不正，以全其本体之正。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is to remove the incorrectness of the heart in order to complete the correctness of the essence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is to get rid of the righteousness of his mind and make his true nature righteous.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One must eliminate the unrighteousness in their heart to preserve the integrity of their true nature.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 就是消除心中不正确的东西，以保持其本来本质的正确性。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无论意志在哪里，错误都必须被消除，以便保持正确性。

text.ori_cn: 即无时无处不是存天理。
text.man_en: In other words, in all places and at all times the Principle of Nature must be preserved.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: That is, there is no time or place where the Divine Principle is not present.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: That is to say, there are laws of nature at all times and everywhere.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is no time or place where heavenly principles are not present.

text.ori_cn: 即是穷理。

text.man_en: The Principle of Nature is clear character,

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 究其根本，则显明性。 ”

text.ori_cn: 〔8〕又曰:"知是心之本体。
text.man_en: He further said, "Knowledge is the original substance of the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [8] It is also said, "Knowledge is the essence of the mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [8] He also said: "Knowledge is the essence of the heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "Knowing is the essence of the mind."
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他还说："知识是心灵的本原。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他进一步说：“知识是心灵的本源。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他还说，‘知识是心灵的本质。’

text.ori_cn: 心自然会知。
text.man_en: The mind is naturally able to know.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart will naturally know.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heart will naturally know.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The heart will naturally understand.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心自然能知。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心自然能够知道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心灵天生具有认知能力。

text.ori_cn: 见父自然知孝，见兄自然知弟，见孺子入井，自然知恻隐。
text.man_en: When it perceives the parents, it naturally knows that one should be filial. When it perceives the elder brother, it naturally knows that one should be respectful. And when it perceives a child fall into a well, it naturally knows that one should be commiserative.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When you see a father, you naturally know filial piety; when you see a brother, you naturally know brotherhood; when you see a child go into a well, you naturally know compassion.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you see your father, you will naturally know filial piety; when you see your elder brother, you will naturally know your younger brother; when you see a child falling into a well, you will naturally know compassion.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Seeing a father, one naturally understands filial piety; seeing an elder brother, one naturally understands fraternal duty; seeing a child fall into a well, one naturally feels compassion.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 感知到父母，自然就知道应该孝顺。感知到兄长，自然知道应该恭敬。感知到孩子掉进井里，自然就知道应该惺惺相惜。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当它感知到父母的时候，自然就知道应该孝顺。当它感知到哥哥的时候，自然知道应该恭敬。当它看到一个孩子掉进井里时，它自然知道应该同情。

text.ori_cn: 此便是良知。
text.man_en: This is innate knowledge of good (liangchih)

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is conscience.

text.ori_cn: 不假外求。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰:"此已被私欲隔断，不是知行的本体了。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, "The knowledge and action you refer to are already separated by selfish desires and are no longer knowledge and action in their original substance.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："你所说的知和行已经被私欲分离，不再是本体的知和行了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“你所说的知行，已经被私欲所隔开，不再是知行的本来面目了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说，“你所说的知行已经被私欲所分隔，不再是原本的知与行了。”

text.ori_cn: 未有知而不行者。
text.man_en: There have never been people who know but do not act.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no one who knows and does not do it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no one who knows but does nothing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There has never been knowledge without action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从来都有人知而不为。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从来没有人知道而不去行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从来没有只知道而不行动的人。

text.ori_cn: 知而不行，只是未知圣贤教人知行，正是要复那本体。
text.man_en: Those who are supposed to know but do not act simply do not yet know. When sages and worthies taught people about knowledge and action, it was precisely because they wanted them to restore the original substance,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To know and not to do is only to be unknown. The sages teach people to know and to do, precisely to restore that essence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing but not doing is just unknown. Sages and sages teach people to know and do precisely to restore the true nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Knowing without action is merely not knowing. The teachings of sages emphasize the union of knowledge and action precisely to restore our true nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所谓知而不行，不过是还不知道而已。圣贤先哲教人知行合一，正是希望人们恢复本真、

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 应知而不行者，只是尚未真知。当圣贤教导人们有关知识与行动时，正是因为他们希望人们恢复原本的本质。

text.ori_cn: 不是着你只恁的便罢。

text.ori_cn: 故大学指个真知行与人看，说‘如好好色’，‘如恶恶臭’。
text.man_en: Therefore the Great Learning points to true knowledge and action for people to see, saying, they are ‘like loving beautiful colors and hating bad odors. '

text.ori_cn: 先生曰:"后儒教人，才涉精微，便谓上达，未当学，且说下学。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, "In their way of teaching people, as soon as they get to anything refined or subtle, scholars of later generations say that it belongs to penetrating on the higher level and should not be pursued, and that it is better to turn to studies on the lower [empirical] level.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said: 'Later scholars, upon merely touching upon the profound, claim to have comprehended the higher truths. This is not the appropriate way to learn; let's discuss the foundational knowledge first.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："后世的学者在教人的时候，一谈到高深、精妙的东西，就会说那是属于高层次的渗透，不应该追求，还是转而研究低层次（经验）的东西比较好。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 子曰：“后世之士，其教人之道，一至精微者，谓之为通达，不宜追求，不如转而去。”到较低[经验]水平的研究。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“在他们教人的方法中，一旦涉及到任何精妙或微妙的东西，后世的学者便说这属于高水平的渗透，不应该追求，而是应该转向较低（经验）层次的研究。”

text.ori_cn: 是分下学上达为二也。
text.man_en: This is to separate the two levels.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is divided into the lower learning and the upper attainment as two.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is divided into two parts: lower school and upper school.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It can be divided into two parts: upper and lower.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这是为了将两个层次分开。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这是为了分隔这两个层级。

text.ori_cn: 夫目可得见，耳可得闻，口可得言，心可得思者，皆下学也。
text.man_en: Now what the eye can see, what the ear can hear, what the mouth can say, and what the mind can think of are all matters of learning on the lower level,

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who can see with their eyes, hear with their ears, speak with their mouths, and think with their hearts are all learning.

text.ori_cn: 目不可得见，耳不可得闻，口不可得言，心不可得思者，上达也。
text.man_en: whereas what the eye cannot see, what the ear cannot hear, what the mouth cannot say, and what the mind cannot think of are matters of penetration on the higher level.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 而眼睛看不到的、耳朵听不到的、嘴巴说不出来的、头脑想不到的，则是更高层次的渗透。

text.ori_cn: 如木之栽培灌溉，是下学也。

text.man_en: whereas the activity of the vegetative life day and night and the tree's smooth and luxuriant growth are penetration on the higher level.

text.ori_cn: 故凡可用功，可告语者，皆下学。
text.man_en: Therefore whatever human effort can do and whatever can be talked about represent learning on the lower level.

text.ori_cn: 上达只在下学里。

text.ori_cn: 凡圣人所说，虽极精微，俱是下学。

text.ori_cn: 〔13〕夫拔本塞源之论不明于天下，则天下之学圣人者，将日繁日难，斯人沦于禽兽夷狄，而犹自以为圣人之学：吾之说虽或暂明于一时，终将冻解于西而冰坚于东，雾释于前而云滃于后，呶呶焉危困以死，而卒无救于天下之分毫也已。
text.man_en: If the doctrine of pulling up the root and stopping up the source does not clearly prevail in the world, people who study to become sages will be increasingly numerous and their task increasingly difficult. They will then degenerate into animals and barbarians and still think this degeneration is the way to study to become a sage. Though my doctrine may perhaps temporarily be made clear and prevail, the situation will ultimately be like that in which the cold abates in the west while the ice freezes in the east, and the fog dissipates in front while clouds rise in the rear. Though I keep on talking until I die in distress, I shall at the end not be the least help to the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [13] If the theory of pulling out the root of the source is not clear to the world, then the world's study of the saints will be more and more difficult, and the people will be reduced to beasts and barbarians, but they still think that the saint's learning: although my words may be temporarily clear in a moment, it will be freezing in the west and ice firm in the east, and the fog will be released in front of the clouds in the clouds in the back, and the crisis of the world is dying, and there is nothing to save the world's pennies.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔13〕 If the theory of the source of the original plug is not clear to the world, it will be increasingly difficult for the world to learn from the saints. These people will be reduced to beasts and barbarians, and they still think that they are learned by the saints: Although my theory may be temporarily clear. , eventually the freeze will thaw in the west and the ice will be solid in the east, the fog will release in front and the clouds will fall behind, and you will die in danger, and your soldiers will not be able to save the world at all.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the argument for eliminating the root cause is not understood by the world, then those who study the teachings of the sages in the world will find it increasingly complicated and difficult. People will degenerate into the state of beasts and barbarians and still consider themselves as followers of the sages. Even if my argument is momentarily accepted, it will eventually dissolve in the west and solidify in the east, clear up in front and cloud up behind, clamorously struggling until death, ultimately without any saving grace for even the slightest part of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果 "拔本塞源 "的学说不能在世间蔚然成风，那么学习圣贤的人就会越来越多，学习圣贤的任务就会越来越艰巨。这样，他们就会堕落为禽兽和野蛮人，还以为堕落就是学习成为圣贤的途径。虽然我的学说可能会暂时得到弘扬和推广，但终究会像西边寒冷，东边冰冻，前方雾散，后方云起一样。虽然我一直喋喋不休，直到在苦难中死去，但我最终也不会对这个世界有丝毫帮助。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果天下没有明显地盛行拔根堵源的思想，那么读书成圣的人就会越来越多，而他们的任务就会越来越艰巨。然后就堕落为畜生、野蛮人，还认为这种堕落是圣人的学习之道。我的学说或许可以暂时明晰、盛行，但最终的情况，却是西边渐冷，东边冰冻，前雾散，后云升。虽然我一直在说，直到我在痛苦中死去，但我最终不会对世界有任何帮助。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果拔本塞源之道不在世上明确流行，修学成圣的人就会越来越多，他们的任务也会越来越艰难。他们就会退化成禽兽和蛮夷，还会以为这种退化是修学成圣的道路。虽然我的学说可能暂时被明确和流行，但最终的情况就像西方寒冷减退，而东方冰雪凝结，前方雾散尽，而后方云笼罩。即使我不停地讲到死于忧愤，最终也不会对世间有丝毫帮助。

text.ori_cn: 夫圣人之心，以天地万物为一体，其视天下之人，无外内远近：凡有血气，皆其昆弟赤子之亲，莫不欲安全而教养之，以遂其万物一体之念。
text.man_en: The mind of a sage regards Heaven, Earth, and all things as one body. The mind of a sage regards Heaven, Earth, and all things as one body. He wants to secure, preserve, educate, and nourish all of them, so as to fulfill his desire of forming one body with all things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart of the saint, with all things in heaven and earth as one, his view of the people of the world, no external and internal far and near: all blood, all his kun brothers and children of relatives, all want to be safe and educated, in order to achieve its idea of the unity of all things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heart of a saint regards the heaven, earth, and all things as one, and sees all people in the world, regardless of whether they are outside or inside, far or near: all flesh and blood are the relatives of his brothers and sisters, and everyone wants to be safe and educate them, so as to realize the idea of ​​​​the unity of all things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The mind of a sage regards Heaven, Earth, and all things as one. They see all people under Heaven without distinction of outside or inside, near or far. All beings with blood and breath are like their siblings or children, whom they wish to protect and nurture, in order to fulfill the idea of the oneness of all things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人之心，视天地万物为一体。圣人之心，视天地万物为一体。圣人之心，视天地万物为一体，欲安之、保之、育之、养之，以实现与万物同体的愿望。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人之心，视天地万物为一体。圣人之心，视天地万物为一体。他要保护、保存、教育、滋养这一切，以实现他与万物合一的愿望。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人的心把天地万物视为一体。圣人的心把天地万物视为一体。他想要保护、保存、教育和滋养所有这些东西，以实现他与万物合一的愿望。

text.ori_cn: 天下之人心，其始亦非有异于圣人也，特其间于有我之私，隔于物欲之蔽，大者以小，通者以塞，人各有心，至有视其父、子、兄、弟如仇雠者。
text.man_en: Now the mind of everybody is at first not different from that of the sage. Only because it is obstructed by selfishness and blocked by material desires, what was originally great becomes small and what was originally penetrating becomes obstructed. Everyone has his own selfish view, to the point where some regard their fathers, sons, and brothers as enemies.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The hearts of the people in the world are not different from those of the saints at the beginning, but they are separated from the selfishness of the people and the materialistic desires of the people, so that the big ones are small and the passers-by are blocked, and each of them has a heart, and there are those who look at their fathers, sons, brothers, and brethren as if they were enemies and collaterals.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The hearts of all people in the world are not different from those of saints in the beginning. They are particularly concerned with the selfishness of self and the shield of material desires. The big ones are small, and the open ones are blocked. Everyone has his own heart, and some regard their father, son, and Brothers and sisters are like enemies.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The hearts of all people in the world, at the beginning, are no different from those of the sages. It is merely due to the interference of selfish desires and the obscuration by material cravings that what is great becomes small, what is clear becomes obstructed. Each person has a heart, yet there are those who regard their fathers, sons, brothers, and siblings as enemies.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，每个人的心灵起初与圣人的心灵并无不同。只是因为被私心所障，被物欲所阻，原本伟大的东西变得渺小，原本透彻的东西变得阻塞。每个人都有自己的私心，以至于有些人视父子兄弟为仇敌。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 今一切人之心，初与圣人无异。只因私欲所阻，物欲所阻，所以本来大的就变小了，原本通达的就变成了障碍。每个人都有自己的私心，甚至有人视父子兄弟为仇人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在每个人的心智最初与圣人并无不同，只因被私心所障碍，被物欲所阻塞，原本伟大的变得渺小，原本通达的变得阻塞。每个人都有自己的私心见解，甚至有人视其父亲、儿子和兄弟为敌人。

text.ori_cn: 圣人有忧之，是以推其天地万物一体之仁以教天下，使之皆有以克其私，去其蔽，以复其心体之同然。
text.man_en: The?Sage worried?over?this. He therefore extended his humanity which makes him form one body with Heaven, Earth, and all things, to teach the world, so as to enable the people to overcome their selfishness, remove their obstructions, and recover that which is common to the substance of the minds of all men.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saints were concerned about this, so they taught the world the benevolence of the unity of heaven and earth and all things, so that they could overcome their selfishness and remove their obscurations, in order to restore the commonality of their minds and bodies.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sage is worried, so he uses his benevolence to teach the world about the unity of heaven, earth, and all things, so that everyone can overcome their selfishness, remove their blindness, and restore the unity of their hearts and bodies.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sages were concerned, and thus they imparted the teaching of the unity of all things in heaven and earth, so as to instruct the people to overcome their selfishness, eliminate their biases, and restore the fundamental nature of their hearts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人为此忧心忡忡。因此，他将自己与天地万物合而为一的人性延伸到世间，教化世人，使人们克服私心，消除障碍，找回所有人心灵中共同的本质。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人为此担心。故以人性，与天地万物合而为一，教化世人，使人民克服私心，排除障碍，恢复共性。所有人的心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人对此感到忧虑。因此，他将仁爱扩展，使自己与天地万物融为一体，来教化世人，以使人们能够克服自私，去除障碍，恢复人心中本有的共性。

text.ori_cn: 其教之大端，则尧、舜、禹之相授受，所谓“道心惟微，惟精惟一，允执厥中”：而其节目，则舜之命契，所谓“父子有亲，君臣有义，夫妇有别，长幼有序，朋友有信”五者而已。
text.man_en: The main point of his teachings is the teachings of Yao, Shun, and Yu. It is said that "the heart of the Tao is only subtle, but the essence is only one, and it is allowed to hold on to the center. " And its program is based on the fate of Shun, the socalled "father and son have relatives, monarch and ministers have relationships. " Righteousness, distinction between husband and wife, orderliness between elders and children, and trust among friends are just the five things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The great end of the teaching is the mutual teaching of Yao, Shun and Yu, the so-called "Taoism is but a microcosm, but the essence is but a single one, and the righteousness is the centre": and the programme is the order of Shun's qi, the so-called "fathers and sons have kinship, rulers and ministers have righteousness, husbands and wives have distinction, the young and the old are in order, and friends have faith", and five other things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The main point of his teachings is the teachings of Yao, Shun, and Yu. It is said that "the heart of the Tao is only subtle, but the essence is only one, and it is allowed to hold on to the center." And its program is based on the fate of Shun, the so-called "father and son have relatives, monarch and ministers have relationships." Righteousness, distinction between husband and wife, orderliness between elders and children, and trustworthiness among friends” are just the five things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The primary teachings are the mutual imparting between Yao, Shun, and Yu, known as 'The mind of the Way is subtle; it is precise and unified; hold steadfastly to the middle path.' And the specific precepts are as described by Shun's mandate to Qi: 'Between father and son, there is affection; between ruler and subject, there is righteousness; between husband and wife, there is differentiation; between elder and younger, there is order; between friends, there is trust.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他的学说的要点是尧、舜、禹的学说。所谓 "道心惟微，惟精惟一，允执厥中。" 而其纲常则以舜之命为本，所谓 "父子有亲，君臣有亲。"礼义廉耻、夫妻有别、长幼有序、朋友有信，就是这五件事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他的教义的要点是尧、舜、禹的教义。所谓“道之心惟微，而精一也，任其守中。”而其纲领则是以舜的命运为依据，所谓“父子”。有亲戚，君臣有关系。”有义，夫妻有别，长辈有秩序，朋友有信任，这就是五事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他的教义的要点是尧、舜、禹的教义。据说：“道之心惟微，而精惟一，许持其中。”其纲领立于舜命，所谓“父子有亲，君臣有义。” 義、夫妇有别、长幼有序、朋友有信，乃五事而已。

text.ori_cn: 唐、虞、三代之世，教者惟以此为教，而学者惟以此为学。
text.man_en: At the time of Yao, Shun, and the Three Dynasties, teachers taught and students studied only this.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the Tang, Yu, and Three Dynasties, this was the only way to teach, and this was the only way for scholars to learn.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: During the Tang, Yu, and Three Dynasties, teachers only used this as their teaching, and scholars only used this as their learning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the era of Tang, Yu, and the Three Dynasties, educators taught only this doctrine, and scholars learned only this knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 尧、舜、三代之世，师者教之，生者学之。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尧舜三朝之时，师之教，学生之学，仅此而已。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在尧、舜和三代时期，教师们教的和学生们学的只有这些。

text.ori_cn: 当是之时，人无异见，家无异习，安此者谓之圣，勉此者谓之贤，而背此者，虽其启明如朱，亦谓之不肖。
text.man_en: At that time people did not have different opinions, nor did families have different practices. Those who practiced the teaching naturally and easily were called sages, and those who practiced it with effort and difficulty were called worthies, but those who violated it were considered degenerate even though they were as intelligent as Tanchu.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: At that time, there are no different opinions, no different habits, and those who are comfortable with this are called saints, and those who are diligent with this are called sages, and those who are against this, even though they are as enlightened as Zhu, they are also called ungrateful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: At that time, people have no different opinions and families have no different habits. Those who adhere to this are called saints, those who encourage this are called virtuous, and those who carry this behind, even though their enlightenment is as bright as Zhu, are also called unworthy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At that time, there were no different views among the people, no different customs among the families. Those who were at peace with this were called sages, those who strived for it were called virtuous, and those who went against it, even if they were as bright as the sun, were still regarded as ignoble.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当时，人们没有不同的观点，家庭也没有不同的做法。自然而然、轻而易举地践行教义的人被称为圣人，费力艰辛地践行教义的人被称为贤人，而违反教义的人则被视为堕落者，即使他们像唐初人一样聪明。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当时人们没有不同的意见，家庭也没有不同的做法。自然而容易地修行的人被称为圣人，努力而艰难地修行的人被称为贤人，而违反教法的人即使聪明如探处，也被认为是堕落的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那时人们没有不同的意见，家家也没有不同的做法。那些自然轻松地实践教义的人被称为圣人，而那些努力艰难地实践教义的人被称为贤人，但那些违背教义的人即使像檀樾一样聪明，也被认为是堕落的。

text.ori_cn: 下至闾井、田野、农、工、商、贾之贱，莫不皆有是学，而惟以成其德行为务。
text.man_en: People of low stationthose in villages and rural districts, farmers, artisans, and merchants—all received this teaching, which was devoted only to the perfection of virtue and conduct.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: From the village, to the fields, to the peasantry, to the labourers, to the merchants, to the lowly, all have the right to learn, but only with the aim of becoming virtuous.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Down to the wells, fields, farmers, workers, merchants, and businessmen, everyone has this kind of learning, but only to achieve their virtues and deeds.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From alleyways and fields, among farmers, workers, merchants, and traders, everyone possesses such learning, focusing solely on perfecting their virtue and conduct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 地位低下的人，如乡村和农村地区的农民、工匠和商人，都接受了这种只致力于完善美德和行为的教育。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 乡村、乡下、农民、工匠、商人，皆受此法，专求德行圆满。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 低阶层的人们——乡村和农村地区的居民、农民、工匠和商人——都接受了这种教导，这种教导只致力于美德和行为的完善。

text.ori_cn: 学校之中，惟以成德为事：而才能之异，或有长于礼乐，长于政教，长于水土播植者，则就其成德，而因使益精其能于学挍之中。
text.man_en: The task of the school was solely to perfect virtue. However, people differed in capacity. Some excelled in ceremonies and music; others in government and education; and still others in public works and agriculture. Therefore, in accordance with their moral achievement, they were sent to school further to refine their abilities.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the school, the only thing is to make virtue: and if there is a difference in talent, or if there is a person who is good at rituals and music, good at politics and education, or good at soil and water planting, then the person will be able to make virtue, and will be able to make his ability more refined in the school.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the school, the only thing to do is to become a virtuous person. If there are differences in talents, such as those who are good at rituals and music, politics and education, or soil and water cultivation, then they will become virtuous, and they will be able to learn more and more.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In school, the focus is solely on cultivating virtue. However, differences in talents, be it in ritual music, governance and education, or in the cultivation of water and soil, should lead to attaining virtue. Consequently, these talents should be further refined within the school environment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 学校的任务只是完善美德。然而，人们的能力各不相同。有些人擅长礼仪和音乐，有些人擅长政府和教育，还有些人擅长公共工程和农业。因此，根据他们的道德成就，他们被送往学校继续深造，以提高他们的能力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 学校的任务只是完善美德。然而，人们的能力不同。有的擅长礼乐，有的擅长礼乐。政府和教育界的其他人；还有一些在公共工程和农业领域。因此，根据他们的道德成绩，他们被送入学校进一步磨练他们的能力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 学校的任务仅在于培养德行。然而，人们的能力各不相同。有些人在礼仪和音乐方面出众；有些人在政府和教育方面；还有些人在公共事业和农业方面。因此，根据他们的道德成就，送他们去学校进一步完善自己的能力。

text.ori_cn: 迨夫举德而任，则使之终身居其职而不易。
text.man_en: When their virtue recommended them to government positions, they were enabled to serve in their positions throughout life without change.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When he is appointed by virtue, he will make it easy for him to live in his office for life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a husband is virtuous and takes up a position, it will not be easy for him to stay in his position for life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Once a person is appointed based on virtue, they should hold the position for life without being replaced.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当他们的美德推荐他们担任政府职务时，他们就能终身任职而不改变。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当他们的德行推荐他们担任政府职务时，他们就可以在自己的职位上终身任职而不会改变。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当他们的美德使他们被推荐到政府职位时，他们能够终身在这些职位上服务而不改变。

text.ori_cn: 用之者惟知同心一德，以共安天下之民，视才之称否，而不以崇卑为轻重，劳逸为美恶：效用者亦惟知同心一德，以共安天下之民，苟当其能，则终身处于烦剧而不以为劳，安于卑琐而不以为贱。
text.man_en: Those who employed them desired only to be united with them in one mind and one character to bring peace to the people. They considered whether the individual's ability was suitable, and did not regard a high or low position as important or unimportant, or a busy or leisurely job as good or bad. Those who served also desired only to be united with their superiors in one mind and one character to bring peace to the people. If their ability matched their positions, they served throughout life in busy and heavy work without regarding it as toilsome, and felt at ease with lowly work and odd jobs without regarding them as mean.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who use it only know that they are of one heart and one mind, in order to be at peace with the people of the world, depending on whether the talent is called or not, and do not regard inferiority or superiority as a matter of priority, or labour or ease as a matter of beauty or evil: those who use it only know that they are of one heart and one mind, in order to be at peace with the people of the world, and that if they are able to do so, then they will spend their whole life in a tedious situation without thinking that it is a labour of love, and will rest on a humble position without thinking that it is a cheap one.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who use it only know that they have one heart and one virtue, so as to bring peace to the people of the world. They regard talent as a priority, and do not regard respect and humiliation as a priority, and work and rest as good or bad. If the people only act according to their abilities, they will live in trouble all their lives without feeling tired, and they will be content with being humble without feeling humble.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who employ people should only consider unity of purpose and shared virtue to bring peace to the citizens of the world, assessing their talents regardless of rank or prominence, and disregarding distinctions between labor and leisure as good or bad. Likewise, those who serve should remain united in purpose and shared virtue to bring peace to the citizens of the world. If they are fit for the task, they shall endure arduous duties without complaint and remain content in humble positions without feeling demeaned.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 雇用他们的人只希望与他们同心同德，为人民带来和平。他们考虑的是个人的能力是否合适，不以职位的高低为重要或不重要，不以工作的繁忙或清闲为好或坏。为官者也只求与上司同心同德，为民造福。如果他们的能力与职位相匹配，他们就会终生服务于繁忙而繁重的工作，而不将其视为劳累；他们也会安心于卑微的工作和零碎的工作，而不将其视为卑鄙。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 使用他们的人只希望与他们同心同德地团结起来，为人民带来和平。他们看个人的能力是否适合，不以职位高低重要不重要，不以工作忙碌或悠闲为好坏。那些服役的人也只希望与上级团结一致，一心一德，为人民带来和平。如果能力与岗位相匹配，他们一生都在忙碌繁重的工作中服役，而不认为是辛苦的，对低贱的工作和零工感到安心，而不认为是卑鄙的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些雇用他们的人只希望与他们在思想和性格上统一，以带给人民和平。他们考虑的是个人的能力是否适合，而不认为职位高低重要或不重要，或工作繁忙或悠闲好或不好。那些服务的人也只希望与他们的上级在思想和性格上统一，以带给人民和平。如果他们的能力与职位相符，他们终身在繁忙和繁重的工作中服务，而不认为它是辛苦的，并且对卑微的工作和零碎的任务感到自在，而不认为它们卑贱。

text.ori_cn: 当是之时，天下之人熙熙皞皞，皆相视如一家之亲。
text.man_en: At that time people were harmonious and contented. They regarded one another as belonging to one family. At that time, people are harmonious and contented. They regarded one another as belonging to one family.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: At that time, the people of the world were all looking at each other as if they were members of the same family.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: At that time, everyone in the world looked at each other as if they were members of the same family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At that time, all the people of the world lived in harmony and regarded each other as members of one family.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那时，人们和谐美满。他们视彼此为一家人。那时，人们和谐美满。他们视彼此为一家人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那时人们和谐、知足。他们彼此视为同一个家庭的成员。那时，人们和谐、知足。他们彼此视为同一个家庭的成员。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那时人们和谐满足，视彼此为一家人。那时人们和谐满足，视彼此为一家人。

text.ori_cn: 其才质之下者，则安其农、工、商、贾之分，各勤其业，以相生相养，而无有乎希高慕外之心。
text.man_en: Those with inferior ability were contented with their positions as farmers, artisans, or merchants, all diligent in their various occupations, so as mutually to sustain and support the life of one another without any desire for exalted position or strife for external things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are below the quality of their talents will be content with their agricultural, industrial, commercial and commercial duties, and will work hard in their respective industries to support each other, without having the heart to admire each other.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those with lower talents and qualities should be divided into farmers, workers, merchants, and businessmen, and each should work hard in his or her own industry to support each other, without any desire to be high and admiring others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those whose talents are lower will be content with their roles as farmers, artisans, merchants, or traders, diligently applying themselves in their respective fields to support and sustain each other, without aspiring to lofty heights or coveting foreign things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那些能力较差的人满足于自己的农民、工匠或商人身份，他们都勤奋地从事着自己的各种职业，以便相互维持和支持彼此的生活，而没有任何对崇高地位的渴望或对外部事物的争夺。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 能力低下的人，安于自己农耕、工匠、商人的地位，各尽其职，互相养活，不求高位，不争外物。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些能力较差的人满足于农民、工匠或商人的职位，人人都勤勉于各自的职业，从而相互维持和支持彼此的生活，没有对高职位的渴望或对外物的争斗。

text.ori_cn: 其才能之异，若皋、夔、稷、契者，则出而各效其能。
text.man_en: Those with special ability like Kao, K'uei, Chi, and Hsieh, came forward and served with their ability,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The differences in their talents, such as gao, kui, ji, qi, then out and each of their ability.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The differences in their talents, such as those of Gao, Kui, Ji, and Qi, will come out and each will use its own abilities.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those with exceptional talents, such as Gao, Kui, Ji, and Qi, emerged to demonstrate their abilities.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那些有特殊能力的人，如高晓松、桂纶镁、池子和谢霆锋，都挺身而出，用自己的能力为大家服务、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 高、贵、芝、谢等有特才的人，挺身而出，发挥自己的能力，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 像考、夔、契和偰这样有特殊能力的人走上前来，用他们的才干服务。

text.ori_cn: 若一家之务，或营其衣食，或通其有无，或备其器用，集谋并力，以求遂其仰事俯育之愿，惟恐当其事者之或怠而重己之累也。
text.man_en: treating their work as their own family concern, some attending to the provision of clothing and food, some arranging for mutual help, and some providing utensils, planning and working together in order to fulfill their desires of serving their parents above and supporting their wives and children below. Their only concern was that those responsible for certain work might not be diligent in it and become a heavy burden to them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a family's affairs, or to operate its food and clothing, or to communicate its availability, or to prepare its utensils, and to set up a conspiracy and force, in order to attempt its wish to look up to the matter of the child, fearing that those who are in charge of it may be negligent and burdened with their own tiredness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the family's duties include managing their food and clothing, checking their availability, or preparing their utensils, they must plan and work together in order to fulfill their wish to look up to and care for them, for fear that those who are responsible for their duties may be lazy and burden themselves. also.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In managing household affairs, whether it is about securing food and clothing, exchanging goods and services, or preparing necessary utensils, everyone cooperates and contributes their efforts. They aim to fulfill the wishes and responsibilities of supporting the family, always fearing that any negligence or laziness might add to the burden on others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他们把工作当成自己的家事，有的负责提供衣食，有的安排互助，有的提供用具，大家一起计划、一起努力，以实现上侍奉父母、下供养妻儿的愿望。他们唯一担心的是，负责某些工作的人可能不会勤奋工作，成为他们的沉重负担。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 把工作当作自己的家庭事，有的供衣食，有的安排互助，有的提供器皿，共同谋划，共同努力，以实现侍奉父母、赡养妻子的愿望。下面的孩子们。他们唯一担心的是，负责某些工作的人可能不勤奋，成为他们的沉重负担。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 将工作视为自己的家务，一些人负责提供衣物和食物，一些人安排互助，一些人提供器皿，计划和共同努力，目的是为了实现上能侍奉父母，下能养育妻儿的愿望。他们唯一担心的是，各自负责的工作可能不够勤勉，而成为他们的重负。

text.ori_cn: 故稷勤其稼，而不耻其不知教，视契之善教，即己之善教也：夔司其乐，而不耻于不明礼，视夷之通礼，即己之通礼也。
text.man_en: Therefore, Chi worked hard in agriculture and did not feel ashamed that he was not a teacher but regarded Hsieh's expert teaching as his own. K'uei took charge of music and was not ashamed that he was not brilliant in ceremonies but regarded Poi's understanding of ceremonies as his own.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, Jikji is diligent in his crops, but not ashamed of not knowing how to teach, depending on the good teachings of Chee, that is, his own good teachings: Kui Si's music, but not ashamed of not knowing the rites, depending on the common rites of Yi, that is, his own common rites.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, Ji is diligent in his crops and is not ashamed of his lack of teaching. He regards the good teaching of Qi as his own good teaching.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, Ji diligently cultivated his crops and did not feel ashamed of his lack of teaching knowledge, viewing Qi's good teaching as his own. Kui managed the music and did not feel embarrassed by his lack of understanding of rituals, regarding Yi's proficiency in rituals as his own.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，蚩尤勤于农事，不以自己不是教师为耻，而把谢氏的专业教学视为自己的教学。克哀掌管音乐，不以自己不精于礼仪为耻，而把伯夷对礼仪的理解视为自己的理解。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，迟先生辛勤耕耘，并不以自己不是老师为耻，而是将谢长廷的专家教导视为自己的教导。奎掌管音乐，并不羞于自己在仪式上的不高明，而是将波伊对仪式的理解视为自己的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，契在农业方面勤奋工作，并不因自己不是老师而感到羞耻，而是把奚的专业教学当作自己的。夔负责音乐，并不因自己在仪式上不出色而感到羞愧，而是把伯夷对仪式的理解当作自己的。

text.ori_cn: 盖其心学纯明，而有以全其万物一体之仁，故其精神流贯，志气通达，而无有乎人己之分，物我之间：譬之一人之身，目视，耳听，手持，足行，以济一身之用，目不耻其无聪，而耳之所涉，目必营焉，足不耻其无执，而手之所探，足必前焉：盖其元气充周，血脉条畅，是以痒疴呼吸，感触神应，有不言而喻之妙。
text.man_en: For the learning of their mind was pure and clear and had what was requisite to preserve the humanity that makes them and all things form one body. Consequently their spirit ran through and permeated all and their will prevailed and reached everywhere. There was no distinction between the self and the other, or between the self and things. It is like the body of a person. The eyes see, the ears hear, the hands hold, and the feet walk, all fulfilling the function of the body. ＃6 The eyes are not ashamed of their not being able to hear. ＃7 When the ears hear something, the eyes will direct their attention to it. ＃8 The feet are not ashamed that they are not able to grasp. ＃9 When a hand feels for something, the feet will move forward. 0 For the original material force feels and is present in the entire body, and the blood and veins function smoothly. 1 Therefore, in feeling itchy and in breathing, their influence and the speedy response to it possess a mystery that can be understood without words.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Covering the pure and clear psychology, and have to full of all things in one of the benevolence, so its spirit flow through, the will to reach, and there is no distinction between people and self, between things and I: such as a person's body, the eye to see, ear to hear, hand holding, foot, in order to achieve a body of the use of the eye, the eye is not ashamed of its no deaf, and the ear of the eye, the eyes will camp, the foot is not ashamed of its no control, and the hand of the probe, the foot will be ahead of the: Covering the full of its vital energy week, the blood smooth, so the itch disease breath, touching the divine response, there is an unspeakably wonderful The most important thing to remember is that it is a wonderful thing to be able to speak of.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Because his mind is pure and clear, and he has the benevolence to integrate all things into one, his spirit flows through him, his ambition is clear, and there is no distinction between others and himself, between things and me: for example, a person's body, eyesight, ears Listen, hold hands, and walk with feet to serve the whole body. The eyes are not ashamed that they have no hearing, but when the ears are involved, the eyes will be camped. The feet are not ashamed of the lack of grasping, but when the hands are exploring, the feet will be forward: Gai Its vitality is full and its blood vessels are smooth. It is self-evidently wonderful to breathe through itching and feel the divine response.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Since his mind is clear and pure, embodying the unity of all things and perfect benevolence, his spirit flows seamlessly, his aspirations are fulfilled, and there is no distinction between self and others, between objects and self. It is like the body of a person: the eyes see, the ears hear, the hands hold, and the feet walk, all working together for the benefit of the whole body. The eyes do not disdain their lack of hearing, yet where the ears venture, the eyes must also pay attention. The feet do not disdain their lack of holding, yet where the hands reach, the feet must advance. This harmonious flow of vital energy and the smooth circulation of the blood vessels create a responsiveness to stimuli and an understanding without the need for words, achieving a natural and profound subtlety.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为他们的思想纯洁而清澈，具有维护人性的必要条件，这使他们和万物形成一个整体。因此，他们的精神贯穿一切，渗透一切，他们的意志占据上风，遍及一切。自我与他人、自我与万物之间没有区别。这就像一个人的身体。眼能视，耳能听，手能握，足能行，这都是身体的功能。＃6 眼睛不会因为听不见而感到羞愧。＃7 耳朵听到了什么，眼睛就会把注意力投向它。＃8 脚不会因为抓不住东西而感到羞愧。9 手摸到东西，脚就会向前迈进。0 因为原始的物质力量感受并存在于全身，血脉运行顺畅。1 因此，在感觉到痒和呼吸时，它们的影响和对它的快速反应具有一种不用言语就能理解的奥秘。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为他们心智的学问是纯净而清晰的，并且具有保存使他们和万物形成一体的人性所必需的东西。因此，他们的精神贯穿一切、渗透一切，他们的意志占上风、到达一切地方。自我与他人、自我与事物之间没有区别。它就像一个人的身体。眼睛看，耳朵听，手拿，脚走，都履行身体的功能。 ＃6 眼睛并不因为听不到声音而感到羞耻。 ＃7 当耳朵听到某件事时，眼睛就会将注意力集中到它上面。 ＃8 脚不因抓不住而感到羞耻。 ＃9 当手感觉到某物时，脚就会向前移动。 0 因为原始的物质力量感觉并存在于整个身体中，血液和静脉运作顺畅。 1 因此，在感觉瘙痒和呼吸时，它们的影响和对其的快速反应具有一种无需言语就能理解的奥秘。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为他们的心智纯洁而清晰，并且具备了维持人性与万物合一所需的要素。因此，他们的精神贯穿并渗透了一切，他们的意志无所不在、无所不达。自我与他人之间，自我与万物之间，没有区别。就像人的身体一样。眼睛看见，耳朵听见，手持物，脚行走，都实现了身体的功能。#6 眼睛不为不能听到而感到羞耻。#7 当耳朵听到什么时，眼睛会将注意力引向那里。#8 脚不为不能抓握而感到羞耻。#9 当手摸索着什么时，脚会向前移动。0 因为原始的物质力量在整个身体中都有感觉并存在，血液和血管功能通畅。1 因此，在感到痒和呼吸时，他们的影响和迅速的反应具备一种无需言表便可理解的奥秘。

text.ori_cn: 此圣人之学斫以至易至简，易知易从，学易能而才易成者，正以大端惟在复心体之同然，而知识技能非所与论也。
text.man_en: This is why the doctrine of the Sage is the easiest, the simplest, easy to know and easy to follow. The reason why the learning can easily be achieved and the ability easily perfected is precisely because the fundamentals of the doctrine consist only in recovering that which is common to our original minds, and are not concerned with any specific knowledge or skill.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This saint's learning to easy to simple, easy to know easy from, easy to learn easy to be able to only easy to become, just to the end of the big only in the body of the complex mind of the same, and knowledge and skills are not with the theory also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This sage's learning is easy to be simple, easy to know and easy to follow, easy to learn and easy to achieve, because the main reason is that the unity of mind and body is the same, and knowledge and skills cannot be discussed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This sage's teaching is extremely straightforward and simple, easy to understand and follow, and readily mastered with talent swiftly developed. This is precisely because its essence lies in the universal nature of the human heart, rather than in the realm of knowledge and skills.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是为什么圣人学说是最容易、最简单、易懂、易行的。学易成，能易成，正是因为学说的根本只在于恢复我们本心的共性，而不涉及任何具体的知识或技能。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人的道理是最简单、最简单、最容易知道、最容易遵循的。学问之所以容易达到，能力之所以容易完善，正是因为法理的根本只是恢复本心共性，而不涉及任何具体的知识或技能。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是为什么圣人的教义是最容易、最简单、易于知晓和易于遵循的原因。学习之所以容易实现，能力之所以容易完美，正是因为教义的基本原则仅在于恢复我们原始心灵中共有的东西，而不涉及任何具体的知识或技能。

text.ori_cn: 〔14〕三代之衰，王道熄而霸术倡：孔、孟既没，圣学晦而邪说横：教者不复以此为教，而学者不复以此为学，霸者之徒，窃取先王之近似者，假之于外以内济其私己之欲，天下靡然而宗之，圣人之道遂以芜塞。
text.man_en: As the Three Dynasties declined, the kingly way was stopped and the techniques of the despot flourished. After the passing of Confucius and Mencius, the doctrine of the Sage became obscure and perverse doctrines ran wild. Teachers no longer taught the doctrine of the Sage and students no longer studied it. Followers of despots stole and appropriated what seemed to be the teaching of ancient kings, and outwardly made a pretense of following it in order inwardly to satisfy their selfish desires. The whole world followed them in fashion. ＃6 As a result the Way of the Sage was obstructed as though stopped by weeds.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [14] The decline of the Three Dynasties, the king's way is extinguished and the hegemony is advocated: Confucius and Mencius have disappeared, the sacred science is obscured and the heresies are rampant: those who teach are no longer taught in this way and scholars are no longer taught in this way, and the hegemony's disciples steal the similarity of the former king and fake it in the outside world to help them with their selfish desires, and the world is overwhelmed by them, and the way of the saints has become overrun with them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [14] With the decline of the three generations, the royal way was extinguished and hegemony was promoted: Confucius and Mencius are gone, the sacred knowledge is obscure and heresy is rampant: teachers no longer use it as teaching, and scholars no longer use it as learning. The disciples of the hegemon, Those who steal the approximations of the previous kings and use them externally to serve their own selfish desires internally will make the world unruly, and the way of the saints will be blocked.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: During the decline of the three dynasties, the way of the king extinguished while the techniques of hegemony rose: with the passing of Confucius and Mencius, the teachings of the sage became obscure and heretical doctrines prevailed. Educators no longer taught this, and students no longer learned this; the followers of the hegemons, stealing likenesses of the ancient kings, feigned external propriety to satisfy their inner selfish desires. The whole world blindly revered them, leading to the obstruction and neglect of the sage's path.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 三代衰微，王道止息，专制之术盛行。孔孟去世后，圣人学说变得模糊不清，歪理邪说横行。老师不再传授圣贤学说，学生不再学习圣贤学说。专制者的追随者窃取和挪用貌似古代君王的学说，表面上装模作样地遵循，内心却在满足自己的私欲。整个世界都跟风效仿。＃6 结果，圣人之道就像被杂草阻挡了一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 三朝衰落，王道停顿，霸王之术盛行。孔孟死后，圣道晦涩，邪道横行。师不再教圣人之道，学生也不再学圣人之道。专制君主的追随者偷窃和盗用了似乎是古代国王的教义，并假装遵循它，以求内心满足他们的私欲。全世界都在时尚界追随他们。 ＃6 于是，圣人之道就如被杂草挡住了一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 随着三代的衰落，王道止息，暴虐的手段盛行。孔子和孟子去世后，圣人的教义变得晦涩不明，邪说泛滥。老师不再教授圣人之道，学生也不再学习。暴君的追随者窃取并挪用古代君王的教诲，表面上假装遵循它，实际上满足他们的私欲。全世界都随之效仿。结果，圣人的道就像被荒草阻挡一样受到了阻碍。

text.ori_cn: 相仿相效，日求所以富强之说，倾诈之谋，攻伐之计，一切欺天罔人，苟一时之得，以猎取声利之术，若管、商、苏、张之属者，至不可名数。
text.man_en: The theory of prosperity and strength, the deception plan, the attack plan, all the tricks of deceiving the heaven and neglecting people, seeking temporary gains, and hunting for fame and fortune, if they belong to Guan, Shang, Su, and Zhang, To innumerable.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Imitate each other, day to day to seek so rich and strong said, tilting fraudulent schemes, attack and conquer the plan, all the deception of the sky is not people, Gou momentary gain, in order to hunt for the art of sound and profit, such as the tube, Shang, Su, Zhang's genus, to the unnamable number.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The theory of prosperity and strength, the deception plan, the attack plan, all the tricks of deceiving the heaven and neglecting people, seeking temporary gains, and hunting for fame and fortune, if they belong to Guan, Shang, Su, and Zhang, To innumerable.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Imitating and emulating each other, they daily seek methods to become rich and powerful, devising schemes of deception, strategies of attack, and all means of deceiving heaven and people. They pursue short-term gains to hunt for fame and profit, akin to those like Guan Zhong, Shang Yang, Su Qin, and Zhang Yi, in numbers beyond reckoning.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 富强之论、诈术之谋、攻伐之计，凡欺天罔人、贪图一时之利、猎取功名利禄之术，若关、商、苏、张之属，不可胜数。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 盛强论，诈计，攻计，一切欺天忽视人，求一时之利，追名逐利的伎俩，若属关、商、苏、张，至无数。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 富强的理论，欺诈的计划，攻击的计划，所有欺骗天意忽视人意的计谋，追求一时之利，猎取名利，如果属于管、商、苏、张，就不计其数。

text.ori_cn: 既其久也，斗争劫夺，不胜其祸，斯人沦于禽兽、夷狄，而霸术亦有所不能行矣。
text.man_en: After a long time, the calamity of war and plundering became infinite. Thus people degenerated to the status of animals and barbarians, and even despotism itself could no longer operate.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Since its long time also, the struggle to rob, can not win the scourge of the people of the beasts, barbarians, and the hegemony can not be carried out.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: After a long period of struggle and plunder, the people were reduced to beasts and barbarians, and their hegemony was no longer possible.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In times of prolonged strife, the relentless struggle and plundering result in innumerable calamities, reducing humans to beasts and barbarians, making it impossible even for the mighty to enforce their will.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 久而久之，战争和掠夺的灾难变得无穷无尽。于是，人们退化到动物和野蛮人的地位，甚至专制主义本身也无法再运作。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 久而久之，战争掠夺之祸无穷。于是，人就堕落到了动物、野蛮人的地位，连专制主义本身都无法运作了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 经过漫长的时间，战争和掠夺的灾难变得无穷无尽。因此人们退化到动物和野蛮人的地位，甚至连专制统治本身也无法再运作。

text.ori_cn: 世之儒者慨然悲伤，蒐猎先圣王之典一草法制而掇拾修补于煨烬之余，盖其为心良欲以挽回先王之道。
text.man_en: The Confucian scholars of the world were deeply saddened. They searched for the laws and regulations of the ancestors of the sage kings and picked them up and repaired them while they were simmering.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world of Confucianism is saddened to collect the first saint of the king's code a grass legal system and pick up and repair in the simmering embers of the rest, cover the heart of the good want to redeem the way of the former king.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Confucian scholars of the world were deeply saddened. They searched for the laws and regulations of the ancestors of the sage kings, picked them up and repaired them while they were simmering, out of a conscience desire to restore the ways of the ancestors.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The scholars of the world lament in sorrow, gathering the remaining classics and laws of the ancient sage-kings from the ashes, and patching them together in an attempt to revive the way of the former kings out of their genuine desire.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天下儒生深感痛心。他们遍寻圣王先祖的法度典章，趁热打铁，拾掇重修。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天下儒生悲痛万分。他们搜查圣王祖先的法令法规，边熬边捡起来修复。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天下的儒士们都深感悲痛。他们寻找圣王祖先的法律法规，并在煎熬中拾起和修补这些法规。

text.ori_cn: 圣学既远，霸术之传积渍已深，虽在贤知，皆不免于习染，其所以讲明修饰，以求宣畅光复于世者，仅是以增霸者之藩篱，而圣学之门墙，遂不复可睹：于是乎有训詀之学，而传之以为名，有记诵之学，而言之以为博，有词章之学，而侈之以为丽：若是者，纷纷籍籍，群起角立于天下，又不知其几家，万径千蹊，莫知所适。
text.man_en: Since Confucian doctrines were discarded and the tradition of the technique of despotism had become strongly entrenched, even the virtuous and wise could not help being influenced by it. The doctrines elucidated and embellished in order to make them clear to the people, make them prevail, and restore them to the world, merely served to fortify the strongholds of despots. As a result, the door of Confucianism was blocked, and it was no longer to be seen. Therefore the learning of textual criticism developed and those perpetuating it were regarded as famous. The practice of memorization and recitation developed and those advocating it were regarded as extensively learned. ＃6 The writing of flowery compositions developed and those indulging in it were regarded as elegant. ＃7 Thus with great confusion and tremendous noise they set themselves up and competed with one another, and no one knew how many schools there were. ＃8 Among tens of thousands of paths and thousands of tracks, none knew which to follow.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world is full of them, and I do not know how many of them are there, and I do not know where they fit in, but I do not know what they are.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sacred knowledge is far away, and the inheritance of hegemony has been deeply stained. Even the wise and knowledgeable are not immune to the influence. The reason why they explain and modify it in order to spread the peace and restore the world is just to increase the barriers of the hegemon, and become a saint. The door and wall of learning are no longer visible: so there is the learning of teaching, which is passed down as a name, the learning of memorization, which is regarded as erudition, the learning of poetry and composition, which is regarded as beautiful. If this is the case, They all have different nationalities, and they all stand out in the world, but they don’t know which family they have. There are thousands of paths and paths, and they don’t know where to go.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With the distance from the teachings of sages and the deep-seated tradition of hegemony, even those who are wise and virtuous cannot escape its influence. In their efforts to elaborate, refine, and seek to revive it in the world, they only serve to fortify the barriers of hegemony. Thus, the true essence of sage teachings becomes obscured. Consequently, there arises the scholarship of interpretation, which is passed down under the guise of fame, the scholarship of memorization, which is spoken of as erudition, and the scholarship of literary skills, which is vaunted as elegance. This results in a multitude of paths and schools competing across the land, so numerous that their exact number is unknown, with myriad approaches and methods whose destination is uncertain.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 由于儒家学说被摒弃，专制技术的传统根深蒂固，即使是贤明的人也不能不受其影响。为了让人们明白这些学说，让这些学说流行起来，让这些学说重现于世，而对这些学说进行阐释和美化，只是为了巩固专制者的堡垒。结果，儒学的大门被堵死了，再也看不到了。于是，"文批 "之学兴起，"文批 "之人被视为名家。背诵之风兴起，提倡背诵的人被认为博学多才。＃6 文采飞扬，沉湎其中者被视为雅士。＃7 于是，他们自立门户，相互竞争，混乱不堪，声势浩大，谁也不知道有多少门派。＃8 在数以万计的道路和数以千计的轨道中，没有人知道该走哪条路。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 由于儒家学说被废弃，专制手段的传统根深蒂固，即使是有德有智的人也不能不受到它的影响。为了使人民明白、使之流行、使之复归于世而阐明和修饰的教义，不过是为了巩固专制君主的堡垒而已。于是，儒家的大门被堵住了，再也不见了。故考据之学发达，而传之者，则为名。记忆和背诵的做法得到了发展，那些提倡这种做法的人被认为是博学多才。 ＃6 华丽的文笔发达，沉迷于其中的人被认为是优雅的。 ＃7 于是，一片混乱，一片喧闹，他们各自摆好位置，相互竞争，不知有多少所学校。 ＃8 千万条路，千万条轨迹，谁也不知道该走哪条。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于儒家学说被抛弃，专制技术的传统已变得根深蒂固，即使是贤德之人也不免受到其影响。为了使人民明白、使儒家学说流行并恢复于世，阐发并润饰这些教义，只是更加巩固了专制者的堡垒。结果，儒家的门被堵塞，再也看不见了。因此，文字批评之学得以发展，并且那些传承这种学问的人被认为是著名的。背诵和朗读的实践得以发展，那些提倡的人被认为是博学多才的。＃6 华丽文章的写作得到发展，那些沉溺于此的人被认为是优雅的。＃7 因此，他们在极大的混乱和巨大的喧嚣中站立起来，相互竞争，而且谁也不知道有多少学派。＃8 在成千上万条路径和千百条轨迹中，没有人知道该追随哪一条。

text.ori_cn: 世之学者如入百戏之场，欢谑跳踉、骋奇斗巧、献笑争妍者，四面而竞出，前瞻后盼，应接不遑，而耳目眩瞀，精神恍惑，日夜遨游淹息其间，如病狂丧心之人，莫自知其家业之所归：时君世主亦皆昏迷颠倒于其说，而终身从事于无用之虚文，莫自知其所谓。
text.man_en: The scholars of the world are like entering the scene of a hundred plays, where people are joking, jumping, playing tricks, and showing off their laughter to compete for beauty. They are competing in all directions, looking forward and looking back, and they are eager to catch up. Their ears and eyes are dazzled, their spirits are confused, and they are wandering around day and night. During the period of drowning and resting, he was like a man who was sick, mad and heartbroken, and did not know where his family and property belonged. The kings and world leaders at that time were also in a coma and confused what he said, and spent their whole lives engaged in useless writing, without knowing what they meant.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The scholars of the world are like those who enter the theatre of a hundred plays, who jest and stagger, who gallop and fight, who offer smiles and vie for beauty, who compete on all sides, who look forward and backward, and who are unable to cope with it, while their ears and eyes are dazzled, and their spirits are confused, and they swim and drown day and night in the midst of it, like a sick and mad man with a broken heart, who does not know to what his family's business belongs: the ruler of the time and the masters of the world are all stupefied by their sayings, and are engaged in a life-long exercise in useless and false writing, and who do not know what they are called.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The scholars of the world are like entering the scene of a hundred plays, where people are joking, jumping, playing tricks, and showing off their laughter to compete for beauty. They are competing in all directions, looking forward and looking back, and they are eager to catch up. Their ears and eyes are dazzled, their spirits are confused, and they are wandering around day and night. During the period of drowning and resting, he was like a man who was sick, mad and heartbroken, and did not know where his family and property belonged. The kings and world lords at that time were also in a coma and confused what he said, and spent their whole lives engaged in useless writing, not knowing what they meant.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Scholars of the world are like those entering a circus, indulging in merry-making, jumping and prancing around, showcasing their unique skills and contending to display their talents. They emerge from all directions, looking ahead and glancing back, overwhelmed by the flurry of events, their senses dazzled and minds confused. Day and night, they wander and linger in this environment, like people mad with illness, unaware of the destiny of their own household. Similarly, contemporary rulers are lost and confounded by their rhetoric, dedicating their lives to useless and empty words without understanding their true meaning.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天下士子如入百戏之场，说说笑笑，蹦蹦跳跳，耍耍小把戏，展露笑颜，争奇斗艳。四面八方，争先恐后，瞻前顾后，你追我赶。他们耳目缭乱，精神迷茫，日夜徘徊。溺水休养期间，如病如狂，伤心欲绝，不知家产归属。当时的君王和世界领袖们也昏迷不醒，搞不清他说的话是什么意思，终其一生都在从事无用的文字工作，不知所云。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天下士人如入百戏现场，人们说笑、跳跃、耍花样、卖弄笑声，争奇斗艳。他们四面八方竞逐，向前看，回望，奋起直追。他们耳目眩目，精神混乱，日夜徘徊。在溺水休息的这段时间里，他就像一个生病、疯狂、伤心欲绝的人，不知道自己的家人和财产属于哪里。当时的国王和各国领导人也都处于昏迷状态，对他所说的话感到困惑，一生从事无用的写作，而不知道其中的含义。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 世间的学者如置身于百戏的现场，众人嘻笑、跳跃、弄巧并炫耀笑容以争奇斗艳。他们四面竞争，前前后后，急切地赶超。他们的耳目昏花，精神迷乱，日夜游荡。在溺水和休息期间，就像一个有病、疯狂和伤心的人，不知道自己的家庭和财产属于哪里。那时的国王和世界领袖也处于昏迷和困惑状态，终生从事无用的写作，不知道其意义。

text.ori_cn: 间有觉其空疏谬妄：支离牵滞，而卓然自奋，欲以见诸行事之实者，极其所抵，亦不过为富强功利、五霸之事业而止。
text.man_en: Occasionally some rulers realized the emptiness, falsehood, fragmentariness, and unnaturalness of their ways, and heroically roused themselves to great effort, which they wished to demonstrate in concrete action. But the most they could do was no more than to achieve national wealth, power, success, and profit, such as those of the Five Despots.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In some cases, there are those who feel that they are empty and delusional: they are detached from the stagnation, and they are so proud of themselves that they want to see the reality of what they are doing, and they are only interested in the cause of wealth and power, and the cause of the Five Hegemons.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sometimes I feel that it is empty, sparse and absurd: it is fragmented and stagnant, but it is outstanding and self-motivated. Those who want to see the reality of their actions are extremely frustrated, and they are just for the cause of wealth, power, utilitarianism, and the Five Hegemons.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In rare instances, one may perceive their emptiness and fallacies: fragmentary, sluggish, yet resolute and self-driven, aiming to manifest the reality in practical affairs, but ultimately, the extent of their reach can only amount to the achievement of wealth, power, and the enterprises of the Five Hegemons.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 偶尔有一些统治者意识到了他们的方式的空虚、虚假、零碎和不自然，并英勇地奋起努力，他们希望用具体的行动来证明这一点。但他们所能做的，也不过是实现国家的财富、权力、成功和利益，比如五霸。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有时，一些统治者认识到自己的做法是空虚、虚假、片断、不自然的，于是奋起奋发，并希望用具体行动来表现出来。但他们最多也不过是获得国家的富强、成功和利益，如五霸那样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 偶尔有一些统治者意识到了他们行为的空虚、虚假、片面和非自然性，并英勇地奋起做出巨大的努力，试图在具体行动中展示出来。但是，他们所能做到的不过是像五霸那样获得国家的财富、权力、成功和利益。

text.ori_cn: 圣人之学日远日晦，而功利之习愈趋愈下：其间虽尝瞽惑于佛、老，而佛、老之说卒亦未能有以胜其功利之心：虽又尝折衷于群儒，而群儒之论终亦未能有以破其功利之见。
text.man_en: Consequently the teachings of the Sage became more and more distant and obscured, while the current of success and profit ran deeper and deeper. Some students turned to Buddhism and Taoism and were deceived by them. But at bottom there was nothing in these systems that could overcome their desire for success and profit. Others sought to reconcile the conflicting doctrines within the Confucian school. But in the final analysis there was nothing in these doctrines that could destroy the view of success and profit.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saints' learning was becoming more and more obscure, and the habit of utilitarianism was getting worse and worse: in the meantime, although he had been bewildered by the Buddha and the Old Masters, the Buddha and the Old Masters were unable to overcome their utilitarianism: although he had been persuaded by the Confucian scholars, they were not able to overcome their utilitarianism.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The learning of the saints is getting darker and darker with each passing day, and their utilitarian habits are getting worse and worse. During this period, although they were confused by the Buddha and Lao Lao, the Buddha and Lao Lao's theories were not motivated to overcome their utilitarianism. Although they were sometimes compromised by A group of Confucianists, and the arguments of a group of Confucianists were ultimately unable to undermine their utilitarian views.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The teachings of the sages grow increasingly distant and obscure by the day, while the habits driven by self-interest become ever lower: though at times they are deluded by the doctrines of Buddha and Laozi, ultimately, the teachings of Buddha and Laozi fail to overcome their utilitarian mindset. Similarly, though they sometimes seek a balance among the various Confucian scholars, the arguments of these scholars still cannot shatter their self-interested views.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 结果，圣人的教诲变得越来越遥远和模糊，而成功和利益的洪流却越来越深。一些学生转向佛教和道教，并受其蒙蔽。但从根本上说，这些体系中没有任何东西能克服他们对成功和利益的渴望。还有一些学生试图调和儒家学派中相互冲突的学说。但归根结底，这些学说中没有任何东西可以摧毁成功和利益观。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 于是，圣人的教义就越来越遥远、越来越模糊，功利的潮流也越来越深。有的学生皈依佛教、道教，受其欺骗。但归根结底，这些系统中没有任何东西可以克服他们对成功和利润的渴望。其他人则试图调和儒家学派内部相互冲突的学说。但归根结底，这些学说中没有任何东西可以摧毁成功和利润的观点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人的教诲变得越来越遥远和模糊，而追求成功和利益的风潮却越来越深。有些学生转向佛教和道教，并被其迷惑。然而，这些体系根本上并没有什么能克服他们对成功和利益的渴望。还有一些学生试图调和儒家内部的矛盾学说，但归根结底，这些学说中也没有什么能摧毁对成功和利益的看法。

text.ori_cn: 盖至于今，功利之毒沦浃于人之心髓，而习以成性也，几千年矣。
text.man_en: For up to the present time it has been several thousand years since the poison of the doctrine of success and profit has infected the innermost recesses of man's mind and has become his second nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Cover to the present day, the poison of utilitarianism is soaked in the marrow of the human heart, and the habit to assimilate, thousands of years.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Up to now, the poison of utilitarianism has been inflicted on people's hearts, and it has become a habit for thousands of years.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To this day, the poison of utilitarianism has permeated into the heart and soul of people, becoming second nature, for thousands of years.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 直到现在，成功学和利益学的毒药已经感染了人类心灵的最深处，成为人类的第二本性，距今已有几千年的历史。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 迄今为止，功利主义的毒害已经侵染人的心灵最深处，成为人的第二天性，已经有几千年了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 到目前为止，成功和利益的教条之毒已经侵蚀了人类内心深处数千年，并已成为人类的第二天性。

text.ori_cn: 相矜以知，相轧以势，相争以利，相高以技能，相取以声誉：其出而仕也，理钱谷者则欲兼夫兵刑，典礼乐者又欲与于铨轴，处郡县则思藩臬之高，居台谏则望宰执之要。
text.man_en: People have mutually boasted of their knowledge, crushed one another with power, rivaled each other for profit, mutually striven for superiority through skill, and attempted success through fame. When they came forward to serve in the government, those in charge of the treasury wanted also to control the departments of military affairs and justice. Those in charge of ceremonies and of a regional governor. And censors looked forward to the key position of the prime minister.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Reserve each other to know, rolling each other to the situation, compete with each other to profit, high skills, take each other to reputation: its out and service also, the money and valley of those who want to concurrently with the military and criminal, ceremonial music and those who want to with the shaft of the Ambrose, in the counties and counties are thinking about the high of the feudal environment, the residence of the Taiwan adman is looking at the importance of the Zaijian.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: They are interested in each other for knowledge, they compete with each other for power, they compete for advantage, they are superior to each other for skills, and they compete for reputation: they go out to serve as officials, those who manage money and valleys want to serve as husbands and soldiers, and those who perform ceremonies and music want to be in charge of the gun axis. When you are in a prefecture or county, you think about the high status of the feudal lord; when you are on the stage to admonish, you look to the prime minister to hold the key points.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: They boast of their wisdom, compete with power, vie for profit, elevate themselves through skills, and seize reputation: When these individuals enter public service, those managing finances desire control over military and judicial affairs; those involved in rites and music aspire to handle personnel decisions; in local government, they covet higher posts of supervision; and in supervisory roles, they yearn for the pivotal positions of administration.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们相互吹嘘自己的学识，以权压人，以利相争，以技争高下，以名图成功。掌管国库的人想兼管军政和司法部门，掌管礼仪的人想兼管地区长官，掌管吏治的人想兼管地方官吏。掌管礼仪和地区长官的人也是如此。佥事则希望担任宰相这一要职。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人们以知识相互夸耀，以权力相互压垮，以利益相互竞争，以技艺相互争强，以名誉相互求成。当他们出任政府时，掌管财政部的人也想控制军事部门和司法部门。负责仪式和地方长官的人。而审查人员则期待着首相的关键职位。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们互相夸耀自己的知识，用权力压制对方，为利益互相竞争，通过技巧争取优势，并试图通过名声获得成功。当他们上台为政府服务时，掌管财政的人也想控制军事事务和司法部门的工作。掌管典礼和地方省长的事务。而监察官则期待着担任首相的重要职位。

text.ori_cn: 故不能其事则不得以兼其官，不通其说则不可以要其誉：记诵之广，适以长其敖也：知识之多，适以行其恶也：闻见之博，适以肆其辨也：辞章之富，适以饰其伪也。
text.man_en: And censors looked forward to the key position of the prime minister. Of course one could not take a concurrent position unless he could do the work and one could not expect any praise unless theories were advanced to justify the practice. Extensive memorization and recitation merely served to increase their pride, substantial and abundant knowledge merely served to help them do evil, enormous information merely served to help them indulge in argumentation, and wealth in flowery compositions merely served to cover up their artificiality.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if you can't do it, then you can't be a part of it, and if you can't understand it, then you can't ask for its reputation: the wide range of recitation is suitable to grow its Ao: the knowledge of the many is suitable to do its evils: the broadness of the hearings and the insights are suitable for the wantonness of the discernment: the richness of the rhetoric is suitable for the adornment of its hypocrisy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you are unable to do something, you cannot hold an official position; if you do not know how to explain it, you cannot be praised. If you memorize it extensively, you will be able to do a good job. If you have a lot of knowledge, you will be able to do bad things. If you hear and see extensively, you will be able to do it. Fourth, the distinction is as follows: The richness of the words and chapters is suitable to cover up the falsehood.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, those who cannot fulfill their duties should not be assigned multiple positions; those who do not understand the principles should not seek acclaim. Broad memorization only extends their arrogance; extensive knowledge only enhances their malice; extensive experiences only amplify their contentiousness; and rhetorical prowess only embellishes their deceit.

text.ori_cn: “系”言“何思何虑”，是言所思所虑只是一个天理，更无别思别虑耳，非谓无思无虑也。
text.man_en: The saying in the “Appended Remarks, ” “What is there to think about or to deliberate about?” means that what is to be thought about or deliberated about is only the Principle of Nature and that outside of it there should be no other thought or deliberation. It does not mean having no thought or deliberation at all.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Xie" means "what to think about, what to worry about", which means that what you think and worry about is just a natural principle, and there is no other way to think about it. It does not mean that there is no thought or worry.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 'What thoughts, what concerns,' it means that what we think and worry about is merely a matter of natural reasoning, and nothing more beyond it, not that there are no thoughts or concerns at all.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 附言》中说："有什么可思考或斟酌的呢？"意思是说，要思考或斟酌的只是自然的原理，在自然的原理之外，不应该有其他的思考或斟酌。这并不是说完全没有思考或商议。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《附注》中有句话：“有什么可思考、可斟酌的？”意思是所要思考或考虑的只是自然法则，在它之外不应有其他思考或考虑。这并不意味着完全没有思考或深思熟虑。

text.ori_cn: 故曰：“同归而殊途，一致而百虑，天下何思何虑。”
