text.ori_cn: 〔1〕来书云：“下手工夫，觉此心无时宁静，妄心固动也，照心亦动也；心既恒动，则无刻暂停也”。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “As I engage in the task, I feel that my mind is not at any time peacefully tranquil. An erroneous mind is of course active. But the shining mind is also active. Since the mind is always active, it has not a moment of rest. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [1] The book says: "When you start to work, you will find that the mind is always quiet; the delusional mind is always moving, and the illumined mind is also moving; if the mind is always moving, there is no moment to pause."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔1〕 The book says: "When you work hard, you will feel that your mind is always quiet. The delusional mind is constantly moving, and the illuminating mind is also moving. Since the mind is constantly moving, it never pauses."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The letter states: 'As I practice, I find my heart never at peace, for my restless mind is constantly agitated. Both the deluded mind and the observing mind are in motion. Since the mind is perpetually active, it never rests, not even for a moment.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："当我从事这项工作时，我感到我的心灵在任何时候都无法平静安宁。错误的思想当然是活跃的。但光明的心灵也是活跃的。因为思想总是活跃的，所以它没有片刻休息。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你的来信中说：“在我从事这项工作的过程中，我感到自己的心时刻都不太平静。错误的思想当然是活跃的。但闪亮的心灵也是活跃的。由于心始终处于活动状态，因此一刻也没有休息。 ”

text.ori_cn: 是有意于求宁静，是以愈不宁静耳。

text.ori_cn: 夫妄心则动也，照心非动也；恒照则恒动恒静，天地之所以恒久而不已也；照心固照也，妄心亦照也。
text.man_en: Now an erroneous mind is of course active, but a shining mind is not. If it is always shining, it will always be both active and tranquil. This is the way in which heaven and earth operate forever without cease. The shining mind will of course shine, but the erroneous mind will also shine.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The delusional mind is also moving, illuminating the mind is not moving; constant illumination is constant movement and constant static, the reason why heaven and earth are constant and unending; illuminating the mind is also illuminating, the delusional mind is also illuminating.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the mind is illuminating, it will move, but if the mind is illuminating, it will not move. If the mind is constantly illuminating, it will always move and remain still. This is why the heaven and earth are eternal.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The deluded mind acts, while the illuminated mind does not; constant illumination implies perpetual motion and stillness, which is the reason for the eternal persistence of heaven and earth; the illuminated mind is essentially illuminating, and the deluded mind is also illuminated.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，一个错误的心灵当然是活跃的，但一个闪亮的心灵却不是。如果它始终闪耀，它就会始终既活跃又宁静。这就是天地运转不息的方式。闪耀的心灵当然会闪耀，但错误的心灵也会闪耀。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 错误的心当然是活跃的，但光明的心却不是。如果它永远闪耀，它就永远既活跃又宁静。天地如此运行，永无休止。光明的心当然会发光，但错误的心也会发光。

text.ori_cn: 此或听之未审；良知者，心之本体，即前所谓恒照者也。

text.ori_cn: 心之本体，无起无不起。
text.man_en: The original substance of the mind neither rises nor does not rise.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The true nature of the mind has no origin and no origin.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心的本体既不升起，也不不升起。

text.ori_cn: 虽妄念之发，而良知未尝不在，但人不知存，则有时而或放耳：虽昏塞之极，而良知未尝不明，但人不知察，则有时而或蔽耳。
text.man_en: Even when erroneous thoughts arise, innate knowledge is present. Only because man does not know how to preserve it is the mind sometimes lost. Even when the mind is most darkened and obstructed, innate knowledge is clear. Only because man does not know how to examine it is the mind sometimes obscured.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Though the delusion is sent, the conscience is not absent, but if a man does not know to store it, it is sometimes or put away: though the fainting is extreme, the conscience is not unknown, but if a man does not know to examine it, it is sometimes or obscured.

Even though they are extremely comatose, their conscience is not clear, but people do not know how to detect them, so sometimes their ears may be blocked.

Though the mind is utterly clouded, inherent knowledge is never truly obscured; yet when people do not perceive it, it may at times be concealed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使出现错误的想法，与生俱来的知识也是存在的。只是因为人类不知道如何保存它，所以有时会迷失心智。即使在心智最黑暗、最受阻的时候，先天知识也是清晰的。只是因为人类不知道如何审视它，所以心智有时会变得模糊不清。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即使当错误的思想出现时，固有的知识仍然存在。只是因为人不知道如何保存它，心灵有时才会迷失。即使心最黑暗、最受阻碍，固有的智慧也是清晰的。只是因为人不知道如何检验它，心有时才变得模糊。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即使错误的念头产生，天赋的知识依然存在。只因人们不懂得如何保存它，心智有时迷失。即使心智最为黑暗和受到阻碍，天赋的知识依然清晰。只因人们不懂得如何审察它，心智有时被掩盖。

text.ori_cn: 虽有时而或放，其体实未尝不在也，存之而已耳：虽有时而或蔽，其体实未尝不明也，察之而已耳。
text.man_en: Although it is perhaps sometimes lost, its substance is always present. The thing to do is to preserve it. And although it is perhaps sometimes obscured, its substance is always clear. The thing to do is to examine it.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although it sometimes disappears or is released, its essence is not yet absent, it is just present. Although it sometimes appears or is hidden, its essence is not yet unclear, it is just observed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Although it may occasionally be neglected, its essence has never truly been absent; it simply needs to be maintained. Although it may occasionally be obscured, its essence has never truly been unclear; it simply needs to be understood.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽然有时可能会丢失，但其本质始终存在。我们要做的就是保护它。虽然它有时会被遮蔽，但其本质却始终清晰可见。我们要做的就是研究它。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尽管它有时可能会丢失，但它的实质始终存在。要做的就是保护它。尽管它有时可能会被掩盖，但其实质总是清晰的。要做的就是检查它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然它有时可能会丢失，但其实质始终存在。要做的事情是保护它。虽然它有时可能会模糊，但其实质始终清晰。要做的事情是审视它。

text.ori_cn: 若谓真知亦有起处，则是有时而不在也，非其本体之谓矣。
text.man_en: To say that innate knowledge arises from somewhere is to say that sometimes it is not present. That would not be the original substance of the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If it is said that true knowledge also has a place of origin, then it is sometimes absent, and is not what it is meant to be.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If it is said that true knowledge also has its origin, then it means that it is sometimes absent, which is not its essence.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 信中说：“元神、元力、元元，必各有其保存之地和起源之地。还有真正被动阴的本质和真正主动阳的力量。 。 。 。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说，“元神、元气、元精各有其保存和发源之处。还有真阴之精和真阳之气。。。。”

text.ori_cn: 真阴之精，即真阳之气之母，真阳之气，即真阴之精之父：阴根阳，阳桹阴，亦非有二也：苟吾良知之说明，即凡若此类，皆可以不言而喻；不然，则如来书所云三关、七返、九还之属，尚有无穷可疑者也。
text.man_en: The essence of true yin is the mother of the qi of true yang, and the qi of true yang is the father of the essence of true yin: yin is the root of yang, and yang is the yin. All categories can be selfevident; otherwise, there are still endless doubts about the attributes of the three passes, seven returns, and nine returns mentioned in the Tathagata's book.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The essence of true yin is the mother of true yang, and the essence of true yang is the father of true yin: yin rooted in yang, yang in yin, and there are not two of them: if I were to explain to my conscience that all such things are self-evident, or if I were not to do so, then, as I said in the book, the three passes, the seven returns, and the nine returns would be infinitely doubtful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The essence of true yin is the mother of the qi of true yang, and the qi of true yang is the father of the essence of true yin: Yin is rooted in yang, and yang is yin. All categories can be self-evident; otherwise, there are still endless doubts about the attributes of the three passes, seven returns, and nine returns mentioned in Tathagata's book.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The essence of true Yin is the mother of the true Yang energy, and the true Yang energy is the father of the true Yin essence: Yin roots in Yang, and Yang sustains Yin, showing they are not two separate entities. If we understand the explanation through our innate good knowledge, then such matters become self-evident; otherwise, as mentioned in the texts regarding the three gates, seven returns, and nine cycles, there would be endless doubts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 真阴之精为真阳之气之母，真阳之气为真阴之精之父：阴为阳之根，阳为阴之本。凡此种种，不证自明，否则，《太极图说》中所说的三通、七返、九还的属性，还会有无穷无尽的疑问。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 真阴之精，真阳之气之母，真阳之气，真阴之精之父：阴为阳之根本，阳为阴。所有类别都是不言而喻的；否则，对于如来书中所说的三关、七返、九返的属性，至今仍存在无尽的疑问。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 真阴之精是真阳之气之母，真阳之气是真阴之精之父：阴乃阳之根，阳乃阴之本。所有类别都可以不言自明；否则，对于如来书中提到的三关、七返、九返的属性仍然有无尽的疑问。

text.ori_cn: 中也，寂也，公也，既以属心之体，则良知是矣。
text.man_en: Since equilibrium, absolute quiet, and impartiality are characteristics of the substance of the mind, then it must be innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The centre is also, the silence is also, the public is also, both to the body of the mind, then the conscience is.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Zhongye, Jiye, Gongye. Since it belongs to the heart, it is conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zhong, tranquility, and impartiality—once attributed to the heart and mind, they become innate knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既然平衡、绝对安静和公正是心的本质特征，那么它就一定是与生俱来的知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 既然平衡、寂静、公正是心体的特征，那么它一定是本具智。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 既然均衡、绝对的宁静和公平是心灵本质的特征，那么它必定是先天知识。

text.ori_cn: 性无不善，故知无不良。
text.man_en: There is no human nature that is not good. Therefore, there is no innate knowledge that is not good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no badness in nature, so we know there is no badness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is nothing bad about nature, so we know there is nothing bad about it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All human nature is inherently good; therefore, all knowledge is without evil.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 没有不善的人性。因此，没有不善的先天知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人性没有不善的。因此，没有什么先天知识是不好的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 没有一种人性不是善良的。因此，没有一种先天知识不是好的。

text.ori_cn: 真知即是未发之中，即是廓然大公，寂然不动之本体，人人之所同具者也：但不能不昏蔽于物欲，故须学以去其昏蔽；然于良知之本体，初不能有加于毫末也。
text.man_en: Innate knowledge is the equilibrium before the feelings are aroused. It is the state of broadness and extreme impartiality. It is the original substance that is absolutely quiet and inactive. And it is possessed by all men. However, people cannot help being darkened and obscured by material desires. ＃6 Hence they must study in order to get rid of the darkness and obscuration. ＃7 But to or from the original substance of innate knowledge they cannot add or subtract even an iota.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: True knowledge is the undeveloped, that is to say, it is the essence of openness, of silence and immovability, which is common to all: but it is not possible not to be obscured by material desires, and therefore it is necessary to learn to remove the obscurity; but in the essence of conscience, it is not possible to add the slightest thing at the beginning.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: True knowledge is something that has not yet been revealed, that is, it is a clear, silent and unmoving essence, which is shared by everyone. However, it cannot but be obscured by material desires, so it is necessary to learn to get rid of its obscuration; however, with good knowledge The essence cannot be added to the beginning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: True knowledge is the state of equilibrium before desires arise, characterized by a grand impartiality and a serene, unmoving essence, which everyone inherently possesses. However, it is often obscured by material desires, necessitating learning to dispel such obfuscation. Nonetheless, this does not add anything in the slightest to the essence of innate knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识是情感被激发之前的平衡。它是一种宽广和极端公正的状态。它是绝对安静、无为的原始物质。它是所有人都拥有的。然而，人总是会被物质欲望所遮蔽。＃6 因此，他们必须学习，以摆脱黑暗和蒙蔽。＃7 但是，对于先天知识的本原，他们却不能增减分毫。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先天的知识是情感被激发之前的平衡。这是一种博大和极端公正的状态。它是绝对安静且不活跃的原始物质。它是所有人都拥有的。然而，人却不可避免地被物欲所蒙蔽和遮蔽。 ＃6 因此，他们必须学习，才能摆脱黑暗和障碍。 ＃7 但是，他们不能对固有知识的原始实体进行任何添加或减少。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 良知是情感未被引起前的平衡状态。它是广而极其公正的状态。它是绝对宁静和静止的本体。并且所有人都拥有它。然而，人们不可避免地被物欲所蒙蔽和遮蔽。＃6 因此，他们必须学习以摆脱黑暗和遮蔽。＃7 但是对于良知的本体来说，他们无法增加或减少一丝一毫。

text.ori_cn: 知无不良，而中、寂、大公未能全者，是昏蔽之未尽去，而存之未纯耳。
text.man_en: Innate knowledge is good. The reason why equilibrium, absolute quiet, broadness, and impartiality are not complete in it is that darkness and obscuration have not been entirely eliminated and its state of preservation is not yet complete.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who know that there is nothing wrong with them, and that they are not able to be neutral, silent, or impartial, are those who have not yet removed all their obscurations, but have not yet purified their existence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing that there is nothing wrong, but failing to complete the Zhong, Jing, and Da Gong, is because the obscuration has not been eliminated and the ears have not been purified.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Knowing without defects, yet incompleteness in the middle, silence, and great impartiality means there is still some obscurity that hasn't been entirely removed, and what remains isn't entirely pure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识是好的。平衡、绝对安静、宽广和公正在它身上之所以不完整，是因为黑暗和遮蔽还没有完全消除，它的保存状态还不完整。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与生俱来的知识是好的。之所以说它的均衡、绝对的安静、广大、公正不完全，是因为黑暗和罔碍还没有完全消除，它的保存状态还没有完全。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天赋的知识是好的。之所以它的平衡、绝对安静、宽广和公正尚未达到完美，是因为黑暗和隐晦尚未完全消除，其状态的保存还不完整。

text.ori_cn: 〔6〕来书云：“周子曰“主静”，程子曰“动亦定，静亦定”，先生曰“定者心之本体”，是静定也，决非不睹不闻，无思无为之谓，必常知常存，常主于理之谓也。
text.man_en: 〔6〕 The book says: "Zhou Zi said "quietness is the main thing", Cheng Zi said "movement is also calm, and stillness is also calm". The master said "stillness is the essence of the heart". It is stillness and calmness, and it is definitely not invisible or unheard. The meaning of "thinking without doing anything" must always be known and always exist, and it is always the master of reason.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [6] to the book cloud: "Zhou Zi said" main quiet ", Cheng Zi said" movement is also fixed, static is also fixed ", Mr. said" fixed the heart of the body ", is the static fixed also, never not see and not hear, no thought and no action, must always know and always exist, always main in the reason of the said also. By no means do not see and hear, no thinking and doing so, must always know and always exist, always master of the reason that.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔6〕 The book says: "Zhou Zi said "quietness is the main thing", Cheng Zi said "movement is also calm, and stillness is also calm". The master said "stillness is the essence of the heart". It is stillness and calmness, and it is definitely not invisible or unheard. The meaning of "thinking without doing anything" must always be known and always exist, and it is always the master of reason.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [6] Your letter states: 'Master Zhou said “focus on tranquility,” Master Cheng said “stillness in action, stillness in tranquility,” and the Teacher said “stillness is the fundamental nature of the heart.” This stillness refers to a calm and stable mind; it is by no means synonymous with not seeing, not hearing, not thinking, or not acting. It must be maintained with constant awareness and presence and grounded in principle.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 6〕书曰：周子曰 "静为主"，程子曰 "动亦静，静亦动"。夫子曰 "静为心之本"。是静是静，绝对不是看不见、听不到。"无为而思 "之意，须常知常存，常为理之主。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 〔6〕书中云：“周子曰“静为主”，成子曰“动也静，静也静”。子曰“静者心之本质”。寂静和平静，绝对不是看不见、闻所未闻的，“思无为”的意义一定是永远知道的、永远存在的，永远是理性的主宰。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 〔6〕书上说：“周子说“静为主”，程子说“动亦静，静亦静”。师父说“静为心之本体”。乃静而定，决非无见无闻。意之“思而无所为”必常知常存，常为理之主也。”

text.ori_cn: 理无动者也。
text.man_en: Principle involves no activity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason is that there is no one who moves.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who have no reason to move.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Reason is unmovable.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 原则不涉及任何活动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 原理不涉及任何活动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 原则无为。

text.ori_cn: 常知常存、常主于理，即不睹不闻，无思无为之谓也。
text.man_en: Always aware, always present, always mastering principles, that is to say, neither seeing nor hearing, thinking or doing anything.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The constant knowledge, the constant existence, the constant main reason, that is, do not see, do not hear, no thought, no action is also the meaning of.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Always aware, always present, always mastering principles, that is to say, neither seeing nor hearing, thinking or doing anything.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Constant awareness, constant existence, and constant mastery of principles mean not seeing and not hearing, without thought and without action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 始终觉知，始终存在，始终掌握原则，也就是说，既不看也不听，既不思考也不做任何事情。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 时时觉知、时时在场、时时掌握原则，也就是说，不看、不听、不思考、不做任何事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 始终警觉，始终当下，始终掌握原则，也就是说，无论是看还是听，想还是做任何事情.

text.ori_cn: 不睹不闻，无思无为，非槁木死灰之谓也：睹闻思为一于理，而未尝有所睹闻思为，即是动而未尝动也；所谓“动亦定静亦定”，体用一原者也。
text.man_en: Not to do these things does not mean to be like dry wood or dead ashes. When one sees, hears, thinks, and acts in complete accord with principle and makes no deliberate effort to do so, it means activity and at the same time no activity. This is what is meant by the saying, “The nature is calm whether it is in a state of activity or in a state of tranquility, ” and by the saying, “Substance and function come from the same source. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Do not see, do not hear, no thought, no action, not a haystack: see, hear and think for a reason, but not to have seen, heard and thought for, that is, the movement and have not moved; the so-called "movement is also fixed static is also fixed", the body of the original one is also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Not seeing, not hearing, not thinking, not doing, is not the same thing as a dead tree: seeing, hearing, thinking is one thing, but not seeing, hearing, thinking, doing, that is, moving but not moving; the so-called "movement, stillness, and concentration" , the body uses one principle.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To neither see nor hear, to be without thought or action, is not to be like dead wood or cold ashes. Rather, it means that seeing, hearing, thinking, and acting are all merged into the principle, and yet there is never really any seeing, hearing, thinking, or acting. This is the state of moving while not moving; as the saying goes, 'motion is also stillness, stillness is also motion,' signifying the unity of essence and function.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不做这些事并不意味着像干柴或死灰一样。当一个人的所见、所闻、所思、所为完全符合原则，而不刻意去做时，就意味着有活动，同时也没有活动。所谓 "性静而不争"，所谓 "本末同源"，就是这个意思。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不做这些事并不意味着就像干木头或死灰一样。当一个人的所见、所闻、所思、所行，完全符合原则，而不刻意去做时，就意味着有为，同时也没有为有为。所谓“性者，动静皆静”，“体与用同源”，就是这个道理。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不做这些事情并不意味着像枯木或死灰。当一个人看到、听到、思考和行动完全符合道理且不进行刻意的努力时，这意味着在活动中同时无为。这就是所谓的“性在动静皆安”和“体用一源”。

text.ori_cn: 若以循理为静，从欲为动，则于所谓“动中有静，静中有动，动极而静，静极而动”者，不可通矣。
text.man_en: If we regard following principle as tranquility and obeying desires as activity, then it is absurd to say that ‘there is activity in tranquility and tranquility in activity, ' and to say, ‘When activity reaches its limit, it becomes tranquility , and when tranquility reaches its limit, it becomes activity. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the reason for the quiet, from the desire to move, then in the so-called "movement in the quiet, quiet in the dynamic, dynamic and static, static and dynamic", can not be carried forward.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If we regard following principles as tranquility and following desire as movement, then we cannot understand the so-called "stillness within movement, movement within stillness, stillness at the extreme of movement, and movement at the extreme of stillness".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one considers following reason as stillness and pursuing desires as movement, then the concept of 'stillness within movement, movement within stillness, extreme movement leading to stillness, and extreme stillness leading to movement' would be incomprehensible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果我们把遵循原则视为宁静，把顺从欲望视为活动，那么说'宁静中有活动，活动中有宁静'，说'当活动达到极限时，它就变成了宁静，当宁静达到极限时，它就变成了活动'，就是荒谬的。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果把顺理为静，顺欲为动，那么“静中有动，动中有静”，“动到了极点就成了静，静到了极点”的说法，都是荒谬的。达到极限，就变成活动。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果我们将遵循原则视为宁静，将服从欲望视为活动，那么说‘宁静中有活动，活动中有宁静’以及‘当活动达到极限时，它变成宁静，当宁静达到极限时，它变成活动’是荒谬的。

text.ori_cn: 若以有事而感通为动，无事而寂然为静，则于所谓“动而无动，静而无静”者，不可通矣。
text.man_en: If we regard the mind's doing something and being acted upon and penetrating things as activity, and its doing nothing but remaining in the state of absolute quietness as tranquility , then it is absurd to say, ‘It is active without activity and tranquil without tranquility. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If there is something to feel through for the movement, nothing and silence for the quiet, then in the so-called "movement without movement, quiet without quiet", can not be passed on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is something going on and the feeling is moving, and if there is nothing happening it is stillness, then the so-called "motion but no movement, stillness but no stillness" cannot be understood.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If we consider responsiveness in the presence of events as movement, and tranquility in the absence of events as stillness, then it becomes impossible to comprehend the notion of 'movement without movement, stillness without stillness.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果我们把心有所为、有所不为和洞察事物看作是活动，而把心无所作为、保持绝对安静的状态看作是宁静，那么说'它有活动而无活动，有宁静而无宁静'就是荒谬的。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果我们把心的做某事、受其作用、洞察事物视为活动，而将心不做任何事情而处于绝对安静的状态视为宁静，那么“有动而无动，静而无静”的说法是荒谬的。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果我们把心灵的有所为、有所受、有所贯通看作是活动，把它的无所为仅仅保持在绝对的静止状态看作是宁静，那么说‘它是无为中的活动和无宁静中的宁静’是荒谬的。

text.ori_cn: 若谓未发在已发之先，静而生动，是至诚有息也，圣人有复也，人不可矣。
text.man_en: If it is said that the undeveloped state is quiet and vivid before it has been released, this means that sincerity has rest, and the saint has recovery, but human beings cannot do it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If it is said that the unissued in the hair of the first, quiet and vivid, is the most sincere have rest also, the saint has to restore also, people can not carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If it is said that the undeveloped state is quiet and vivid before it has been released, this means that sincerity has rest, and the saint has recovery, but human beings cannot do it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one says that the unexpressed precedes the expressed, that calmness gives rise to activity, it means the utmost sincerity still exists, sages can always reincarnate, but ordinary people cannot.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 若曰：未发之谓静，未发之谓生，是谓诚已息，圣人已复，而人不能行也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果说未开发的状态在未释放之前是安静和生动的，这意味着真诚有休息，圣人有恢复，但人类无法做到。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果说未开发的状态在放出来之前是安静而生动的，这意味着诚意得以休息，圣人得以恢复，但人类却做不到。

text.ori_cn: 有事而感通，固可以言动，然而寂然者未尝有增也。
text.man_en: When the mind engages in something and is thereby acted upon and penetrates things, it can of course be said to be active. But nothing has been added to the state of absolute quietness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you have something to say and feel it, you can certainly say it, but the silence has not increased.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When something happens and you feel it, you can certainly speak and move it, but there is no increase in silence.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When there is a matter that resonates deeply, actions and words naturally follow. Yet, in stillness, nothing is ever added.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当心灵投入到某件事情中，并因此受到影响、渗透到事物中时，当然可以说它是活跃的。但是，在绝对安静的状态下，什么也没有增加。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当心从事某件事并因此而受到影响并穿透事物时，它当然可以说是活跃的。但绝对安静的状态中并没有添加任何东西。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当心灵投入到某件事上并因此受到影响并渗透到事物中时，当然可以说它是活跃的。但绝对的静止状态并没有因此而有所改变。

text.ori_cn: 无前后内外而浑然一体，则至诚有息之疑，不待解矣：未发在已发之中，而已发之中未尝别有未发者在，已发在未发之中，而未发之中未尝别有已发者存；是未尝无动、静，而不可以动、静分者也。
text.man_en: As the mind is neither before nor after any state, is neither internal nor external, but is one substance without differentiation, the question of absolute sincerity's having any moment of rest requires no answer. As the mind is neither before nor after any state, is neither internal nor external, but is one substance without differentiation, the question of absolute sincerity's having any moment of rest requires no answer. But in this state there is not a separate state which is before the feelings are aroused. The state after the feelings are aroused exists in the state before the feelings are aroused. But in this state there is not a separate state in which the feelings have been aroused. ＃6 Both are not without activity or tranquility and cannot be separately characterized as active or tranquil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: No before and after the internal and external and all in one, then the sincerity of the rest of the doubt, do not need to be solved: not hair in the hair, and hair in the hair did not have to be not hair in, has been hair in the hair, and not hair in the hair did not have to be hair in the existence of; is not tasted no movement, static, and can not be moved, static points also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no front, back or inside but one whole body, so there is no doubt about the sincerity of rest. It is not yet to be solved: the undeveloped is in the already developed, and there is no difference between the undeveloped in the already developed. The already developed is in the undeveloped, but it is not released. There is nothing in it that has already developed; it is nothing without movement and stillness, but there is nothing that can be divided into movement and stillness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without distinction of before and after, inside and outside, attaining a seamless unity, then the suspicion of sincerity having form will not need to be resolved: the not-yet-manifested is within the manifested, and within the manifested, there is never a separate not-yet-manifested; the manifested is within the not-yet-manifested, and within the not-yet-manifested, there is never a separate manifested. Thus, it is never without movement or stillness, and yet cannot be divided by movement or stillness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心既不在任何境界之前，也不在任何境界之后，既不在内部，也不在外部，而是无差别的一种物质，因此，绝对真诚是否有任何休息时刻的问题无需回答。由于心既不在任何状态之前，也不在任何状态之后，既不是内在的，也不是外在的，而是无差别的一种物质，因此，绝对真诚是否有片刻安宁的问题无需回答。但是，在这种状态下，并不存在一个单独的状态，即感觉被唤醒之前的状态。情感唤醒后的状态存在于情感唤醒前的状态中。但在这种状态中，并不存在一个单独的状态，即情感被唤醒的状态。＃6 两者都不是没有活动或宁静的，也不能分别说它们是活动的或宁静的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 由于心既不在任何状态之前，也不在任何状态之后，既不内也不外，而是一体而不分别，所以绝对真诚是否有任何休息的问题是不需要答案的。由于心既不在任何状态之前，也不在任何状态之后，既不内也不外，而是一体而不分别，所以绝对真诚是否有任何休息的问题是不需要答案的。但在这种状态下，在感受被唤起之前，并没有一个单独的状态。感情被唤起之后的状态存在于感情被唤起之前的状态中。但在这种状态下，并没有一种单独的状态可以激起感受。 ＃6 二者并非没有动静，不能单独定性为动静。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 既然心既不在任何状态的前后时间，也不是内在或外在的，而是一种没有区分的单一实体，那么绝对真诚是否有片刻停歇这个问题就无需回答。既然心既不在任何状态的前后时间，也不是内在或外在的，而是一种没有区分的单一实体，那么绝对真诚是否有片刻停歇这个问题就无需回答。然而在这种状态下，没有一个单独的状态是在感情被激起之前的。感情被激起之后的状态存在于感情被激起之前的状态中。但在这种状态下没有一个单独的状态是感情已经被激起的。两者都不是没有活动或宁静，不能单独被归类为活动或宁静。

text.ori_cn: 凡观古人言语，在以意逆志而得其大旨：若必拘泥于文义，则“靡有孑遗”者，是周果无遗民也。
