text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Where to view the words of the ancients, in order to intention against the will and get the main idea: if we must stick to the meaning of the text, then "no survivors", is the week of the fruit of the people are also no survivors.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you look at the words of the ancients, you can get the main idea by using your intention against your will: if you must stick to the literal meaning, then "there will be survivors", which means that there will be no survivors in the Zhou Dynasty.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When observing the words of ancient people, one must interpret their underlying intent to grasp the main idea: if one is bound to the literal meaning, then 'there are no remnants' would imply that the Zhou truly had no surviving people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 观古人之言，以意逆志，可以得其大意：如果一定要拘泥于字面意思，那么 "必有遗民"，也就是周朝不会有遗民。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果你看古人的话，用意违心就可以明白大意了：如果一定要拘泥于字面意思，那么“必有幸存者”，也就是说，没有幸存者。周朝。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若观古人之言，可用心得其意：若必固守字面，则“将有幸存者”，意谓在周时将无幸存者。

text.ori_cn: 周子“静极而动”之说，苟不善观，亦未免有病；盖其意从“太极动而生阳，静而生阴”说来。
text.man_en: Master Chou's theory that when tranquility reaches its limit activity begins is not free from defects if one does not view it in the right way. His idea is derived from the theory that the Great Ultimate through activity generates the active element yang and through tranquility generates the passive element yin.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Zhou Zi "static pole and movement" said, if not good view, but also inevitably sick; cover its intention from the "Tai Chi movement and Yang, static Yin" said.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Zhouzi's theory of "moving from extreme stillness" means that even if you don't take a good view, you may be ill. His meaning comes from "Tai Chi creates yang when it moves, and yin when it is still."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zhou Zi's theory of 'Extreme Stillness Leads to Movement,' if not well comprehended, may indeed have its shortcomings; for its concept is derived from the saying 'The Supreme Ultimate, in its movement, generates yang, and in its stillness, generates yin.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 周大师的理论认为，当宁静达到极限时就会开始活动，如果不以正确的方式来看待它，就不会没有缺陷。他的观点源于 "大至 "通过 "动 "产生 "阳"，通过 "静 "产生 "阴 "的理论。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 周先生的“静到了即动”的理论，如果不正确地看待的话，也并非没有缺陷。他的思想来源于“太极以动生阳，以静生阴”的理论。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 周大师的理论认为，当安静达到极限时，活动就会开始；如果没有以正确的方式看待这一点，这一理论并非无缺陷。他的观点源于这样一种理论，即太极通过活动产生阳的活跃元素，通过安静产生阴的被动元素。

text.ori_cn: 太极生生之理，妙用无息，而常体不易。
text.man_en: The principle of production and reproduction of the Great Ultimate is ceaseless in its wonderful functioning, but its eternal substance does not change.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The principle of Taiji's birth is wonderful and uninterrupted, while the permanent body is not easy to use.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The principle of Tai Chi's life and death is wonderful and endless, but the body is not easy to change.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The philosophy of Tai Chi embodies the principle of continuous creation; its subtle applications are boundless, yet its fundamental essence remains unchanged.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 伟大终极的生产和再生产原理在其奇妙的运作中永不停息，但其永恒的实质却不会改变。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大终极的产生和繁衍的原理，其奇妙的运作是不断的，但其永恒的实质却不会改变。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 太极生生不息，其妙用无穷，但其本质恒久不变。

text.ori_cn: 太极之生生，即阴阳之生生。
text.man_en: The production and reproduction of the Great Ultimate are the same as those of yin and yang.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The birth of Tai Chi is the birth of yin and yang.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The birth of Tai Chi is the birth of Yin and Yang.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The continuous generation of Taiji is the continuous generation of Yin and Yang.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 大极的产生和繁衍与阴阳的产生和繁衍相同。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大极的产生和繁衍，与阴阳相同。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 太极的生成和再生与阴阳相同。

text.ori_cn: 就其生生之中，指其妙用无息者而谓之动，谓之阳之生，非谓动而后生阳也：就其生生之中，指其常体不易者而谓之静，谓之阴之生，非谓静而后生阴也；若果静而后生阴，动而后生阳，则是阴阳动静，截然各自为一物矣。
text.man_en: Referring to its processes of production and reproduction and pointing to the ceaselessness of their wonderful functioning, we say that there is activity and that yang is engendered, but do not say that there is first activity and then yang is engendered. Referring to its processes of production and reproduction and pointing to the unchanging aspect of their eternal substance, we say that there is tranquility and that yin is engendered, but do not say that there is first tranquility and then yin is engendered. If it is really true that yin is engendered after there is tranquility and yang is engendered after there is activity, then yin and yang and activity and tranquility are each a separate and distinct thing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: On its birth, refers to its wonderful use of breathless and called the dynamic, called the birth of Yang, not to say that the dynamic and after the birth of Yang: on its birth, refers to its permanent body is not easy to say that the static, called the birth of the yin, not to say that the static and after the birth of the yin; if the static and then born after the birth of yin, after the birth of the Yang, then it is the yin and yang, static and dynamic, and cut off each one for a thing to carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the process of its life and death, it refers to the fact that its wonderful functions are endless, and it is called movement. It is called the birth of Yang. It does not mean that it is moving and then produces Yang. In its life and life, it refers to the fact that its constant body is not easy to change. It is called tranquility. It is called it. The birth of yin does not mean that there is stillness and then yin; if there is stillness and then yin, and movement then yang, then yin and yang, movement and stillness, are completely one and the same thing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the continual process of creation, the term 'motion' refers to its ceaseless functionality and is called the birth of Yang; it does not mean that Yang is born only after motion occurs. Similarly, in the continual process of creation, the term 'static' refers to its constant and unchanging nature and is called the birth of Yin; it does not mean that Yin is born only after stillness occurs. If indeed stillness were required for Yin to be born, and motion for Yang to be born, then Yin, Yang, motion, and stillness would each be entirely separate entities.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们说 "阳生阴长"，而不是说 "阴生阳长"。我们说 "阴生阳长"，而不是说 "阳生阴长"。我们说 "阴生阳长"，而不是说 "阳生阴长"。在谈到其生产和繁衍过程并指出其永恒物质的不变性时，我们说 "静 "而 "阴 "生，但不说先 "静 "而后 "阴 "生。如果真的是先有静而后有阴，先有动而后有阳，那么阴与阳、动与静就是各自独立的、不同的东西。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 论其产生、繁衍的过程，指其妙用的不断，我们说有活动而生阳，但不说先有活动而后生阳。就其产生、繁衍的过程而言，针对其永恒实质不变的一面，我们说有静而生阴，但不要说先有静而后生阴。若真是静而生阴，动而生阳，则阴阳、动静各异。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 提到其生产和再生产的过程，并指出它们精彩运作的连续性，我们说有活动，有阳产生，但不说先有活动，然后阳才产生。提到其生产和再生产的过程，并指出它们永恒物质的不变性，我们说有静，有阴产生，但不说先有静，然后阴才产生。如果说先有静然后有阴产生，先有活动然后有阳产生，那阴阳、动静便是各自独立和区分的东西。

text.ori_cn: 阴阳一气也，一气屈伸而为阴阳：动静一理也，一理隐显而为动、静。
text.man_en: Yin and yang are both the same material force. It becomes yin or yang as it contracts or expands. Activity or tranquility are the same principle. It becomes activity or tranquility as it is manifested or remains hidden.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Yin and yang, a gas, a gas flexion and extension for yin and yang: movement and static, a reason, a reason hidden and obvious for movement and static.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Yin and Yang are one Qi, and one Qi bends and stretches to form Yin and Yang; movement and stillness are one principle, and one principle is hidden and manifest to form movement and stillness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Yin and Yang are one Qi; the one Qi contracts and extends to become Yin and Yang. Motion and stillness are one principle; the one principle hides and reveals to become motion and stillness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 阴和阳是同一种物质力量。它随着收缩或膨胀而变成阴或阳。活动或宁静是相同的原理。它随着显现或隐藏而变得活跃或宁静。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 阴和阳都是同一种物质力量。当它收缩或扩张时，它会变成阴或阳。活跃或宁静都是同样的道理。当它显现或保持隐藏时，它就会变得活跃或平静。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 阴和阳是同一种物质力量。它在收缩或扩展时变成阴或阳。动或静是同一个原理。它在表现出来或隐藏起来时变成动或静。

text.ori_cn: 春夏可以为阳为动，而未尝无阴与静也：秋冬可以为阴、为静，而未尝无阳与动也。
text.man_en: Spring and summer can be regarded as cases of yang and activity, but they are not without yin or tranquility. Autumn and winter may be regarded as cases of yin and tranquility, but they are not without yang or activity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Spring and summer can be yang for movement, but not without yin and stillness: autumn and winter can be yin and stillness, but not without yang and movement.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Spring and summer can be yang and movement, but there is no yin and stillness; autumn and winter can be yin and stillness, but there is no yang and movement.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Spring and summer can be associated with yang and activity, yet they are never entirely devoid of yin and stillness; autumn and winter can be associated with yin and stillness, yet they are never wholly without yang and movement.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 春夏可以说是阳气旺盛，但也并非没有阴气和静气。秋冬可视为阴和静，但也并非没有阳或活动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 春天和夏天可以说是阳气和活动的例子，但也不是没有阴气或安静的。秋季和冬季可以被视为阴和宁静的情况，但它们并非没有阳或活动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 春夏可视为阳与动的例子，但并非没有阴或静。秋冬可视为阴与静的例子，但并非没有阳或动。

text.ori_cn: 春夏此不息，秋冬此不息，皆可谓之“阳，谓之动也：春夏此常体，秋冬此常体，皆可谓之阴，谓之静也。
text.man_en: Spring and summer are ceaseless in their course. So are autumn and winter. In this respect they may both be regarded as cases of yang and activity. The substance of spring and summer is eternal. So is that of autumn and winter. ＃6 In this respect they may both be regarded as cases of yin and tranquility.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This unceasing spring and summer, this unceasing autumn and winter, can be called "Yang," or movement: this constant body in spring and summer, this constant body in autumn and winter, can be called Yin, or stillness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The constant nature of spring and summer, the constant nature of autumn and winter, can all be called "yang", or movement; the constant nature of spring and summer, and the constant nature of autumn and winter, can all be called yin, or stillness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Spring and summer are unceasing, and autumn and winter are unceasing, all of which can be called 'Yang,' representing movement: Spring and summer are the usual state, and autumn and winter are the usual state, all of which can be called 'Yin,' representing stillness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 春夏无休。秋天和冬天也是如此。在这方面，它们都可以被视为阳气和活动。春夏的物质是永恒的。秋天和冬天也是如此。＃6 就此而言，它们都可以被视为阴和静。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 春天和夏天在他们的过程中永不停歇。秋季和冬季亦如此。在这方面，它们都可以被视为阳和活动的例子。春夏的本质是永恒的。秋冬也是如此。 ＃6 从这一点来看，它们都可以被视为阴静的例子。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 春夏四时，循环不止，秋冬亦然，此乃阳与动也；春夏之质，永无止息，秋冬亦然，此乃阴与静也。

text.ori_cn: 自元、会、运、世、岁、月、日、时以至刻、秒、忽、微，莫不皆然。
text.man_en: The same may be said of a cycle, an epoch, a revolution, a generation, a year, a month, a day, or a period down to a minute, a second, or an infinitesimal duration.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: From Yuan, Hui, Yun, Shi, age, month, day, hour to moment, second, ku, micro, everything is the same.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: From Yuan, Hui, Yun, Shi, year, month, day, hour to moment, second, sudden and micro, everything is the same.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From eras, cycles, and fates, down to years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds, moments, and instants, nothing is exempt.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个周期、一个纪元、一场革命、一代人、一年、一月、一天，或者小到一分钟、一秒钟或无限长的时间，都可以这样说。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 同样的道理也适用于一个周期、一个纪元、一场革命、一代人、一年、一个月、一天，或者小至一分钟、一秒或无穷小的一段时间。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 同样的话可以用于描述一个周期、一段时期、一场革命、一代人、一年、一个月、一天，或者直到一分钟、一秒钟，甚至微小的时间片段。

text.ori_cn: 所谓动静无端，阴阳无始，在知道者默而识之，非可以言语穷也。
text.man_en: “Activity and tranquility have no beginning, and yin and yang have no starting point. ” Those who know the Way will understand this in silence. This idea cannot be completely expressed in words.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The so-called movement and static without end, yin and yang without beginning, in the knower of the silence and knowledge, not words can be poor also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The so-called movement and stillness have no reason, and yin and yang have no beginning. Those who know know it silently, and they cannot be described in words.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What is called motion and stillness has no ultimate source, nor do Yin and Yang have a beginning. Those who understand it recognize it in silence; it cannot be fully explained through language.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "动静无始，阴阳无极。"知道者于无声处悟道。这一思想无法用言语完全表达。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “动静无始，阴阳无始。 ” 懂道的人会默默地了解这一点。这个想法无法完全用言语表达。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “动与静没有开始，阴与阳没有起点。” 知道道的人会在静默中明白这一点。这种思想无法完全用言语表达。

text.ori_cn: 若只牵文泥句，比拟仿像，则所谓心从法华转，非是转法华矣。
text.man_en: If one follows words and phrases rigidly, takes them literally, and imitates and copies, then it will be what is called the “mind being turned around by the Lotus Scripture and not turning the Lotus Scripture around. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you only pull the text of the mud sentence, compared to the imitation, then the so-called heart from the Dharma to turn, not to turn the Dharma to carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you only refer to the text and clay sentences and compare them with images, then the so-called mind turning from the Lotus is not actually turning to the Lotus.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one merely imitates phrases and makes comparisons, then what is referred to as the mind being transformed by the Lotus Sutra is actually not the transformation of the Lotus Sutra.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果生搬硬套，照本宣科，模仿抄袭，那就是所谓的 "心被《法华经》转，不转《法华经》心"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果拘泥于字句，按字面意思去模仿、临摹，那就是所谓“法华经转心，而不转法华经”。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人拘泥于词句，字面理解并模仿和抄袭，那么这就是所谓的“被《莲花经》转，而不是转《莲花经》。”

text.ori_cn: 〔8〕来书云：“尝试于心，喜、怒、忧、惧之感发也，虽动气之极，而吾心良知一觉，即罔然消阻，或遏于初，或制于中，或悔于后。
text.man_en: Your letter says “I have tested my own mind and found that as pleasure, anger, worry, and fear are felt and aroused, although I am much perturbed, nevertheless as soon as the innate knowledge of my mind realizes it, then without any resolution on my part the feelings disappear or are stopped. They may be checked at the beginning, or controlled while they are in progress, or changed at the end.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [8] to the book cloud: "try in the heart, joy, anger, worry, fear of the feeling of hair, although the extreme gas, and my heart conscience a sense, that is, reckless obstruction, or curbed at the beginning, or system in the middle, or repentance in the aftermath.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔8〕 Lai Shu says: "Try it in your heart. Feelings of joy, anger, worry, and fear arise. Even though they are extremely agitated, as soon as my conscience wakes up, the obstruction will be eliminated, either at the beginning or under control." in the middle, or regret later.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The received letter states: 'When trying something in the heart, the feelings of joy, anger, sorrow, and fear may arise. Even though these emotions may reach their extreme, once my inner conscience awakens, they dissipate as if they never existed. This can happen by either stopping them at the beginning, controlling them in the midst, or regretting them afterward.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你在信中说："我对自己的心灵进行了测试，发现当快乐、愤怒、担忧和恐惧被感受和激发时，尽管我非常不安，但只要我心灵中与生俱来的知识意识到这一点，那么无需我做任何决定，这些感受就会消失或停止。它们可以在开始时被抑制，或在进行时被控制，或在结束时被改变。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你的来信说：“我曾测试自己的心，发现当快乐、愤怒、忧虑、恐惧被感受和唤起时，虽然我很不安，但一旦我心的固有知识意识到这一点，就没有任何解决办法。”就我而言，这种感觉消失或停止了。它们可以在开始时进行检查，或者在进行中进行控制，或者在最后进行更改。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说：“我反省了自己的内心，发现当感受到和激起愉悦、愤怒、焦虑和恐惧时，尽管我很不安，但只要我的内心本能地意识到这一点，这些感情就会在没有任何刻意的决心下消失或停止。它们可能在一开始被遏制，或在进行中得到控制，或在结束时被改变。”

text.ori_cn: 知此，则知未发之中、寂然不动之体，而有发而中节之和、感而遂通之妙矣。
text.man_en: Since you know this, you know that the equilibrium before the feelings are aroused involves the harmony after the feelings are aroused and each and all attain due measure and degree, and also that the substance that is quiet and inactive involves the wonder of being acted upon and penetrating things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you know this, you will know the body of silence and immobility in the undeveloped, and have the harmony of hair and middle section, and the wonderfulness of sensation and pass on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you know this, you will know that the still and unmoving body is still in the undeveloped state, but it is wonderful to have the harmony of the middle part and the feeling to pass through.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Knowing this, one can understand the essence of inner tranquility and calmness before action, and the harmony of proper conduct when in action, as well as the subtle enlightenment that arises from interaction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既然你知道这一点，你就会知道，情感唤起之前的平衡包含着情感唤起之后的和谐，每一种情感都达到了应有的度与量，而且，安静无为的物质包含着被作用和渗透事物的奇妙。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你既知道了这一点，就知道，情未起前的平衡，是情起后各得其度的和谐，而静寂的实质，是受作用的奇妙。和穿透的东西。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 既然你知道这一点，你就知道在情感被激起之前的平衡涉及在情感被激起之后的和谐，以及所有人都达到了应有的程度；你也知道，宁静不动的本质包含了被作用和透彻事物的奇妙。

text.ori_cn: 然谓“良知常若居于优闲无事之地”，语尚有病。
text.man_en: But when you say that it seems that innate knowledge always exists in the condition of leisure and having no activity, your wording is still defective.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, it is said that "the conscience always resides in a place of leisure", which is still sick.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, it is said that "a conscience always seems to live in a place of leisure and leisure", which is still a disease.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, to say that 'innate knowledge always resides in a place of calmness and idleness' is still problematic.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，当你说先天知识似乎总是在闲暇和无活动的状态下存在时，你的措辞还是有缺陷的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但当你说先天知识似乎总是存在于闲暇、无为的状态时，你的措辞还是有缺陷的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但是，当你说先天知识似乎总是在闲暇和没有活动的状态下存在时，你的措辞仍然有欠妥当。

text.ori_cn: 盖良知虽不滞于喜、怒、忧、惧，而喜、怒、忧、惧亦不外于良知也。
text.man_en: For although innate knowledge is not impeded in pleasure, anger, worry, and fear, these feelings are after all not outside the realm of innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Although conscience is not stagnant in joy, anger, sorrow, and fear, joy, anger, sorrow, and fear are not external to conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For example, although good knowledge is not limited to joy, anger, worry, and fear, joy, anger, worry, and fear are also not outside of good knowledge.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For although good conscience is not impeded by joy, anger, sorrow, or fear, these emotions are also not beyond the realm of good conscience.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为虽然先天知识在喜、怒、忧、思、恐中不会受到阻碍，但这些感受毕竟没有超出先天知识的范畴。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为喜、怒、忧、恐，虽然不妨碍先知，但这些感受毕竟不是在先知的范围之外。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为虽然天生的知识不会在愉悦、愤怒、烦恼和恐惧中受到阻碍，但这些情感毕竟并不超出天生知识的范围。

text.ori_cn: 〔9〕来书云：“夫子昨以良知为照心。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “Sir, lately you have considered innate knowledge as the shining mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [9] The letter from the author says: "The Husband yesterday used his conscience as an illuminating mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔9〕The letter says: “Yesterday, Master took care of his conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In your letter, it states: 'The Master reflected upon his mind using innate knowledge yesterday.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："先生，最近您把与生俱来的知识视为闪亮的心灵。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你的信中写道：“先生，最近您认为先天知识是闪亮的心灵。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 您的信中写道：“先生，您最近将先天知识视为光明的心灵。

text.ori_cn: 窃谓良知心之本体也，照心人所用功，乃戒慎恐惧之心也。
text.man_en: I dare say that innate knowledge is the original substance of the mind, whereas the shining mind is the task of the individual. It is the mind of caution and apprehension, comparable to thought.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is said that the conscience of the heart is also the essence of the mind, and the work of the person who looks after the heart is the heart of caution and fear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that the essence of the conscience is the heart of caution and fear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I believe that innate knowledge is the essence of the heart, and the effort to illuminate the heart involves a cautious and fearful mind.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我敢说，先天的知识是心灵的本源，而闪耀的心灵则是个人的任务。它是谨慎和领悟之心，堪比思想。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我敢说，先天知识是心的本源，而闪耀的心是个人的任务。这是一种谨慎和忧虑的心，相当于思想。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我敢说天赋知识是心灵的原始本质，而心灵的光辉是个人的任务。这是一种谨慎和顾虑的心态，类似于思考。

text.ori_cn: “能戒慎恐惧者，是良知也。
text.man_en: It is innate knowledge that can be cautious and apprehensive.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "He who is able to abstain from fear is a conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: “He who can guard against fear is a conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To be able to remain cautious and fearful is a sign of a clear conscience.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这是与生俱来的知识，可以让人谨慎和忐忑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这是与生俱来的知识，可以谨慎和忧虑。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这是与生俱来的知识，可以让人变得谨慎和担忧。

text.ori_cn: 〔10〕来书云：“先生又曰：“照心非动也。”
text.man_en: Your letter says, “Sir, you also said, ‘A shining mind is not active. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [10] The letter came to me and said, "The gentleman also said, "Illuminating the mind is not moving."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [10] Lai Shu said: "The teacher also said: "Looking at the heart is not moving. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [10] The letter states: 'The Master also said: 'Illuminating the heart is not about movement'.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："先生，您还说过，'光辉的心灵是不活跃的。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你的信中说：“先生，您也说过：‘闪亮的头脑并不活跃。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说，“先生，你也说过，‘一个闪耀的头脑是不活跃的。’

text.ori_cn: “妄心亦照也。”
text.man_en: You also said, ‘The erroneous mind also shines. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "The deluded mind also shines."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "The delusional mind also shines."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The deluded mind is also illuminating.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你还说：'错误的思想也会发光。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你又说：‘邪心亦会发光。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你也说过，‘错误的心灵也会发光。’

text.ori_cn: 且既曰妄心，则在妄心可谓之照，而在照心则谓之妄矣。
text.man_en: And since it is called the delusional mind, it can be said to be illuminating in the delusional mind, and it can be said to be delusional in the illuminating mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And both said delusional heart, then in the delusional heart can be called the light, and in the light of the heart is called delusional.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: And since it is called the delusional mind, it can be said to be illuminating in the delusional mind, and it can be said to be delusional in the illuminating mind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Furthermore, since it is called a deluded mind, what appears as illumination in the deluded mind can be called illumination, whereas in the mind of illumination, it would be seen as delusion.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既然称之为妄心，就可以说是妄心所照，也可以说是照心所妄。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 又既然称为妄心，则可以说是妄心中的明，也可以说是明心中的妄。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 既然它被称为妄心，那么可以说是在妄心中显现的，同时也可以说是在显现心中妄想的。

text.ori_cn: 今假妄之照以续至诚之无息，窃所未明，幸再启蒙。”
text.man_en: Now to suppose that the erroneous mind also shines in order to enable the unceasing progress of absolute sincerity to go on is something I do not understand. Kindly enlighten me again. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Today, the false delusion of illumination to continue the uninterruptedness of supreme sincerity, I have not understood, and I am glad to be enlightened again."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Today, the illumination of falsehood will continue to the end of sincerity. The reason is not yet clear. Fortunately, I can be enlightened again. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Today, assuming falsehood to continue the unceasing sincerity, I find myself unclear on this matter and humbly seek further enlightenment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，假设错误的思想也会发光，以使绝对真诚的不断进步得以继续，这是我无法理解的。请再给我一次启发。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 现在假设错误的心也会发光，以便使绝对真诚的不断发展继续下去，这是我不明白的事情。请再次赐教。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在假设错误的心智也放光以使绝对诚意的不断进步得以继续进行，是我所不明白的。请再次指教。

text.ori_cn: “照心非动”者，以其发于本体明觉之自然，而未尝有所动也：有所动即妄矣：“妄心亦照”者，以其本体明觉之自然者，未尝不在于其中，但有所动耳；无所动即照矣。
text.man_en: The shining mind is not active because it arises from the natural state of the original substance's clear consciousness and there is no effort to be active [to stir it]. To stir it would make the mind erroneous. The erroneous mind also shines, because the natural state of the original substance's clear consciousness is always present in it, but it is in fact stirred. If not stirred, it will shine.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "Illumination of the heart is not moving", to its origin in the nature of the body of consciousness, but not moved: some movement is delusion: "delusion of the heart is also illuminated", to its nature of the body of consciousness, but not in which there is no movement; no movement that is illuminated.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Illuminating the mind without moving" means that it arises from the nature of the original body's clear awareness, and it does not move at all. If it does move, it is delusional. "The delusional mind also illuminates" means that it originates from the natural nature of the original body's clear awareness, and does not move. It is not in it, but it touches the ear; if it is not moved, it will shine.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The phrase 'illuminating the heart without stirring' means that it originates from the innate clarity of the true self without any movement at all; if there is movement, it is delusional. The phrase 'the delusional heart also illuminates' means that the innate clarity of the true self is always present within it, merely experiencing some movement; without movement, it is illumination.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 闪耀之心并不活跃，因为它产生于本体清明觉性的自然状态，无需努力活跃[搅动它]。搅动它就会使心智出错。错误的心也会发光，因为本体清明意识的自然状态始终存在于其中，但事实上它是被搅动的。如果不搅拌，它就会发光。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 光明心不活跃，因为它是从本体明识的自然状态中生起，并且没有努力去活跃。搅动它会使心产生错误。邪心也会发光，因为本体明识的本然状态始终存在于其中，但实际上却受到了搅动。如果不搅拌，它会发光。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 明心不动，因为它源于本质清明觉性的自然状态，没有动的作意。一动就会使心出错。错心也明，因为本质清明觉性始终存在于其中，但它确实被扰动了。如果不动，它就会明。

text.ori_cn: 无妄、无照，非以妄为照，以照为妄也。
text.man_en: To say that the mind is neither erroneous nor shining is not to say that the erroneous mind shines or that the shining mind is erroneous.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no delusion, no illumination, not delusion as illumination and illumination as delusion.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no illusion and no illumination. It is not the illumination that is illumination, but the illumination that is illumination.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without delusion, without illumination, it is neither using delusion for illumination nor using illumination as delusion.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 说 "心 "既不错误也不闪耀，并不是说错误的 "心 "会闪耀，也不是说闪耀的 "心 "是错误的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 说心不错误、不发光，并不是说错误的心发光，或者发光的心是错误的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 说心既非错误也非光明，并不是说错误的心发光或光明的心是错误的。

text.ori_cn: 照心为照，妄心为妄，是犹有妄、有照也。
text.man_en: The illumination of the heart is illumination, and the delusion of the heart is delusion. This is why there is still delusion and illumination.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The illuminated mind is illuminated and the deluded mind is deluded; it is as if there were delusion and illumination.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The illumination of the heart is illumination, and the delusion of the heart is delusion. This is why there is still delusion and illumination.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When observing with the true mind, what is reflected is true; when observing with the false mind, what is reflected is false. Thus, there are still falsehoods and reflections.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心照就是心照，心妄就是心妄。这就是为什么还有妄想和光明。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心明是明，心痴是痴。这就是为什么仍然有迷惑和光明的原因。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心的光明是光明，心的迷惑是迷惑。这就是为什么依然有迷惑和光明。

text.ori_cn: 有妄、有照，则犹贰也，贰则息矣。
text.man_en: If there is delusion and illumination, then it is still two, and if it is two, it will stop.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If there is delusion and illumination, then it is as if the two were two, and the two are rested.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is delusion and illumination, then it is still two, and if it is two, it will stop.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With delusion and awareness, duality remains; but when duality ceases, peace prevails.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有妄有照，则仍为二，二则止矣。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若有迷明，则仍二，若二则止。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若有妄、悟，则仍为二，若为二，则停。

text.ori_cn: 无妄、无照则不贰，不贰则不息矣。
text.man_en: If they are not separated as erroneous mind and shining mind, there will not be doubleness, and without doubleness [absolute sincerity] will not cease.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If there is no delusion and no illumination, then there is no second thought, and if there is no second thought, then there is no rest.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is no delusion and illumination, there will be no two, and if there is no two, there will be no rest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without delusion and without reflection, there is no duality. Without duality, there is no interruption.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果不把它们分别为错误的心和光明的心，就不会有双重性，而没有双重性，[绝对真诚]就不会停止。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若不分别为邪心与明心，则无二重，无二重亦不灭。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果它们不被分为错误的心和光明的心，就不会有二元性，没有二元性，就不会停止[绝对诚意]。

text.ori_cn: 〔11〕来书云：“养生以清心寡欲为要。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “To nourish life it is important to have a pure heart and few desires.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The letter to the editor says: "Nourishing the body is about clearing the mind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔11〕The letter says: “The key to maintaining health is to have a clear mind and few desires.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The letter states: 'The key to health preservation lies in maintaining a clear mind and minimizing desires.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："要滋养生命，最重要的是要有一颗纯净的心，少一些欲望。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你来信说：“养生，重要的是清心寡欲。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说，“养生之道在于心清欲少。”

text.ori_cn: 夫清心寡欲，作圣之功毕矣。
text.man_en: In having a pure heart and few desires, the task of becoming a sage is complete.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you have a clear mind, you will be able to do the work of the Holy Spirit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you have a pure heart and few desires, you have completed your work as a saint.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When one clears the mind and restrains desires, the work of becoming a sage is complete.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 清心寡欲，方成圣贤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 清心寡欲，圣人的任务就完成了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心境纯净而欲望寡淡，成圣之事便已完成。

text.ori_cn: 然欲寡则心自清，清心非舍弃人事而独居求静之谓也：盖欲使此心纯乎天理，而无一毫人欲之私耳。
text.man_en: However, if desires are few, the heart is naturally pure. Having a pure mind does not mean to cast aside human affairs, living a secluded life and seeking tranquility. Rather it means to enable the mind to be completely identified with the Principle of Nature and to be rid of every iota of selfish desire.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, the desire of the heart is clear, clear mind is not to abandon the personnel and live alone to seek the quiet of the said also: cover to make this heart is purely heavenly, without the slightest human desire of the private ear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, if you have few desires, your heart will be pure. A pure heart does not mean abandoning people and things and living alone to seek tranquility. It means that you want to make your heart pure and pure, without any selfish desire for human beings.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, if desires are few, the heart will be naturally clear. A clear heart does not mean abandoning worldly affairs and seeking solitude, but rather ensuring that the heart is purely aligned with heavenly principles, without a trace of selfish human desires.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然而，欲望少了，心自然就纯净了。心灵纯净并不意味着抛开人情世故，过着隐居的生活，追求宁静。相反，它意味着让心灵完全认同自然的原则，摒弃一丝一毫的私欲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 然而，欲望少了，心自然清净。心清净，并不是抛开人事，隐居安宁。相反，它意味着使心灵完全认同自然法则，并摆脱一切私欲。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，如果欲望很少，心自然会纯洁。拥有纯净的心灵并不意味着抛弃人事，过着隐居生活并寻求宁静。相反，这意味着使心灵完全与自然法则相契合，并摆脱一丝一毫的自私欲望。

text.ori_cn: 今欲为此之功，而随人欲生而克之，则病根常在，未危灭于东而生于西：若欲刊剥洗荡于众欲未萌之先，则又无所用其力，徒使此心之不清。
text.man_en: If, in wanting to accomplish this task, one subdues selfish desires after they have arisen, then the root of the trouble will always be there, and it will be a case of destroying them in the east while they grow in the west. But if one wishes to cut out, pull off, wash out, and dissipate all desires before they have sprouted, there is no way to begin, and one merely causes his heart to be impure.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Now, if we want to do this work, but with the human desire to be born and overcome, then the root of the disease is always there, and not yet endangered in the East and born in the West: if we want to publish stripped and cleansed in the desire of the masses has not yet sprung up before, then it is useless to use its power, and only make the heart of this unclear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Now if we want to do this, we can overcome people's desire to live, then the root of the disease will always be there, and it will be born in the west before it is destroyed in the east. If we want to strip and wash away all the desires before they have sprouted, then there will be no use of their power. , which only makes this mind unclear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one desires to achieve this endeavor, but follows human desires and suppresses them as they arise, the root of the problem will persist; it will not be eradicated in the east and will resurface in the west. However, if one strives to eradicate them before their nascence, there will be no place to exert effort, and it will only lead to a lack of mental clarity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果为了完成这项任务，在私欲产生之后才加以抑制，那么问题的根源就会一直存在，就会出现 "东边日出西边雨，道是无晴却有晴 "的情况。但是，如果想在欲望萌芽之前就将其斩断、拔除、洗去、消散，那就无从下手，只会使自己的心变得不纯净。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果为了完成这个任务，私欲生起之后就去降伏，那么烦恼的根源就一直在那里，那就是东灭西长的情况了。但欲欲未萌芽，欲断、拔、洗、灭，则无从下手，只能使心不净。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果为了完成这项任务，人们在欲望产生后压制它们，那么麻烦的根源永远都会存在，东边消除的时候西边又会滋生。但如果希望在欲望未萌发之前剪除、拔除、清洗和消散所有欲望，就没有办法开始，反而会让心灵变得不纯净。

text.ori_cn: 且欲未萌而搜剔以求去之，是犹引犬上堂而逐之也，愈不可矣“。
text.man_en: Moreover, if before desires are sprouted one searches and pokes for them in order to get rid of them, it is like leading a dog into the hall and then chasing it away. This is even more unfeasible. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And want to not bud and search and pick in order to seek to go, is like leading the dog to the hall and chase it, the more not carry on".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you want to search for them before they are young, it is like leading a dog to the hall and chasing them away, which is even more unacceptable."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To search for and eliminate desires before they even arise is like leading a dog into the hall and then chasing it away; it is even more futile.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 此外，如果在欲望萌发之前就去寻找和窥探，以求摆脱欲望，那就好比把狗牵进大厅，然后再赶走它。这更是行不通的。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 又若欲未萌芽，而求之、戳之，欲除之，则如引狗入堂而后驱之。这更是行不通的。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 此外，如果在欲望萌发之前就去搜寻并设法消除它们，这就像是把狗带进大厅然后再赶走。这更加行不通。

text.ori_cn: 必欲此心纯乎天理，而无一毫人欲之私，此作圣之功也：必欲此心纯乎天理，而无一毫人欲之私，非防于未萌之先而克于方萌之际不能也。
text.man_en: The determination to have the mind completely identified with the Principle of Nature and devoid of even an iota of selfish desire is the task of becoming a sage. But this is not possible unless selfish desires are prevented from sprouting and are subdued at the time of sprouting. There is no other task outside of this.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I want this heart to be purely heavenly, without the slightest human desire for selfishness, and this is the work of the Holy Spirit: I want this heart to be purely heavenly, without the slightest human desire for selfishness, and it is not to be prevented in the first place, but it is not to be overcome on the occasion of the square buds.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heart that must desire is purely based on heaven's principles, without any selfish desires from human beings. This is the merit of being a saint. The heart that must desire is pure from heaven's principles without any selfish desires from human beings. It cannot be prevented before it sprouts. You can't do it when Fang Meng is young.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is essential for this mind to be purely guided by heavenly principles, without the slightest trace of selfish human desire; this is the work of becoming a sage. For this mind to be purely guided by heavenly principles, without the slightest trace of selfish human desire, it cannot be achieved without preventing desires before they arise and overcoming them at the moment they begin to sprout.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 决心让心灵完全认同自然的原则，不带一丝私欲，这就是成为圣人的任务。但是，除非防止私欲萌芽，并在萌芽时加以抑制，否则这是不可能实现的。除此之外，别无其他任务。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心志完全符合自然法则，没有一丝一毫的私欲，这就是成为圣人的任务。但这是不可能的，除非自私的欲望在萌芽时被阻止并被抑制。除此之外没有其他任务。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 将心完全与自然之理同一，并且没有丝毫自私欲望的决心，是成为圣人的任务。但这不可能，除非自私的欲望在萌芽时受到抑制，并在萌芽时被压制。除此之外，没有其他任务。

text.ori_cn: 防于未萌之先而克于方萌之际，此正《中庸》“戒慎恐惧”、《大学》“致知格物”之功：舍此之外，无别功矣：夫谓灭于东而生于西、引犬上堂而逐之者，是自私自利、将迎意必之为累，而非克治洗荡之为患也。
text.man_en: To do this is the task of being cautious and apprehensive as taught in the Doctrine of the Mean and of the extension of knowledge and the investigation of things as taught in the Great Learning. There is no other task outside of this. What is said about desires being destroyed in the east while they grow in the west, or leading a dog into a hall and then chasing it away, is said because of the troubles of selfishness, leaning forward or backward to accommodate things, arbitrariness of opinion, and dogmatism, not because of the difficulty of subduing desires or washing them out and dissipating them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Prevention in the early bud of the first and grams in the square bud time, this is "the middle" "caution and fear", "University" "Zhi Zhi Ge Matters" of the work: outside of this, there is no other work carried out: the said to perish in the East and born in the West, lead the dog on the hall and the expulsion of the person, is selfishness, will be welcome to the exhaustion of the intention to be The problem is that it is selfishness and self-interest that will make us tired, and not a matter of curing and cleansing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To guard against the early onset and to overcome the early onset, this is the merit of "Beware of Fear" in "The Doctrine of the Mean" and "To Know and Observe Things" in "The Great Learning": Apart from this, there is no other merit: I say that it will be destroyed in the east. Those who are born in the West and lead dogs to the hall and chase them away are selfish and will only bring trouble to those who welcome them, rather than to overcome the troubles caused by washing and wandering.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To prevent things before they arise and to overcome them at the moment they start, this is precisely the practice of 'caution and fear' in the Doctrine of the Mean, and 'extending knowledge and investigating things' in the Great Learning. Beyond this, there is no other method. To say that extinguishing it in the east will make it arise in the west, or leading a dog into the hall just to expel it, is to burden oneself with selfishness and the anticipation of problems, rather than truly overcoming and cleansing away the afflictions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是《中庸》所讲的 "慎终追远"，也是《大学》所讲的 "格物致知"。除此之外，别无其他任务。所谓 "东边日出西边雨，道是无晴却有晴"，"牵狗入厅堂，赶狗出厅外"，说的是自私自利、趋炎附势、独断专行、教条主义的烦恼，而不是降伏欲望、洗涤欲望、消解欲望的困难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 做到这一点，就是中庸的谨慎、慎重，大学的广博、格物。除此之外没有其他任务。所谓东欲灭，西生欲，引狗入堂而赶走，是为自私、前后迁就、一意孤行的烦恼。和教条主义，并不是因为抑制欲望或清洗和驱散欲望有困难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 要做到这一点，就需要如《中庸》所教导的那样谨慎和保持警觉，以及如《大学》所教导的那样扩充知识和格物致知。除此之外没有别的任务。所谓的东边抑制欲望而西边增长欲望，或者把狗引入大堂然后将其赶走的说法，是因为自私的烦恼，为了迎合事物而前倾或后仰，意见的专断和教条主义，而不是由于难以克制欲望或清除和消散欲望。

text.ori_cn: 今曰“养生以清心寡欲为要”，只养生二字，便是自私自利、将迎意必之根。
text.man_en: Now you may say that for nourishing life it is important to have a pure heart and few desires. The very idea of nourishing life is the root of selfishness, leaning forward or backward to accommodate things, arbitrariness of opinion, dogmatism.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Today, it is said that "to maintain a healthy life with a clear mind and low desire is important", only the word "maintain a healthy life" is the root of selfishness, will welcome the intention to be.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Today, it is said that "the key to maintaining health is to have a pure mind and few desires." Just the word "preserving health" is the root of selfishness and self-interest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nowadays, 'health preservation emphasizes a tranquil mind and minimal desires,' but focusing solely on health preservation itself is selfish and the root of all sycophancy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在你可能会说，要想滋养生命，最重要的是要有一颗纯净的心和很少的欲望。滋养生命的理念本身就是自私自利、前倾或后退以迎合事物、独断专行、教条主义的根源。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 现在你可能会说，养生重要的是清心寡欲。滋养生命的观念本身就是自私、随波逐流、独断专行、教条主义的根源。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在你可能会说，养生重要的是要心地纯洁，欲望少。养生这个概念本身就是自私的根源，为适应事物而前倾或后仰，固执己见，独断专行。

text.ori_cn: 有此病根潜伏于中，宜其有灭于东而生于西、引犬上堂而逐之之患也。
text.man_en: With this root of trouble lying hidden in the mind, no wonder there is the trouble of destroying desires in the east while they grow in the west and of leading a dog into a hall and then chasing it away.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: With the root of this disease lurking in the middle, it is appropriate to have it perish in the east and be born in the west, and to lead the dog to the hall and expel it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the root of the disease is latent, it is likely that it will die in the east and be born in the west, leading dogs to the hall and chasing them away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With this latent root of the disease, it is likely that it will perish in the east and arise in the west, bringing the danger of inviting trouble while trying to expel it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有了这个隐藏在心中的祸根，难怪会有 "东边日出西边雨，道是无情却有情 "的烦恼，也难怪会有 "牵狗入厅堂，又把狗赶走 "的烦恼。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 此烦恼根藏于心，难怪有东灭欲，西生欲，引狗入堂又赶走的烦恼。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于这种隐伏在内心深处的根源问题存在，就不足为奇了，正如在东边灭欲望时它却在西边滋长，正如牵狗入堂后又驱之出门一般。

text.ori_cn: 〔12〕来书云：“佛氏于“不思善，不思恶，时认本来面”，于吾儒“随物而格”之功不同。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “The Buddhists advocate recognizing one's original state at the time when one thinks of neither good nor evil. It is different from our Confucian way of investigating things as they come.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [12] He came to write: "The Buddha's work of "not thinking of good, not thinking of evil, and recognising the original face" is different from that of our Confucianism, which is to "follow the object and frame it".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔12〕 The letter says: "Buddhist's "not thinking about good, not thinking about evil, always recognizing the true nature" is different from my Confucianism's "following the pattern of things".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 〔12〕The letter states: In Buddhism, recognizing the original face lies in neither thinking good nor evil, which differs from our Confucian practice of interacting with things and applying effort.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："佛家主张在不思善、不思恶时认清自己的本来面目。这与我们儒家的随遇而安不同。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你来信中说：“佛家主张在不思善恶的时候认清本性。这与我们儒家探究事物发生的方式不同。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说，“佛教徒主张在不思善恶的时候认清自己的本来面目。这不同于我们儒家随事而察的方法。

text.ori_cn: 吾若于不思善，不思恶时，用致知之功，则已涉于思善矣。
text.man_en: If I exert effort to extend knowledge at the time of thinking of neither good nor evil, I would already be involved in thinking of good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If I use the work of Zhi Zhi Zhi when I do not think of good or evil, then I am already involved in thinking of good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If I use the power of knowing when I am neither thinking about good nor thinking about evil, then I am already involved in thinking about goodness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If I do not think of good nor evil, and attempt to use the effort of discernment, I have already ventured into thinking of good.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果我在思考 "非善非恶 "时努力扩展知识，那么我就已经在思考 "善 "了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果我在不思善不思恶的时候努力扩展知识，我就已经陷入善思了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果我在思考无善无恶的时候努力扩展知识，我已经在思考善了。

text.ori_cn: 欲善恶不思，而心之良知清静自在，惟有寐而方醒之时耳。
text.man_en: The only time when one thinks of neither good nor evil and his mind of innate knowledge is clear, tranquil, and at ease, is the period of transition from sleep to waking.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you want to be free from thinking about good and evil, and your conscience is quiet and at ease, you can only wake up when you are asleep.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Desire to do good and evil without thinking, and the conscience of the heart is quiet and at ease, only when you are asleep can you wake up.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when one refrains from contemplating good and evil, and the innate conscience of the heart is clear and serene, can one achieve the state as if just awakened from slumber.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有在从睡眠到清醒的过渡时期，人们才会不思善恶，先天知识的头脑才会清晰、宁静和自在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 唯有不思善恶、本识心清、静、自在的时候，就是从睡眠到清醒的过渡时期。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 唯一一个既不思善也不思恶，同时先验之知晓的心神清澈、宁静、安逸的时刻，是从睡眠到清醒的过渡期。

text.ori_cn: 斯正孟子“夜气”之说。
text.man_en: This is precisely Mencius' theory of the restorative power of the night.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is exactly what Mencius said about "night air".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is what Mencius said about "night air".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is Zheng interpreting Mencius's concept of 'night qi.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这正是孟子关于夜的恢复力的理论。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这正是孟子关于夜的恢复力的理论。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这正是孟子的夜间恢复力量理论。

text.ori_cn: “不思善、不思恶，时认本来面目。”
text.man_en: "Don't think about good or evil, always recognize your true colors. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "Do not think of good or evil, but recognise the original face when you do."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Don't think about good or evil, always recognize your true colors."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Neither think of good nor of evil; at this moment, recognize your original face.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "不思善恶，永辨本色。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “不要去想善恶，永远认清自己的本来面目。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不思善恶，永远认清你的本色。

text.ori_cn: 此佛氏为未识本来面目者设此方便：本来面目即吾圣门所谓良知；今既认得良知明白，即已不消如此说矣。
text.man_en: To recognize one's original state at the time of thinking of neither good nor evil is the Buddhist expedient or convenient way intended for those who do not yet recognize their original state. The original state is what our Confucian school calls innate knowledge. If we already understand clearly what innate knowledge is, there is no longer any need of recognizing one's original state as the Buddhists have advocated.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This Buddha's for those who do not know the original face to set up this convenience: the original face is our holy door is called conscience; now that we have recognised the conscience to understand, that is, there is no need to say so.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Buddha has created this convenience for those who have not recognized the original face: the original face is what my sect calls the conscience; now that the conscience is clear and clear, there is no need to say this.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This method was devised by the Buddha for those who have not yet recognized their true nature: the true nature referred to is what our sage’s teachings call 'innate knowledge.' Once this innate knowledge is clearly understood, it is no longer necessary to explain it in this way.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在不思善不思恶的时候认清自己的本来面目，是佛教为尚未认清自己本来面目的人提供的权宜之计或方便之门。本来面目就是我们儒家所说的 "先天之知"。如果我们已经清楚地认识到什么是 "先天之知"，就没有必要再像佛家所主张的那样认清自己的本来面目了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 于不思善不思惟时认出本性，是佛教为尚未认清本性的人所设的方便法门。本初状态就是我们儒家所说的先天知识。如果我们已经清楚地了解什么是本性知识，就不再需要像佛家所提倡的认清本性了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在不思善不思恶的时候认清自己的本来面目，是佛教为了那些尚未认清自己本来面目的人所作的方便法门。这个本来面目就是我们儒家所说的良知。如果我们已经清楚地了解了什么是良知，就不再需要像佛教所提倡的那样去认清自己的本来面目了。

text.ori_cn: “随物而格”，是致知之功，即佛氏之“常惺惺”，亦是常存他本来面目耳，体段工夫大略相似，但佛氏有个自私自利之心，所以便有不同耳。
text.man_en: To investigate things as things come is the task of the extension of knowledge. It is what the Buddhists called “Be always alert, ”29 that is, always preserve one's original state. In broad outline the two methods are about the same. However, the Buddhists are different from us because they have the mind that is motivated by selfishness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "With things and frame", is the work of knowledge, that is, the Buddha's "always sympathetic", but also always save his original face ear, the body section of the work is very similar, but the Buddha's have a self-interested heart, so there is a different ear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Following the pattern of things" is the power of knowledge, which is Buddha's "constant Xingxing", which also means that his original face, eyes and ears are always preserved. The body, stage and skill are roughly similar, but Buddha has a selfish mind, so the methods are different. Ear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To follow the nature of things is the effort of acquiring knowledge, akin to the Buddhist concept of 'constant mindfulness.' It is essentially about maintaining one's original state. While the method is generally similar, the difference lies in the selfishness inherent in Buddhist thought.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 探究事物的来龙去脉是知识扩展的任务。这就是佛家所说的 "时时警醒 "29 ，即始终保持自己的原初状态。概括地说，这两种方法大致相同。但是，佛教徒与我们不同，因为他们有一颗自私自利的心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 随着事物的发生而研究事物是知识延伸的任务。就是佛家所说的“常警醒”29，即常保本状。总的来说，这两种方法大致相同。但是佛教徒和我们不一样，他们有自私的心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 格物致知的任务是探究事物的本质。这正是佛教徒所说的“时时醒觉”，即始终保持自己的本来面目。大体上，两种方法是相同的。然而，佛教徒与我们不同，他们有一个受自私心驱动的心态。

text.ori_cn: 今欲善恶不思，而心之良知清静自在，此便有自私自利、将迎意必之心，所以有“不思善、不思恶时，用致知之功，则已涉于思善”之患。
text.man_en: Now to wish to think of neither good nor evil and to want the mind of innate knowledge to be clear, tranquil, and at ease, means to have the mind of selfishness, leaning forward or backward, arbitrariness of opinion, and dogmatism. This is why if one exerts effort to extend knowledge at the time of thinking of neither good nor evil, one will have the trouble of already being involved in thinking of good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Now I want to think of good and evil, but the conscience of the heart is quiet and free, this will have selfishness, will welcome the heart of the will, so there is "not think of the good, not think of evil, with the knowledge of the work, it is already involved in thinking of the good" of the problem.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Now if you want to not think about good and evil, but the good knowledge in your heart is pure and at ease, you will have a selfish mind and will follow your will. Therefore, when you don’t think about good or evil, you have already involved in thinking when you use the power of knowing. good" problem.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Now, if one neither thinks about good nor evil, and the innate knowledge of the mind remains pure and at ease, there may arise a heart of selfishness and a yearning for gains. Therefore, there occurs the issue of 'when not thinking of good or evil, if one strives to extend his knowledge, it is inevitably tainted by thoughts of good.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，若想 "非善非恶"，想让 "先天之知 "的心清明、宁静、自在，就意味着要有自私自利之心、前倾后仰之心、独断专行之心、教条主义之心。这就是为什么如果在非善非恶的思考中努力扩展知识，就会产生已经卷入善的思考的麻烦。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 今欲不思善恶，欲知心清静自在，即有自私心、前倾心、专断心、教条心。这就是为什么，如果一个人在不思善、不思恶的时候努力扩展知识，那么就会有已经陷入思善的麻烦。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在希望不思善恶，想要让良知的本心清明、宁静、自在，意味着心中有自私、自我、任性和独断。这就是为什么如果在不思善恶时努力扩展知识，便会面临已经在思考善的困扰。

text.ori_cn: 孟子说“夜气”，亦只是为失其良心之人指出个良心萌动处，使他从此培养将去，今已知得良知明白，常用致知之功，即已不消说“夜气”：却是得兔后不知守兔，而仍去守枺，免将复先之矣。
text.man_en: When Mencius said "night qi", he only pointed out the place where conscience sprouts for those who have lost their conscience, so that they can cultivate their conscience from now on. Now that they have a clear conscience and use it to gain knowledge, there is no need to talk about "night qi": After getting the rabbit, he didn't know how to guard the rabbit, but still guarded the rabbit to prevent the enemy from returning to him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mencius said "night air", but only for the loss of his conscience to point out a conscience sprouting place, so that he will cultivate from now on, now known to have a conscience to understand, commonly used to Zhi Zhi Zhi Gong, that is, there is no need to say "night air": but after the rabbit do not know to guard the rabbit, but still go to guard the Wife, so as to avoid the restoration of the first! This is not to say "night breath".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When Mencius said "night qi", he only pointed out the place where conscience sprouts for those who have lost their conscience, so that they can cultivate the future. Now that we have a clear conscience and use it to gain knowledge, there is no need to talk about "night qi": After getting the rabbit, he didn't know how to guard the rabbit, but still guarded the rabbit to prevent the enemy from returning to him.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mencius spoke of the 'night air,' merely pointing out the initial stirrings of a good conscience in those who had lost it, so that they might nurture it from then on. Now that we understand the concept of innate knowledge clearly and constantly seek to extend this knowledge, there is no need to speak of the 'night air.' This is akin to continuing to guard the stump after catching the rabbit, rather than keeping the rabbit itself, thereby avoiding a return to prior ignorance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孟子说 "夜气"，只是为失去良知的人指出良知萌发的地方，让他们从此修养良知。既然已经问心无愧，用良知来获取知识，就没有必要再谈 "夜气 "了：得兔后，不知守兔，仍守兔，以防敌归。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孟子说“夜气”，只是为那些失去了良心的人指明了良心萌芽的地方，让他们从现在开始培养良知。现在他们问心无愧，用它来获取知识，就无需谈论“夜气”了：得到兔子后，他不知道如何看守兔子，但仍然看守着兔子，以防止被盗。敌人无法回到他身边。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当孟子说“夜气”时，他只是指出了良知萌发的地方，以便那些失去良知的人从此开始培养良知。现在他们已经有了清晰的良知，并用它来获得知识，就不需要再谈“夜气”了：得到兔子后，他不知道如何看守兔子，却仍然看守兔子以防敌人归还他。

text.ori_cn: 欲求宁静，欲念无生，此正是自私自利、将迎意必之病，是以念愈生而愈不宁静。
text.man_en: To seek peaceful tranquility and to want thoughts not to arise are precisely the trouble of selfishness, leaning forward or backward, arbitrariness of opinion, and dogmatism. Consequently, more and more thoughts will arise and there will be less and less peaceful tranquility.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The desire for tranquillity, the desire for thoughts without birth, this is precisely the disease of selfishness, will meet the will, so that the more thoughts are born, the less tranquillity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Desire for tranquility without the birth of desires is a disease of selfishness and self-interest. The more thoughts arise, the less peaceful one becomes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The pursuit of tranquility and the absence of desires actually stem from selfishness and the inevitable desire to satisfy one's own whims, resulting in even more thoughts and less tranquility.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 追求平和宁静，希望念头不生，正是自私自利、前倾后仰、独断专行、教条主义的烦恼。因此，念头会越来越多，宁静会越来越少。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 求清静，不让念头生起，正是自私、前后、专断、教条的烦恼。结果，杂念就会越来越多，平静的平静也会越来越少。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 追求和平安宁，并希望心中不起杂念，恰恰是自私、自我、偏执和教条主义的问题所在。结果是，杂念会越来越多，而和平安宁会越来越少。

text.ori_cn: 良知只是一个良知，而善恶自辨，更有何善何恶可思！良知之体本自宁静，今却又添一个求宁静，本自生生，今却又添一个欲无生，非独圣门致知之功不如此，虽佛氏之学亦未如此将迎意必也。
text.man_en: There is but one innate knowledge which by its own nature discriminates between good and evil. What good and evil are there for the mind to think about? In its substance innate knowledge is in the state of peaceful tranquility, and now you want to add the effort to seek peaceful tranquility. Innate knowledge naturally brings forth thoughts, and now you want to add the wish that thoughts will not arise. Not only is the task of the extension of knowledge practiced in the Confucian school different from this. ＃6 Even the learning of the Buddhists, I believe, does not go so far in leaning forward or backward, arbitrariness of opinion, and dogmatism.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conscientiousness is only a conscience, but good and evil are self-evident, and there is no good or evil to be contemplated! The body of conscience is from tranquillity, but now there is another one to seek tranquillity, this is from birth, but now there is another one to want no birth, not only the work of the Holy Doctrine of Zhi Zhi Zhi is not like this, even though the Buddhist school has not been so will be welcoming to the intention of the must also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Conscience is just a conscience, and since it can distinguish between good and evil, there is no need to think about what is good and what is evil! The body of conscience is originally peaceful, but now it has the desire for tranquility. It is originally self-generated, but now it has the desire to have no birth. It is not the only way to achieve knowledge by the Holy Sect. Even if the Buddha's teachings are not like this, it will be welcomed. .
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Conscience is simply conscience, and the discernment of good and evil needs no further contemplation of what is good or evil! The essence of conscience is inherently tranquil; however, now adds a pursuit of tranquility. It is inherently vibrant, yet now adds a desire for stillness. Not only does the sage's pursuit of knowledge not follow this, even the Buddhist teachings do not necessarily align with such anticipative meanings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有一种与生俱来的知识，它本身就能辨别善恶。那还有什么善恶可言？先天之识的本质是宁静安详的，而你现在要做的是努力寻求宁静安详。先天之识自然会生出念头，而你现在要做的是希望念头不再生出。儒家学派的知识扩展任务与此不同。＃6 即使是佛家之学，我认为也不至于前俯后仰、独断专行、教条主义。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有一种与生俱来的知识，其本质上可以区分善恶。心有什么善恶值得思考？本质上，本智处于平静的状态，现在你要加努力去寻求平静。本来智自然会产生念头，现在你要加上念头不生起的愿望。儒家学校所实践的知识扩展的任务不仅与此不同。 ＃6 我认为，即使是佛教徒的学问，也不至于前后左右、独断专行、教条主义。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只有一种天赋知识，它凭借自己的本性区分善恶。心灵有什么善恶可思考呢？在其本质上，天赋知识处于平静安宁的状态，而现在你想要加上追求平静安宁的努力。天赋知识自然会产生思想，而现在你希望思想不会出现。不仅儒家学派所实践的知识扩展任务与此不同。即使是佛教徒的学习，我相信，也不会如此趋前或后，随意的意见和教条主义。＃6

text.ori_cn: 只是一念良知，彻头彻尾，无始无终，即是前念不灭，后念不生，今却欲前念易灭，而后念不生，是佛氏所谓断灭种性，入于槁木死灰之谓矣。
text.man_en: In the functioning of innate knowledge, a single thought penetrates all. It has neither beginning nor end. This means that the earlier thoughts cannot be wiped out and later thoughts do not arise. Now to wish earlier thoughts to be easily wiped out and later thoughts not to arise amounts to what the Buddhists call “destroying the seed nature, ” and getting into the situation of what is called “dry wood and dead ashes. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Just a thought of conscience, through and through, without beginning and without end, that is, the former thought is not extinguished, the latter thought is not born, but now want the former thought is easy to extinguish, and the latter thought is not born, is the Buddha's so-called severance of the seed, into the haystack of the meaning of the dead ash is carried out.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is just a single thought of conscience, from beginning to end, without beginning or end, that is, the previous thought will never die, and the later thought will not arise. However, now the previous thought is easy to die, and the later thought will not arise. This is what Buddha calls the annihilation of the species nature, and the death of the dead tree. That’s it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is merely a single thought of innate knowledge, thorough and complete, with neither beginning nor end. This means the previous thoughts do not perish, and future thoughts do not arise. Yet now, if we wish the previous thoughts to easily perish and future thoughts not to arise, it is as the Buddhists describe the cessation of the seed of extinction, akin to entering a state of withered wood and dead ashes.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在先天知识的运作中，一念贯通万物。它既没有开始，也没有结束。这意味着，先前的念头无法消除，后来的念头也不会产生。现在，如果希望先前的念头能被轻易抹去，而后来的念头不会出现，这就相当于佛家所说的 "破坏种子性"，陷入所谓 "干柴烈火 "的境地。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在先天知识的运作中，单一的思想贯穿一切。它没有开始也没有结束。这就是说，较早的念头无法消灭，而较晚的念头也不会生起。现在希望先念容易消灭，后念不生起，就等于佛家所说的“破种性”，进入所谓“干木死灰”的境地。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在先天之知的运作中，一念贯通一切。它既无始也无终。这意味着先前的念头无法抹去，后来的念头不会产生。现在希望先前的念头容易抹去，后来的念头不产生，这相当于佛教所说的‘破坏种性’，并陷入所谓的‘枯木死灰’的境地。

text.ori_cn: 于此念头提在之时，而事至物来，应之必有其道。
text.man_en: If one's thoughts are brought to the fore, when things occur, one can handle them in the proper way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When this thought is raised, and things come to pass, there must be a way of responding to it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When this thought comes up, when things happen, there must be a way to deal with them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At the moment this thought arises, when things come and events occur, there must be a proper way to respond.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人的思想能够凸显出来，那么当事情发生时，他就能以适当的方式加以处理。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果一个人的思想能够发挥出来，那么当事情发生的时候，就能正确地处理它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人的想法被提到前列，当事情发生时，他就可以以适当的方式处理它们。

text.ori_cn: 但恐此念头提起时少，放下时多，则工夫间断耳。
text.man_en: What I am afraid is that more often than not one's thoughts are neglected rather than brought to the fore and one's task will be interrupted.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: But I am afraid that when this thought is brought up less and when it is put down more, the work will be interrupted.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: But I'm afraid that when I bring up this thought, I rarely bring it up, but when I put it down, my time will be interrupted.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, if this thought arises infrequently and is abandoned often, then the effort will be intermittent.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我担心的是，人的思想往往会被忽视，而不是凸显出来，这样人的工作就会被打断。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我担心的是，一个人的想法常常被忽视而不是被凸显出来，一个人的任务就会被打断。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我担心的是，人的想法往往被忽视而不是被提出来，同时人的工作会被打断。

text.ori_cn: 虽曰常提不放，而不加戒惧克治之功，恐私欲不去：若加戒惧克治之功焉，又为“思善”之事，而于“本来面目”又未达一间也。
text.man_en: Even though I constantly bring thoughts to the fore and do not neglect them, if I do not supplement this with the effort of caution, apprehension, and selfmastery, I am afraid selfish desires cannot be eliminated. But if I supplement it with such effort, then I will be engaging in thinking of good and still keep myself a slight distance from the original state of the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Although said that often mention not put, but not add the fear of curbing the work, I am afraid that selfishness does not go: if you add the fear of curbing the work of curbing the work, but also for the "thinking about the good" thing, and in the "original face" and not up to a room also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although it is said that it is always mentioned and not put away, it does not have the effect of overcoming fear and restraint, and the fear of selfish desires will not go away: if it does not have the effect of overcoming restraint and fear, it is also a matter of "thinking about good", but it does not reach the "original appearance".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Though it is often mentioned and always in mind, if one does not exert the effort of vigilance and self-restraint, personal desires may not be eradicated. However, if one does exert the effort of vigilance and self-restraint, it then becomes a matter of 'thinking towards goodness,' yet still might not fully reveal the 'original true self.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使我不断地让思想凸显出来，并不忽视它们，但如果我不辅以谨慎、忧虑和自我掌控的努力，恐怕私欲是无法消除的。但是，如果我辅以这种努力，那么我就会从事于向善的思考，并且仍然与心灵的原始状态保持着微小的距离。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 虽然我时常把念头摆在眼前，不忽视它们，但如果我不以谨慎、忧虑、自制的努力来补充它，恐怕私欲就无法消除。但如果我用这样的努力来补充它，那么我就会一直在想善，但仍然与本来的心状态保持着一点距离。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即使我不断地把这些想法提到前台并不忽视它们，如果我不辅以谨慎、警觉和自我控制的努力，我担心无法消除自私的欲望。但如果我辅以这样的努力，那么我会在思考好的事物的同时，依然与心灵的原初状态保持一小段距离。

text.ori_cn: 此节所问，前一段已自说得分晓，末后却是自生迷惑，说得支离，及有“‘本来面目’未达一间”之疑，都是自私自利、将迎意必之为病，去此病自无此疑矣。
text.man_en: The first part of what you have asked in this question has already been clearly explained by yourself. In the latter part, however, you have deceived and confused yourself, you have gone into fragmentary and isolated details in your explanation, and you entertain worry about being distant from the original state. All this is because of the defects of selfishness, leaning forward or backward, arbitrariness of opinion, and dogmatism. Get rid of these defects and you will have no such doubts.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This section of the question, the first paragraph has been said to be clear, the end of the confusion is self-generated, said that the separation, and "'original face' is not up to a" doubt, are self-serving, will meet the intention to be for the disease, go to this disease since there is no such doubt.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The questions asked in this section are self-explanatory in the first paragraph, but in the end, they are confused, confused, and have doubts that "the 'original face' has not reached one level." This is all selfish and self-serving. Disease, there is no doubt that this disease will be cured.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The previous paragraph has already clearly explained the questions raised in this section. However, the latter part becomes confusing, with fragmented explanations and doubts arising from not fully comprehending the 'true nature.' These doubts and fragmented thoughts stem from selfishness and the tendency to cater to one's biases. Eliminating this selfishness will naturally dispel such doubts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你在这个问题中提出的前半部分，你自己已经解释得很清楚了。然而，在问题的后半部分，你却自欺欺人、混淆视听，你的解释支离破碎、孤立无援，你还担心自己会远离原初的状态。这一切都源于自私、前倾或后仰、武断和教条主义的缺陷。改掉这些毛病，你就不会再有这样的疑虑了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你在这个问题中所问的第一部分你自己已经解释得很清楚了。但到了后半部分，你却自欺欺人、迷惑不解，解释得支离破碎、孤立无援，担心与原来的状态相去甚远。这一切都是由于自私、前后左右、独断专行、教条主义等毛病造成的。去掉这些缺陷，你就不会有这样的疑虑了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你在这个问题中所问的第一部分已经由你自己明确解释清楚了。然而，在后半部分，你自欺欺人，困惑自己，在解释中陷入了零碎和孤立的细节，并且担心远离原来的状态。所有这些都是由于自私、前倾或后仰、主观意见和教条主义的缺陷。摆脱这些缺陷，你就不会有这样的疑虑。

text.ori_cn: 〔14〕来书云：“质美者明得尽，渣滓便浑化。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “ ‘One whose physical nature is excellent will be perfectly intelligent, and the impure dregs in him will be completely transformed. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [14] He came to say: "When the quality of the beautiful is clear, the dregs will be muddled.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔14〕 A letter says: “Those who are beautiful in quality will be clear enough, and the dregs will become muddy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 〔14〕The letter states: 'For those of good quality, the clarity is fully attained, while residues dissolve completely.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你在信中说："'一个人的身体本质是优秀的，他就会有完美的智慧，他身上不纯净的渣滓就会被完全转化。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 来信云：‘身性优秀的人，智慧圆满，其不净渣滓皆悉转变。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中写道：“‘一个身体素质出色的人会非常聪明，他体内的杂质会彻底转变。’

text.ori_cn: 良知本来自明。
text.man_en: Innate knowledge is by nature intelligent.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conscience is originally derived from clarity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Conscience is self-evident.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Conscience is inherently self-evident.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识的本质是智慧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与生俱来的知识本质上是聪明的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天生的知识本质上是智慧的。

text.ori_cn: 气质不美者，渣滓多，障蔽厚，不易开明：质美者，渣滓原少，无多障蔽，略加致知之功，此良知便自莹彻，些少渣滓，如汤中浮雪，如同能作障蔽。
text.man_en: Those whose physical nature is not excellent have many impure dregs and heavy obscuration and are not easily enlightened. Those whose physical nature is excellent have originally few dregs and not much obscuration. With a little effort at the extension of knowledge, their innate knowledge will of itself become clear and transparent. How can a little dreg, like melting snow in hot water, be an obscuration?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the temperament is unattractive, there is much dross, and the barrier is thick, and it is not easy to be enlightened: if the temperament is beautiful, there is little dross, and there is not much barrier, and if you add a little to your knowledge, your conscience will be clear, and some little dross, such as the floating snow in the soup, will be as much of a barrier as if it were a barrier.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those whose temperament is not beautiful will have many dregs and thick obstacles, making it difficult to be enlightened. Those with beautiful qualities will have few dregs and not many obstacles. With a little effort to achieve knowledge, the conscience will be clear and clear. A little bit of dregs will be like snow floating in the soup, as if it can be enlightened. As a barrier.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those with an unrefined disposition are filled with impurities and heavy obstructions, making enlightenment difficult: those with a refined nature have fewer impurities and obstacles, requiring only a little effort in acquiring knowledge for their innate understanding to become clear and bright. Any remaining impurities are like snowflakes floating in soup, unlikely to create significant obstructions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 体质不佳的人糟粕多、晦气重，不容易开悟。体质优秀的人，糟粕本来就少，蒙蔽也不多。只要稍加努力扩展知识，他们与生俱来的知识本身就会变得清澈透明。一点渣滓，就像融化在热水中的雪，怎么会是蒙昧呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 色身不善的人，浊渣多，障蔽重，不易开悟。色性优秀的人，原本就少渣滓，没有太多的障蔽。只要稍微努力扩展知识，他们的固有知识就会变得清晰透明。一点点渣滓，就像热水里融化的雪一样，怎么可能成为障碍呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些体性不好的人有许多杂质和沉重的障碍，不容易开悟。那些体性好的人本来杂质就少，障碍也不多。稍微努力扩展知识，他们的天赋智慧就会自然变得清晰透明。怎么会有点杂质像热水中的融雪一样，成为障碍呢？

text.ori_cn: 向曾面论明善之义，明则诚矣，非若后儒所谓明善之浅也。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 之前，我曾与你们面对面地讨论过 "理解善 "的含义。有了理解或智慧，就会有诚意。它不像后世学者所说的理解善那样肤浅。

text.ori_cn: 愚意窃云谓诸公见道偏则可，谓全无闻则恐后儒崇尚记诵训诂之过也。
text.man_en: In my humble opinion, it is all right to say that these grand gentlemen understand only part of the Way. But to say that they did not hear the Way at all is, I am afraid, a mistake, resulting from the emphasis of later scholars on recitation and textual criticism.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 依笔者愚见，说这些大人物只理解了 "道 "的一部分，倒也无可厚非。但如果说他们根本没听懂 "道"，恐怕就大错特错了，这是后世学者强调背诵和文本批判造成的。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在我看来，说这些伟人只理解了道的一部分是可以的。但说他们完全不懂道，我担心是错误的，这种说法源于后来的学者对背诵和训诂学的重视。

text.ori_cn: 性一而已。

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Just sex.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is merely a matter of nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 自然只有一个，仅此而已。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 本质只有一种，仅此而已。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地万物，本质为一。

text.ori_cn: 仁、义、礼、知，性之性也，聪、明、睿、知，性之质也，喜、怒、哀、乐，性之情也，私欲、客气，性之蔽也：质有清浊，故情有过不及，而蔽有浅深也：私欲、客气，一病两痛，非二物也。
text.man_en: Humanity, righteousness, propriety, and wisdom are its basic nature. Quickness of apprehension, intelligence, insight, and wisdom are its physical nature. Pleasure, anger, sorrow, and joy are its feelings, and selfish desires and passions caused by external stimuli are its obscuration. Physical nature may be clear or turbid and therefore feelings are sometimes excessive or insufficient, and the obscuration heavy or light. Selfish desires and passions caused by external stimuli are the same disease with two different kinds of pain, and are not two different things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Benevolence, righteousness, propriety, knowledge, the nature of the nature of the nature, intelligent, bright, wise, knowledge, the nature of the quality of the joy, anger, sadness, happiness, the feelings of the nature of the private desires, politeness, the nature of the obscuration of the quality of the quality of the turbid and clear, so that the feelings of the over and under, and obscuration of the depth of the shade: the private desires, politeness, a disease of the two pains, but also not the two things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Benevolence, righteousness, propriety, and knowledge are the nature of nature, intelligence, intelligence, wisdom, and knowledge are the qualities of nature, happiness, anger, sadness, and joy are the emotions of nature, selfish desires, politeness, and the concealment of nature: quality is there Pure and turbid, so emotions have faults and shortcomings, and there are shallow and deep shades: selfish desires, politeness, one disease and two pains, they are not two things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Benevolence, righteousness, propriety, and wisdom are the inherent nature of one's character; intelligence, brightness, insight, and knowledge are the qualities of one's nature; joy, anger, sorrow, and pleasure are the emotions of one's nature; selfish desires and external influences are the obscurations of one's nature: qualities vary in purity, hence emotions can be excessive or insufficient, and obscurations can be superficial or profound: selfish desires and external influences are ailments of the same nature, not two separate things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人、义、礼、智是其基本性质。悟性、聪明、洞察力和智慧是其体性。喜、怒、哀、乐是其情，私欲和外界刺激引起的激情是其昧。人的体性有清有浊，因此人的感受有时过多，有时不足；人的蒙蔽有时重，有时轻。私欲和外界刺激引起的激情是同一种病，有两种不同的痛苦，并不是两种不同的东西。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 仁、义、礼、智是其基本本质。敏锐、聪明、洞察力、智慧是其身体本质。喜、怒、哀、乐是其受，私欲和外在刺激所引起的贪欲是其障。色性有清有浊，所以受有时过多或不足，障有时重或轻。自私的欲望和外在刺激引起的情欲是同一种病，两种不同的痛苦，并不是两种不同的东西。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 仁义礼智是它的本性。敏捷、智慧、洞察力和聪明是它的物性。快乐、愤怒、悲伤和喜悦是它的情感，外界刺激所引起的私欲和激情是它的蒙蔽。物性可以清或浊，因此情感有时过度或不足，蒙蔽则有轻重之分。外界刺激所引起的私欲和激情是一种病症的两种不同痛苦，不是两种不同的事物。

text.ori_cn: 张、黄、诸葛及韩、范诸公，皆天质之美，自多暗合道妙，虽末可尽谓之知学，尽谓之闻道，然亦自其有学，违道不远者也：使其闻学知道，即伊、傅、周、邵矣。
text.man_en: The grand gentlemen Chang, Huang, Chuko, Han, and Fan were all excellent in their natural endowment and were in most cases unnoticeably in accord with the ultimate truth. Although they cannot be said to have completely understood the learning or to have heard the Way fully, nevertheless each had his own learning which did not depart very far from the Way. Had they fully heard the learning and understood the Way completely, they would have been equal to Iyin, Fu Yüeh, Duke Chou, and Duke Chao.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Zhang, Huang, Zhuge and Han, Fan, all the public, are the beauty of the quality of the sky, since more implicitly with the Tao, although the end can be called all the knowledge of the study, as much as called the hear the Tao, but also from its learning, against the Tao is not far away: so that its hear the learning to know that Yi, Fu, Zhou, Shao carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Zhang, Huang, Zhuge, Han, and Fan are all beautiful in nature, and they are all in harmony with the Tao. Although they are not fully known as knowing and learning, they can only be called hearing the Tao. However, they also have learning, and those who violate the Tao are not far away. Also: to make them hear and learn, that is, Yi, Fu, Zhou, and Shao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mr. Zhang, Mr. Huang, Mr. Zhuge, and Messrs. Han, Fan, have natural endowments and often grasp the subtleties of the Way intuitively. Although it cannot be fully said that they are learned or have comprehended the Way, they are nonetheless close in their studies and not far from the Way. Should they hear and understand the teachings of the Way, they would be like Yi Yin, Fu Yue, Zhou Dunyi, and Shao Yong.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 张、黄、朱、韩、范诸公，皆天纵之才，大抵与至理相通。虽然不能说他们完全理解了学问，也不能说他们完全听懂了道，但他们每个人都有自己的学问，与道相去不远。如果他们完全听懂了学问，完全明白了道，他们就会与伊尹、夫差、周公、昭公等人平起平坐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 张、黄、中子、韩、范诸君子，皆天赋极好，多半与究竟谛不着不合。虽然不能说是完全明白了学问，也不能说是完全听懂了道，但是却各有各的学问，与道相去不远。若能充分闻学，彻底了解道，就相当于伊尹、伏月、周公、昭公了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 长、黄、诸葛、韩、范五位贤人都天资卓越，并且在大多数情况下与至理契合。虽然他们不能说完全理解了学问或完全听闻了道，然而他们每个人的学问都没有远离大道。若他们完全听闻了学问并彻底理解了道，便能够媲美伊尹、傅说、周公和召公。

text.ori_cn: 若文中子则又不可谓之不知学者，其书虽多出于其徒，亦多有未是虚，然其大略则亦居然可见，但今相去辽远，无有的然凭证，不可悬断其所至矣。

Although his books are mostly the products of his pupils and there are many mistakes, their general outline can easily be seen. However, since we are far from his time and have no positive evidence, we cannot arbitrarily conclude from imagination just what he had attained.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the text of the son can not be said to be unaware of the scholars, although the book is mostly out of his disciples, but also more than not is false, but its strategy is also actually visible, but now far away, there is no proof of Ran, can not be suspended to its to carry on.

However, his general principles can be seen. However, they are far away from each other and there is no evidence. We cannot suspend them. That’s it.

However, due to the considerable temporal distance, there is no definitive evidence, and it is impossible to make a conclusive judgment about his achievements.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 至于文忠子，不能说他不懂圣人的教诲。虽然他的书大多是他的学生的产物，而且有许多错误，但其大体轮廓还是很容易看出来的。但是，由于我们离他的时代很远，没有确凿的证据，我们不能凭想象武断地断定他的成就。

text.ori_cn: 夫良知即是道。

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Good knowledge is the way.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Innate knowledge itself is the Way.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先天知识与道同一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 先天的知识与道是一致的。

text.ori_cn: 良知之在人心，不但圣贤、虽常人亦无不如此，若无有物欲牵蔽，但循着良知发用流行将去，即无不是道：但在常人多为物欲牵蔽，不能循得良知。
text.man_en: That it is present in the mind is true not only in the cases of the sages and worthies but even in that of the common man. When one is free from the driving force and obscurations of material desires, and just follows innate knowledge and leaves it to continue to function and operate, everything will be in accord with the Way. In the case of ordinary men, most of them are driven and obscured by material desires and cannot follow innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conscience in the human heart, not only the sages, although the ordinary people are not so, if there is no material desires to hide, but follow the conscience of the development of the use of popular will go, that is, nothing is not the way: but in the ordinary people more for material desires to hide, can not follow the conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Liangzhi is in the human heart, not only for sages but also for ordinary people. If there is no material desire, but if it is followed by the use of conscience, it will be the Tao. However, ordinary people are mostly hindered by material desire and cannot follow conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The presence of conscience in the human heart is not limited to sages and worthies; even ordinary people have it. If there are no desires obstructing it, and one follows and acts upon this conscience, it is nothing but the Dao. However, in most ordinary people, desires often obstruct them, preventing them from following their conscience.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 它存在于心中，这不仅是圣贤名士的真实写照，甚至也是普通人的真实写照。当一个人摆脱了物欲的驱使和遮蔽，只是遵循先天的知识，让它继续发挥作用和运行时，一切都会合乎大道。就普通人而言，他们大多被物欲所驱使和遮蔽，无法遵循先天的知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不仅在圣贤之人身上如此，在普通人身上也是如此。当一个人摆脱了物欲的驱动和障碍，只遵循先天知识，让它继续运作和运作时，一切都会符合道。就普通人而言，他们大多数都受到物欲的驱使和遮蔽，无法遵循先天的知识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这种存在于心的真实不仅仅是圣贤之人，即便是普通人也是如此。当人摆脱了物欲的驱使和遮蔽，只顺从其本心并让其继续运作，一切便会符合大道。至于普通人，他们多半被物欲所驱使和遮蔽，无法顺从其本心。

text.ori_cn: 如数公者，天质既自清明，自少物欲为之牵蔽，则其良知之发用流行处，自然是多，自然违道不远。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Such as the number of public, the quality of heaven since the clear, since less material desires for the cover, then the conscience of the hair with the popularity of the place, naturally more, naturally against the road is not far away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Just like Shu Gong, since his nature has been clear and clear since he was little, and has been hindered by material desires since he was little, his conscience will naturally be used in many places, and it will naturally go against the path.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are impartial by nature possess an inherent clarity and purity. As they are seldom swayed by material desires, their innate wisdom naturally flourishes, and they are seldom far from the path of righteousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 由于几位大君子的先天禀赋本就纯净清明，当然也只是稍稍被物欲所驱使和遮蔽，他们的先天知识的功能和运行自然是非常丰富的，自然也不会离道太远。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于几位伟大君子的天赋本性纯净明澈，当然不会被物欲大大驱使和遮蔽，他们的良知之功能和运作自然充足，自然离道不远。

text.ori_cn: 学者学循此良知而已。
text.man_en: To learn simply means to learn to follow innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Scholars learn to follow this conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Scholars only follow this conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Scholars pursue the cultivation of this innate knowledge.

text.ori_cn: 谓之知学，只是知得专在学循良知。

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although it is not known that Shu Gong works exclusively on his conscience, he may be overly confused and confused by the influence, so he may be separated or combined and ultimately pure. If he knows how to do it, he is a sage.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Although Shugo did not specifically focus his efforts on the inherent knowledge, he sometimes wandered into multiple paths, confused by influences, resulting in inconsistency: if he had recognized the right moment, he would have become a sage.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽不知叔公专作用于良知，然或惑乱过甚，受其影响，或离或合，终归清净。知其然，则圣人矣。
