text.ori_cn: 后懦尝以数子者，尚皆是气质用事，末免于行不著，习不察：此亦未为过论。
text.man_en: Later scholars have regarded them as having behaved on the basis of physical nature and therefore having acted without understanding and habitually without examination. This is not putting it too strongly.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: After the cowards tasted to count the sons, still all are temperament with things, the end of the line is not noteworthy, habits are not observed: this is also not too much to say.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is not an exaggeration to say that those who are cowardly and try to count their sons are still using their temperament to prevent them from being unable to do it and not observing their habits.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Later scholars who follow these few gentlemen often tend to act based on their temperament and emotions, inevitably resulting in actions that go unnoticed and habits that go unexamined: this should not be considered an excessive criticism.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 后来的学者认为，他们的行为是基于身体的本性，因此是不加理解和习惯性地不加审查地行事。这种说法并不过分。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 后来的学者认为它们是基于物理性质而行动的，因此是在没有理解和习惯性地未经检查的情况下行动的。这并不算太强烈。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 后来的学者认为他们的行为是基于本能，因此在没有理解的情况下习惯性地没有进行反思。这种说法并不过分。

text.ori_cn: 但后儒之所谓著、察者，亦是狃于闻见之狭，蔽于沿习之非，而依拟仿像于影响形迹之间，尚非圣门之所谓著、察者也。
text.man_en: However, what later scholars called understanding and examination are, after all, confined to narrow information and obscured by wrong habits of thought. They follow, grope after, and imitate what is apparent or illusory. What they mean by understanding and examination is not what is understood in the Confucian school.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, the so-called "writing" and "observing" of the Latter Confucians are accustomed to the narrowness of hearing and seeing, and are blinded by the wrongness of their habits, and are imitated in the influence of the shape and signs, which is not the so-called "writing" and "observing" of the Sacred Sect.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, the so-called writing and observing of post-Confucianism is also due to the narrowness of hearing and seeing, concealed by the mistakes of following habits, and relying on imitation and imitation to influence the traces. It is not the so-called writing and observing of the holy sect.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, what later scholars referred to as detailed observation was also limited by narrow experience and clouded by habitual misconceptions. Their reliance on imitating the superficial appearance and traces fell short of the true essence of detailed examination as taught by the sages.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然而，后世学者所谓的理解和审视，毕竟局限于狭隘的信息，被错误的思维习惯所遮蔽。他们追随、摸索、模仿的是表象或虚幻的东西。他们所说的 "悟 "和 "审"，并非儒家所理解的 "悟 "和 "审"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 然而，后世学者所谓的理解和检验，毕竟局限于狭隘的信息，并被错误的思维习惯所掩盖。他们追随、摸索、模仿明显或虚幻的事物。他们所说的“悟”和“考”，并不是儒家所理解的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，后来的学者所称的理解和考察，毕竟只是局限于狭窄的信息，被错误的思维习惯所模糊。他们追随、摸索并模仿的是显而易见或虚幻的东西。他们所谓的理解和考察，并不是儒家学派所理解的那样。

text.ori_cn: 所谓生知、安行，知、行二字，亦是就用功上说；若是知、行本体即是良知、良能，虽在困勉之人，亦皆可谓之生知、安行矣。
text.man_en: The words “knowledge” and “practice” in the phrase “born with knowledge and practice it naturally and easily” refer to one's effort. If the original substance of any knowledge and practice were innate knowledge and innate ability, then it would be possible to say that those who learn through hard work and practice their learning with effort and difficulty could practice it naturally and easily.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The so-called birth of knowledge, safe line, knowledge, line two words, but also on the use of power; if the body of knowledge, line that is conscience, conscience, although in the struggle of the people, can also be called the birth of knowledge, safe line carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The so-called "knowledge and conduct", the two words "knowledge and conduct" are also said in terms of practice; if the essence of knowledge and conduct is good knowledge and good ability, even if it is a difficult person, it can be said to be "knowledge and conduct".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The so-called innate knowledge and comfortable practice, the terms 'knowing' and 'practicing', are also discussed in terms of exertion; if it refers to the essence of knowing and practicing, which is innate knowledge and innate ability, then even in those who are struggling diligently, it can also be called innate knowledge and comfortable practice.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "天生我材必有用，千金散尽还复来 "中的 "知 "和 "行 "指的是人的努力。如果任何知识和实践的本原都是先天的知识和先天的能力，那么就可以说，那些通过努力学习并通过努力和困难来实践自己的学习的人可以自然而然、轻而易举地实践它。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “生而有知，行之自然易”中的“知”、“行”，就是指努力。如果任何知识和实践的本源都是先天知识和先天能力，那么可以说，勤奋学习、努力实践所学的人，可以自然轻松地实践它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “生而知之者，习而安之”中的“知”和“习”指的是一个人的努力。如果任何知识和实践的原初实质是先天的知识和先天的能力，那么就可以说那些通过努力学习并费力地实践其学习的人可以自然地、轻松地习之。

text.ori_cn: 知、行二字更宜精察。
text.man_en: The two words “knowledge” and “practice” should be understood more thoroughly.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The words "know" and "do" should be examined more carefully.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The two words "knowledge" and "action" are more suitable for careful observation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The words 'knowledge' and 'action' should be examined with greater precision.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 对 "知 "和 "行 "这两个词的理解应该更加透彻。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “知”和“行”这两个词应该理解得更透彻。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “知识”和“实践”这两个词应该更深入地理解。

text.ori_cn: 〔16〕来书云：“昔周茂叔每令伯淳寻仲尼，颜子乐处。
text.man_en: [16] The letter says: "In the past, Uncle Mao of the Zhou Dynasty would always order Bo Chun to look for Zhongni, and Yan Zi was happy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [16] The letter came to us in the following words: "In the past, Zhou Mao Shu every made Bo Chun search for Zhong Ni, and Yan Zi was happy to be there.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [16] The letter says: "In the past, Uncle Mao of the Zhou Dynasty would always order Bo Chun to look for Zhongni, and Yan Zi was happy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In [Letter] 16, it is written: 'In the past, Zhou Maoshu always instructed Bo Chun to seek the contentment of Confucius and Yan Hui.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: [16] 信中说："昔者周毛叔常命伯嚭寻仲尼，晏子乐之。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: [16]信中说：“昔周毛伯伯，常令伯春寻仲尼，颜子大喜。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 来信说：“过去周朝的毛叔总是派伯春去找仲尼，颜子很高兴。”

text.ori_cn: 澄平生多闷，未常见真乐之趣，今切愿寻之”乐是心之本体，虽不同于七情之乐，而亦不外于七情之乐；虽则圣贤别有真乐，而亦常人之所同有，但常人有之而不自知，反自求许多忧苦，自加迷弃。
text.man_en: I am often depressed and have not yet experienced true joy. I am eager to find it. ” Joy is characteristic of the original substance of the mind. Though it is not identical with the joy of the seven feelings, it is not outside of it. Sages and worthies have another true joy, it is true, but it is shared by ordinary people except that these people do not realize it though they have it. Instead they bring upon themselves a great deal of sorrow and grief and, in addition, confusion and selfabandonment.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Cheng life much boredom, not common interest in real music, now eager to find the "music is the essence of the heart, although different from the music of the seven emotions, but also not outside the music of the seven emotions; although the sages and sages do not have real music, but also the common people have, but the common people have and do not know, and seek a lot of self-seeking sorrow and pain, and abandonment of self-addicted.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Cheng has been bored a lot in his life, and has never seen true happiness. Now he is eager to find it. "Happiness is the essence of the heart. Although it is different from the happiness of the seven emotions, it is not different from the happiness of the seven emotions. Although the sages and sages have no true happiness, but It is common to ordinary people, but ordinary people have it without realizing it. Instead, they cause themselves a lot of sorrow and confusion.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: For most of his life, Cheng Ping felt restless and never experienced real joy. Now he earnestly desires to seek it. True joy is the essence of the heart. Although it is different from the joy derived from the seven emotions, it is not outside of it. While sages have a unique kind of true joy, it is also something that common people possess. However, common people are unaware of it, and instead, they seek out many worries and pains, adding to their own confusion and abandonment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我经常感到沮丧，还没有体验过真正的快乐。我渴望找到它。"快乐是心灵本原的特征。虽然它不等同于七情六欲的喜悦，但它并不在七情六欲之外。诚然，圣贤和达官贵人拥有另一种真正的快乐，但普通人也拥有这种快乐，只不过他们虽然拥有这种快乐，却没有意识到它的存在。相反，他们给自己带来了大量的忧愁和悲伤，此外还有困惑和自暴自弃。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我常常心情郁闷，还没有体会到真正的快乐。我急于找到它。 ” 喜悦是心本来本质的特征。虽然与七受之乐不同，但并不在七受之乐之外。圣贤有另一种真正的快乐，这是事实，但它是普通人所共有的，只不过这些人虽然有它却没有意识到。相反，他们给自己带来了巨大的悲伤和悲伤，此外，还有困惑和自我放弃。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我经常感到沮丧，还没有体验过真正的快乐。我渴望找到它。‘快乐是心的本体特征。虽然它与七情的快乐不完全相同，但也不完全分离。圣人和贤者确实有另一种真正的快乐，但是这个快乐普通人也有，只是他们没有意识到而已。相反，他们给自己带来了很多悲伤和困扰，以及困惑和自暴自弃。’

text.ori_cn: 虽在忧苦迷弃之中，而此乐又未尝不存，但一念开明，反身而诚，则即此而在矣。
text.man_en: Even in the midst of all these, this joy is not absent. As soon as a single thought is enlightened, and one examines himself and becomes sincere, the joy is present right there.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Though in the midst of sorrow and misery and abandonment, and this joy is not yet absent, but a thought of enlightenment, and the opposite of sincerity, then this is this and in.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although in the midst of sorrow, misery and abandonment, this happiness does not disappear, but if one thought is open-minded, reflexive and sincere, then it is here.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Even amidst sorrow and abandonment, this joy is never truly absent; with a moment of enlightenment and sincere introspection, it is immediately present.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使在这一切之中，这种喜悦也不会缺席。只要一个念头豁然开朗，只要一个人审视自己，变得真诚，喜悦就会立刻出现。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即使在这一切之中，这种喜悦也不缺席。一念一开，省察自己，真诚起来，喜悦就在身边。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即使在这些困难之中，这种喜悦也不会消失。当一个念头被点亮，他自省并变得真诚时，喜悦就在那里。

text.ori_cn: 每与原静论，无非此意，而原静尚有“何道可得”之问，是犹未免于骑驴觅驴之蔽也。
text.man_en: I have often discussed with you, Yuanching, this same idea and you still ask in what way it can be found. This is a case of obscuration like one's looking for a donkey while riding it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Every discussion with the original Jing, all this is the same, and the original Jing still have "what road can be obtained" question, is not free from riding the donkey looking for donkeys of the blind also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is the meaning whenever discussing Yuan Jing, but Yuan Jing still has the question of "what is the way to get it", which is why he is still not free from the blindness of riding a donkey to find a donkey.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Every discussion with Yuan Jing invariably revolves around this idea. However, Yuan Jing still poses the question, 'How can the Way be attained?' This suggests that he is still not free from the mistake of searching for the donkey while riding it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我经常和你讨论同样的想法，袁青，你还在问用什么方法可以找到它。这就像骑驴找驴一样模糊不清。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我经常和你元庆讨论同样的想法，你仍然问如何找到它。这是一个像骑驴找驴一样的障蔽。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我常常与你讨论这个想法，远清，而你还在问怎么能找到它。这就像骑着驴找驴一样，是被蒙蔽了。

text.ori_cn: 〔17〕来书云：“《大学》以“心有好乐、忿懥、忧患，恐惧”为“不得其正”，而程子亦谓“圣人情顺万事而无情。”
text.man_en: Your letter says, “According to the Great Learning, when the mind is affected by fondness, anger, worries, and fear, it will not be correct. Master Ch'eng Hao also said, ‘The feelings of the sage are in accord with all creation and yet he has no feeling of his own. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [17] The book says, "The Great Learning uses the phrase "the heart is full of joy, anger, sorrow, and fear" to mean that it is "not right", and Cheng Zi also says that "the saint's feelings are in harmony with all things and have no emotions. "
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔17〕 Lai Shu says: ""The Great Learning" regards "the heart has joy, anger, sorrow, and fear" as "unable to be right", and Cheng Zi also said that "the sage is in harmony with everything but ruthless." "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [17] The letter says: In the 'Great Learning,' having joy, anger, sorrow, and fear in the heart is considered improper, and Chengzi also said that sages conform to all things and have no personal emotions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："《大学》曰：'喜怒忧惧之心，皆不正也。正浩大师也说：'圣人之情，与万物同，而无所感。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 来信曰：“大学者，心有喜、怒、忧、恐，则不正。程灏先生也说：“圣人的感情与万物一致，而他却没有自己的感情。” '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中写道：“根据《大学》的说法，当心灵受到爱慕、愤怒、忧虑和恐惧的影响时，它就不会是正确的。程颢大师也说过，‘圣人的情感与万物相一致而他自己却没有任何感情。’

text.ori_cn: 圣人致知之功，至诚无息；其良知之体，皦如明镜，略无纤翳，妍媸之来，随物见形，而明镜曾无留染：所谓“情顺万事而无情”也。
text.man_en: The sage's effort at extending knowledge is characterized by his absolute sincerity which never ceases. The substance of his innate knowledge is as clear as a bright mirror without any slight obscuration. Whether a beautiful or an ugly object appears, it reflects it as it comes, without anything being left behind on the bright mirror itself. This is what is meant by saying that the feelings of the sage are in accord with all things and yet of himself he has no feelings.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saint's work of knowledge is sincere; the body of his conscience is sparkling like a mirror, slightly without any cataracts, and the ugly woman comes to see the shape of things as they are, but the mirror has never been tainted: the so-called "love goes with all things and has no feelings".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sage's contribution to knowledge is sincere and everlasting; the body of his conscience is as clear as a bright mirror, with no shadow at all. When beauty comes, it can be seen with objects, but the bright mirror once had no stain: the so-called "emotions follow everything but are ruthless".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sage’s effort to attain knowledge is marked by utmost sincerity and unceasing perseverance; his intrinsic wisdom is clear as a bright mirror, utterly free from the slightest speck. Whatever comes before it, beauty or ugliness, is reflected as it is, without the mirror ever retaining a trace: this is what is meant by 'steering emotions to all matters without being swayed by them.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人努力扩展知识的特点是，他绝对真诚，永不停息。他与生俱来的知识的实质就像一面明亮的镜子一样清晰，没有丝毫模糊。无论是美丽的还是丑陋的事物，它都能如实反映出来，而不会在明镜上留下任何痕迹。这就是 "圣人之情，与万物同，而无情也 "的意思。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人的广博之学，其特点是其至诚至诚，永不止息。其先天知识的实质，如明镜般清晰，没有丝毫的障蔽。无论是美丽的还是丑陋的物体出现，它都会在它出现时反射它，而不会在明亮的镜子本身上留下任何东西。这就是说圣人的情感与万物相一致而自己却没有情感。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人扩展知识的努力特点是他的绝对真诚，永不间断。他的天赋智慧就像一面明镜，毫无丝毫遮蔽。无论是美的还是丑的事物出现，它都能如实反映，而明镜本身没有留下任何痕迹。这就是说，圣人的情感与万物相谐，而他自己却无情感。

text.ori_cn: “无所所住而生其心”佛氏曾有是言，未为非也；明镜之应物，妍者妍，媸者媸，一照而皆真，即是生其心处：妍者妍，媸者媸，一过而不留，即是无所住处。
text.man_en: The Buddhists have a saying, “One should have no attachment to anything and thus let the mind grow. ” This is not incorrect. In the bright mirror's response to things, what is beautiful appears beautiful and what is ugly appears ugly. In the same reflection all things are reflected and are true. This is like the mind growing. ＃6 What is beautiful appears beautiful and what is ugly appears ugly. ＃7 The things pass along without remaining in the mirror. ＃8 This is where the mirror has no attachment.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "The Buddha has said that there is nothing to live in, and it is not wrong; the mirror is a mirror that responds to things, and the ugly woman is ugly, and the ugly woman is ugly, and the ugly woman is ugly, and the ugly woman is ugly, and the ugly woman is ugly, and the ugly woman is ugly, and the ugly woman is ugly, and the ugly woman passes by and does not remain, and that is where there is nothing to live in.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "There is no place to live, but the heart is born." Buddha once said this, and it is not wrong; the objects reflected in the bright mirror, the beautiful ones are beautiful, the beautiful ones are beautiful, if they are all true when they are illuminated, it is the place where the heart is born: the beautiful ones are Yan, a girl means a girl, if she passes by without staying, she has no place to live.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Buddha once said, 'Let the mind reside nowhere and allow it to arise.' This is not unfounded. The clear mirror reflects things as they are: beautiful as beautiful, ugly as ugly; it reflects them truthfully in a single instance. This is where the mind arises: beautiful as beautiful, ugly as ugly, all passing without attachment. This is where the mind resides nowhere.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 佛家有句话说："对任何事物都不应执着，这样才能让心灵成长。"这句话并没有错。在明镜对事物的反应中，美则美矣，丑则丑矣。在同样的反射中，所有事物都被反映出来，都是真实的。这就好比心灵的成长。＃6 美丽的事物呈现出美丽，丑陋的事物呈现出丑陋。＃7 物过而不留镜。＃8 这就是镜中无物。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 佛家有句话：“不执着任何事物，从而让心成长。 ” 这句话并没有错。明镜照物，美者显美，丑者显丑。在同一个反射中，所有事物都得到反映并且都是真实的。这就像心灵的成长。 ＃6 美丽的事物显得美丽，丑陋的事物显得丑陋。 ＃7 事物流逝，不留镜中。 ＃8 这是镜子没有附件的地方。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 佛教徒有句话说：“当无所执着而使心灵成长。”这句话是不错误的。明镜对事物的反应，美的显现美，丑的显现丑。在同一反映中，万物都反映并真实。这就像心灵的成长。＃6 美的显现美，丑的显现丑。＃7 事物经过，不留在镜中。＃8 这里镜子无所执着。

text.ori_cn: 大抵原静所疑，前后虽若不一，然皆起于自私自利、将迎意必之为崇：此根一去，则前后所疑，自将冰消雾释，有不待于问辨者矣。
text.man_en: Generally speaking, though the thing about which you are in doubt in this case seems to be different from those earlier cases, they are all caused by the evil influence of selfishness, leaning forward or backward, arbitrariness of opinion, and dogmatism. As soon as this root is removed, all present and earlier doubts will of themselves disappear like ice melting and fog disappearing and there will be no need of asking about them or arguing them out.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For the most part, the original quiet doubt, before and after, although if not the same, but all start from selfishness, will meet the intention to be Chong: this root of a go, then before and after the doubt, since the ice will be eliminated fog release, there is no need to ask the discernment of the carries on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Most of Yuan Jing's doubts, although the front and back are not the same, are all caused by selfishness, and will be respected. Once this root is removed, the doubts about the front and back will be cleared away, and there is no need to ask and distinguish. That’s it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Roughly speaking, Jing's suspicions, though seemingly inconsistent over time, all stemmed from self-interest and the desire to cater to superiors: once this root cause is eliminated, the doubts from both the past and the present will naturally dissipate like melting ice or clearing fog, without the need for further questioning.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一般来说，虽然你现在所怀疑的事情似乎与之前的那些情况不同，但它们都是由自私、向前或向后看、武断和教条主义的邪恶影响造成的。只要拔掉这个病根，现在和以前的所有疑虑都会像冰雪消融、雾气消散一样自行消失，也就没有必要再去追问或争论了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 总的来看，本案中你所怀疑的事情虽然与以往的案件有所不同，但都是由于自私、唯我独尊、独断专行、教条主义的邪恶影响造成的。此根一除，一切现在及先前的疑虑，便如冰融雾消，自然消散，不必再问，也不必争辩。

text.man_en: So outside of innate knowledge there is no other knowledge. text.man_en: (2) Your letter says, “Sir, you said, ‘The saying in the “Appended Remarks” of the Book of Changes, “What is there to think about or to deliberate about ?” means that what is to be thought about or deliberated about is only the Principle of Nature and that outside of it there should be no other thought or deliberation. It does not mean having no thought or deliberation at all. . . .
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [2] The book of the coming book says, "The teacher says, "'The system'" means "what thoughts and concerns", which means that the thoughts and concerns are only the Divine Principle, and there are no other thoughts and concerns, and it does not mean that there are no thoughts and concerns. I am not saying that I have no thoughts or worries.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔2〕 Lai Shu says: "The master said: "'Xi'" means "what to think about, what to worry about", which means that what you think and worry about is just the law of heaven, and there is no other way to think about it. It does not mean that there is no thought or worry.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [2] The letter states: 'Master said: To tie oneself to 'thinking' and 'considering' means that what is thought and considered are merely principles of nature, and there are no other thoughts or considerations. It does not mean there is no thinking or considering at all.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (2) 你在信中说："先生，你说：'《易经》'附注'中说：'何思何虑'，意思是说，所思所虑的只是自然之理，在自然之理之外，不应有其他的思虑。这并不是说完全不需要思考或斟酌。. . .
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （二）你来信说：“先生，您说‘《易经附注》中的一句话：‘有什么可思虑的？’”意思是说，所思虑的只是自然法则，在自然法则之外，不应有其他的思考或思虑。这并不意味着完全没有思考或深思熟虑。 。 。 。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信上说：“先生，您曾经说过《易经·系辞》中的‘夫何思何虑’意思是所思虑的只能是天道之外不应该有其他的思虑。不是说根本不应该有思虑。...'

text.ori_cn: 学者用功，虽千思万虑，只是要复他本体，不走以私意去安排思索出来：若安排思索，便是自私用智矣。”
text.man_en: Although in his task a student may engage in a thousand thoughts and ten thousand deliberations, they should be directed at nothing but restoring its original substance [and function]. This is not to be brought about by pondering or manipulation according to one's personal wishes. . . . If one ponders and manipulates according to his personal wishes, that is “the exercise of cunning and selfishness. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Scholars use, although a thousand thoughts, just to restore his essence, do not go to the private will to arrange thinking out: if the arrangement of thinking, is selfish use of wisdom."

If one arranges and thinks with personal intent, that is selfishly using one's intellect.

text.ori_cn: 良知是天理之昭明灵觉处。
text.man_en: Innate knowledge is where the Principle of Nature is clear and intelligent.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conscience is the clear and spiritual place of the Divine Principle.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Conscience is the seat of enlightenment of heavenly principles.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Conscience is the luminous and intuitive manifestation of heavenly principles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识是自然原理的清晰和智慧所在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先天知识是自然法则清晰而聪明的地方。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 先天之知，就是天理分明透彻之处。

text.ori_cn: 故良知即是天理，思是良知之发用。
text.man_en: Therefore innate knowledge is identical with the Principle of Nature. Thinking is the emanation and functioning of innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, conscience is the Divine Principle, and thought is the emanation of conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, conscience is the principle of heaven, and thinking is the function of conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, innate knowledge is the principle of Heaven, and thought is the manifestation of this innate knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，先天知识与自然原理是一致的。思维是先天知识的发散和运作。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此先天知识与自然原理是一致的。思维是先天知识的散发和发挥作用。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，天赋的知识与自然的原理是相同的。思维是天赋知识的放射和运作。

text.ori_cn: 若是良知发用之思，则所思莫非天理矣。
text.man_en: If one's thinking is the emanation and functioning of innate knowledge, whatever he thinks about is the Principle of Nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If it is the thought of the conscience that is used, then there is nothing that is not the Divine Principle.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the conscience is used to think, then what we are thinking is not the law of heaven.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the thought is initiated by conscience, then whatever is thought will be nothing but heavenly principles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人的思维是先天知识的发散和运作，那么他所思考的就是自然的原理。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果一个人的思维是先天知识的流露和作用，那么他所想的就是自然法则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人的思维是先天知识的发散和运作，那么他所思考的一切都是自然之理。

text.ori_cn: 良知发用之思，自然明白简易，良知亦自能知得。
text.man_en: Thoughts resulting from the emanation and functioning of innate knowledge are naturally clear, simple, and easy. The faculty of innate knowledge knows them as such.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The thought that conscience develops and uses is naturally understandable and simple, and conscience is also self-knowledgeable.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The thoughts that the conscience uses are naturally clear and simple, and the conscience can also know it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The function of conscience is naturally clear and simple, and conscience itself can perceive and understand.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识的发散和运作所产生的思维自然是清晰、简单和容易的。先天知识的能力就是这样认识它们的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 由先天知识的流散和作用所产生的思想自然是清晰、简单和容易的。固有知识的能力本身就知道它们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从本能知识的发散和运作中产生的思想本质上是清晰、简单和容易的。本能知识的能力就知道它们是这样的。

text.ori_cn: 若是私意安排之思，自是纷纭劳扰，良知亦自会分别得。
text.man_en: But thoughts issuing from manipulation according to one's personal wishes are naturally troublesome and disturbing, and the innate faculty is naturally able to distinguish them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If one's thoughts are arranged by one's own will, one's conscience will be confused and disturbed, and one's conscience will be divided.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If it is a matter of private arrangement, it will be troublesome and troublesome, and conscience will distinguish it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If there are thoughts arranged out of personal motives, naturally there will be confusion and trouble, and one’s conscience will naturally be able to discern it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，按照个人意愿操纵而产生的想法自然会带来麻烦和困扰，而先天的能力自然能够分辨它们。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但随心所欲地操纵而产生的念头，自然是麻烦、不安的，本根自然能够辨别。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但根据个人意愿操纵而产生的思想自然是麻烦和扰人的，而先天的能力自然能分辨它们。

text.ori_cn: 盖思之是非邪正，良知无有不自知者。
text.man_en: For whether thoughts are right or wrong, correct or perverse, the faculty of innate knowledge itself knows them all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is nothing that the conscience does not know about the right and wrong of thinking.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who think about what is right and wrong and what is right and wrong have no conscience and do not know it themselves.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for discerning right from wrong, there is nothing that innate moral knowledge does not inherently understand.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为无论思想是对是错、是正是邪，先天的知识能力本身都了如指掌。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为无论思想是对还是错误，正确还是错误，固有知识本身都知道它们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 对于思想的是非正误，先天的知识本能自知一切。

text.ori_cn: 所以认贼作子，正为致知之学不明，不知在良知上体认之耳。
text.man_en: People take a thief to be their son precisely because they do not understand the learning of the extension of knowledge and do not know how to realize it genuinely and earnestly by means of innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason why he recognised the thief as his son was that he did not know the science of Zhi Zhi, and did not know how to recognise it in his conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, to recognize a thief as a son is because he does not know how to achieve knowledge and does not know how to recognize it in his conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, recognizing a thief as one's own child stems from the lack of clarity in the pursuit of knowledge and failing to understand it through innate moral knowledge.

text.ori_cn: 若说宁不了事，不可不加培养，却是分为两事也。”
text.man_en: To say that one would rather leave the work undone but the mind must be cultivated and nourished is to regard [things and the mind] as two different things.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you say that you can't do anything, you must cultivate it, but it can be divided into two things. "

text.ori_cn: 窃意觉精力衰弱，不足以终事者，良知也。
text.man_en: In my humble opinion, when one's spirit and energy are weak and not sufficient to complete the work, that is a matter of innate knowledge itself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I think that the person who is not energetic enough to finish his work has a good conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who feel that their energy is weak and are not strong enough to finish the matter are those who have a conscience.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 依我拙见，当一个人的精神和精力薄弱，不足以完成工作时，那是先天知识本身的问题。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在我看来，当一个人的精神和能量薄弱不足以完成工作时，那是一个内在知识的问题。

text.ori_cn: 宁不了事，且加修养，致知也。
text.man_en: Rather, leaving the work undone but cultivating and nourishing the mind are matters of the extension of knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It would be better not to do anything, but to cultivate and learn.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't want to do anything, you should practice more and become more knowledgeable.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Rather than rushing things, it's better to cultivate oneself and seek knowledge.
