text.man_en2gpt_cn: 相反，不完成工作而是修养心性才是知识扩展的事情。

text.ori_cn: 若事变之来，有事势不容不了，而精力虽衰，稍鼓舞亦能支持，则持志以帅气可矣。
text.man_en: When an unexpected event arises and by circumstance something has to be done but my spirit and energy are weak, if I rouse myself somewhat, I am able to hold on. In that case it is all right to ‘hold the will firm and lead the vital force. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the incident comes, there is a situation can not be, and although the energy is declining, a little encouragement can also support, then hold the will to handsome gas can be carried out.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If unexpected events come and things cannot be tolerated, and even though your energy is weak, you can still support it with a little encouragement, then you can keep your ambition and be handsome.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If circumstances arise that cannot be neglected, and although one's energy may wane, a slight encouragement can still sustain one's efforts, then it is possible to uphold one's resolve to lead the spirit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当突发事件发生时，由于情况所迫，有些事情必须去做，但我的精神和体力都很虚弱，如果我稍稍振作起来，就能坚持下去。在这种情况下，'坚守意志，引领活力'是完全正确的。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当遇到突发事件，因情况必须要做一些事情，但我的精神和精力很弱时，如果我稍微振奋一下自己，我就能坚持下去。既然如此，“坚志领元气”就可以了。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当突发事件出现，由于情况必须得做点什么，而我的精神和精力都很弱，如果我稍微振作，我就能坚持住。这样的话，‘守意固气’是没问题的。

text.ori_cn: “宁不了事，不可不加培养之”意，且与初学如此说亦不为无益。
text.man_en: The idea that one should rather leave the work undone than neglect cultivating and nourishing the mind is not without merit when told to the beginner.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "I would rather not be able to do anything than not to cultivate it," he said, and it would not be unhelpful to say so to the beginners.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "It would be better if nothing can be done than to cultivate it", and it is not unhelpful to say this to beginners.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The meaning of 'Rather not complete the task than not nurture the cultivation' is not without benefit for beginners.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 对于初学者来说，"宁可荒废功课，也不能忽视修心养性 "的观点不无道理。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 宁可不做事，也不要忽视对心灵的培养和滋养，这种想法对于初学者来说并不是没有道理的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在对初学者说起时，认为宁可让工作搁置也不要忽视心灵的培养和滋养，这一观点并非没有道理。

text.ori_cn: 若云宁不了事，不可不加培养者，亦是先有功利之心，计较成败利钝而爱憎取舍于其间，是以将了事自作一事，而培养又别作一事，此便有是内、非外之意，便是自私用智，便是“义外”，便有“不得于心，勿求于气”之病，便不是致真知以求自慊之功矣。
text.man_en: If one says that one should rather leave the work undone than neglect to cultivate and nourish the mind, it is first of all to have the idea of success and profit, to weigh matters in terms of success and failure, advantages and disadvantages, to decide to love or hate and to accept or reject. He therefore considers getting the work done as one thing and cultivating and nourishing the mind as quite another. This means he has the desire to consider what is within the mind to be right and what is outside to be wrong. This is selfishness and the exercise of cunning. This is regarding righteousness as external. 6 This is the trouble with “What is not attained in the mind is not to be sought in the vital force [thus separating the mind and the vital force]. ”7 And this is not the effort to extend innate knowledge to satisfy yourself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the cloud would rather not matter, not without training, but also the first utilitarian mind, the success or failure of profit and loss and love, hate and give and take in the middle of it, so that will be a matter of self, and cultivation and a separate matter, this will be within, not outside of the meaning of selfishness, is the use of wisdom, is the "righteousness outside", there is a "can not be in the heart, do not seek to gas" of the disease, it is not the true knowledge to seek self-control work. This is the disease of "not being able to seek in the heart, not seeking in the air", and it is not the work of seeking true knowledge for self-satisfaction.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If Yun Ning can't do something, he must cultivate it. He also has a utilitarian mind first, cares about success and failure, and chooses between love and hate. Therefore, he does one thing to solve the problem, but does another thing to cultivate. This is the inner meaning. , it is not an external meaning, it is selfish use of wisdom, it is "external meaning", and there is a disease of "not seeking from the heart, do not seek from the Qi", which is not the result of achieving true knowledge and seeking self-examination.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If Yun cannot resolve the matter, it is necessary to cultivate him more, as he initially possesses a utilitarian mindset, weighing success and failure, benefits and drawbacks, and making choices based on preferences. This causes resolving the matter to become separate from the act of cultivation, leading to an internal self-seeking wisdom, which is considered 'outside of righteousness'. This results in the flaw of 'not attaining ease of mind, and thus not demanding peace in spirit', and deviates from the effort to attain true knowledge to seek self-satisfaction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果说 "宁可荒废功课，不可忽视修心养性"，首先就是要有成败得失、利害得失的观念，要权衡成败得失、利害得失，要决定是爱是恨，是接受还是拒绝。因此，他认为完成工作是一回事，修身养性又是另一回事。这意味着他有一种欲望，认为内心的东西是对的，而外界的东西是错的。这就是自私和狡诈。这是将正义视为外在。6 这就是 "心之所不达，气之所不求[从而将心与气分开]"的问题所在。"7 这不是为了满足自己而努力扩展先天知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若说宁可闲置，不可怠慢修养，首先要有成利观念，权衡成败利弊，作出决定。爱或恨，接受或拒绝。因此，他认为完成工作是一回事，而修养心灵则是另一回事。这意味着他愿意考虑内心的事情是对的，而外面的事情是错的。这是自私和狡猾的表现。这是把义当作外在的。 6 这就是“在头脑中得不到的东西，就不能在生命力中寻求[从而将头脑和生命力分开]”的麻烦。 ”7这并不是为了扩展先天知识来满足自己的努力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果有人说宁可不做工作也不要忽视修养心性，那么首先就要有成功和利益的观念，要用成功与失败、利弊得失来衡量事情，决定爱与恨、接受与拒绝。因此，他把完成工作视为一件事，而把修养心性视为完全不同的另一件事。这意味着他有心去考虑什么是心内的正确，什么是心外的错误。这是自私和使诡计的表现。这是把义看作外在的麻烦。这就是“心不在內，不求诸气”的问题所在。这不是扩展先天知识来满足自己的努力。

text.ori_cn: 所云“鼓舞支持，毕事则困惫已甚”，又云“迫于事势，困于精力”，皆是把作两事做了，所以有此。
text.man_en: You said that if you rouse yourself you can hold on but that when the work is done you are completely exhausted. You also mentioned being forced by circumstances and being exhausted in spirit and energy. This is the case because you proceed with the idea that [things and the mind] are two different things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The cloud "inspire support, the whole thing is very tired", and the cloud "forced by the situation, trapped in the energy", are to make two things to do, so there is this.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that "encourage and support, but you will be very tired after finishing the work", and "forced by the situation, trapped in energy", both are doing two things, so this is the reason.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The saying 'enthusiasm and support lead to exhaustion upon completion,' as well as 'pressed by circumstances, exhausted by energy,' both refer to the same concept being applied to two tasks, hence the result.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你说，如果你唤醒自己，你就能坚持下去，但当工作完成后，你就会完全精疲力竭。你还提到了被环境所迫，精神和精力疲惫不堪。之所以会出现这种情况，是因为你的出发点是[事物和心灵]是两回事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你说，如果你振作起来，你就能坚持下去，但当工作完成后，你就彻底精疲力尽了。您还提到了环境所迫，精神和精力的疲惫。情况如此，因为你继续认为[事物和思想]是两个不同的事物。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你说如果振作起来你能坚持下去，但当工作完成后你就完全筋疲力尽了。你还提到了被迫于环境，并且精神和精力都疲惫不堪。这是因为你持有的观念是[事物和心]是两回事。

text.ori_cn: 凡学问之功，一则诚，二则伪。
text.man_en: All achievements in learning are firstly sincere and secondly false.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Where the work of learning is concerned, the first is sincerity and the second is falsehood.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All achievements in learning are firstly sincere and secondly false.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The efficacy of learning lies in two aspects: one is sincerity, and the other is deceit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 凡学之成，一曰诚，二曰伪。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一切学成，第一是真诚，第二是虚假。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所有的学习成就，首先是真诚，其次是虚假。

text.ori_cn: 凡此皆是致真知之意，欠诚一真切之故。
text.man_en: All the above is due to the fact that in wanting to extend innate knowledge one lacks the true and earnest effort toward sincerity and singlemindedness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: All this is the intention of true knowledge, the reason for the lack of sincerity and truthfulness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All of these are intended to lead to true knowledge, but they are not sincere and true.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All of these are intentions of attaining true knowledge, lacking solely due to an absence of genuine sincerity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所有这些都是由于人们在想要扩展先天知识时，缺乏对真诚和一心一意的真正而认真的努力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这都是因为想要扩展先天知识而缺乏真诚、专一的真正认真的努力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 以上所有这些都归因于当人们想要扩展本能知识时，缺乏真正诚恳和专注的努力。

text.ori_cn: 《大学》言“诚其意者，如恶恶臭，如好好色，此之谓自慊。”
text.man_en: Therefore the Great Learning says, “Making the will sincere [is allowing no selfdeception] as when we hate a bad odor or love a beautiful color. This is called satisfying oneself. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The University says, "Those who are sincere in their intentions are as dissatisfied with themselves as with a bad smell or a good colour."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "The Great Learning" says, "Those who are sincere are like those who hate bad odors and like those who are lustful. This is called self-inflicted."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Great Learning states: 'To make one's intentions sincere is like loathing a foul odor or loving beautiful colors; this is called being satisfied in oneself.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，《大学》说："使志诚[就是不允许自我欺骗]，就像我们讨厌难闻的气味或喜欢美丽的颜色一样。这就是所谓的满足自己。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故大学曰：“志诚如恶臭，好色好。这就是所谓的满足自己。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以《大学》说，“诚其意者，如恶恶臭，如好好色。此谓自慊。”

text.ori_cn: 此可以知其受病之所从来矣。
text.man_en: From this you can know where the trouble comes from.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This can be known as the origin of the disease.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: From this we can know the origin of his illness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From this, one can ascertain the origin of their ailment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 由此你就能知道问题出在哪里。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 由此可知烦恼从何而来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由此你可以知道麻烦从哪里来。

text.ori_cn: 〔4〕来书又有云：“人情机诈百出，御之以不疑，往往为所欺，觉则自入于逆、臆。
text.man_en: (4) Your letter also says, “In human affairs tricks and deceits manifest themselves in a hundred ways. If one handles them without suspicion, one often gets cheated, but if one knows [the intentions behind them] one puts himself in the position of anticipating deceit and predicting being distrusted.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [4] The book also has a cloud: "Humanity is deceitful, Royal with no doubt, often for the deception, awareness of the self-introduction in the reverse, guess.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [4] There is another saying in the letter: "Human emotions are full of deceptions. If you don't doubt them, you will often be deceived. If you realize it, you will fall into the wrong and make assumptions.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [4] The letter also states: 'Human nature is full of cunning and deception. If you deal with it without suspicion, you are often deceived. Once you become aware, you yourself fall into opposition and conjecture.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (4) 你在信中还说："在人际交往中，诡计和欺骗会以各种方式表现出来。如果不加怀疑地处理它们，往往会上当受骗，但如果知道[它们背后的意图]，就会把自己置于预测欺骗和预测被不信任的境地。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (4) 你的信还说：“人间的诡计和欺骗有一百种。如果不加怀疑地处理它们，人们常常会被骗，但如果知道[其背后的意图]，就会把自己置于一种预期被欺骗和预测不被信任的境地。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 您的信中还说：“在人类事务中，诡计和欺骗以百种方式表现出来。如果在毫无怀疑之下处理这些事情，往往会被骗，但如果了解这些背后的意图，就会把自己置于预见欺骗和预测被怀疑的位置上。”

text.ori_cn: 夫逆诈，即诈也，臆不信，即非信也，为人欺，又非觉也：不逆，不臆而常先觉，其惟良知莹彻乎。
text.man_en: To anticipate deceit is itself deceit, and to predict being distrusted is itself distrust. At the same time to be cheated is not to know. Only with the crystal clarity of innate knowledge can one desist from anticipating deceit and predicting being distrusted but always know them readily.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the reverse fraud, that is, fraud, guess not believe, that is, non-belief, for people to deceive, but also non-awareness: not reverse, not guess and often first awareness, it is only conscience Ying Chew.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you are rebellious and deceitful, you are deceitful. If you assume that you don't believe it, you are not trusting.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To counter deceit with deceit is still deceit; to question in disbelief is not trust; to be deceived by others is not clarity. Not countering, not doubting, but always being perceptive—could this be what genuine wisdom, crystal-clear and profound, truly is?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 预测欺骗本身就是欺骗，预测被不信任本身就是不信任。同时，被骗也是不知道。只有拥有与生俱来的清澈见底的知识，人们才能不预知欺骗和预知不被信任，而始终对它们了如指掌。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 预见到欺骗本身就是欺骗，预见到不被信任本身就是不信任。同时被骗也不知道。只有拥有水晶般清晰的先天知识，人们才能停止预见欺骗和预测不被信任，但总是很容易知道它们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 预料到欺骗本身就是欺骗，预见到被怀疑本身就是怀疑。同时，被欺骗是因为不知。只有凭借天生的晶莹剔透的智慧，才能停止预料欺骗和预见被怀疑，但始终能轻易识别。

text.ori_cn: 然而出入毫忽之间，背觉合诈者多矣。”
text.man_en: However, one often deviates from the norm, in however small degree, betrays one's own knowledge, and falls into deceit. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, there are a lot of people who go in and out of the room, and who are not aware of the fraud."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, in the blink of an eye, there are many people who betray and commit fraud. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, the difference between genuine and deceitful behavior can be barely noticeable, yet many fall for the fraudulent ones.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然而，人往往会偏离常规，无论偏离的程度有多小，都会背叛自己的知识，陷入欺骗之中。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 然而，一个人常常会偏离规范，无论程度多么小，都会背叛自己的知识，陷入欺骗之中。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，人们常常偏离常轨，无论程度多么微小，背叛自己的知识，陷入欺骗。

text.ori_cn: 不逆、不臆而先觉，此孔子因当时人专以逆诈、臆不信为心，而自陷于诈与不信，又有不逆、不臆者，然不知致良知之功，而往往又为人所欺诈，故有是言：非教人以是存心，而专欲先觉人之诈与不信也。
text.man_en: Not rebelling, not making assumptions, and realizing it beforehand. This is because Confucius at that time was obsessed with cheating and making assumptions, so he fell into deceit and unbelief. There are also people who are not rebelling, not making assumptions, but they don’t know the merit of having a good conscience, and they often behave badly. It is deceitful, so there is this saying: instead of teaching people this intention, they only want to know in advance their deceit and unbelief.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Not against, not guessing and first Jue, this Confucius because the people at that time dedicated to the reverse fraud, guessing not believe for the heart, and self trapped in fraud and unbelief, and not against, not guessing, but do not know to conscientiousness of the work, and often for the people of fraud, so there is a word: not to teach the people to is the heart, and dedicated to the first Jue of the people's fraud and unbelief is also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Not rebelling, not making assumptions, and realizing it beforehand. This is because Confucius at that time was obsessed with cheating and making assumptions, so he fell into deceit and unbelief. There are also people who are not rebelling, not making assumptions, but they don’t know the merits of having a good conscience, and they often behave badly. It is deceitful, so there is this saying: instead of teaching people to have this intention, they only want to know in advance their deceit and unbelief.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Neither going against, nor assuming without evidence, but anticipating — this was Confucius' way in response to the people of his time, who often employed deceit and suspicion, entrapping themselves in dishonesty and mistrust. There were also those who neither opposed nor presumed without evidence, yet lacked the effort to achieve true understanding, and thus were frequently deceived by others. Hence, Confucius spoke these words: not to teach people to harbor such thoughts, but to make them aware of deceit and mistrust in advance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不反叛，不臆断，事先意识到这一点。这是因为当时的孔子迷恋于欺骗和臆断，所以陷入了欺骗和不信。也有的人不造反，不臆断，却不知道良心发现的好处，常常做坏事。是欺人也，故有此言：不教人此意，只欲人先知其欺与不信。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不反抗，不做假设，提前意识到。这是因为当时的孔子沉迷于欺骗和假设，所以陷入了欺骗和不信之中。还有一些人，不叛逆，不妄加揣测，却不知良心的好处，常常表现得不好。它是欺骗性的，所以有这样的说法：与其教人这个意图，而只想预先知道他们的欺骗和不信。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不反叛，不作假设，事先意识到。这是因为那时的孔子痴迷于欺骗和假设，所以他陷入了欺骗和不信任的困境。也有一些人虽然不反叛，不作假设，但他们不知道拥有良知的功德，因此经常行为不端。这是欺骗的，所以有这句话：与其教导人们这种意图，不如让他们事先知道自己的欺骗和不信任。

text.ori_cn: 以是存心，即是后世猜忌险薄者之事：而只此一念，已不可与入尧、舜之道矣。
text.man_en: To harbor such thoughts is the behavior of people of later generations who are suspicious, envious, treacherous, and mean. With this idea of harboring such thoughts alone they will be unable to enter into the Way of the sages, Yao and Shun.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be so minded is the thing of those who are suspicious and dangerous in later times: and this thought alone is no longer compatible with the way of Yao and Shun.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the intention is to be jealous of the dangerous ones in later generations: and this single thought can no longer be compared with the way of Yao and Shun.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To act with such intention is indeed the act of those suspected of treachery in later generations; and with just this single thought, one cannot enter the way of Yao and Shun.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 后世之人，多疑、嫉妒、奸诈、卑鄙，就是怀有这样的想法。单凭这种思想，他们就无法进入圣人尧舜之道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 怀有这样的想法，就是后世之人多疑、嫉妒、奸诈、卑鄙的行为。光有这样的思想，就不能进入尧、舜圣人之道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心怀这种想法是那些多疑、嫉妒、奸诈、卑鄙的后人的行为。仅仅怀有这种想法，他们就无法进入尧舜圣贤之道。

text.ori_cn: 不逆、不臆而为人所欺者，尚亦不先为善：但不如能致其良知，而自然先觉者之尤为贤耳。
text.man_en: He who does not anticipate deceit or predict being distrusted, but is deceived by others, still cannot be said to have failed in doing good, but this is not as worthy as his being able to extend his innate kno wledge and naturally know readily.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who is not rebellious, and who is not deceived by his own ideas, is not yet the first to be good: but he is not as virtuous as he who is able to achieve his own conscience, and who is naturally aware of it first.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are not rebellious, do not make assumptions and are deceived by others, do not do good first: but it is not as good as being able to have a conscience, and those who are naturally enlightened are especially wise.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who neither oppose nor conjecture and thus avoid being deceived by others haven't necessarily first committed to goodness. However, it is far better to cultivate one's innate understanding, so that one naturally becomes preeminent in wisdom without external prompting.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 没有预料到欺骗或预料到不被信任，却被别人欺骗的人，仍然不能说他没有行善，但这不如他能够扩展自己与生俱来的知识并自然而然地知晓来得有价值。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不预诳，预不信，而被人诳惑，尚不能说未行善，但不如能延其先天之知，自然而知。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不预防欺骗或预料不被信任而被他人欺骗的人，仍不能说在行善上失败了，但这不如他能够扩展他的天赋知识，并自然地很快了解那么值得称道。

text.ori_cn: 崇一谓“其惟良知莹彻”者，盖已得其旨矣。
text.man_en: In saying that innate knowledge is crystal clear, you, Ch'ungi, already understand the fundamental point.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chongyi said that "it is only the conscience of the transparent", cover has got its purpose.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who admire the saying "only their conscience is clear and clear" have already achieved their purpose.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chongyi's remark 'Only pure and clear conscience' has indeed grasped the essence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 说到先天知识非常清晰，你，钱吉，已经明白了最根本的一点。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 说先天知识是清清楚楚的，你清吉已经明白了根本的道理。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 说先天的知识是清晰明了的，你，崇義，已经理解了根本要点。

text.ori_cn: 然亦颖悟所及，恐未实际也。
text.man_en: However, you have arrived at this point probably through your intelligence and [your understanding], I am afraid, is not yet concrete.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, it is also within the reach of the intelligent, and I am afraid that it is not practical.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, it is just a matter of imagination, but it may not be practical.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Although understanding might have been attained, I fear it may not be practical.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然而，你们可能是凭借自己的智慧走到这一步的，[你们的理解]恐怕还不够具体。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不过，你大概是通过你的智慧才走到这一步的，恐怕还不够具体。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，你到达这个阶段可能是通过你的智慧，我担心，你的理解还不够深入。

text.ori_cn: 夫谓背觉合诈者，是虽不逆人而或未能自欺也，虽不臆人而或未能果自信也，是或常有先觉之心，而未能常自觉也。
text.man_en: Although what you say about betraying one's own knowledge and falling into deceit is not to anticipate deceit by others, it is, I believe, not free from selfdeception. Although it is not to predict being distrusted by others, it is, I believe, not a firm trust in oneself. It is perhaps a case of always having the mind to seek to know readily but not always being able to know by oneself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The person who says that the back of the consciousness and fraud, is not against the people or failed to self-deception, although not guessing the people or failed to fruitful confidence, or often have the heart of the first consciousness, but failed to always consciously also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that betrayal and deceit are caused by the fact that although one does not go against others, one may not be able to deceive oneself; although one does not make assumptions about others, one may not be able to be self-confident; the person may always have a foreknowledge but cannot always realize it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are deemed as turning their back on awareness and embracing deceit, may not necessarily deceive others but might still fail to deceive themselves; they may not necessarily judge others without reason but might still lack true self-confidence. They might often possess an enlightened mind, yet fail to always remain self-aware.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽然你所说的背叛自己的知识和陷入欺骗，并不是预料到别人会欺骗自己，但我相信，这并没有摆脱自欺欺人。虽然不是预料到会被别人不信任，但我相信，这并不是对自己的坚定信任。这也许是一种总是有心求知，却不一定能够自知的情况。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你所说的出卖自己的知识、陷入欺骗，虽然不是预见别人的欺骗，但我认为，这也不能免于自欺。虽然不是预示着会被别人不信任，但我认为，这并不是对自己的坚定信任。这或许是一个人总是有心去求知，但自己却不一定能知道的情况。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然你所说的背叛自己的知识而陷入欺骗不是去预见他人的欺骗，但我认为，这并不意味着没有自欺。虽然这不是去预见他人不信任自己，但我认为，这并不是对自己有坚定的信任。或许这是因为总是有求知的想法，但却并不总是能够独立求知吧。

text.ori_cn: 常有求先觉之心，即已流于逆、臆而足以自蔽其良知矣，此背觉合诈之所以未免也。
text.man_en: He who always has the mind to seek to know readily has already drifted into anticipating and predicting sufficiently to obscure his innate knowledge. This is why betraying one's own knowledge and falling into deceit cannot be avoided.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason for this unavoidable backwardness and deceit is that the mind that seeks to be first aware of the truth has flowed in the opposite direction, and is sufficient to conceal its conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you always have the heart to seek enlightenment beforehand, you will already go against the grain and make assumptions, which is enough to obscure your conscience. This kind of betrayal and enlightenment is unavoidable.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Frequently having a desire for premature enlightenment actually leads to contrivance and subjective assumptions, thereby obstructing one's innate wisdom. This is why it is inevitable to align with deceit and deviate from true awareness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个总想着随时求知的人，已经陷入了预知和预测的误区，足以掩盖他与生俱来的知识。这就是为什么无法避免背叛自己的知识和陷入欺骗的原因。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 总是有求知之心的人，已经陷入了充分的预期和预测，以致掩盖了他与生俱来的知识。这就是为什么背叛自己的知识和陷入欺骗中是不可避免的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个人如果总是想要寻求更多知识，就很容易预见和预测，从而使他的原有知识蒙上阴影。这就是为什么背叛自己的知识并陷入欺骗是不可避免的。

text.ori_cn: 君子学以为己：未尝虑人之欺己也，恒不自欺其良知而已。
text.man_en: A gentleman learns to think of himself: he does not worry about others deceiving him, he never deceives himself and his conscience.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A gentleman learns to think of himself: he does not think of others deceiving him, but he does not deceive his own conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A gentleman learns to think of himself: he does not worry about others deceiving him, he never deceives himself and his conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman learns for his own sake: he never worries about others deceiving him, but is always true to his conscience.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 君子学会为自己着想：他不担心别人欺骗他，也从不欺骗自己和良心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子学会为自己着想：不担心别人欺骗自己，不欺骗自己和良心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君子学会自省：他不担心别人欺骗他，他从不欺骗自己和良心。

text.ori_cn: 是故不欺则良知无所伪而诚，诚则明矣：自信则良知无所惑而明，明则诚矣。
text.man_en: Therefore, if one does not deceive himself, his innate knowledge will have no falsehood but will be sincere. Given sincerity, there will be enlightenment. If one trusts himself, his innate knowledge will have no doubt and will be intelligent. Being intelligent, it will be sincere.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if you are not deceived, your conscience will be sincere without any falsehood, and sincerity will be clear: if you are confident, your conscience will be clear without any confusion, and sincerity will be clear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you do not deceive, your conscience will be free from hypocrisy and sincerity, and if you are honest, you will be clear; if you are confident, your conscience will be free of confusion and clear, and if you are clear, you will be sincere.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, if one does not deceive, then the innate knowledge remains true and sincere, and sincerity leads to clarity. If one is self-confident, then the innate knowledge remains free from confusion and clear, and clarity leads to sincerity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，如果一个人不自欺，他的先天知识就不会有虚假，而是真诚的。有诚则有悟。人若自信，则先天之知无疑而有智。明则诚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以，如果一个人不自欺，那么他的本识就没有虚伪，而是真诚的。有了真诚，就会有开悟。如果一个人相信自己，他的先天知识就不会怀疑，就会聪明。有了智慧，就会真诚。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，如果一个人不自欺欺人，他的良知便不会有虚假而是真诚的。有了真诚，就会有觉悟。如果一个人相信自己，他的良知便不会有怀疑而是聪明的。聪明的，就是真诚的。

text.ori_cn: 明、诚相生，是故良知常觉，常照：常觉，常照则如明镜之悬，而物之来者自不能遁其妍桤矣。
text.man_en: Thus intelligence and sincerity produce each other. Consequently, innate knowledge always knows and always shines. Always knowing and shining, it is like a suspended brilliant mirror. As things appear before it, none can conceal its beauty or ugliness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ming, sincerity is born, so the conscience is always aware of, often light: often aware of, often light is like a mirror hanging, and things that come from the people can not hide its Yan Ao carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ming and sincerity coexist with each other, so good knowledge is always aware and always shines: always aware, always shining is like a hanging mirror, and what comes to you cannot escape its beauty.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Clarity and sincerity give rise to each other, thus true knowledge is ever-aware and ever-illuminating: being ever-aware and ever-illuminating is like a bright mirror hanging in the air, where everything that comes before it cannot escape its clear and vivid reflection.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，智慧与真诚相辅相成。因此，与生俱来的知识总是知道，总是闪耀。常知常照，就像一面悬浮的明镜。当事物出现在它面前时，没有人能掩盖它的美或丑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，智慧和真诚是相互产生的。因此，与生俱来的知识总是知道并且总是闪耀。常知常照，如悬明镜。当事物呈现在它面前时，没有人能掩盖它的美或丑。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，智力和真诚相互产生。因此，天生的知识总是知道并且总是闪耀。总是知道和闪耀，它就像一面悬挂的明亮镜子。当事物出现在它面前时，没有任何东西能掩盖它的美丑。

text.ori_cn: 不欺而诚，则无所容其欺，荀有欺焉而觉矣：自信而明，则无所容其不信，苟不信焉而觉矣。
text.man_en: Not deceiving but sincere, it leaves no room for any deception. If there is any deception, it is already known. Trusting itself and being intelligent, it leaves no room for any distrust. If there is any distrust, it is already known.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are not deceitful and sincere, then there is no tolerance for deceit, Xun has deceit and is aware of it: confident and clear, then there is no tolerance for unbelief, Gou unbelief and is aware of it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you are sincere without deceiving, you will not tolerate being deceived. If you are confident and clear, you will not tolerate being deceived. If you are confident and clear, you will not tolerate being deceived.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By being honest and sincere, there is no place for deceit to hide, and even if there is any deceit, it will be detected. By being self-confident and clear-sighted, there is no room for distrust, and if there is any distrust, it will be recognized.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不欺而诚，不留余地。如果有任何欺骗，也早已被人知晓。相信自己，充满智慧，就不会留下任何不信任的余地。如果有任何不信任，也早已被人知晓。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不是欺骗而是真诚，没有任何欺骗的余地。如果有任何欺骗，人们已经知道了。相信自己并且很聪明，它没有留下任何不信任的余地。如果有任何不信任，那也是众所周知的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不欺骗而真诚，不留任何欺骗的余地。如果有任何欺骗，早已被察觉。自信且聪明，不留任何不信任的余地。如果有任何不信任，早已被察觉。

text.ori_cn: 是谓易以知险，简以知阻，子思所谓“至诚如神，可以前知”者也，然子思谓“如神”，谓“可以前知”，犹二而言之，是盖推言思诚者之功效，是犹为不能先觉者说也：若就至诚而言，则至诚之妙用，即谓之“神”，不必言“如神”，至诚则“无知而无不知”，不必言“可以前知”矣。
text.man_en: This means that innate knowledge operates easily and knows where danger is, and operates simply and knows what obstructions are. This is what Tzussu meant when he said, “He who has absolute sincerity is like a spirit” and “ [It is characteristic of those with absolute sincerity] to be able to foreknow. ” However, Tzussu said, “like a spirit” and “able to foreknow. ” Thus he was still thinking in terms of two levels. These phrases describe by inference the effect of thinking how to be sincere and are meant for those who are not able to know readily. 6 When we come to those with absolute sincerity, the wonderful operation of absolute sincerity itself is called spirit, not just like a spirit. 7 Those with absolute sincerity have no knowledge and yet know all, and need not be described as being able to foreknow.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is easy to know the danger, simplicity to know the obstacles, Zi Si called "sincerity is like God, can be known before" also, but Zi Si said "like God", said "can be known before", as if the two say, it is cover Push to say the efficacy of the sincerity of the person, is just like for those who can not be aware of the first said: if the sincerity of the sincerity, the sincerity of the wonderful, that is, "God", do not have to say "as God", the sincerity of the "no knowledge and no ignorance The most sincere is "no knowledge and no ignorance", do not have to say "can be known before" carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that it is easy to know the dangers, and it is easy to know the obstacles. Zisi also said that "the sincerity is like a god and can be known in advance." To speculate on the efficacy of those who think sincerely is to say it for those who are not aware of it: if we talk about sincerity, then the wonderful function of sincerity is to call it "god". There is no need to say "like god", sincerity means "ignorance and omniscience" ”, there is no need to say “it can be known in advance”.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is said that by understanding the easy, one can know danger; by understanding the simple, one can know obstacles. This is what Zisi meant by 'supreme sincerity is like a deity, and one can foresee the future with it.' However, when Zisi said 'like a deity' and 'can foresee,' he was still speaking of these as two separate things. This was to illustrate the effects of sincerity through reasoning. It is a way to explain it to those who have not yet achieved this level of awareness. If we speak of supreme sincerity itself, its magical function can directly be called 'divine.' There is no need to say 'like a deity.' With supreme sincerity, 'one knows without knowledge and knows everything without learning.' There is no need to say 'can foresee the future.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 意思是说，先天的知识运用自如，知道危险在哪里；运用简单，知道障碍在哪里。这就是子素所说的 "至诚者，精神也 "和 "先知先觉，诚之者也"。然而，子苏说的是 "如灵 "和 "能知"。"因此，他仍然是从两个层面来思考问题的。这些短语通过推论描述了思考如何做到真诚的效果，是为那些不能轻易知晓的人准备的。6 说到 "至诚"，"至诚 "的妙用本身就叫做 "精神"，而不是 "精神"。7 绝对真诚的人没有知识，但却知道一切，不必说他们能够预知。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是说，先天知识操作容易，知道危险在哪里；操作简单，知道障碍是什么。这就是祖苏所说的“至诚者如神”、“能预知”的意思。 ” 然而，祖苏说，“像精灵一样”并且“能够预知。” ” 所以他还是从两个层面来思考的。这些短语通过推论描述了思考如何真诚的效果，适合那些不太容易知道的人。 6 至诚者，至诚本身的奇妙作用，称为神，不单单是神。 7 至诚者，无知而无所不知，不须谓能预知。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这意味着先天的知识能够轻松地运作，知道危险在哪里，能够简单地运作，知道障碍是什么。这正是子思所说的“至诚如神”和“ [至诚之人] 能预知”的意思。然而，子思说“如神”和“能预知”，所以他仍在考虑两个层次。这些词语是通过推断描述如何真诚思考的效果，并且是针对那些无法轻松认知的人。到了至诚之人，至诚本身的奇妙运作被称为神，而不仅仅像神。真正的至诚之人没有知识，却无所不知，无需被描述为能够预知。

text.ori_cn: 〔1〕某顿首启：昨承教及《大学》，拨舟匆匆，未能奉答。
text.man_en: (1) I beg respectfully to address you. Yesterday I received your instructive letter regarding the Great Learning, , but since I was in a hurry, as the boat was leaving, I was not able to answer it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [1] A certain person pause to start: yesterday, I undertook to teach and "University", dial boat in a hurry, not able to answer.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔1〕 A certain meal begins: Yesterday I received the teaching and "The Great Learning", but I was in a hurry and could not answer.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Respectfully bowing, I begin: Yesterday I received your guidance and 'The Great Learning.' In my hurried departure by boat, I was unable to properly respond.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (1) 我谨致函于您。昨天，我收到了您关于 "伟大的学习 "的指导性信件，但由于船要开了，我很匆忙，所以没能给您回信。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (1) 我谨向您致意。昨天，我收到了您关于大学的教诲，但由于船要开，我很着急，所以没能回信。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 恭敬地请向您致辞。昨日收到您关于《大学》的教诲信，但由于船要开了，我匆忙之中未能回复。

text.ori_cn: 晓来江行稍暇，复取手教而读之。
text.man_en: This morning, as the boat proceeds along the Yangtze River, I am somewhat at leisure and so took your letter to read again.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Xiao lai river line a little bit of time, again take the hand teach and read.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: At dawn, I had some free time while traveling to Jiang, so I picked up the manual and read it again.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At dawn, while traveling by the river, I had a brief moment of leisure and took out the letter to read again.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 今天上午，船在长江上行驶，我有点闲，就把你的信拿出来读了一遍。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 今天早上，船沿着长江行进，我有些闲心，所以把你的信又看了一遍。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 今天早上，随着船沿长江前行，我有些闲暇，于是又拿出你的信来读了一遍。

text.ori_cn: 恐至赣后人事复纷沓，先具其略以请。
text.man_en: Fearing that after arriving at Kanchou I shall be kept occupied with business, I shall now write briefly to you.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am afraid that the personnel will be in a flurry after arriving in Gan, so I will first give a brief description of the situation.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I'm afraid that things will get messy again after Jiangxi, so I'll give you some advice first.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Upon arriving in Ganzhou, it is feared that matters will become even more intricate. Therefore, I am presenting a general outline in advance for your consideration.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我担心抵达关中后会忙于公务，现在就给您写一封简短的信。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 恐到了关州后又忙于公事，现简短写信给您。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 担心到达赣州后会忙于公务，我现在简要地给你写信。

text.ori_cn: 来教云；“见道固难，而体道尤难。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “To see the Way is of course difficult, but personally to demonstrate it is even more so.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The coming teaching is; it is difficult to see the Way, but it is especially difficult to realise the Way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Lai Jiao said: "Seeing the Tao is difficult, but understanding the Tao is even more difficult.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Master Yun said, 'It is indeed difficult to see the Way, but it is even more challenging to embody it.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："见道固然难，亲身示范更难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 来信曰：见道固然难，亲证道更难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说，“见到道当然困难，但亲自证明它就更难了。”

text.ori_cn: 道诚未易明，而学诚不可不讲：恐未可安于所见而遂以为极则也。”
text.man_en: Truly the Way is not easy to apprehend, but surely its study should not be neglected. I am afraid you should not be satisfied with your own view and without any hesitation regard it as the ultimate principle. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The way is not easy to understand, but the learning is not to be avoided: I am afraid that I may not rest on what I see and then think that it is the ultimate rule."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sincerity of the Tao is not easy to understand, but it is necessary to learn sincerity: for fear that you may not be satisfied with what you see and think it is the most extreme principle. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Way is not easily understood, but the pursuit of sincerity in learning is indispensable: one should be wary of resting content with what one has seen and assuming it to be the ultimate understanding.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诚然，"道 "并不容易理解，但对 "道 "的研究却不容忽视。恐怕你不应该满足于自己的观点，而毫不犹豫地将其视为终极原则。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 道固然不易领悟，但其研究却不可忽视。恐怕你不应该满足于自己的看法，而毫不犹豫地把它当作最终的原则。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 真正的道理难以领悟，但其研究绝不可忽视。我担心你不应满意于自己的见解，并毫不迟疑地将其视为终极原则。

text.ori_cn: 正思就天下之道以讲明之耳。
text.man_en: I merely wanted to make it clear to those in the world who are in accord with the Way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am trying to explain the way of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I am thinking about the way of the world so as to explain it to my ears.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zheng Si is solely focused on elucidating the Way of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我只是想让世界上那些符合 "道 "的人明白这一点。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我只是想向世间符合道的人说清楚而已。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我只是想向那些世上与道相符的人表明这一点。

text.ori_cn: 夫“德之不修，学之不讲”，孔子以为忧。
text.man_en: Confucius regarded as causes for concern not cultivating virtue and not discussing thoroughly what is learned.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Confucius was concerned about the "lack of cultivation of virtue and the lack of learning".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Confucius felt worried that "virtue is not cultivated and learning is not taught."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The neglect of virtue and the disregard for learning, these were concerns of Confucius.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孔子认为，不修德行和学而不思则罔是令人忧虑的原因。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孔子认为不修德、不深论是忧虑的原因。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孔子认为，不修德和不详谈学到的东西是值得担忧的原因。

text.ori_cn: 夫道必体而后见，非已见道而后加体道之功也：道必学而后明，非外讲学而复有所谓明道之事也。
text.man_en: To say that the Way must be personally demonstrated before it can be revealed does not mean that one first sees it and then proceeds to apply the effort of personal demonstration, and to say that the Way must be learned before it can be understood does not mean that outside of pursuing learning there is another undertaking called understanding the Way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Tao must be seen after the body, not after seeing the Tao but after adding the work of the body of the Tao: the Tao must be learnt after the Ming, not after the external lectures but after the so-called Ming Tao.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Tao must be understood and then seen. It does not mean that one has already seen the Tao and then adds the power of understanding the Tao. The Tao must be learned and then understood. There is no such thing as explaining the Tao by external lectures.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Way must be embodied before it can be seen; it is not that the Way is seen before one applies oneself to embodying it. The Way must be studied before it can be understood; it is not that there is some external study that leads to the so-called understanding of the Way.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 说 "道 "必先 "亲证 "而后 "明道"，并不是说先看到 "道"，然后再去 "亲证"；说 "道 "必先 "学道 "而后 "明道"，也不是说在 "学道 "之外，还有一项叫做 "明道 "的事业。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所谓道必须亲证才能显明，并不是说先见而后用心去亲证，说道必须先学才可以明白，也不是说先见而后用心去亲证，也不是说道必须先学才可以明白。学问之外，还有一事，名为悟道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 说要亲身实践才可以揭示大道，并不是说人们先看到它，然后才去进行亲身实践。同样，说要先学习才可以理解大道，也并不是说除了追求学习外，还有另一项名为理解大道的任务。

text.ori_cn: 然世之讲学者有二，有讲之以身心者，有讲之以口耳者。
text.man_en: There are two ways to pursue learning. Some pursue it with their bodies and minds and some with their mouths and ears.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, there are two kinds of scholars in the world: those who talk about the body and mind, and those who talk about the mouth and ears.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, there are two types of lecturers in the world: those who teach with the body and mind, and those who teach with the mouth and ears.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There are two types of scholars in the world: those who teach with their minds and hearts, and those who teach with their mouths and ears.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 学习有两种方式。有些人用身体和头脑去学习，有些人用嘴巴和耳朵去学习。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 追求学习有两种方式。有的人用身体和思想去追求，有的人用嘴和耳朵去追求。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 求学有两种方法。有些人用身体和心灵去追求，有些人用嘴巴和耳朵去追求。

text.ori_cn: 讲之以口耳，揣摸测度，求之影响者也：讲之以身心，行著习察，实有诸己者也。
text.man_en: Those who pursue it with their mouths and ears grope and imagine; they seek after what is apparent. Those who pursue it with their bodies and minds act with understanding and do so habitually with examination; they sincerely and concretely realize the Way in themselves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The one who speaks with the mouth and the ears, speculates and measures, and seeks influence: the one who speaks with the body and the mind, acts and learns and observes, and actually has his own self.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who talk about it with their mouth and ears, speculate and measure it, and seek its influence; those who talk about it with their body and mind, practice and observe, and actually have all their own.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Teaching through words and ears relies on speculation and influence; teaching through body and mind involves practices and observations, embodying the principles within oneself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 用口和耳去追求的人，只是摸索和想象，他们追求的是表象。而用身心去追求的人，则是在理解的基础上行动，并习惯性地进行审视；他们真诚而具体地在自己身上实现了 "道"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 用嘴、用耳朵追求的人摸索、想象；他们追求显而易见的东西。那些用身心追求它的人，会带着理解而行动，并习惯性地通过审视来行动；他们真诚而具体地认识自己的道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 以口耳追求的人摸索和想象；他们追求的是表面的东西。用身体和心灵追求的人则是理性行动，经常反省；他们在自己内心中真诚地、具体地实现了道。

text.ori_cn: 知此，则知孔门之学矣。
text.man_en: He who knows this [the difference of these ways] knows the learning of the Confucian school.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you know this, then you know the study of Confucius.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you know this, you will know the teachings of Confucius.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Knowing this, you will understand the learning of Confucius' disciples.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知此（道之不同）者，知儒家之学也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知此者，则知儒家之学。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知此者，知儒家之学。

text.ori_cn: 〔2〕来教谓某“《大学》古本之复，以人之为学但当求之于内，而程、朱‘格物’之说不免求之于外，遂去朱子之分章，而削其所补之传。”
text.man_en: (2) Your letter says that I revived the old text of the Great Learning because I believe that in the task of learning people should seek learning only from within, whereas according to the doctrine of the investigation of things of Ch'eng I and Chu Hsi, they should seek it in external things, and that I therefore omitted Master Chu's division into chapters and deleted his commentary which was intended to supplement the text.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [2] to teach that a "University" of the ancient text of the restoration, to the people of the study but when the search for the internal, and Cheng, Zhu 'material' that is not exempt from the search for the external, so go to Zhu Zi sub-chapter, and cut its complementary biography."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔2〕 Lai Jiao said that a certain "repair of the ancient version of "The Great Learning" should be based on people's learning but should seek it from within. However, Cheng and Zhu's theory of "investigating things" cannot help but seek it from the outside, so Zhu Zi's chapter division was removed, and Cut off what it makes up for."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [2] Lai Jiao believes in the restoration of the ancient text of the 'University' book, advocating that learning should be sought internally, while Cheng and Zhu's theory of 'gewu' (investigation of things) inevitably seeks from the external. Thus, he removed Zhu Xi's division of chapters and eliminated the annotations he added.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (2) 您在信中说，我恢复了《大学》的旧文本，因为我认为，在学习任务中，人们只应该从内部寻求学问，而根据钱锺书和朱熹的格物致知学说，他们应该从外部事物中寻求学问，因此我省略了朱子的章节划分，并删除了他的注释，而他的注释本是为了补充文本。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (2) 来信说我重《大学》旧文，是因为我认为人之为学，应当向内求学，而按照程楚的格物之说，熙，当求于外物，所以我省略了朱子的分章，并删除了他的注释，这是为了补充文本。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说我复兴了《大学》的古本，是因为我认为在学习的任务中，人们应该只从内在寻求学习，而根据程颐和朱熹的格物致知学说，他们应该在外在事物中寻求学习，因此我省略了朱子的章节划分并删去了他为了补充文本所作的注释。

text.ori_cn: 非敢然也。
text.man_en: I dare not do so.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It's not a dare.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Not so daring.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It's not that I dare to do so.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我不敢这么做。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我不敢这样做。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我不敢这样做。

text.ori_cn: 《大学》古本乃孔门相传旧本耳。
text.man_en: The old text of the Great Learning is the original text transmitted from generation to generation in the Confucian school.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The ancient book of the University is the old book passed down from Confucius to Confucius.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The ancient version of "The Great Learning" is an old version passed down by Confucius.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "The Great Learning" is an ancient text that was handed down through the teachings of Confucius' disciples.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 古文《大学》是儒家学派代代相传的原文。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《大学旧文》是儒家世代相传的原始文本。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《大学》古文是儒家学派代代相传的原文。

text.ori_cn: 朱子疑其有所脱误而改正补缉之，在某则谓其本无脱误，悉从其旧而已矣。
text.man_en: Master Chu, suspecting that parts have been lost and errors have crept in, corrected and mended it. To me, there has been neither loss nor error. I follow the old text entirely, as it originally was, that is all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Zhu Zi suspected that some of its errors and corrections to make up for the seizure, in a certain it is said to have no errors, all from its old just carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Zhu Zi suspected that there was an error and corrected it, but at one point he said that there was no error at all, and he just followed the old one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zhuzi suspected that there were omissions and errors, so he corrected and supplemented them. In some cases, however, it was said that there were originally no omissions or errors, so he simply followed the old version.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 朱师疑有遗失，又疑有误，乃改补之。对我来说，既没有遗失，也没有错误。我完全按照旧文本的原样，仅此而已。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 楚师傅怀疑有零件丢失、有误，便予以纠正和修补。对我来说，既没有损失，也没有错误。我完全遵循旧文本，因为它原来是这样，仅此而已。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 朱先生怀疑其中有遗漏和错误，因此进行了修订和补正。而对我来说，既没有遗漏，也没有错误。我完全遵照原文，只是这样而已。

text.ori_cn: 失在于过信孔子则有之，非故去朱子之分章而削其传也。
text.man_en: It is possible that I am wrong in believing too much in Confucius, but I did not purposely omit Master Chu's chapter divisions or delete his commentary.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Lost in the over-confidence of Confucius is there, not so go to the sub-chapter and cut its biography also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The fault lies in over-confidence in Confucius, not in cutting off Zhu Zi's chapters and cutting off his biography.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The mistake lies in overly trusting Confucius, not in consciously discarding Zhu Xi's division of chapters and abolishing his explanations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 可能我过于相信孔子是错误的，但我并没有刻意省略朱子的分章或删除他的注释。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 也许我过于相信孔子是错误的，但我并没有故意省略楚夫子的章节划分或删除他的注释。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我可能过于相信孔子而犯了错，但我并没有故意省略朱熹的章法或删除他的注释。

text.ori_cn: 惟其工夫之详密，而要之只是一事，此所以为“精一”之学，此正不可不思者也。
text.man_en: [All these steps are necessary] so the task will be thorough and careful. Essentially speaking, they are all one and the same. This is what is meant by the learning of refinement and singlemindedness. This should be borne in mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: But the work of the detailed, and to be just one thing, this is why the "essence of a" learning, this is not to think about it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, the work is very detailed and requires only one thing. This is why it is a "fine and one" study, and this is something that must be considered.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is precisely because of the meticulousness of the effort, though it is merely about one matter, that it is called the study of 'precision and singularity'. This is indeed something that must be thoughtfully considered.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: [所有这些步骤都是必要的]，因此任务将是彻底而细致的。从本质上讲，它们都是一脉相承的。这就是 "精进 "和 "专一 "之学的含义。这一点应牢记在心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: [所有这些步骤都是必要的]所以任务将是彻底和仔细的。从本质上讲，它们都是同一的。这就是所谓精学、专一之学。应该牢记这一点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 【所有这些步骤都是必要的】以确保任务彻底且谨慎。从本质上讲，它们都是一样的。这就是所谓的精细学习和专注。这应该牢记于心。

text.ori_cn: 夫理无内外，性无内外，故学无内外。
text.man_en: Since there is no distinction between the internal and the external in principle and there is no such distinction in human nature, therefore there is no such distinction in learning.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no inside or outside of reason, there is no inside or outside of nature, so there is no inside or outside of learning.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no inside or outside for logic, and there is no inside or outside for nature, so there is no inside or outside for learning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Principles have no distinction between inner and outer, nature has no distinction between inner and outer, thus learning has no distinction between inner and outer.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既然原则上没有内外之分，人性中也没有这种区别，那么学习中也就没有这种区别。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 既然原则上没有内外之分，人性也没有内外之分，所以学问上也没有内外之分。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 既然原则上内外没有区别，人性上也没有这种区别，所以在学习上也没有这种区别。

text.ori_cn: 讲习、讨论，未尝非内也；反观、内省，未尝遗外也。
text.man_en: Explanation, study, and discussion are also internal, and introspection and selfexamination do not neglect the external.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Lecture and discussion are not internal; reflection and introspection are not external.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Lectures and discussions are always internal; reflection and introspection are always external.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Lectures and discussions, though seemingly external, are not without internal significance; self-reflection and introspection, though seemingly internal, are never divorced from external circumstances.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 解释、研究和讨论也是内在的，反省和自查也不会忽视外在。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 解释、学习、讨论也是内在的，内省、自省也不忽视外在。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 解释、研究和讨论也是内在的，反省和自我检查也不能忽视外在。

text.ori_cn: 夫谓学必资于外求，是以己性为有外也，是“义外”也，用智者也；谓反观、内省为求之于内，是以己性为有内也，是有我也，自私者也：是皆不知性之无内外也。
text.man_en: To say that learning must depend on the external is to regard one's own nature as having an external aspect, to consider righteousness as external, and to exercise cunning. And to say that introspection and selfexamination are seeking learning from within is to regard one's own nature as having an internal aspect, to be egoistic, and to be selfish. In both cases there is evident ignorance of the fact that in the nature there is no distinction between the internal and the external.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To say that learning must be financed from the outside is to regard one's own nature as having an outside, which is "outside of righteousness", and to use one's intellect; to say that looking back and introspecting is to seek the inside is to regard one's own nature as having an inside, and to regard one's own nature as having an inside, which is to have an ego, and to be selfish: all of these are ignorant of the fact that there is no inside or outside of nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that learning must be based on seeking from the outside. This means that one’s own nature means that it has the outside. This means that it means “externally”, and one should use wisdom. It is said that introspection and introspection mean that it is sought from the inside. This means that one’s own nature means that it has the inside. This is There is a self, and there are selfish people: they all don’t know that nature has no inside or outside.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To say that learning must rely on external pursuit implies that one's nature has an exterior, which is to externalize righteousness, characteristic of the wise; to say that introspection and self-examination seek internally implies that one's nature has an interior, which suggests an ego, characteristic of the self-centered: both fail to recognize the nature of having neither internal nor external distinctness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 说学习必须依靠外在，是把自己的本性看成是外在的，把义看成是外在的，是狡猾的。而说反省和自我审视是从内部寻求学习，则是把自己的本性看作是内在的，是利己主义，是自私自利。在这两种情况下，人们显然不知道在本性中并不存在内在和外在的区别。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所谓学习必须依赖外在，就是以本性为外在，以义为外在，以狡猾为外在。而说内省、自省是向内求学，就是把自己的本性看成是内向的，是利己主义的，是自私的。在这两种情况下，人们显然都忽视了这样一个事实：在本质上，内在和外在之间是没有区别的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 说学习必须依赖外部就是认为自己的本性有外在的一面，认为正义是外在的，并施展诡计。而说内省和自我反省是从内部寻求学习就是认为自己的本性有内在的一面，是自我中心和自私的。在这两种情况下，都明显忽视了本性中内外无别的事实。

text.ori_cn: 故曰：“精义入神，以致用也；利用安身，以崇德也”：“性之德也，合内外之道也。”
text.man_en: Therefore it is said, “Investigate the principles of things with care and refinement until we enter into their spirit, for then their application can be extended; and utilize that application and secure personal peace, for then our virtue will be exalted. ” As it is said, “ [Humanity and wisdom] are the character of the nature, and they are the way in which the internal and the external are united. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is said, "Essence and righteousness enter into the spirit, so as to use it; use the body to be at peace, so as to sublimate virtue": "The virtue of nature is also, and the way of combining the internal and external is also."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is said: "The essence of meaning is absorbed into the spirit, so that it can be used; it can be used to settle down, so as to respect virtue." "The virtue of nature is also the combination of internal and external principles."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus it is said: 'Refining one's essence to the point of spiritual mastery to achieve practical application; utilizing one's skills to secure oneself for the sake of enhancing virtue.' 'The virtue of nature lies in harmonizing the way of the internal and the external.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故曰："究天人之际，通古今之变，成一家之言，而后可以致用；致用而后能安其身，可以兴其德。"又说："[人性和智慧]是本性的特征，是内外结合的方式。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故曰：“深究事物的道理，精进其精，则其用处，方能延展；并利用这个应用并确保个人的平静，因为那时我们的德行就会受到崇高。 ” 所谓“仁智，是性性，是内外相合之道。” ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此有人说，“探究事物的原理，细致入微地观察，直到进入它们的本质，因为这样它们的应用就可以扩展；利用这种应用并获得个人的安宁，因为这样我们的德行就会提升。” 正如所说，“[仁和智]是自然的本性，也是内外统一的方式。”

text.ori_cn: 此可以知“格物”之学矣。
text.man_en: From these we may know the learning of the investigation of things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This can be known as the "material" of the study carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This can be understood as the study of "investigating things".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From this, you can understand the study of 'gewu.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从中我们可以了解到探究事物的学问。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 由此可知格物之学。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由此我们可以了解格物致知的学习。

text.ori_cn: “格物”者，《大学》之实下手处，彻首彻尾，自始学至圣人，只此工夫而已，非但入门之际有此一段也。
text.man_en: In the Great learning, the investigation of things is the concrete starting point. From the beginning to the end, from the start of learning to the achievement of sagehood, there is but this one task. It is not a separate section for the beginning of the task.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The "Ge Bi" is the actual starting point of the "University", and it is the only work from the beginning to the saints, not only at the time of the introduction of this paragraph.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Studying things" is the starting point of "The Great Learning", from beginning to end, from the beginning to the sage, this is the only effort, not just at the beginning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "Investigation of things" is the practical approach outlined in the Great Learning, thoroughly comprehensive, from the time one begins to learn until one reaches sagehood. This is the only method, and it is not just a stage at the beginning of the journey.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在大学习中，探究事物是具体的起点。从开始到结束，从开始学习到成就圣贤，只有这一个任务。它不是任务开始的单独部分。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大学里，格物是具体的出发点。自始至终，从学成圣，无非就是这一件事。它不是任务开始时的单独部分。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在《大学》中，格物是具体的起点。从始至终，从学习的开始到成就圣贤，只有这一项任务。这并不是任务开始的一个独立部分。

text.ori_cn: 夫“正心”、“诚意”、“致知”、“格物”，皆所以“修身”：而“格物”者，其所用力，日可见之地。
text.man_en: The rectification of the mind, the sincerity of the will, the extension of knowledge, and the investigation of things are all means of cultivating the personal life. But it is in the investigation of things that the effort to cultivate the personal fife can be seen in one's daily conduct.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The "correcting of the heart", "sincerity of intention", "knowledge", and "the study of material things" are the means of "cultivating the body": and the "study of material things" is the place where one's efforts are visible from day to day. "Cultivate one's body": and the "materialism" is the place where one's efforts are visible from day to day.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Correct mind," "sincerity," "knowledge," and "observation of things" are all for "cultivation of one's self." But for "observation of things," the effort he exerts will be visible day by day.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 'Rectifying the mind,' 'sincerity of intention,' 'extending knowledge,' and 'investigating things' are all ways to cultivate oneself; among these, 'investigating things' is where one's efforts are most visibly exerted daily.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正心、诚意、致知、格物都是修身的手段。但正是在对事物的探究中，修身的努力才能体现在日常行为中。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心灵的正直、意志的真诚、知识的广博、事物的探究，都是修养个人生活的手段。但只有在对事物的考察中，才能在一个人的日常行为中看到培养个人生活的努力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正心、诚意、扩充知识和格物都是修身的手段。但在格物中，修身的努力可以在日常行为中体现出来。

text.ori_cn: 故“格物”者，格其心之物也，格其意之物也，格其知之物也：“正心”者，正其物之心也：“诚意”者，诚其物之意也：“致知”者，致其物之知也。
text.man_en: Therefore the investigation of things is investigating the things of the mind, the things of the will, and the things of knowledge. To rectify the mind is to rectify the mind of things, to make the will sincere is to make the will of things sincere, and to extend knowledge is to extend the knowledge of things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, "to make things" means to make things in one's mind, to make things in one's heart, to make things in one's mind, and to make things in one's knowledge: "to make the mind right" means to make the mind right: "to make the mind sincere" means to make the mind sincere: "To know" means to know the knowledge of things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, to "check things" means to check things in one's mind, to check one's meaning, and to check things one knows; to "rectify one's mind" means to correct one's heart towards things; to "sincerely" means to be sincere to the meaning of things. : "To know" means to know things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, 'investigating things' is to investigate the things of the mind, the things of the intent, and the things of the knowledge; 'rectifying the mind' is to rectify the mind of these things; 'making intentions sincere' is to make the intentions of these things sincere; 'extending knowledge' is to extend the knowledge of these things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所以，格物就是格心、格志、格知。正心就是正物之心，诚意就是诚物之意，致知就是致物之知。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，考察事物就是考察心灵的事物、意志的事物、知识的事物。正心，就是正物之心；诚志，就是物物之志诚；广知，就是广物之知。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，格物就是格心之物、格意之物和格知之物。正心就是正心之物，诚意就是诚意之物，致知就是致知之物。

text.ori_cn: 理一而已：以其理之凝聚而言则谓之“性”，以其凝聚之主宰而言则谓之“心”，以其主宰之发动而言则谓之“意”，以其发动之明觉而言则谓之“知”，以其明觉之感应而言则谓之“物”：故就物而言谓之“格”，就知而言谓之“致”，就意而言谓之“诚”，就心而言谓之“正”。
text.man_en: Principle is one and no more. In terms of its condensation and concentration in the individual it is called the nature. In terms of the master of this accumulation it is called mind. In terms of its emanation and operation under the master, it is called the will. In terms of the clear consciousness of the emanation and operation, it is called knowledge. 6 And in terms of the stimuli and responses of this clear consciousness, it is called things. 7 Therefore when it pertains to things it is called investigation, when it pertains to knowledge it is called extension, when it pertains to the will it is called sincerity, and when it pertains to the mind it is called rectification.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason is just one: in terms of the cohesion of the reason, it is called "nature"; in terms of its cohesive master, it is called "heart"; in terms of its master's activation, it is called "mind"; in terms of its activated consciousness, it is called "knowledge"; in terms of its activated induction, it is called "thing": so in terms of thing, it is called "frame", and in terms of its activated induction, it is called "thing": so in terms of thing, it is called "frame", and in terms of its activated induction, it is called "thing". In terms of its enlightened consciousness, it is called "knowledge", and in terms of its enlightened induction, it is called "thing": so in terms of thing, it is called "frame", in terms of knowledge, it is called "to", and in terms of intention, it is called "to". In the case of things, it is called "ge", in the case of knowledge it is called "zhi", in the case of meaning it is called "sincerity", and in the case of the heart it is called "zheng".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is only one principle: in terms of the cohesion of the principles, it is called "nature", in terms of the domination of the cohesion, it is called "heart", in terms of the activation of its domination, it is called "intention", and in terms of the activation of it, it is called "mind". In terms of clear awareness, it is called "knowledge", and in terms of the induction of clear awareness, it is called "object": so in terms of things, it is called "ge", in terms of knowledge, it is called "zhi", and in terms of meaning, it is called "object". What is called "sincerity" in words is called "righteousness" in terms of heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is but one principle: when referring to the concentration of this principle, it is called 'nature'; when referring to the master of this concentration, it is called 'mind'; when referring to the activation by this master, it is called 'will'; when referring to the clear perception resulting from this activation, it is called 'knowledge'; and when referring to the response from this clear perception, it is called 'thing.' Therefore, in the context of things, it is called 'investigation'; in the context of knowledge, it is called 'extension'; in the context of will, it is called 'sincerity'; and in the context of the mind, it is called 'rectification.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 原理只有一个，没有其他。就其在个体中的凝结和集中而言，它被称为 "本性"。就这种积累的主宰而言，它被称为心。就其在主宰下的发散和运行而言，它被称为意志。就其发散和运行的清晰意识而言，它被称为 "知"。6 而就这种清晰意识的刺激和反应而言，它被称为事物。7 因此，与事物相关时，它被称为探究；与知识相关时，它被称为延伸；与意志相关时，它被称为真诚；与心灵相关时，它被称为修正。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 原则只有一个，仅此而已。就其在个体中的凝结和浓缩而言，它被称为本质。对于这个积累的主人而言，它被称为心。就其在主人之下的散发和运作而言，它被称为意志。就其流放与运作的清明意识而言，称为智。 6就这种清晰意识的刺激和反应而言，它被称为事物。 7 故于物者曰察，于知者曰广，于意者曰诚，于心者曰正。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 原则只有一个，没有其他。就其在个体中的凝结和集中而言，这叫做性。就其主宰这种积聚而言，这叫做心。就其在主宰下发散和运作而言，这叫做意。就其对这种发散和运作的清晰意识而言，这叫做知。就其对这种清晰意识的刺激和反应而言，这叫做物。因此，当涉及物时，这叫做格物；当涉及知时，这叫做致知；当涉及意时，这叫做诚意；当涉及心时，这叫做正心。

text.ori_cn: 正者，正此也；诚者，诚此也；致者，致此也；格者，格此也；皆所谓穷理以尽性也；天下无性外之理，无性外之物。
text.man_en: To rectify is to rectify this [principle], to be sincere is to be sincere about this, to extend is to extend this, and to investigate is to investigate this. These are all means of investigating the principle of things to the utmost so as to develop the nature fully. There is no principle in the world outside nature, and there is no thing outside nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The righteousness is this; the sincerity is this; the sincerity is this; the sincerity is this; the character is this; the character is this; all of these are so-called the exhaustion of reason to the fullest extent of nature; there is no reasoning outside of nature in the world, and there is no thing outside of nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The right one means correctness; the sincerity means sincerity; the zhi means the result; the standard means this; they are all called exhausting reason to exhaust one's nature; there is no reason outside nature in the world, and there is no thing outside nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To be upright is just this; to be sincere is just this; to achieve is just this; to examine is just this. All of these refer to the pursuit of reason to fully realize one's nature. There is no reason outside nature, and there is nothing outside nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正就是正这个[原理]，诚就是诚这个[原理]，延就是延这个[原理]，究就是究这个[原理]。这些都是把事物的原理探究到极致，从而充分发挥本性的手段。世界上没有自然之外的原理，也没有自然之外的事物。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 正就是正这个，诚就是诚这个，延就是延这个，考察就是考察这个。这些都是最大限度地考察事物的原理，从而充分发挥性的方法。世界上没有自然之外的法则，也没有自然之外的事物。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所谓正，就是正这【理】；诚，就是诚这；推，就是推这；格，就是格这。这些都是穷究事物之理以充分发展本性的手段。天地之间不存在本性之外的理，也不存在本性之外的物。

text.ori_cn: 〔4〕凡执事所以致疑于“格物”之说者，必谓其是内而非外也，必谓其专事于反观、内省之为，而遗弃其讲习讨论之功也，必谓其一意于纲领、本原之约，而脱略于支条、节目之详也，必谓其沈溺于枯槁、虚寂之偏，而不尽于物理、人事之变也。
text.man_en: (4) Your Honor is skeptical about my theory of the investigation of things because you undoubtedly believe that it affirms the internal and rejects the external; that it is entirely devoted to selfexamination and introspection and neglects the work of explanation, study, and discussion; that it concentrates on the oversimplified fundamental principles and leaves out the full details; that it submerges itself in the extremes of Buddhist and Taoist lifeless contemplation, emptiness and silence, and fails to take full account of the changing conditions of human affairs and the principles of things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [4] All deacons who doubt the saying of "Ge Shi" must say that it is internal rather than external, and must say that it is devoted to reflection and introspection and abandons the work of study and discussion, and must say that it is intent on the programme and the principles and omits the details of the articles and the programme, and must say that it is absorbed in the withered and silent bias but does not exhaust the changes of physics and human affairs. It must be said that he is addicted to the withered and silent bias, but not to the physical and human changes.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [4] The reason why deacons cast doubt on the theory of "investigating things" must be that it is internal rather than external, that they specialize in introspection and introspection, and abandon the merits of lectures and discussions. Its focus is on the program and the original agreement, but it is not focused on the branches and details of the program. It must be said that it is indulged in the haggard and empty side, and is not fully absorbed in the changes in physics and personnel.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All who question the theory of 'investigation of things' must think it is internal rather than external, must think it is exclusively about introspection and self-examination while neglecting the efforts in study and discussion, must think it focuses solely on the principles and essentials while overlooking the details and particulars, and must think it indulges in the bias of withering and emptiness without fully addressing the changes in natural laws and human affairs.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (4) 法官阁下对我的事物研究理论持怀疑态度，因为毫无疑问，您认为它肯定了内在而否定了外在；它完全致力于自我检查和反省，而忽视了解释、研究和讨论的工作；它专注于过于简化的基本原理，而忽略了全部细节；它沉浸于佛教和道教的无生沉思、空虚和寂静的极端，没有充分考虑到人类事务和事物原理的变化情况。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （四）法官对我的格物论表示怀疑，因为你无疑认为它肯定内在、否定外在；完全注重自省、反省，而忽视解释、研究、讨论工作；它集中于过于简单化的基本原则，而忽略了完整的细节；它陷入了佛教和道教死气沉沉、空虚寂静的极端，没有充分考虑人事变化和事物的原理。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 大人对我的格物之理心存怀疑，因为您无疑认为它肯定内在而拒绝外在；它完全致力于自我检查和内省而忽视了解释、研究和讨论的工作；它专注于简化的基本原理而遗漏了全部细节；它沉浸于佛教和道教无生命的沉思、空虚和沉默的极端，而未能充分考虑人类事务不断变化的条件和事物的原则。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 韩愈说："佛、道之害，甚于杨、墨、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 韩愈说：“佛、道之害，远胜于阳、墨之害，

text.ori_cn: 韩愈之贤不及孟子，孟子不能救之于未坏之先，而韩愈乃欲全之于已坏之后，其亦不量其力，且见其身之危，莫之救以死也。
text.man_en: and Han Yu's virtue is not equal to that of Mencius. Mencius was not able to save his age before it had been injured, but Han Yu hopes to recover his age after it has been damaged. He fails to realize the limitations of his own duty. It is clear that he will place himself in danger and will perish without anyone's saving him. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The wisdom of Han Yu was not as good as that of Mencius, who could not save it before it was broken, but Han Yu wanted to save it after it was broken, and he did not measure his strength, and he saw the danger of his body, and he did not save it from death.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Han Yu was not as wise as Mencius, and Mencius could not save him before he was broken, but Han Yu wanted to save him after he was already broken, but he did not consider his own strength, and seeing that his body was in danger, he did not save him until he died.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Han Yu's virtue does not match Mencius; Mencius could not save it before it was lost, yet Han Yu wanted to restore it after it had already been ruined. This indeed overlooks his own capabilities, and seeing the danger to himself, he could not save himself from death.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 韩愈的德行比不上孟子。孟子 "未老先衰"，韩愈 "老而弥坚"。他没有认识到自己责任的局限性。显然，他将自己置于危险之中，没有人救他，他就会灭亡。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 韩愈的德行不如孟子。孟子无法挽回受伤前的年龄，韩愈则希望恢复受伤后的年龄。他没有意识到自己职责的局限性。很明显，他将自己置于危险之中，并且在没有人救他的情况下就会灭亡。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 韩愈的德行不及孟子。孟子未能在时代受伤之前挽救它，而韩愈希望在时代已经受伤之后恢复它。他没有意识到他自己职责的局限性。显然，他会将自己置于危险之中，并且没有人会救他。

text.ori_cn: 夫众方嘻嘻之中，而犹出涕嗟若，举世恬然以趋，而独疾首蹙额以为忧，此其非病狂丧心，殆必诚有大苦者隐于其中，而非天下之至仁，其孰能察之。
