text.man_en2dpl_cn: 朱、陆之分，世人早已知晓；洪可《先祖记》及《外纪》所载二书，显非完备，今不复述。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 朱鲁之别，早已为世人所知；洪恪所记先人及外极所放两书，均显示不完整，故现不复印。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 朱陆之分，世所共知已久；鸿苛祖宗之录，及外记所录两书，皆不全，今不复载。

text.ori_cn: 其余指知，行之本体，莫详于答人论学与答周道通、陆清伯、欧阳崇一四书；而谓格物为学者用力日可见之地，莫详于答罗整庵一书。
text.man_en: Among the other six letters, the ideas on the original substance of knowledge and action are most fully expressed in the four letters in reply to someone about learning, to Chou Taot'ung, to Lu Yüanching, and to Ouyang Ch'ungi. The idea that in the investigation of things the effort of the student gradually shows effect is most fully discussed in the letter in reply to Lo Chengan.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The rest refers to the knowledge, the essence of the line, not detailed in the answer to the study and the answer to Zhou Dao Tong, Lu Qing Bo, Ouyang Chongyi four books; and said that the material for the scholars to exert themselves on the day to see the place, not detailed in the answer to the whole of the anam a book.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The rest refers to the knowledge that the essence of action is not detailed in the four books of Da Ren Lun Xue and Da Zhou Daotong, Lu Qingbo, and Ouyang Chongyi; while the investigation of things is a place where scholars can see it day by day, and it is not detailed in the book Da Luo Zheng'an.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for the understanding and practice of fundamental principles, nothing is more detailed than my discussions with others about learning, as well as my responses to Zhou Daotong, Lu Qingbo, and Ouyang Chongyi on the Four Books. Furthermore, regarding the study of investigation of things as a diligent effort, nothing is more detailed than my response to Luo Zheng’an.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在其他六封信中，关于知与行的本原的思想在给周陶陶、陆俨少和欧阳询的四封回信中表达得最为充分。在给卢承安的回信中，最充分地论述了学生在探究事物的过程中，努力逐渐显现效果的思想。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 其余六封信中，关于知行本源的思想，以周道通、陆远庆、欧阳崇祯这四封回学书信表达得最为充分。在对事物的探究中，学生的努力逐渐显现出效果的观点，在给罗成安的回信中得到了最充分的讨论。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在其他六封信中，关于知识和行动的本质的观点在回覆关于学习、回覆周道通、回覆陆元靖、回覆欧阳充一的四封信中表达得最为充分。在格物致知中，学生的努力逐渐见效这一观点在给罗承安的回信中讨论得最为详尽。

text.ori_cn: 平生冒天下之非诋，推陷万死，一生遑遑然不忘讲学，惟恐吾人不闻斯道，流于功利、机智以日堕于匈狄、禽兽而不觉，其一体同物之心，譊譊终身，至于毙而后已；此孔、孟以来贤圣苦心，虽门人子弟未足以慰其情也；是情也，莫见于答聂文蔚之第一书：此皆仍元善所录之旧：而揭“必有事焉”即“致良知”功夫，明白简切，使人言下即得入手，此又莫详于答文蔚之第二书，故增录之。
text.man_en: Throughout his life our Teacher was the object of attack and of attempts to destroy him. He had only one chance in ten thousand to live. Yet he always kept himself busy and never relaxed his effort to expound the doctrine lest we might fail to hear it and drift into the pursuit of success and profit and opportunistic cunning, and degenerate to the level of barbarians and criminals without realizing it. Because of his desire to form one body with all things, he talked and taught all his life and did not stop until death. This is the bitter decision of selfsacrifice on the part of all sages and worthies, from Confucius and Mencius on down, and not even his disciples have been able to console him. ＃6 His feeling is most fully expressed in the first letter in reply to Nieh Wenyü.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I have risked the world's denigration, pushed into ten thousand deaths, all my life no time to forget the lecture, but I am afraid that our people do not hear the way, flow in utilitarianism, wit to fall into the Huns and beasts without realising it, and their heart of one body and the same thing, wrangling, wrangling for a lifetime, to the death of his last day; this is the painstaking heart of the sages and sages since Confucius, Mencius, even though the disciples are not yet enough to comfort their feelings; this is the feeling, which is not found in the answer to Nie Wenwei's first book: this is still the same as the old recorded by Yuan Shan: but the uncovering of the "there must be something", that is, "to conscience" work is clear and concise, so that one can say that it is the hand. The "something must be done", i.e., "to know the conscience", is clear and concise, so that one can get started with the words, which is not detailed in the second book of the reply to Nie Wenwei, and so it is added to the record.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Throughout his life, he has braved the slander of the world and fallen into thousands of deaths. He never forgets to teach, for fear that we will not listen to this way, and will fall into the trap of Huns and beasts due to utilitarianism and cleverness without realizing it. The sages from Confucius and Mencius have worked hard, but the disciples are not enough to comfort their feelings. Such feelings are not found in the first reply to Nie Wenwei: These are all still recorded by Yuan Shan. : And the skill of "getting good knowledge" by "there must be something" is clear and concise, so that people can start it immediately by saying it. This is not detailed in the second book of reply to Wen Wei, so it is added.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Throughout his life, he endured the world's reproach, facing countless dangers, and never ceased his pursuit of learning. He feared that people would not hear this doctrine, falling into utilitarianism and cunning, degenerating day by day into barbarism and animalistic tendencies without realizing it. His compassion for all beings and creatures persisted throughout his life, ceasing only at his death. This same heartfelt concern extends back to the sages since Confucius and Mencius; even their disciples could scarcely console them. This sentiment is evident in his first letter to Nie Wenwei, recorded by Yuan Shan. In it, he elucidates the practice of 'unyielding commitment' and the 'attainment of innate knowledge' with clear and concise language, instantly comprehensible. This is further detailed in his second letter to Wenwei, which is why it has been additionally recorded.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在他的一生中，我们的老师一直是被攻击和企图摧毁的对象。他只有万分之一的机会活下来。然而，他总是忙忙碌碌，从未放松对教义的阐释，生怕我们听不到教义，陷入对成功、利益和投机取巧的追逐，不知不觉地堕落为野蛮人和罪犯。因为渴望与万物融为一体，他一生都在讲学，至死方休。这是上自孔子、孟子，下至所有圣贤名士自我牺牲的痛苦抉择，连他的弟子也无法安慰他。6 在给聂文玉的第一封回信中，他的心情得到了最充分的表达。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在他的一生中，我们的老师一直是攻击和企图摧毁他的对象。他只有万分之一的机会活下去。但他总是忙忙碌碌，不曾放松弘扬佛法的心，唯恐我们听不到，而陷入追求功利、投机取巧的境地，不知不觉地堕落到野蛮人和罪犯的地步。因欲与万物合一，一生言教，至死不息。这是从孔孟以下的圣贤们自我牺牲的痛苦决定，就连他的弟子也无法安慰他。 ＃6 他的感受在给聂文宇的第一封回信中表达得最为充分。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我们老师一生都遭受攻击和试图毁灭他的企图。他只有万分之一的生存机会。然而，他总是让自己忙碌，不懈怠地阐述教义，生怕我们听不到而陷入追求成功和利益以及机会主义的诡计中，不知不觉地堕落到野蛮和犯罪的境地。因为他渴望与万物合为一体，所以他一生讲道和教诲，直到死也没有停止。这是从孔子和孟子以来所有圣贤自我牺牲的痛苦决定，甚至他的弟子们也无法安慰他。他的这种感情在回复聂文郁的第一封信中得到了最充分的表达。

text.ori_cn: 元善当时汹汹，乃能以身明斯道，卒至遭奸被斥，油油然惟以此生得闻斯学为庆，而绝无有纤芥愤郁不平之气。
text.man_en: Yuan Shan was a man of great turmoil at that time, but he was able to show his wisdom through his own life. However, when he died, he was raped and reprimanded. However, he was proud of having learned this knowledge in this life, and he never had any anger or resentment.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: At that time, Yuan Shan was in a state of turmoil, and he was able to demonstrate the Way by his own body, and when he was reprimanded for being a traitor, he was glad that he was able to hear about the Way, and he never felt any indignation or indignation.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Yuan Shan was a man of great turmoil at that time, but he was able to show his wisdom through his own life. However, when he died, he was raped and reprimanded. However, he was proud of having learned this knowledge in this life, and he never had any anger or resentment.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Yuan Shan, despite the intense situation at the time, managed to exemplify this principle through his actions. Eventually, he fell victim to treachery and was dismissed. Yet, he remained composed, and his sole joy was the opportunity to hear and learn about these teachings in his lifetime, without harboring even the slightest resentment or indignation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 沅珊在那个动荡的年代，用自己的生命诠释了智慧。然而，他死后却遭到了奸污和斥责。然而，他以今生学到这些知识为荣，从未有过任何愤怒和怨恨。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 袁山当时是一个经历了巨大动荡的人，但他却能够通过自己的一生展现出自己的智慧。然而，他死后却遭到强奸和斥责。不过，他为今生学到了这些知识而感到自豪，从未有过任何愤怒和怨恨。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 元山是在那个动荡年代中的一位伟人，他通过自己的一生展示了他的智慧。然而，当他去世时，他却遭到了诽谤和责难。不过，他为能在这一生中学到这些知识而感到自豪，他从未有过任何的愤怒或怨恨。

text.ori_cn: 斯录之刻，人见其有功于同志甚大，而不知其处时之甚艰也。
text.man_en: People know that his publication of the letters was a great contribution to likeminded friends but do not realize the extremely difficult situation he was in.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The moment of the record, people see that it has great merit in comrades, but do not know that it is in a very difficult time also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: At the time of Si Lu, people saw that he had made great contributions to his comrades, but they did not realize how difficult it was at the time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At the moment of recording this, people see his great contributions to his comrades but do not know how difficult his situation was at the time.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们知道他发表这些书信是对志同道合的朋友们的巨大贡献，却不知道他当时所处的极端困难的境地。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人们知道他的公开信是对志同道合的朋友的巨大贡献，却没有意识到他所处的处境极其艰难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们知道他发表这些信件对志同道合的朋友们是一个伟大的贡献，但却不知道他当时处于极其困难的境地。

text.ori_cn: 今所去取，裁之时义则然，非忍有所加损于其间也。
text.man_en: In retaining six of the eight letters and omitting two, I do not mean to add or subtract anything from them without regret. In view of the new developments, it is the proper thing to do.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not the case that we should tolerate any addition or detriment to it, but it is the case that we should take what we have taken at the time of cutting.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you go and get it now, it will be just as it was when you cut it. You can't tolerate adding any damage to it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What is chosen and taken now is done in accordance with the current moral and ethical standards, not out of a desire to heartlessly add harm to the situation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我保留了 8 封信中的 6 封，删去了 2 封，并不是要无怨无悔地增加或减少什么。鉴于新的事态发展，这样做是恰当的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在保留八个字母中的六个并省略两个时，我并不是要毫无遗憾地从中添加或减去任何内容。鉴于新的事态发展，这是正确的做法。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在保留八封信中的六封并省略两封时，我并不是无意间添加或减少了什么。鉴于新进展，这是合适的做法。

text.ori_cn: 〔1〕来书云：“近时学者务外遗内，博而寡要，故先生特倡‘诚意’一义，针砭膏肓，诚大惠也。”吾子洞见时弊如此矣，亦将同以救之乎？
text.man_en: 〔1〕The letter says: "In recent times, scholars have focused on external affairs and left internal affairs, and they are knowledgeable and few important. Therefore, Mr. Xiang advocated the meaning of 'sincerity', and pointed out that sincerity is a great benefit. " My son has realized that the current disadvantages are like this, and he will also adopt the same approach. To save him?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [1] letter to the cloud: "recent scholars business outside the internal, Bo and few important, so Mr. specially advocate 'sincerity' a sense of acupuncture, really a great benefit." My son insight into the ills of the time so far, will also be the same to save it?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔1〕The letter says: "In recent times, scholars have focused on external affairs and left internal affairs, and they are knowledgeable and few important. Therefore, Mr. Xiang advocated the meaning of 'sincerity', and pointed out that sincerity is a great benefit." My son has realized that the current disadvantages are like this, and he will also adopt the same approach. To save him?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The received letter states: 'Recently, scholars have been focusing on external matters while neglecting the internal, being broad yet lacking in essentials. Hence, you have particularly advocated the principle of 'sincerity,' aiming to cure deep-seated ills, which is indeed a great benefit.' You have such a clear understanding of the current issues; will you join in addressing them as well?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 1〕信中说："近世学者，重外事而轻内政，博学而寡要。故先生倡'诚'之义，指诚为大利。"吾子既悟时弊如此，亦将以之。要救他？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 〔1〕信中说：“近代士人重外事而左内事，有学问而少重。故向先生主张‘诚’之义，并指出诚是很大的好处。”儿子已经意识到现在的弊端就是这样，他也会采取同样的做法。为了救他？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 信中说：“近年来，学者们专注于外部事务，忽略了内部事务，他们见多识广，但却少有重视。因此，襄先生提倡‘诚’的意义，并指出诚是一大益处。” 我的儿子意识到当前的弊端也是这样，他也将采取相同的做法。能救他吗？

text.ori_cn: 若“诚意”之说，自是圣门教人用功第一义：但近世学者乃作第二义看，故稍与提掇紧要出来，非鄙人所能特倡也。
text.man_en: If "sincerity" is said, it is the first meaning of the teachings of the Holy Sect. However, modern scholars see it in the second meaning, so it is important to mention it briefly and it is not something I can specifically advocate.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the "sincerity" of the said, since the Sacred Door to teach people to use the first meaning: but the recent scholars are as the second meaning of the view, so a little with the mention of the key out, not I can not advocate also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If "sincerity" is said, it is the first meaning of the teachings of the Holy Sect. However, modern scholars see it in the second meaning, so it is important to mention it briefly and it is not something I can specifically advocate.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the concept of 'sincerity' is indeed the foremost principle for applying oneself according to the teachings of the sages, contemporary scholars, however, seem to regard it as secondary. Hence, it is necessary to emphasize its importance, something which I alone cannot underscore sufficiently.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果说 "诚"，是圣教教义的第一层含义。但现代学者认为是第二种含义，所以有必要简单提一下，这不是我可以特别提倡的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 若说“诚”，便是圣教教义的第一义。但现代学者看的是第二种含义，所以有必要简单提一下，不是我能特别提倡的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若说“诚”，乃是圣教教义的第一要义。然而，现代学者用第二种意思来理解它，所以有必要简要提及，这并非我能特别倡导的事情。

text.ori_cn: 〔2〕来书云：但恐立说太高，用功太捷，后生师传，影响谬误，未免坠于佛氏明心、见性，定慧，顿悟之机，无怪闻者见疑。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “But I am afraid your doctrine is too idealistic and the task involved too abrupt. In studying and transmitting it, the younger generation will misunderstand and be mistaken and will not be able to help falling into the Buddhist method of understanding the mind, seeing one's own nature, attaining calmness and wisdom, and achieving sudden enlightenment. No wonder those who hear your views are skeptical.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [2] to the book cloud: but I'm afraid to say that too high, with too much work too quickly, after the student teacher transmission, the impact of the fallacy, not inevitably fall in the Buddha's clear mind, see the nature of the fixed wisdom, the opportunity to enlightenment, no wonder that the hearer see doubt.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔2〕 The letter says: However, I am afraid that the theory is too high, the practice is too quick, and the teachings of later generations will influence the fallacy. It will fall into the Buddha's clear mind, see nature, calm wisdom, and sudden enlightenment, and there will be no doubts among those who hear it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The letter states: I only fear that the teachings may be too lofty and the efforts too swift. With future generations of disciples, the transmission of these teachings might lead to misconceptions. Inevitably, this could result in falling into the doctrines of the Buddhists, which emphasize awakening, understanding one's nature, as well as sudden enlightenment through meditative wisdom, thus it is no wonder that those who hear this might harbor doubts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您在信中说："但我担心您的学说过于理想化，所涉及的任务过于突然。年轻一代在学习和传播的过程中，会误解、误入歧途，不由自主地陷入佛家明心见性、清静无为、顿悟成佛的方法之中。难怪听到你的观点的人会怀疑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你的信中说：“但我担心你的学说过于理想化，所涉及的任务也过于突然。后辈们学传之时，就会产生误解、误入歧途，不免陷入佛法的明心见性、定慧顿悟的境界。难怪那些听到你的观点的人会持怀疑态度。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的信中说，“但我怕你的学说太过理想化，任务也过于突然。当年轻一代学习和传递它时，会误解和犯错误，不免陷入佛教理解心性、见性、得定慧、顿悟的方法。难怪听到你观点的人会持怀疑态度。”

text.ori_cn: 区区格、致、诚、正之说，是就学者本心、日用事为间，体究践履，实地用功，是多少次第、多少积累在，正与空虚顿悟之说相反；闻者本无求为圣人之志，又未尝讲究其详，遂以见疑，亦无足怪：若吾子之高明，自当一语之下便了然矣。乃亦谓立说太高，用功太捷，何邪？
text.man_en: The theory of "difficulty, sincerity, sincerity, and righteousness" is based on the scholar's original intention, daily life, experience, practice, and onthespot learning. How many times and how many accumulations are there. It is the opposite of the theory of empty enlightenment; the listener has no pursuit at all. It is the ambition of a saint, and I have not paid attention to its details, so I feel doubtful. It is not surprising: if my son is brilliant, it will be clear with just one sentence. It is also said that the theory of establishment is too high and the effort is too quick. Why is it wrong?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The district, to, sincerity, is said, is on the scholars of the heart, day-to-day matters for the inter, body study practice, field work, is how many times, how much accumulation in, is the opposite of the empty epiphany; hearers of the will of the saints who are not seeking, and have not been talking about its details, so to see the doubt, and no wonder: if I am a highly intelligent, since it would have been a word would have been clear. He also said that he was too high and too quick in his endeavours, why not?
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The theory of "difficulty, sincerity, sincerity, and righteousness" is based on the scholar's original intention, daily life, experience, practice, and on-the-spot learning. How many times and how many accumulations are there. It is the opposite of the theory of empty enlightenment; the listener has no pursuit at all. It is the ambition of a saint, and I have not paid attention to its details, so I feel doubtful. It is not surprising: if my son is brilliant, it will be clear with just one sentence. It is also said that the theory of establishment is too high and the effort is too quick. Why is this wrong?
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sayings of 'sincerity', 'devotion', 'stepping in sincerely' and 'orthodoxy' refer to the scholar's original mind, daily actions, diligent practice, and grounded efforts. They involve stages and accumulation over time, which are contrary to the concept of sudden and void enlightenment. The listeners, who do not aspire to be sages and have never delved into these details, doubt them without much surprise. As for you, with your great wisdom, you should understand it clearly with just one explanation. Yet, you also say the ideas are too lofty and the efforts too swift, why is that?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "难、诚、笃、义 "的理论，是建立在学者的初心、日常生活、经验、实践、现场学习的基础上的。有多少次，有多少积累。它与空悟论相反，听者根本没有追求。此乃圣人之志，吾未留意其详，故有所疑。殊不知：吾子有才，一语便明。又曰：立论过高，用力过急。何错之有？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “难、诚、诚、义”的理论是基于学者的初心、日常生活、经验、实践、临场学习。有多少次，有多少积累。它与空觉理论相反；听者毫无追求。这是圣人的志向，我没有留意过它的细节，所以我感到怀疑。这并不奇怪：如果我的儿子聪明的话，一句话就清楚了。也有人说，建立的理论太高，力度太快。为什么错了？

text.ori_cn: 〔3〕来书云：“所喻知、行并进，不宜分别前后，即《中庸》尊德性而道问学之功，交养互发，内外本末，一以贯之之道。
text.man_en: Your letter says, “You teach us that knowledge and action should proceed simultaneously, that no distinction should be made as to which one should precede the other, and that this is the task of ‘honoring the moral nature and following the path of study and inquiry' as taught in the Doctrine of the Mean, 2 in which the two nourish and develop each other and the internal and external, the fundamental and the secondary form one thread running through all.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [3] The letter says: "Knowing and doing go hand in hand, and it is not appropriate to distinguish between the front and the back. That is, the Doctrine of the Mean respects virtue and nature, teaches the merits of learning, mutually nourishes and develops each other, and is a consistent way from the inside to the bottom.

This is akin to the principle in the Doctrine of the Mean, which respects virtue while also emphasizing the practice of learning and inquiry. It suggests the mutual development of both internal character and external skills, maintaining a consistent and unified approach throughout.'

text.ori_cn: “专求本心，遂遗物理，”此盖失其本心者也：夫物理不外于吾心，外吾心而求物理，无物理矣。
text.man_en: He who only seeks his original mind and consequently neglects the principles of things is one who has lost his original mind. For the principles of things are not external to the mind. If one seeks the principles of things outside the mind, there will not be any to be found.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "dedicated to seek the heart, then lost physics," which cover the loss of its heart also: the physical is not outside my heart, outside my heart and seek physical, no physical carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Pursue only the original mind, and then leave behind physics." This covers those who have lost their original intention: Physics is nothing more than my mind. If I seek physics outside my mind, there is no physics.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "Seeking only the true self, thus abandoning the principles of things," such is the case of those who have lost their true self: for the principles of things do not exist outside our mind. To seek these principles beyond our mind results in finding nothing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只追求本心而忽视事物原理的人，是失去本心的人。因为万物之理不在心外。如果在心外寻找事物的原理，那就找不到了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只求本心而忽略了事物的道理的人，就是失了本心的人。因为事物的原理并不外在于心灵。若求心外事物之理，则无所得。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只求本心而忽略事物原理的人，才是失去本心的人。因为事物原理不在心外。如果心外求理，是永无所得的。

text.ori_cn: 心之体，性也，性既理也。
text.man_en: The substance of the mind is nature, and nature is identical with principle.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The body of the mind is also nature, and nature is both reason and nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The body of the heart is nature, and nature is rational.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The essence of the heart is nature, and nature is reason.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 心灵的实质是本性，而本性与原则是一致的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心的本体是性，性与理是同一的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心之本质是自然，自然即是理。

text.ori_cn: 故有孝亲之心，即有孝之理，无孝亲之心，即无孝之理矣。
text.man_en: Consequently, as there is the mind of filial piety toward parents, there is the principle of filial piety. If there is no mind of filial piety, there will be no principle of filial piety.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if there is filial piety, there is the reason for filial piety, and if there is no filial piety, there is no reason for filial piety.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you have the heart of filial piety, you have the principle of filial piety; if you don’t have the heart of filial piety, you have no principle of filial piety.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, having a heart of filial piety implies the principle of filial piety; without a heart of filial piety, there is no principle of filial piety.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，对父母有孝心，就有孝的原则。如果没有孝心，也就没有孝的原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以，有了孝顺父母的心，就有了孝顺的原则。没有孝心，就没有孝道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，有孝敬父母的心，就有孝道的原则。如果没有孝敬的心，就没有孝道的原则。

text.ori_cn: 有忠君之心，即有忠之理，无忠君之心，即无忠之理矣。
text.man_en: As there is the mind of loyalty toward the ruler, there is the principle of loyalty. If there is no mind of loyalty, there will be no principle of loyalty.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a loyal heart of the king, that is, there is the reason of loyalty, no loyal heart of the king, that is, there is no reason of loyalty.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you have a heart of loyalty to the emperor, you have the principle of loyalty; if you don't have the heart of loyalty to the emperor, you have no principle of loyalty.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With a loyal heart to the sovereign, there exists the principle of loyalty; without a loyal heart to the sovereign, the principle of loyalty does not exist.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有对君主的忠诚之心，就有忠诚的原则。如果没有忠诚之心，也就没有忠诚的原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有对君主的忠诚之心，就有忠诚的原则。没有忠诚之心，就没有忠诚之理。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有忠于君主的心，就有忠诚的原则。如果没有忠于君主的心，就没有忠诚的原则。

text.ori_cn: 晦庵谓“人之所以为学者与理而已：心虽主乎一身，而实管乎天下之理：理虽散在万事，而实不外乎一人之心”。
text.man_en: Hui'an said, "The reason why people are scholars and principles is that although the heart is the master of one body, it actually governs the principles of the world; although principles are scattered in everything, it is really nothing more than the heart of one person. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Hiuan said "the reason why people are scholars and reason only: although the heart of the main in a body, but the real management of the world's reason: although the reason is scattered in all things, but really not outside of a person's heart".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Hui'an said, "The reason why people are scholars and principles is that although the heart is the master of one body, it actually governs the principles of the world; although principles are scattered in everything, it is really nothing more than the heart of one person."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hui An said, 'The reason for one to engage in learning lies in pursuing principles: although the heart/mind governs the individual, it actually manages the principles of the world; although principles are scattered among myriad things, they are ultimately not beyond the heart/mind of the individual.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 惠安说："人之所以为学者，之所以为理者，心虽主一身，实则主天下之理；理虽散于万物，实则无非一人之心。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 惠安曰：“人之所以为士而为理，是因为心虽为一身之主，实则主宰天下之理；理虽散于万物，实也不过是心而已。”一个人的”。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 惠安说：“人之所以为学者和原则，是因为心虽然是一个身体的主宰，它其实支配着世界的原则；虽然原则散布于万物之中，其实不过是一个人的心。”

text.ori_cn: 犹与天为二也。
text.man_en: In so doing, one and Heaven are still separated.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Judah and heaven are also two.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: You and heaven are two.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It would still be separate from the heavens.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如此一来，一与天还是分离的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这样做的话，人和天仍然是分开的。

text.ori_cn: 天之所以命于我者，心也，性也。
text.man_en: My mind and nature are what Heaven has endowed in me.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason why Heaven has ordained me is that the heart is also the nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The reason why God has ordained me is my heart and my nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What Heaven has ordained for me are the heart and the nature.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我的心性，是天所赐予的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我的心性是上天赋予我的。

text.ori_cn: 吾但存之而不敢失，养之而不敢害，如“父母全而生之，子全而归之”者也。
text.man_en: I merely preserve them and dare not lose them, nourish them and dare not injure them, as parents give the son his body in its completeness and the son returns it in its completeness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I but save but do not dare to lose, raise but do not dare to harm, such as "parents all born, the son of the whole and return to the" also.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我只保其而不敢失，养其而不敢伤，如父母将其身体完整地给予儿子，而将其完整地归还给儿子一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我只不过是保存它们，不敢丢失它们，滋养它们，不敢损伤它们，就像父母把完整的身体交给儿子，儿子也将完整的身体归还。

text.ori_cn: 故曰，此学知利行，贤人之事也。
text.man_en: I therefore, say that these are matters learned through study and practiced for their advantage, matters of the worthy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is said that this study of knowledge and beneficial actions is also the work of the wise man.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is said that this knowledge is beneficial to practice, and it is the work of wise people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus it is said, this learning to know and practice righteousness is the business of the virtuous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，我说，这些都是通过学习和实践而获得的好处，是有价值的事情。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故我说，此乃学而习之事，为利事，为贤事也。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，我说这些是通过学习而掌握，并为了它们的好处而实践的事情，是有价值的事情。

text.ori_cn: 至于夭寿不贰，则与存其心者又有间矣。
text.man_en: As to those who do not allow any doublemindedness regardless of longevity or brevity of life, they are different from those who preserve the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: As for those who live and die young, there is a gap between them and those who keep their hearts.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As for those who live long enough to die young, there is still a gap between them and those who have the intention to do so.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for living without deviation, it differs from solely preserving one's intentions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 至于那些无论长寿还是短命都不允许有任何二心的人，他们与保持心灵的人不同。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 至于无论寿命长短，不容许有二心的人，与保存心的人不同。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 至于那些无论生命长久与否都不容许有任何犹豫不决的人，他们与那些保全内心的人不同。

text.ori_cn: 存其心者，虽未能尽其心，固己一心于为善。
text.man_en: Although those who preserve the mind are not yet able to exert the mind to the utmost, they already have singlemindedly determined to do good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who keeps his heart, though he may not be able to do all that is in his heart, has one heart for the good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who have their heart in mind may not be able to do their best, but they are determined to do good.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who preserve their intention, though they may not fully achieve their aim, have already devoted their entire heart to doing good.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 存心者虽然还不能将心发挥到极致，但他们已经一心向善。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 存心者，虽未能尽心，但已一心行善。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然那些保守心灵的人还不能充分发挥心智，他们已经一心一意决定行善。

text.ori_cn: 时有不存，则存之而已。
text.man_en: When at times the mind has not yet been preserved, they make an effort to preserve it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If there are times when they do not exist, then they just exist.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sometimes it doesn’t exist, but it just exists.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When it does not exist at times, we merely establish it.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有时，当心灵尚未被保存时，他们会努力保存它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当有时心灵尚未被保存时，他们会努力去保存它。

text.ori_cn: 今使之夭寿不贰，是犹以夭寿贰其心者也。
text.man_en: Now he is given a life span of less than two years, which is just like those who use his short life span to ruin his heart.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Now, if we make them live young, we will be like those who are not sure of their lives, but who are not sure of their hearts.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Now he is given a life span of less than two years, which is just like those who use his short life span to ruin his heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Now, to make it so that one's briefness or longevity does not change, is like making one change their mind regarding briefness or longevity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，他被赋予了不到两年的寿命，这就像那些利用他短暂的寿命来毁掉他的心的人一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 现在他被赐予的寿命还不到两年，这就像那些用他短暂的寿命来毁掉他的心的人一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在他被告知剩下的寿命不到两年，这就像那些利用他短暂生命摧毁他内心的人一样。

text.ori_cn: 立者，创立之立。
text.man_en: The word establish means to found, to build up,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The one who establishes is the one who establishes.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The one who establishes is the one who establishes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To establish means to create.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 建立 "一词的意思是创立、建立、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 建立这个词的意思是建立、建立、
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “establish” 一词的意思是创立、建立、

text.ori_cn: 如立德，立言，立功，立名之类。
text.man_en: as in establishing virtue, establishing words, establishing achievement, and establishing fame.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Such as establishing virtue, speech, merit, and fame, and so on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Such as establishing virtue, establishing reputation, establishing merit, establishing reputation, etc.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Such as establishing virtue, establishing ideas, achieving success, and gaining a reputation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如立德、立言、立功、立名。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如立德、立言、立功、立名。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如同立德、立言、立功、立名。

text.ori_cn: 凡言立者，皆是昔未尝有，而今始建立之谓。
text.man_en: Whenever we say “establish, ” it always means that such and such a thing is not there and is now to be built up from the beginning.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: All those who say that they are established are those who have not been established in the past, but are now being established.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Everything that is said to be established means that it has never existed in the past and is now being established.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Whatever is established through words, is something that did not exist before and is only now being created and established.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 每当我们说 "建立 "时，它总是意味着这样或那样的东西并不存在，现在要从头开始建立起来。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 每当我们说“建立”时，总是意味着这样那样的东西不存在，现在要从头建立起来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当我们说“建立”的时候，总是意味着某种事物还不存在，现在需要从头开始构建。

text.ori_cn: 孔子所谓“不知命，无以为君子”者也。
text.man_en: This is what Confucius meant when he said, “Without knowing the mandate of Heaven, it is impossible to be a superior man. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Confucius said, "If you don't know your destiny, you can't be a gentleman".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Confucius said that "one who does not know destiny cannot be called a gentleman."

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是孔子所说的 "不知天命，无以为上"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是孔子所说的“不知道天命，就不可能为君子”的意思。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是孔子所说的，“不知天命，无以为君子。”

text.ori_cn: 故曰，此困知勉行，学者之事也。
text.man_en: Therefore, I say these things are matters learned through hard work and practiced with effort and difficulty, matters of the student.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is said that this is a difficult knowledge and diligence, and the scholars are also the things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is said that it is the scholar's job to know and encourage people to do things in a difficult situation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, it is said that overcoming difficulties and striving for action are the responsibilities of a scholar.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，我说这些事情都是通过努力学习和艰苦实践得来的，是学生的事情。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以我说这些东西都是通过努力学来的，苦练出来的，是学生的事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，我说这些事情是通过努力学习和艰苦实践获得的，是学生的事情。

text.ori_cn: 今以尽心知性知天为格物致知，使初学之士，尚未能不贰其心者。
text.man_en: Now to regard exerting the mind to the utmost, knowing one's nature, and knowing Heaven as the investigation of things and the extension of knowledge is suddenly to compel the beginning student who is not yet able to avoid doublemindedness
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Now, if we use the knowledge of nature and heaven as the basis for the knowledge of things, then the beginner will not be able to be unqualified.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Nowadays, using one's mind, one's nature, one's mind and one's nature to know heaven is used as a way to study things and achieve knowledge, so that novices can't stop thinking about it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Now, to fully understand the nature and comprehend the heavens through the investigation of things and the extension of knowledge, there are still beginners who cannot yet avoid a divided heart.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，把尽心、知性、知天视为事物的探究和知识的扩展，突然迫使还不能避免二心的初学者
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 今以尽心、知性、知天为格物、致知，忽逼初学者，尚难免二意。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在将尽心、知性、知天称作格物致知，是突然强迫一个尚未能避免心猿意马的初学者。

text.ori_cn: 而遽责之以圣人生知安行之事。
text.man_en: to practice those things that pertain to the sage who is born to know and can practice naturally and easily.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And he suddenly reproaches the saints for what they know and do.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: And he was suddenly blamed for the fact that saints know how to do things safely.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Suddenly blaming him for the sage's innate knowledge and ease of action.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 去实践那些属于圣人的事情，圣人生来就知道并且能够自然而轻松地实践。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 去实践那些属于天生知晓并能自然轻松地进行修行的圣人的事物。

text.ori_cn: 如捕风捉影，茫然莫知所措。
text.man_en: He will be seizing the wind and grasping at shadows, as it were, and will be at a loss and will not know what to do with his mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It's like catching the wind and not knowing what to do.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Like catching a shadow in the wind, you are at a loss and don't know what to do.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Like chasing shadows, utterly at a loss.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他就会像抓住了风，抓住了影子一样，不知所措，不知如何是好。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 就如乘风抓影，不知所措，不知所措。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他将像是在抓风捉影一样，感到茫然不知所措，并不知道如何安顿自己的心绪。

text.ori_cn: 夫良知之于节目时变，犹规矩尺度之于方圆长短也：节目时变之不可预定，犹方圆长短之不可胜穷也。
text.man_en: Innate knowledge is to minute details and varying circumstances as compasses and measures are to areas and lengths. Details and circumstances cannot be predetermined, just as areas and lengths are infinite in number and cannot be entirely covered.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The conscience of the programme and the change of time is like the rule and the scale of the square and the circle and the length: the programme and the change of time cannot be predetermined, and it is like the square and the circle and the length that cannot be exhausted.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The husband's conscience is to the changing of the program, just like the rules and regulations to the length of the square and the circle: the program is unpredictable from time to time, just like the length of the square and the circle is inexhaustible.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The relationship between good conscience and changing circumstances is like that between compasses and rulers and shapes and measurements; just as changing circumstances cannot be predetermined, so too can shapes and measurements be fathomless.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识对于微小细节和不同情况的作用，就像罗盘和量具对于面积和长度的作用一样。细节和情况是无法预先确定的，就像面积和长度是无穷无尽的，不可能完全涵盖。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与生俱来的知识涉及微小的细节和变化的情况，就像指南针和测量方法涉及面积和长度一样。细节和情况无法预先确定，就像面积和长度是无限的并且无法完全覆盖一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 先天知识对于细节和变化的情况，就像指南针和尺度对于面积和长度一样。细节和情况无法预先确定，就像面积和长度是无限的，无法完全涵盖。

text.ori_cn: 故规矩诚立，则不可欺以方圆，而天下之方圆不可胜用矣：尺度诚陈，则不可欺以长短，而天下之长短不可胜用矣：良知诚致，则不可欺以节目时变，而天下之节目时变不可胜应矣。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the rules of sincerity, can not be deceived to square and round, and the world of square and round can not be used: the scale of sincerity, can not be deceived to the length of the world of the length of the world of the short can not be used: the conscience of sincerity, can not be deceived to the programme of the time, and the world of the programme of the time can not be changed to be used.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, if rules and standards are truly established, one cannot deceive with shapes and forms, and the world's shapes and forms will be inexhaustible; if measures and scales are sincerely set forth, one cannot deceive with lengths and shortness, and the world's lengths and shortness will be inexhaustible; if true knowledge is genuinely achieved, one cannot be deceived by the changes in events and seasons, and the world's changes in events and seasons will be inexhaustible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果圆规和正方体真的摆好了，那么在面积方面就不会有任何欺骗，世界上正确面积的可能性就不会穷尽。如果度量衡得到了很好的展示，那么在长度方面就不会有任何欺骗，世界上正确长度的可能性也不会穷尽。如果先天知识得到了真正的扩展，那么对于细枝末节和各种情况就不会有任何欺骗，而世界上细枝末节和各种情况的可能性也不会穷尽。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果圆规和直角尺真的设定好了，面积就不会有任何欺骗，世界上正确面积的可能性就不可能穷尽。如果尺寸表现得好，就不可能有任何关于长度的欺骗，并且世界上正确长度的可能性也不会穷尽。如果先天知识真正得到延伸，那么细微差别就不能有任何欺骗，而世界细微差别的可能性也不能穷尽。

text.ori_cn: 未发之中，即良知也，无前后内外，而浑然一体者也。
text.man_en: The equilibrium before the feelings are aroused is innate knowledge. It is neither before nor after any state and is neither internal nor external but is one substance without differentiation.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The conscience is the one that has not yet been developed, the one that has no front or back, no inside or outside, and the one that is all in one.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Before it emerges, it is the conscience, which has no front, back or inside but is integrated into one body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the state of non-arising, it is inherent knowing; there is no distinction between before and after, inside and outside, but it is a unified whole.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 情感唤起之前的平衡是与生俱来的知识。它既不在任何状态之前，也不在任何状态之后，既不是内在的，也不是外在的，而是一种没有区别的物质。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 情感被激发之前的平衡是先天的知识。它既不在任何状态之前，也不在任何状态之后，既不内在也不外在，而是一体无别。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 感情未被激发时的平衡是天赋的知识。它既不在任何状态之前也不在之后，既不是内部的也不是外部的，而是一种没有差别的本质。

text.ori_cn: 有事、无事可以言动、静，而良知无分于有事、无事也；寂然、感通可以言动、静，而良知无分于寂然、感通也。
text.man_en: Activity and tranquility may refer to the mind's engaging in something or nothing, but innate knowledge makes no distinction between doing something and doing nothing. Activity or tranquility may also refer to the state of being absolutely quiet and that of being acted upon and penetrating things, but innate knowledge does not make any distinction between such states.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Something and nothing can be said to be moving and still, but conscience is not divided into something and nothing; silence and sensibility can be said to be moving and still, but conscience is not divided into silence and sensibility.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is something and nothing that can be said to be moving and quiet, but good knowledge is not divided into something and nothing; silence and enlightenment can be said to be active and still, but good knowledge is not divided into silence and sense.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Whether there is something or nothing, we can speak of movement and stillness, but the innate knowledge does not differentiate between them; whether there is silence or response, we can speak of movement and stillness, but the innate knowledge does not differentiate between silence and response either.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 活跃和宁静可以指心灵有所为或有所不为，但先天知识并不区分有所为和有所不为。活跃或宁静也可以指绝对安静的状态，也可以指被作用和穿透事物的状态，但先天知识并不区分这些状态。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 动与静可能是指心有事或无事，但先天知并没有区分有事与无事。动或静也可以指绝对安静的状态，以及作用于事物和穿透事物的状态，但先天知识并不区分这些状态。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 动静可以指心灵参与某事或什么都不做，但良知并不区分做什么和不做什么。动静也可以指绝对安静的状态和被动穿透事物的状态，但良知并不区分这些状态。

text.ori_cn: 动、静者，所遇之时；心之本体，固无分于动、静也。
text.man_en: Activity and tranquility appertain to the time when the mind comes into contact with things, whereas in the original substance of the mind there is no distinction between activity and tranquility .
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart's essence is not divided into movement and static.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Movement and stillness are encountered at the same time; the essence of the heart is not divided into movement and stillness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Motion and stillness are encountered at times; the fundamental nature of the mind is inherently indifferent to both.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 活跃和宁静是指心灵与事物接触的时候，而在心灵的本原中，活跃和宁静是没有区别的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 动与静属于心与事物接触的时候，而在心的本来本体中，动与静并无区别。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 动静是当心与事物接触时发生的状态，然而在心的本质中并无动静之分。

text.ori_cn: 理无动者也，动即为欲。
text.man_en: If there is no reason for movement, movement is desire.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Reason has no movement, and movement is desire.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is no reason for movement, movement is desire.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Reason is inherently motionless; once in motion, it becomes desire.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果没有运动的理由，运动就是欲望。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果没有运动的理由，运动就是欲望。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果没有移动的理由，移动就是欲望。

text.ori_cn: 循理则虽酬酢万变，而未尝动也。
text.man_en: If it follows principle, it is not active [stirred] in spite of countless changes in its dealing with things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you follow reason, you will not be moved, even though you are entertained by ten thousand changes.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: According to the principles, although the entertainment is changing, it has not changed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Following principles, though responding to myriad changes, remains unfaltering.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果它遵循原则，那么尽管在处理事物时发生了无数的变化，它也不会活跃[激动]。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果它遵循原则，尽管处理事情有无数的变化，但它并不积极。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果遵循原则，尽管在处理事情上有无数的变化，它依然不会主动[搅动]。

text.ori_cn: 但作两事看了，便有病痛。
text.man_en: But if [things and the mind] are regarded as two things, it is a defect.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: But when two things have been looked at, there is sickness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: But after seeing two things, I felt sick.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: But if you view it as two separate matters, it will cause illness and pain.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，如果把[事物和心灵]视为两样东西，那就是一种缺陷。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但如果把[物与心]视为两种东西，那就是缺陷了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但如果把[事物和心]看作两件事，那就是一个缺陷。

text.ori_cn: 在孟子言必有事焉，则君子之学终身只是“集义”一事。
text.man_en: Mencius said, “Always be doing something. ” This means that throughout his life the learning of the superior man consists purely of accumulating righteousness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the words of Mencius, there must be something to do, and the study of a gentleman is only a matter of "collecting righteousness" for life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Mencius said that there must be something to do, so the gentleman's learning is only a matter of "collecting righteousness" throughout his life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In Mencius's teachings, there is always a matter to be addressed; therefore, a gentleman's lifelong learning is solely about the cultivation of righteousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孟子曰："行有余力。"意思是说，上等人一生的学问完全在于积累义理。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孟子说：“总要有所作为。 ”这是说君子一生的学问，纯粹是为了积累仁义。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孟子说：“持之以恒。” 这意味着在他的一生中，君子的学习完全是积累正义的过程。

text.ori_cn: 义者，宜也，心得其宜之谓义。
text.man_en: What is right means what is proper. When the mind attains what is proper, it is called righteousness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Righteousness is also called righteousness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Righteousness means appropriateness. It is called righteousness when one feels what is appropriate.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Righteousness means appropriateness; it is called righteousness when the heart aligns with appropriateness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正确意味着恰当。当心灵达到适当的境界时，就称为 "正"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 什么是正确的意思就是什么是正确的。心达到正的时候，就叫做正。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 什么是正确的就意味着什么是适当的。当心灵达到适当的状态时，这就叫做正义。

text.ori_cn: 能致良知则心得其宜矣，故“集义”亦只是致良知，君子之酬酢万变，当行则行，当止则止，当生则生，当死则死，斟酌调停，无非是致其真知，以求自慊而已。
text.man_en: If innate knowledge can be extended, the mind will attain what is proper. Therefore accumulating righteousness is nothing other than the extension of innate knowledge. In the countless changes in his dealings with others, the superior man acts if it is proper to act, stops if it is proper to stop, lives if it is proper to five, and dies if it is proper to die. In all his considerations and adjustments he does nothing but extend his innate knowledge to the utmost so that he can satisfy himself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Can cause the conscience is the heart of its appropriate, so the "set of righteousness" is also just to the conscience, the gentleman's entertainment of all kinds of changes, when the line is line, when the stop is stopped, when the life is born, when the death is dead, deliberations and mediation, is nothing more than to its true knowledge, in order to seek their own dissatisfaction only.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If it can lead to good conscience, then the heart will be suitable. Therefore, "collecting righteousness" can only lead to good conscience. A gentleman's courtesy is ever-changing. When he should do it, he will do it, when he should stop, he will stop. When he should live, he will live, and when he should die, he will die. Deliberation and mediation are nothing more than the result. The true knowledge is just for self-examination.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one can achieve a clear conscience, then the heart finds its proper state. Thus, 'gathering righteousness' is also just about achieving a clear conscience. A gentleman adapts to myriad changes: he acts when it’s time to act, stops when it’s time to stop, lives when it’s time to live, and dies when it’s time to die. He weighs and balances situations, all to achieve true understanding and seek self-satisfaction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天之知若能延展，则心得其正。因此，积累仁义只不过是先天知识的延伸。在与他人交往的无数次变化中，上等人该行则行，该止则止，该生则生，该死则死。在所有的考虑和调整中，他都只是将自己与生俱来的知识扩展到极致，以满足自己。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果先天知识能够扩展，心就会获得正确的东西。故积义无非是先天知识的延伸。君子在为人处世的无数变化中，适行则行，适止则止，适五则生，宜死则死。他的一切考虑和调整，无非就是将自己的先天知识发挥到极致，以求满足自己。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果先天的知识能够得到扩展，心智就会达到应有的状态。因此积累正义不过是扩展先天知识罢了。在与他人交往中的无数变化中，君子行该行的事，停该停的地方，活该活的命，死该死的时。在所有的考量和调整中，他所做的一切不过是将先天知识发挥到极致以满足自己。

text.ori_cn: 故“君子素其位而行”，“思不出其位”。
text.man_en: Therefore “The superior man does what is proper to his position, ” and “in his thought he does not go out of his place. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, "a gentleman walks in his place" and "thinks out of his place".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, "a gentleman acts according to his position" and "cannot think out of his position."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, a gentleman acts according to his position and does not entertain thoughts beyond it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，"高人行其所当行之事"，"在思想上不越位"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故“君子行其所当”，“其思想不离其位”。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此“君子居其位而行其事”，并且“在他的思想中，他不会超越自己的职责。”

text.ori_cn: 凡谋其力之所不及，而强其知之所不能者，皆不得为致真知，而凡“劳其筋骨，饿其体肤，空乏其身，行拂乱其所为，动心忍性以增益其所不能”者，皆所以致其真知也。
text.man_en: All those who “scheme to get what is beyond their strength and force their intellectual faculty to know what it is incapable of”17 cannot be considered as extending their innate knowledge. On the other hand, “subjecting one's sinews and bones to hard work, exposing one's body to hunger, putting oneself in poverty, placing obstacles in the path of one's deeds, so as to stimulate one's mind, harden one's nature, and improve oneself wherever one is incompetent” are all ways to extend innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Anyone who seeks to do more than he can do, and who strengthens his knowledge of what he cannot do, is not allowed to achieve true knowledge, while anyone who "stretches his muscles and bones, starves his body and skin, empties his body, acts in a disorderly manner, and endures his heart and mind in order to increase what he cannot do", is achieving his true knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Anyone who seeks to achieve what his strength cannot reach and who tries to force what he knows cannot achieve true knowledge will not achieve true knowledge. However, anyone who "works his muscles and bones, starves his body and skin, depletes his body, disturbs his actions by walking, and stirs up his mind and forbearance to gain benefit" "What he cannot do" is the reason for his true knowledge.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All those who strive beyond their capabilities and force their knowledge beyond their limits cannot attain true understanding. However, those who 'strain their muscles, starve their bodies, exhaust their physical strength, face disruptions in their actions, move their hearts, and endure hardships to enhance what they cannot do' are the ones who indeed attain true understanding.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 凡是 "谋其所不能谋，强其所不能强 "17 的人，都不能算是扩展了先天的知识。反之，"劳其筋骨，饿其体肤，空乏其身，行拂乱其所为，所以动心忍性，增益其所不能 "都是扩展先天知识的方法。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所有那些“谋求获得超出其能力的事物并迫使其智力知道其无法获得的事物”17的人都不能被视为扩展了他们与生俱来的知识。另一方面，“苦劳筋骨，使身挨饿，使自己困苦，在行道上设置障碍，以激发心志，硬性本性，处处提高自己”。 “人无能”都是扩展先天知识的方法。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所有那些“图谋超越自己能力范围的事情，并强迫自己的智力去了解其无法理解的事物”17，都不能算是扩充其天赋知识。另一方面，“使自己的筋骨劳作艰苦，让自己的身体忍受饥饿，把自己置于贫困之境，在自己的行动路径上设置障碍，以此来激发心志，磨练性格，并在自己无能之处努力提升”的方法都是扩展天赋知识的方式。

text.ori_cn: 不知吾身之疾痛，无是非之心者也；是非之心，不虑而知，不学而能，所谓“良知”也：良知之在人心，无间于圣愚，天下古今之所同也，世之君子惟务致其良知，则自能公是非，同好恶，视人犹己，视国犹家，而以天地万物为一体，求天下无冶，不可得矣。
text.man_en: Those who are not aware of the disease and pain in their own body are people without the sense of right and wrong. The sense of right and wrong is knowledge possessed by men without deliberation and ability possessed by them without their having acquired it by learning. It is what we call innate knowledge. This knowledge is inherent in the human mind whether that of the sage or of the stupid person, for it is the same for the whole world and for all ages. If gentlemen of the world merely devote their effort to extending their innate knowledge they will naturally share with all a universal sense of right and wrong, share their likes and dislikes, regard other people as their own persons, regard the people of other countries as their own family, and look upon Heaven, Earth, and all things as one body. 6 When this is done, even if we wanted the world to be without order, it would not be possible.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I do not know the pain of my body, there is no right and wrong heart; right and wrong heart, do not think and know, do not learn and can, the so-called "conscience": conscience in the hearts of people, no intermediate in the saint and fools, the world of the world of the ancient and modern is also the same, the world of the gentleman but the task of its conscience, it can be public right and wrong, the same as the good and the bad, as a person is like himself, as the country is like a family, and the world as a whole, and seeking the world The world is not the same as the past and the present.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I don’t know the illness and pain of my body, and I don’t have a mind of right and wrong. The mind of right and wrong can be known without worrying, and can be done without learning. The so-called "good knowledge" is also: good knowledge is in the human heart, and it is the same as that of saints and fools. It is the same in the world in ancient and modern times. , The gentleman of the world should only serve his conscience, then he can distinguish right from wrong, agree on likes and dislikes, regard others as oneself, regard the country as one's family, and regard the heaven, earth and all things as one, and seek for the world to be unruly, which will not be achieved.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Not knowing the pain and illness of one's own body means one lacks the heart of right and wrong; the heart of right and wrong is known without thinking, and can be done without learning, which is called 'innate knowledge'. Innate knowledge in the human heart is no different between the wise and the foolish, and this is the same throughout the world and across all times. The gentlemen of the world should strive to realize their innate knowledge so that they can naturally distinguish right from wrong, share common likes and dislikes, view others as they view themselves, regard the nation as their home, and consider the entirety of heaven and earth as one entity. Seeking a world without governance is impossible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那些对自己身体的疾病和痛苦一无所知的人，是没有是非观念的人。是非感是人不经思考而拥有的知识，是人不经学习而拥有的能力。这就是我们所说的先天知识。无论是圣人还是愚人，这种知识都是与生俱来的，因为它古今中外都是一样的。世间君子只要努力扩展自己的先天知识，就会自然而然地与所有人分享普遍的是非观，分享自己的好恶，视他人为自己的人，视他国人为自己的家人，视天地万物为一体。6 做到这一点，即使我们想让世界没有秩序，也是不可能的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不知道自己身体的疾病和痛苦的人，是没有是非观念的人。是非意识是人不经过思考而拥有的知识，是人未经学习而拥有的能力。这就是我们所说的先天知识。这种知识是人的思想所固有的，无论是圣人的思想还是愚人的思想，因为它对于整个世界和所有时代都是一样的。天下之士，若仅致力扩展先天知识，自然会与大家有普世是非观念，有共同的好恶，视别人如自己人，视别国人民为自己人。自家，视天地万物为一体。 6 这样做之后，即使我们希望世界没有秩序，也是不可能的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些对自己身体中的疾病和痛苦没有意识的人是没有是非感的人。是非感是人类不经思考就拥有的知识，是他们不通过学习就具备的能力。这就是我们所说的良知。无论是圣人还是愚人，这种知识都在人类心中天生具备，因为它是普遍存在于全世界、所有时代的。如果世上的君子们只要努力扩展他们的良知，他们自然会与众人分享一种普遍的是非感，分享他们的喜好，视他人为己身，视他国之人为自己的家人，并将天地万物视为一体。当这种情况发生时，即使我们想让世界无序，也是无法做到的。

text.ori_cn: 古之人所以能见善不啻若己出，见恶不啻若己人，视民之饥溺犹己之饥溺，而一夫不获，若己推而纳诸沟中者，非故为是而以蕲天下之信己也，务致其良知求自慊而已矣。
text.man_en: When the ancients felt that the good seemed to come from themselves when they saw others do good, when they felt that they had fallen into evil when they saw others do evil, when they regarded other people's hunger and drowning as their own, and when they felt that if one person's condition was not well adjusted it was as if they had pushed him into a ditch, they did not purposely do so in order to seek people's belief in them. They merely devoted their effort to extending their innate knowledge and sought to satisfy themselves.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ancient people so can see the good as if their own out, see the evil as if their own people, depending on the people's hunger and drowning as if their own hunger and drowning, and a man does not get, as if they push the ditch in the person, not for the sake of is to implore the world's faith in their own, and to do their conscience to seek self-satisfaction is only carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The reason why people in ancient times could see good as if it were one's own, and see evil as if it were one's own neighbor, and treat the hunger and drowning of the people as if it were one's own, and not catch a single person, or push one's way into ditches, was not for this reason. It is just a matter of asking the people of the world to trust themselves, and to make their consciences seek self-restraint.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The people of ancient times could perceive good as if it were their own and see evil as if it were done to themselves. They regarded the hunger and suffering of the people as their own hunger and suffering. And if one person was left destitute, they saw it as if they had personally pushed them into a ditch. They did not act this way to gain the trust of the world; rather, they strove to fulfill their innate moral sense and seek inner peace.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当古人看到别人行善时，觉得善似乎来自自己；当古人看到别人作恶时，觉得自己堕入恶中；当古人把别人的饥饿和溺水视为自己的饥饿和溺水；当古人觉得如果一个人的状况调整不好，就好像自己把他推入沟渠时，他们并不是为了寻求人们对他们的信任而故意这样做的。他们只是努力扩展自己与生俱来的知识，并寻求自我满足。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当古人看到别人行善时，觉得善似乎是从自己身上来的时候；当看到别人作恶时，觉得自己陷入了恶行时；当他们把别人的饥饿和溺水视为自己的时候；当他们觉得如果一个人的状态调整不好，就等于把他推到了沟里，他们并不是故意这样做，以寻求人们对他们的信任。他们只是致力于扩展他们与生俱来的知识并寻求满足自己。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当古人看到别人行善时，感觉到善好像是从他们自己身上发出来的；当他们看到别人作恶时，感觉到自己陷入了罪恶；当他们把别人的饥饿和溺水当作自己的情况时，以及当他们感觉到如果一个人的情况没有得到良好调整就好像是他们把他推到了沟里时，他们并不是故意这样做以求得别人的信任。他们只是致力于扩展他们的天赋知识，寻求自我满足。

text.ori_cn: 尧、舜、三王之圣，言而民莫不信者，致其良知而言之也；行而民莫不说者，致其真知而行之也。
text.man_en: The Sage emperors Yao and Shun and the Three Kings spoke and all people believed them, because in speaking they extended their innate knowledge. They acted and all people were pleased with them, because in acting they extended their innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saints of Yao, Shun, and the three kings, when they spoke and the people did not believe them, they spoke from their conscience; when they acted and the people did not speak, they acted from their true knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sages of Yao, Shun and the three kings, if the people did not believe what they said, they would have their conscience to speak; if they did what they did, and the people would not fail to speak, it would be true knowledge and they would act on it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The wisdom of Yao, Shun, and the three sage kings was such that when they spoke, the people trusted them without exception because they spoke from their innate knowledge; when they acted, the people were pleased without exception because they acted from their true understanding.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 尧舜圣人和三皇五帝说话，天下人都相信，因为他们在说话时扩展了自己的先天知识。尧、舜、三皇之言，天下皆信，以其言广先知也；禹、汤之行，天下皆喜，以其行广先知也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣帝尧、舜、三王之言，众人皆信之，因言而增知之故。他们表演了，所有人都对他们感到满意，因为他们在表演中扩展了与生俱来的知识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 尧舜圣帝与三王言而众信之，是以言而尽其良知也。行而众悦之，是以行而尽其良知也。

text.ori_cn: 是以其民熙熙皞皞，杀之不怨，利之不庸，施及蛮貊，而凡有血气者莫不尊亲；为其良知之同也。
text.man_en: Therefore, the people are prosperous and prosperous, killing them without resentment, benefiting them without mercy, and giving to barbarians, and all fleshandblood people will respect their relatives; this is the same as their conscience.
