text.ori_cn: 主上圣明洞察，责付甚重，不敢遽辞：地力军务冗沓，皆舆疾从事。
text.man_en: His Majesty, possessing sagely intelligence and great understanding, has given me great responsibility which I dare not abruptly decline. Local military affairs have been heavy and busy. I have handled all of them while going about in carriages in spite of illness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: His Lordship was so wise and perceptive that he did not dare to make a hasty resignation: the land and the military affairs were so redundant that they were all engaged in public opinion and illness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Lord has a sage insight and the responsibility is very heavy, so he dare not say it hurriedly: the land and military affairs are too long, and they are all carried out according to public health.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: His Majesty is wise and perceptive, entrusting me with heavy responsibilities which I dare not decline. The state's resources and military affairs are numerous and time-consuming, all of which I must manage despite my ailments.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 陛下英明神武，深明大义，委以重任，臣不敢推辞。地方军务繁重而繁忙。我不顾病痛，坐着马车四处奔波，处理了所有这些事务。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 陛下具有圣人的聪明才智，赋予我重大的责任，我不敢贸然推辞。地方军事事务繁重而忙碌。我带着病坐马车走来走去，处理了所有这些事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 陛下具备圣明智慧和卓越见识，赋予我重任，我不敢轻易推辞。地方军事事务繁重。我尽管身患疾病，仍乘车处理所有这些事务。

text.ori_cn: 今却幸已平定，已具本乞回养病，得在林下稍就清凉，或可瘳耳。
text.man_en: Fortunately the region is now pacified. I have presented a memorial seeking permission to return home for treatment of my disease. If I can rest in a grove and enjoy to some extent the clear and cool air, perhaps I can recover.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Now, fortunately, it has been pacified, and I have already begged to go back to recuperate from my illness, so that I may be able to convalesce in the coolness of the forest.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Fortunately, things have been settled now, and I have already returned home to recuperate. I have to stay under the forest for a while to cool off, or my ears may be cured.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Now, however, fortunately the turmoil has been pacified, I have formally requested to return and recuperate. I will seek tranquility in the countryside, and perhaps this will lead to my recovery.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 幸运的是，该地区现已平定。我已经递交了一份奏折，请求允许我回国治病。如果我能在小树林里休息一下，在一定程度上享受一下清凉的空气，也许我的病就能痊愈。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 幸运的是，该地区现已平息。我已提交一份奏折，请求允许我回家治疗我的疾病。如果我能在小树林里休息一下，享受一下清新凉爽的空气，也许我就能康复。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 幸亏该地区现在已经平定。我已经呈递了一份奏折，请求允许返乡治疗我的疾病。如果我能在树林中休息，享受一下清凉的空气，也许我能康复。

text.ori_cn: 人还，伏枕草草，不尽倾企外惟浚一简幸达致之。
text.man_en: As your messenger is about to return, I have hastily written while resting on my pillow, but I cannot fully express my regard for you. In addition I am sending a letter to Weichiin. Please deliver it to him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People still, ambush pillow grass, not all pouring enterprise outside but dredge a brief luck to achieve.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When people return, they lie down on their pillows and have straw. They don’t pour out everything but dredge up a simple thing to reach it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He remains, hastily resting on the pillow, unable to fully express his aspirations beyond the mundane, hoping to convey them through this letter.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 您的信使即将返回，我在枕边休息时匆忙写下了这封信，但我无法完全表达我对您的敬意。另外，我还要给 Weichiin 送一封信。请转交给他。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 眼见你的使者即将归来，我枕在枕头上匆匆写下，却无法充分表达我对你的思念。另外我还给Weichiin寄了一封信。请交给他。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于您的使者即将返回，所以我在枕上匆忙写下这些话，但仍无法完全表达我对您的情谊。另外，我还写了一封信给位謦，请将它转交给他。

text.ori_cn: 〔9〕来书所询，草草奉复一二：近岁来山中讲学者，往往多说“勿忘、勿助”工夫甚难。
text.man_en: (9) Let me roughly answer one or two questions you put forth in your letter. In the last year or two, those who came to the mountains to study with me have repeatedly said that the task of not forgetting one's objective and not making any artificial effort to help the mind grow is most difficult.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [9] to the book inquired, hastily replied to one or two: in recent years to the mountains in the scholars, often say "do not forget, do not help" work is very difficult.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔9〕I wrote to ask questions and gave a hasty reply: In recent years, scholars who come to the mountains to give lectures often say "don't forget, don't help." It's very difficult.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In response to your letter, I hastily offer a brief reply: In recent years, those who have come to the mountains to give lectures often say that the practice of 'do not forget, do not aid' is extremely difficult.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (9) 请允许我粗略地回答您在信中提出的一两个问题。近一两年来，来山里跟我学习的人一再表示，最难做到的是不忘记自己的目标，不做任何人为的努力来帮助心灵成长。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (9) 让我粗略地回答你在信中提出的一两个问题。最近一两年来，和我一起进山学习的人一再说过，不忘初心、不做任何人为的努力来帮助心灵成长是最困难的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 让我大致回答一下你在信中提出的一两个问题。在过去的一两年里，来山中跟我学习的人一再说不忘记自己的目标并且不刻意去努力让心智成长的任务最为困难。

text.ori_cn: 问之，则云“才着意便是助，才不着意便是忘”，所以甚难。
text.man_en: When asked for an explanation, they said, “As soon as one fixes his attention, he is helping, and as soon as he pays no attention, he forgets. Therefore it is most difficult. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When asked, he said, "To be attentive is to help, but not to be attentive is to forget", so it is very difficult.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When asked, it goes like this: "If you pay attention, you will help; if you don't pay attention, you will forget." So it is very difficult.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When asked, they said, 'As soon as you focus on it, you are assisting it; as soon as you don't focus on it, you forget it.' Therefore, it is very difficult.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当被问及原因时，他们说："一个人一旦集中注意力，他就会有所帮助，而一旦不注意，他就会忘记。因此，这是最困难的。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当被问及解释时，他们说：“一集中注意力，他就在帮忙，一不集中，他就忘记了。因此是最困难的。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当被要求解释时，他们说：“一旦一个人集中注意力，就在帮忙，而一旦他不注意，就会忘记。因此，这是最困难的事情。”

text.ori_cn: 其人默然无对，始请问。
text.man_en: They remained silent and made no reply, and then asked me for my opinion.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man was silent and unresponsive, and then he asked for a question.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The man remained silent, so he asked.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The person remained silent, having no response, and then began to ask questions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他们保持沉默，没有回答，然后问我的意见。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他们保持沉默，没有回答，然后询问我的意见。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他们保持沉默，没有回答，然后问我我的意见。

text.ori_cn: 区区因与说，我此闲讲学，却只说个“必有事焉”，不说“勿忘、勿助”。
text.man_en: Whereupon I explained to them as follows: In my discussions here I talk only about the point that “One must always be doing something” and not about forgetting or not helping.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The district because and said, I have this idle lecture, but only said a "must have something", not to say "do not forget, do not help".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Just because of this, I have the time to give lectures, but I only say "something must happen", not "don't forget, don't help".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Because of certain remarks, I am here discussing learning in my free time, yet I only talk about 'there must be something to do,' instead of 'do not forget' or 'do not assist.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 于是，我向他们解释如下：在这里的讨论中，我只谈 "一个人必须始终在做事 "这一点，而不是忘记或不帮忙。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 于是我向他们解释如下：我在这里的讨论中只讲“人必须始终在做某事”这一点，而不是忘记或不帮忙。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 于是我向他们解释如下：在这里的讨论中，我只谈论“人必须总是做些什么”的观点，而不是忘记或不帮忙。

text.ori_cn: “必有事焉”者只是时时去“集义”。
text.man_en: “One must always be doing something” means that one should accumulate righteous deeds at all times.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The one who "must have something to do" is only to "gather righteousness" from time to time.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who "must have something to do" just go to "collect righteousness" from time to time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "There must be something to it" means always striving to gather righteousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "人必有所为 "的意思是，人应该随时积累义行。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “时时有所为”，就是时时刻刻积累善行。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “一个人必须时常做些事情”意思是说一个人应该随时积累正义的行为。

text.ori_cn: 若时时去用“必有事”的工夫，而或有时间断，此便是忘了，即须二勿忘：时时去用“必有事”的工夫，而或有时欲速求效，此便是助了，即须“勿助”。
text.man_en: If one devotes all his time to the task of seeing to it that he must always be doing something and yet he is interrupted at times, it means he forgets. The immediate task here is not to forget. If one devotes all his time to the task of always doing something and is impatient and seeks quick results, it means he helps. The immediate task here is not to help.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you always use the work of "something must be done", but sometimes interrupt it, this is forgetfulness, i.e., you must not forget: if you always use the work of "something must be done", but sometimes want to achieve quick results, this is assistance, i.e., you must "not help". Do not help".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you always use the effort of "something must happen", and sometimes there is a break, this is forgetting. That is to say, don't forget two things: always use the effort of "something must happen", and sometimes you want to get quick results. This is If you want to help, you must "don't help".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If you constantly apply the diligence of always having something to do but occasionally lapse, this means you have forgotten and must remember two things: constantly apply the diligence of always having something to do, and if ever you seek rapid results, this means you have hastened, and you must avoid hastening.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人把所有的时间都投入到他必须始终在做的事情上，而他却时常被打断，这就意味着他忘记了。这里的当务之急就是不要忘记。如果一个人把所有的时间都投入到总是在做某件事情上，而且缺乏耐心，急于求成，这意味着他在帮忙。这里的当务之急不是帮助。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果一个人把所有的时间都投入到确保他必须始终做某件事的任务上，但有时却被打断，那就意味着他忘记了。当前的任务是不要忘记。如果一个人把所有的时间都投入到总是做一件事上，而且没有耐心，急于求成，这意味着他在帮忙。当前的任务不是提供帮助。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人把所有的时间都用在确保自己总是在做什么的任务上，但有时却受到打扰，这意味着他忘记了。此刻的紧要任务是不忘记。如果一个人把所有的时间都用在总是做什么的任务上，且不耐烦并追求快速的结果，这意味着他在帮忙。此刻的紧要任务是不帮忙。

text.ori_cn: 其工夫全在“必有事焉”上用：“勿忘、勿助”，只就其间提撕警觉而已。
text.man_en: The task lies wholly in the practice of the teaching that one must always be doing something. In this situation the injunctions not to forget and not to help are meant only to hold the individual's attention and make him alert.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The work is all in the "something must be done" on the use of "do not forget, do not help", only to mention the tear in the middle of the vigilance only.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All his efforts are spent on "something must happen" and "don't forget, don't help", just to be alert in the meantime.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The effort lies entirely in 'there must be something in it': 'Don't forget, don't aid,' just maintaining alertness and vigilance in between.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们的任务完全在于践行 "一个人必须始终有所作为 "的教诲。在这种情况下，"勿忘 "和 "勿助 "的禁令只是为了吸引个人的注意力，使其保持警觉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 任务完全在于实践“一个人必须始终在做某事”的教导。在这种情况下，“不要忘记”和“不要提供帮助”的禁令只是为了吸引个人的注意力并让他保持警惕。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 任务完全在于实践必须始终在做某事的教导。在这种情况下，不得忘记和不得帮助的指示只是为了保持个人的注意力并让他保持警觉。

text.ori_cn: 若是工夫原不间断，即不须更说“勿忘”：原不欲速求效，即不须更说“勿助”。
text.man_en: If from the start the task is not interrupted, there is no further need of talking about not forgetting, and if from the start one is not impatient and does not seek quick results, there is no further need of talking about not helping.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the work is uninterrupted, then there is no need to say "do not forget": if there is no desire for quick results, then there is no need to say "do not help".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the work is uninterrupted, there is no need to say "don't forget"; if there is no desire for quick results, there is no need to say "don't help".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the work is truly continuous, there is no need to mention 'never forget'; if one does not seek rapid results, there is no need to mention 'don’t assist.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果从一开始就不中断工作，就没有必要再谈 "不遗忘"；如果从一开始就不急躁、不急功近利，就没有必要再谈 "不帮助"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果从一开始就没有间断，就更不用说不忘记；如果从一开始就不急躁，不求速，就更不用说不帮助。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果从一开始任务就不被打断，就没有必要再谈什么不忘记了，而如果从一开始就不急躁不求快速结果，就没有必要再谈什么不帮助了。

text.ori_cn: 吾恐火候未及调停，而锅已先破裂矣。
text.man_en: I am afraid that before the intensity of the fire can be adjusted the skillet will already be cracked.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am afraid that the pot will break before the fire can be tempered.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I'm afraid that the pot will break before the heat can be adjusted.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I fear that before the right moment for mediation arrives, the pot will have already shattered.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 恐怕还没来得及调整火候，平底锅就已经裂开了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 恐怕还没来得及调节火力，煎锅就已经裂开了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 恐怕还没等火力调节好，煎锅就已经裂了。

text.ori_cn: 近日，专在“勿忘、勿助”上用工者，其病正是如此：终日悬空去做个“勿忘”，又悬空去做个“勿助”，奔奔荡荡，全无实落下手处，究竟工夫，只做得个沈空守寂，学成一个痴騃汉，才遇些子事来，即便牵滞纷扰，不复能经纶宰制。
text.man_en: Nowadays, the trouble of those who devote their efforts only to not forgetting and not helping is precisely like this. All day long they attempt to practice not forgetting in a vacuum and also attempt to practice not helping in a vacuum. Pushing and rushing, they completely lack a concrete starting point. In the end their task will result only in their sinking into emptiness and maintaining quietness and learning to be stupid fools. As soon as anything happens to them, they are handicapped and confused and cannot manage or control it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Recently, dedicated to the "do not forget, do not help" on the work of the person, the disease is exactly this: all day long hanging to do a "do not forget", and hanging to do a "do not help", running around, all the real drop The work of the hands, the work, only to do an empty silence, learning to become a stupid stupid man, only to meet some things, even if the stagnation of the disturbance, no longer be able to handle Zaizi.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Recently, those who work exclusively on "Don't forget, don't help" have exactly the same disease: they spend all day doing "Don't forget" and "Don't help" all day long, running around and wandering around without any real results. When it comes to hands, in the end, all I can do is stay in silence, learn to be a moron, and only then will things happen, and even if they are entangled and disturbed, I can no longer control them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Recently, those who focus on 'Do not forget, do not assist' are afflicted precisely by this: spending the entire day hanging between 'do not forget' and 'do not assist,' flitting about without any real grounding. Ultimately, this effort results only in maintaining an empty stillness, learning to be a foolish person; as soon as even a small matter arises, they are immediately entangled and disturbed, no longer able to manage and control things effectively.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如今，那些只致力于 "不忘 "和 "不帮 "的人的烦恼正是如此。他们整天试图在真空中练习 "不忘记"，也试图在真空中练习 "不帮助"。推来推去，匆匆忙忙，完全没有一个具体的出发点。到头来，他们的任务只能是沉入空虚，保持安静，学做傻子。一旦有什么事情发生在他们身上，他们就会手足无措，无所适从，无法驾驭和控制。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如今，那些只致力于不忘记而不帮助的人的麻烦正是如此。他们整天试图在真空中练习不忘记，也试图在真空中练习不帮忙。他们推来推去，完全没有具体的出发点。最终他们的任务只会让他们陷入空虚、保持安静、学会做傻瓜。一旦发生什么事，他们就手足无措，手足无措，管理不了，控制不了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在，那些只是不忘记和不帮助而尽力的人们的麻烦正是如此。整天他们试图在真空中实践不忘记，也试图在真空中实践不帮助。推推搡搡，他们完全缺乏一个具体的起点。最终，他们的任务只会导致他们陷入空虚，保持安静，学会成为愚蠢的傻瓜。一旦发生任何事情，他们就会手足无措，困惑不已，无法处理或控制。

text.ori_cn: 〔10〕夫“必有事焉”只是“集义”，“集义”只是“致良知”。
text.man_en: (10) “One must always be doing something” means merely the accumulation of righteous deeds, and the accumulation of righteous deeds means merely the extension of innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [10] "Something must be done" is only "to gather righteousness", and "to gather righteousness" is only "to know the conscience".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [10] "There must be something going on" is just "to gather righteousness", and "to gather righteousness" is just to "bring conscience".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 'There must be an endeavor' simply means 'accumulating righteousness,' and 'accumulating righteousness' simply means 'achieving good conscience.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (10) "人必有所为 "仅仅意味着义行的积累，而义行的积累仅仅意味着先天知识的扩展。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (十)“常作”，只是义行的积累，义行的积累，只是先天知识的延伸。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “一个人总是要做一些事情的”仅仅意味着积累正义的行为，而积累正义的行为仅仅意味着扩展先天的知识。

text.ori_cn: 说“集义”则一时末见头脑，说“致良知”即当下便有实地步可用功；故区区专说“致良知”。
text.man_en: To talk about accumulating righteous deeds does not immediately reveal the basis, but as soon as we talk about the extension of innate knowledge there is right away a concrete basis on which to engage in the task. I therefore advocate solely the extension of innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To say "to gather righteousness" is to see the mind at the end of a moment, but to say "to know the conscience" means that there is real ground to work on at the present time; therefore, the district is devoted to "to know the conscience".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Saying "Jiyi" means that you don't have a clear idea for a while, saying "Zhiliangzhi" means that you have practical and practical application at the moment; therefore, you just talk about "Zhiliangzhi".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When speaking of 'accumulating righteousness,' one may not immediately grasp the essence, but 'extending one's innate knowledge' provides practical steps that can be taken immediately; hence the exclusive emphasis on 'extending one's innate knowledge.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 谈论积累义行并不能立即揭示其基础，但只要我们谈论先天知识的扩展，就立即有了从事这项工作的具体基础。因此，我只主张扩展先天知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 讲积累善行，并不能马上显出基础，但一讲到根智的延伸，立刻就有了具体的基础去做事。因此，我主张只扩展先天知识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 谈论积累善行并不能立即揭示其基础，但一旦谈到扩展良知，就马上有一个具体的基础来进行这个任务。因此，我只提倡扩展良知。

text.ori_cn: 随时就事上致其良知，便是“格物”：著实去致良知，便是“诚意”，著实致其良知，而无一毫意必固我，便是“正心”。
text.man_en: To extend innate knowledge in daily affairs as they occur is to investigate things. To extend innate knowledge in a genuine and earnest way is to make the will sincere. To extend innate knowledge in a genuine and earnest way without the least arbitrariness of opinion, dogmatism, obstinacy, or egotism is to rectify the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To attain a conscience at all times and in respect of all things is to "realise things"; to attain a conscience practically is to "be sincere"; to attain a conscience practically without the slightest intention of fixing oneself on it is to "rectify the mind".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To address one's conscience at all times is to "investigate things"; to truly address one's conscience is to be "sincerity"; to truly address one's conscience without any intention to fix oneself is to have a "righteous heart".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Constantly applying one's innate knowledge to the matter at hand is 'investigation of things'; earnestly applying one's innate knowledge is 'sincerity of intention'; sincerely applying one's innate knowledge without any selfish biases is 'rectification of the mind'.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在日常事务中扩展先天知识，就是探究事物。真诚而认真地扩展先天知识，就是使意志真诚。真心诚意地扩展先天知识，不带丝毫武断、教条、固执或利己主义，就是正心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在日常事务中扩展固有的知识就是研究事物。真诚地扩展先天知识，就是使意志真诚。真正、认真地扩展先天知识，没有一点专断、教条、固执或自我主义，这就是正心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在日常事务中扩展内在知识就是格物。诚心诚意地扩展内在知识就是意诚。诚心诚意地扩展内在知识而没有丝毫意见武断、教条、固执或自负就是正心。

text.ori_cn: 著实致良知，则自无忘之病：无一毫意必固我，则自无助之病。
text.man_en: If one extends innate knowledge genuinely and earnestly, there will naturally be no defect of forgetting, and if one has not the least arbitrariness of opinion, dogmatism, obstinacy, or egotism, there will naturally be no defect of helping.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you have a good conscience, you will be free from the disease of forgetfulness: if you do not have the slightest intention of fixing yourself on me, you will be free from the disease of assistance.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you really have a good conscience, you will not suffer from the disease of forgetfulness; if you don’t have any intention to consolidate yourself, you will suffer from the disease of helplessness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one endeavors to attain true knowledge, there will naturally be no problem of forgetfulness; if one has no slightest obstinacy or self-assumption, there will naturally be no problem of assistance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人真心诚意地扩展先天知识，自然就不会有遗忘的缺陷；如果一个人没有丝毫的武断、教条、固执或利己主义，自然就不会有帮助的缺陷。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果一个人真诚地、认真地扩展先天知识，自然不会有忘记的毛病；如果没有一点专断、教条、固执、自私的毛病，自然不会有帮助的毛病。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若能真正诚心地扩展先天的知识，自然不会有遗忘的缺陷；若不存丝毫的主观意见、教条主义、固执或自负，自然也不会缺乏帮助。

text.ori_cn: 故说“格、致、诚、正”，则不必更说个“忘、助”。
text.man_en: Therefore if we advocate the investigation of things, the extension of knowledge, the sincerity of the will, and the rectification of the mind, there will be no need of any further talk of forgetting or helping.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is not necessary to talk about "forgetting and helping" when it is said to be "style, sincerity, honesty and righteousness".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, when talking about "character, sincerity, sincerity, and uprightness", there is no need to add "forgetfulness, help".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, it is said that 'Grasping, Investigation, Sincerity, and Rectification' preclude the need to mention 'Forgetting and Assisting.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，如果我们提倡格物、致知、诚意、正心，就不必再谈什么忘我和助人了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故若主张格物、致知、诚心、正心，则不必再谈忘助。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，如果我们倡导格物致知，诚意正心，就没有必要再谈论什么忘记或帮助了。

text.ori_cn: 孟子说“忘、助”，亦就告子得病处立方。
text.man_en: Mencius talked of them in order to prescribe a formula for remedying the defects of Kao Tzu.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When Mencius said "forget and help", he was also referring to the cubes at the place where Suzi got sick.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Mencius said "forget and help", so he told him to give him a prescription for the cure.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mencius said that 'forgetting and assisting' were also remedies prescribed for Gaotze's ailments.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孟子说到这些，是为了开出一剂方子，以弥补高子的缺陷。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孟子讲这些，是为了开一个方子来弥补高子的缺陷。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孟子谈论这些，是为了给高子缺陷开出补救的方子。

text.ori_cn: 告子强制其心，是助的病痛，故孟子专说助长之害。
text.man_en: Kao Tzu's control of the mind is the defect of helping the mind to grow. Therefore Mencius only talked about the harm of helping.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The suits compel their hearts, which is the disease of help, so Mencius speaks exclusively of the evils of help.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Telling Zi to force his mind is to help the disease, so Mencius specifically talks about the harm caused by encouraging it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Gaozi forced his heart, which exacerbated his affliction, and thus Mencius specifically spoke of the harm of over-assistance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 高子制心，是助长心性的缺陷。所以孟子只讲助长之害。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 高子对心的控制是帮助心成长的缺陷。所以孟子只讲帮助之害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 告子的心之控制是帮助心成长的缺陷。因此，孟子只谈了帮助的危害。

text.ori_cn: 告子助长，亦是他以义为外，不知就自心上“集义”，在“必有事焉”上用功，是以如此。
text.man_en: Kao Tzu advocated helping the mind to grow because he regarded righteousness as external to the mind and failed to realize that righteousness should be accumulated in and through one's own mind and that one should devote his effort to the task of always doing something. This is why he had this defect.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason why the scholar was so helpful is that he took righteousness as an exception and did not know how to "gather righteousness" from his own heart and work on "something must be done".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Gaozi encouraged him because he regarded righteousness as an external thing. Without knowing it, he "gathered righteousness" in his heart and worked hard on "something must happen". This is why.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The story of Guo Zi pulling up the seedlings to help them grow also shows that he considered righteousness to be external and did not know how to cultivate it within himself. He did not understand the importance of diligently applying his efforts, hence the result.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 高子之所以主张 "助长"，是因为他把 "义 "看成是外在的，没有认识到 "义 "应该在自己的心中积累，应该通过自己的心来积累，应该 "终日为之"。因此，他才会有这样的缺陷。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 高子主张助心成长，因为他认为义是心的外在，而没有意识到义应该通过自己的心来积累，并且应该致力于经常做某事。这就是他有这个缺陷的原因。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 告子主张帮助心灵成长，因为他认为正义是心外之物，没有认识到正义应当积累在自身的心灵之中，并且通过自己的心灵来实现，人应当努力不断做事。这就是他有这个缺陷的原因。

text.ori_cn: 孟子“集义”、“养气”之说，固大有功于后学，然亦是因病立方，说得大段，不若《大学》“格、致、诚、正”之功，尤极精一简易，为彻上彻下，万世无弊者也。
text.man_en: Mencius' doctrine of accumulating righteousness and nourishing the vital force is of course a great help to students. Nevertheless, it is but a prescription for a particular ailment expounded at length. It is not as good as the task of the investigation of things, the extension of knowledge, the sincerity of the will, and the rectification of the mind taught in the Great Learning, which is much more refined, unified, simple, and easy. It penetrates both the higher and the lower levels and is good for ten thousand generations.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mencius "set of righteousness", "raise the gas" said, certainly a great success in the later school, but also due to the disease cubes, said a large section, not as "University" "frame, to, sincere, positive" work, especially the most refined one. Simple and easy, for the whole top and bottom, the world without harm.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Mencius's theory of "gathering righteousness" and "nurturing qi" is a great contribution to later learning. However, it is also due to illness that the cubes are made in long paragraphs, which is not as good as the "character, Zhi, sincerity, and righteousness" of "The Great Learning", which is particularly extreme. It is refined and simple, and it is thorough from top to bottom, and has no disadvantages in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mencius’ doctrines of 'Amassing Righteousness' and 'Nourishing the Qi' have indeed been of great benefit to later scholars. However, they were founded as remedies for specific issues, and despite their extensive discourse, they do not compare to the 'Investigation of Things, Extension of Knowledge, Sincerity of Will, and Rectification of the Mind' in the Great Learning. These principles are exceptionally refined and straightforward, applicable to all levels, and beneficial for all time.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孟子的 "积义养气 "学说对学生当然大有裨益。然而，它不过是长篇累牍地阐述的治疗某种疾病的药方。它不如《大学》所讲的格物、致知、诚意、正心之道精炼、统一、简易。它贯通上下，流芳万世。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孟子的积义养元学说对于学生来说当然是有很大帮助的。然而，它只是详细阐述的针对特定疾病的处方。不如《大学》所传授的格物、致知、诚志、正心的任务精炼、统一、简单、容易。通达上下，利万代。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孟子的积善养气之说，固然对学生是一大帮助。然而，这只是针对某种特定病症的详细处方。不如《大学》中所教的格物致知，诚意正心的功夫，那功夫更加精微、统一、简单、易行。它贯通上下层次，对万代都有益。

text.ori_cn: 〔11〕圣贤论学，多是随时就事，虽言若人殊，而要其工夫头脑，若合符节。
text.man_en: (11) In discussing learning, sages and worthies mostly do so in accordance with the times and with events. They seem to differ from one another in what they say, but essentially they are in complete harmony on the basis of the task.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [11] The sages discuss the study, mostly at any time on the matter, although the words are different, but to work on the mind, if in line.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔11〕Sages and sages often deal with matters at any time. Although their words are different from person to person, their hard work and mind must be consistent with the rules.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The discussions on learning by sages and worthies often arise from contemporary situations. Although their words may seem directed at different individuals, the core principles of their efforts align perfectly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (11)圣贤名士论学，大多因时因事而论。他们的言论看似各不相同，但本质上却是在任务的基础上完全一致的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (11)圣贤之论学，多随时随事。他们的说法似乎各有不同，但本质上他们在任务的基础上是完全一致的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: （11）在讨论学习时，圣贤们大多根据时代和事件来说。他们似乎在言论上有所不同，但实际上在任务的基础上他们完全一致。

text.ori_cn: 缘天地之间，原只有此性，只有此理，只有此良知，只有此一件事耳，故凡就古人论学处说工夫，更不必搀和兼搭而说，自然无不吻合贯通者，才须搀和兼搭而说，即是自己工夫未明彻也。
text.man_en: The reason for this is that in the universe there is only this one nature, this one principle, this one innate knowledge, and this one endeavor. Therefore, whenever we discuss our task on the basis of the doctrines of the ancients, we should not force extraneous ideas upon them or mix them with such ideas. Then they will naturally blend together and penetrate one another. As soon as one feels the necessity of forcing extraneous ideas upon them or mixing them with such ideas, it is apparent that one's own task is not yet clearly understood.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Rim of heaven and earth, the original only this nature, only this reason, only this conscience, only this one thing ear, so all the ancients on the study of said work, more need not be mixed and tie and said, naturally, there is no coincidence through the person, only to be mixed and tie and said, that is, their own work is not clear and thorough.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Between heaven and earth, there is only this nature, only this principle, only this conscience, and only this one thing. Therefore, anyone who talks about the ancients' theory of learning, let alone mixing it up, will naturally be consistent and coherent. To say that it needs to be mixed together means that one's own skills are not clear enough.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Between heaven and earth, there is only this nature, only this principle, only this conscience, and only this one matter. Therefore, when discussing the efforts of ancient scholars, there is no need to mix or combine other thoughts; naturally, everything will align and harmonize. Only when one must mix and combine other thoughts does it indicate that one's own efforts are not yet clear.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 原因在于，宇宙中只有这一种性质、这一种原理、这一种先天知识和这一种努力。因此，每当我们在古人学说的基础上讨论我们的任务时，我们不应该把不相干的思想强加给他们，也不应该把他们与这些思想混为一谈。这样，它们就会自然而然地融合在一起，相互渗透。一旦觉得有必要把外来的思想强加于它们，或把它们掺杂在这些思想中，就说明自己的任务还没有理解清楚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为宇宙中只有这一性，只有这一理，只有这一根知，只有这一努力。因此，当我们根据古人的学说来讨论我们的任务时，我们不应该把外来的想法强加给他们，或者与这些想法混在一起。然后它们就会自然地融合在一起，互相渗透。一旦一个人感到有必要将无关的想法强加给他们或将他们与这些想法混合在一起，很明显，自己的任务还没有被清楚地理解。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这是因为在宇宙中只有这一种本性，这一种原则，这一种天生的知识和这一种努力。因此，每当我们依据古代学说讨论任务时，不应强加外来的思想于其上或将它们混杂在一起。这样，它们自然会相互融合和渗透。一旦感到需要强加外来的思想或将其混杂在一起，就显然表明自己的任务尚未明确理解。

text.ori_cn: 近时有谓“集义”之功，必须兼搭个“致良知”而后备者，则是“集义”之功尚未了彻也：“集义”之功尚未了彻，适足以为“致良知”之累而已矣。
text.man_en: In recent days it is said that the task of accumulating righteousness must be combined with the extension of innate knowledge before it can be complete. Such a contention shows that the task of accumulating righteousness is not yet thoroughly understood. If the task of accumulating righteousness is not thoroughly understood, the extension of innate knowledge will suffer.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In recent times, it is said that the "set of righteousness" of the work, must also take a "conscience" and back up, is "set of righteousness" of the work is not yet complete: "set of righteousness" of the work is not yet complete: "set of righteousness The work of "collecting righteousness" is not yet complete, and it is enough to think that the "conscience" is just tired.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Recently, it has been said that the merit of "gathering righteousness" must be combined with "leading to conscience" as a backup. This means that the merit of "gathering righteousness" has not yet been fully understood: the merit of "gathering righteousness" has not yet been fully understood, which is enough to be called "gathering righteousness". That’s all.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Recently, it has been said that the practice of 'gathering righteousness' must be combined with the concept of 'extending innate knowledge' for it to be complete. However, if the practice of 'gathering righteousness' is not thoroughly accomplished, it will merely become a burden to 'extending innate knowledge.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 近来有人说，积累义理的任务必须与先天知识的扩展相结合才能完成。这种说法表明，人们对积累义理的任务还没有彻底理解。如果对积累义理的任务理解不透彻，先天知识的扩展就会受到影响。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 近来有人说，积义的任务必须与先天知识的延伸相结合，才能完成。这样的说法，说明我们对积义的任务还没有彻底了解。如果积义的任务没有彻底了解，先天知识的延伸就会受到影响。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 近日来有人说积累正义的任务必须与扩展内在知识结合起来才能完成。这样的说法表明积累正义的任务尚未被彻底理解。如果积累正义的任务没有被彻底理解，扩展内在知识就会受到影响。

text.ori_cn: 谓“致良知”之功，必须兼搭一个“勿忘、勿助”而后明者，则是“致良知”之功尚未了彻也；“致良知”之功尚未了彻也，适足以为“勿忘、勿助”之累而已矣。
text.man_en: To say that the task of the extension of innate knowledge must be combined with the effort not to forget or to help before it becomes clear means that the task of the extension of innate knowledge is not yet thoroughly understood. If the task of the extension of innate knowledge is not yet thoroughly understood, the effort not to forget or help will suffer.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The "to conscience" work, must be accompanied by a "do not forget, do not help" and then clear, is "to conscience" of the work has not yet been thorough also; "to conscience The work of "conscientiousness" is not yet complete, and it is enough to think that "do not forget, do not help" is tired.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that the merit of "developing good conscience" must be combined with "Don't forget, don't help" and then understand it. This means that the merit of "developing conscience" has not yet been fully realized; "Don't forget, don't help" is enough.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the effort of 'cultivating innate knowledge' requires the additional condition of 'not forgetting, not aiding' to be illuminated, then the effort of 'cultivating innate knowledge' is not yet complete; the incompleteness of 'cultivating innate knowledge' merely becomes a burden to 'not forgetting, not aiding'.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果说先天知识的扩展任务必须与不忘或帮助的努力相结合才能变得清晰，这意味着先天知识的扩展任务还没有被彻底理解。如果先天知识的扩展任务还没有被彻底理解，那么不忘初心或助人为乐的努力就会受到影响。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果说扩展先天知识的任务必须与不忘记或帮助的努力结合起来，然后才变得清晰，那就意味着扩展先天知识的任务还没有被彻底理解。如果尚未彻底理解扩展先天知识的任务，那么不忘记或帮助的努力就会受到影响。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 说先天知识的扩展任务必须与不忘记或帮助别人成为明显之前的努力相结合，这意味着先天知识的扩展任务尚未被完全理解。如果先天知识的扩展任务尚未被完全理解，不忘记或帮助的努力将会受到影响。

text.ori_cn: 若此者，皆是就文义上解释牵附，以求混融凑泊，而不曾就自己实工夫上体验，是以论之愈精，而去之愈远。
text.man_en: All such contentions are the results of literal interpretations and farfetched explanations for the purpose of combining together or mixing various elements and not the results of personal realization obtained in one's own concrete task. Consequently, the more refined one's discussion becomes, the farther he is away from the truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If this is the case, they are all explaining and attaching themselves to the meaning of the text in order to blend and integrate, without ever experiencing their own actual work, so the more refined the theory is, the farther away it is.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If this is the case, they are all interpreting it in terms of meaning, in order to blend it in, without ever experiencing it in practice. Therefore, the more refined the discussion, the farther away it will be.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In such cases, all explanations are merely attached to the literal meaning in an attempt to blend and fit, without ever experiencing the actual practice themselves. Therefore, the more meticulously they discuss it, the further they stray from it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所有这些争论都是字面解释和牵强附会的结果，目的是将各种因素组合在一起或混合在一起，而不是在自己的具体工作中获得的个人领悟的结果。因此，一个人的讨论越精炼，他就离真理越远。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所有这些论点都是为了将​​各种因素组合或混合而进行的字面解释和牵强解释的结果，而不是个人在自己的具体工作中得到的认识结果。因此，一个人的讨论越精细，他离真相就越远。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所有这些争论都是字面解释和牵强附会的结果，其目的是为了结合或混合各种元素，而不是通过自己切身任务获得的个人领悟的结果。因此，一个人的讨论越精细，他离真理就越远。

text.ori_cn: 文蔚之论，其于大本达道既已沛然无疑，至于“致知”、“穷理”及“忘、助”等说，时亦有搀和兼搭处，却是区区所谓康庄大道之中，或时横斜迂曲者，到得工夫熟后，自将释然矣。
text.man_en: As to the doctrines of the extension of knowledge and the investigation of the principles of things to the utmost, not forgetting, not helping, and so forth, at times you have forced extraneous ideas upon them or mixed them with other elements. This is why I have said that in riding along the broad highway one sometimes goes obliquely or zigzags, and that after one masters the task everything will be clear to him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Wen Wei's thesis, its in the DaBen DaDao has been abundantly undoubtedly, as for "Zhi Zhi", "poor reason" and "forget, help" and so on, sometimes there are also mixed and match place, but is the district so-called KangZhuang road In the so-called "road to prosperity", or sometimes oblique and circuitous, to get to work after ripe, since it will be released.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wenwei's theory is undoubtedly the basis of Daben Daodao. As for the theories of "zhizhi", "qianli" and "forgetting and assisting", they are sometimes mixed and combined, but they are only among the so-called Kangzhuang Dao. , or those who are sideways and tortuous at times, will be relieved after the skill is matured.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Regarding Wen Wei’s discourse, his understanding of the fundamental principles and the overarching path is both thorough and unambiguous. However, on topics like 'extending knowledge,' 'exploring principles,' and concepts like 'forgetting' and 'assistance,' there are occasional overlaps and interminglings. These can be seen as minor deviations on the broad and clear main path, which one will naturally comprehend and become at ease with after sufficient practice.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 至于知识的扩展和对事物原理的深入探究、不忘初心、不助纣为虐等学说，你有时会把不相干的思想强加于它们，或把它们与其他因素混杂在一起。这就是为什么我说过，在宽阔的大道上骑行时，有时会走斜路或之字形路线，而当一个人掌握了这项任务之后，一切都会豁然开朗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 至于知识广延、究理至极、不忘、不助等学说，有时是强加了一些外来的思想，或者是掺入了其他的成分。所以我说，在宽阔的公路上骑行，有时会走斜路，有时会走弯路，掌握了之后一切就都清楚了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 至于格物致知之说，勿忘勿助等等，有时你们把外来的观念强加在其上，或把它们与其他成分混在一起。这就是为什么我说在人行大道时，有时会走偏斜或曲折之路，而在掌握了任务后，一切将变得清清楚楚。

text.ori_cn: 〔12〕文蔚谓“致知”之说，求之事亲、从兄之间，便觉有所持循者，此段最见近来真切笃实之功。
text.man_en: (12) You said, Wenyu, that when the doctrine of the extension of knowledge is sought in serving one's parents and obeying one's elder brother, it will be felt that there is something concrete to grasp and to follow. This section shows best the result of your recent genuine and concrete effort.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [12] Wen Wei said that the "Zhi Zhi Zhi", seeking to serve relatives, from brother to brother, then feel that there is something to follow, this paragraph is the most recent true to the work of the truth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔12〕 Wen Wei talks about the theory of "Zhizhi". Those who seek for things from close relatives and from brothers will feel that they have something to follow. This section is the most effective and practical in recent times.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "Wenwei states that the concept of 'extending knowledge' can be sought in the relationships between serving one's parents and following one's elder brothers, where one clearly feels a guiding principle. This passage most clearly embodies the recent genuine and earnest efforts."
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (12)文宇，你说过，在侍奉父母、孝顺兄长中寻求知识的外延，就会感到有具体的东西可以把握和遵循。本节最能体现您近期真切而具体的努力成果。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (12)文鱼你说，事奉父母、服从兄长，追求知识广博的道理，就会感到有具体的把握和遵循。本节最好地展示了您最近真诚而具体的努力的结果。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 文郁，你说过，当把知识的扩展用在侍奉父母和服从兄长上时，会觉得有具体的东西可以掌握和遵循。这一部分最能体现你最近真诚和具体努力的成果。

text.ori_cn: 但以此自为不妨，自有得力处，以此遂为定说教人，却未免又有因药发病之患，亦不可不一讲也。
text.man_en: However, if from this you think that if you follow this procedure yourself, it will be effective, and forthwith teach it to others as an established doctrine, you will not be free from the defect of incurring disease because of the application of medicine. This matter should not be passed over without comment.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, this is not as good as it should be, it has its own strength, so as to teach people as a rule, but inevitably, there is the risk of illness due to medicine, but also can not not not be a talk also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, it is okay to use it as a self-contained method, and it has its own advantages. If you use it as a definite guide to teach people, you will inevitably run into the risk of getting sick due to medicine, so you must also explain it at the same time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, considering this is not harmful in itself, it indeed has its own merits. Yet, if it becomes a fixed doctrine when teaching others, it might, unfortunately, lead to issues akin to ailments caused by medicine. This risk cannot be overlooked and must be addressed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，如果因此就认为只要自己照着做就会有效，并将其作为既定的教义传授给他人，那就无法摆脱因用药而致病的缺陷。对这个问题，我们不应该不加评论地一笔带过。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 然而，如果由此认为自己照此做法，就会有效，并立即将其作为既定的教义传授给他人，那么，就不能免于因用药而患病的毛病了。这件事不应该不加评论而被忽略。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，如果因此你认为自己遵循这个程序会有效，并立即将其作为既定教义传授给他人，那么你将无法避免因用药而产生的病症。这件事不应忽视不作评论。

text.ori_cn: 盖良知只是一个天理自然明觉发见处，只是一个真诚恻怛，便是他本体。
text.man_en: Innate knowledge is nothing other than the Principle of Nature where the natural clear consciousness reveals itself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conscience is only a place where the natural and clear understanding of the Divine Principle can be seen, and it is only a place of sincerity and compassion, which is the essence of his being.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Gai Liangzhi is just a natural enlightenment of heavenly principles. It is just a sincere compassion, which is his true nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Innate knowledge is merely the natural and clear manifestation of heavenly principles; it is simply a genuine compassion, and this is its essence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识无非是自然的原理，在这里，自然的清晰意识显现出来。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先天知识无非是自然法则，自然清明的意识显现出来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天赋知识无非是自然原则，其中自然的明晰意识得以显现。

text.ori_cn: 故致此良知之真诚恻怛以事亲便是孝，致此良知之真诚恻怛以从兄便是弟，致此良知之真诚恻怛以事君便是忠，只是一个良知，一个真诚恻怛。
text.man_en: Its original substance is merely true sincerity and commiseration. Therefore, when the true sincerity and commiseration of this innate knowledge is extended to serve one's parents, it becomes filial piety. When the true sincerity and commiseration of this innate knowledge is extended to obey one's elder brother, it becomes brotherly respect. And when the true sincerity and commiseration of this innate knowledge is extended to serve one's ruler, it becomes loyalty. There is but one innate knowledge, one true sincerity and commiseration.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, to serve one's parents with the sincere compassion of conscience is filial piety, to serve one's brother with the sincere compassion of conscience is brotherhood, and to serve one's ruler with the sincere compassion of conscience is loyalty; it is only one conscience and one sincere compassion.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, to express the sincere compassion of this conscience, to serve relatives is filial piety, to express the sincere compassion of conscience, to obey the elder brother is to be younger, to express the sincere compassion of conscience, to serve the king is loyalty, just a conscience, a sincere compassion Tao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus applying the genuine sincerity and compassion of this conscience to serve one's parents is filial piety, applying it to follow one's elder brother is brotherhood, applying it to serve one's sovereign is loyalty. It is but one conscience, one genuine sincerity and compassion.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 其本质只是真挚和恻隐之心。因此，当这种先天知识的真挚和恻隐之心扩展到侍奉父母时，它就成了孝。如果把这种先天知识的真挚和恻隐之心扩展到服从兄长，那就是悌。如果把这种先天知识的诚意和恻隐之心用于侍奉君主，那就成了 "忠"。只有一种先天的知识，只有一种真正的诚意和恻隐之心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 它的本质只是真诚和慈悲。因此，当这种与生俱来的真诚和同情心延伸到侍奉父母时，那就是孝。当这种与生俱来的真诚和同情心延伸到服从长辈时，就变成了兄弟般的尊重。当这种与生俱来的知识的真正真诚和同情延伸到服务一个人的统治者时，它就变成了忠诚。只有一种与生俱来的知识，一种真正的真诚和同情心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 其原本的实质只是纯粹的真诚和怜悯。因此，当这种天赋知识的真诚和怜悯扩展到服务父母时，就成了孝顺。当这种天赋知识的真诚和怜悯扩展到服从兄长时，就成了敬兄。而当这种天赋知识的真诚和怜悯扩展到服务君主时，就成了忠诚。只有一个天赋知识，一个真挚和怜悯。

text.ori_cn: 若是从兄的良知不能致其真诚恻怛，即是事亲的良知不能致其真诚恻怛矣：事君的良知不能致其真诚恻怛，即是从兄的良知不能致其真诚恻怛矣。
text.man_en: If in obeying one's elder brother the true sincerity and commiseration of innate knowledge cannot be extended, they cannot be extended in serving one's parents. If they cannot be extended in serving one's ruler, they cannot be extended in obeying one's elder brother.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the conscience of a subordinate brother cannot be sincere and compassionate, then the conscience of a relative cannot be sincere and compassionate: if the conscience of a ruler cannot be sincere and compassionate, then the conscience of a subordinate brother cannot be sincere and compassionate.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If following your brother's conscience cannot lead to sincere compassion, it means that serving your relatives' conscience cannot lead to sincere compassion. If serving your brother's conscience cannot lead to sincere compassion, it means that following your brother's conscience cannot lead to sincere compassion. .
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the elder brother's conscience cannot bring forth genuine empathy, it is as if the filial conscience cannot bring forth genuine empathy; if the patient's conscience cannot bring forth genuine empathy towards the ruler, it is as if the elder brother's conscience cannot bring forth genuine empathy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果在顺从兄长时不能发扬先天知识的真正诚意和恻隐之心，那么在侍奉父母时也不能发扬这种诚意和恻隐之心。事君不能至，事兄亦不能至。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果在服从兄长时不能发挥出真正的真诚和慈悲的先天知识，那么在侍奉父母时也不能发挥出这些真诚和同情心。不能长于侍奉君主，就不能长于服从兄长。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果在听从兄长时无法扩展出由先天知识产生的真正诚意和怜悯之心，那么在侍奉父母时也无法扩展出这种真正诚意和怜悯之心。如果在侍奉君主时无法扩展出这种真正诚意和怜悯之心，那么在听从兄长时也无法扩展出这种真正诚意和怜悯之心。

text.ori_cn: 故致得事君的良知，便是致却从兄的良知，致得从兄的良知，便是致却事亲的良知。
text.man_en: Therefore, to have extended the innate knowledge that serves the ruler is to have extended the innate knowledge that obeys one's elder brother. To have extended the innate knowledge that obeys one's elder brother is to have extended the innate knowledge that serves one's parents.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the conscience that serves the ruler is the conscience that serves the brother, and the conscience that serves the brother is the conscience that serves the relative.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, to have the conscience of serving the king is to serve the conscience of the elder brother, and to gain the conscience of the elder brother is to serve the conscience of one's relatives.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, achieving the conscience in serving one's lord is the same as achieving the conscience in dealing with one's brother. Achieving the conscience in dealing with one's brother is the same as achieving the conscience in serving one's parents.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故延先天之知以事君，即延先天之知以事兄也。延先天之知以事兄者，延先天之知以事父母也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故扩展了侍奉君王的良知，就是扩展了服从兄长的良知。弘扬了孝顺兄长的良知，就是弘扬了侍奉父母的良知。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，扩展服务君主的天赋知识就是扩展服从兄长的天赋知识。扩展服从兄长的天赋知识就是扩展服务父母的天赋知识。

text.ori_cn: 不是事君的良知不能致，却须又从事亲的良知上去扩充将来。
text.man_en: This does not mean that if the innate knowledge that serves one's ruler cannot be extended one has to develop the innate knowledge that serves one's parents.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not that the conscience of the ruler cannot be achieved, but that the conscience of the relatives must be enlarged for the future.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It’s not that you can’t do it with your conscience, but you need to use your parents’ conscience to expand the future.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is not that the ruler's conscience cannot be fully realized, but rather it must be further expanded based on the parent's conscience.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这并不意味着，如果不能扩展为君主服务的先天知识，就必须发展为父母服务的先天知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这并不意味着，如果为君主服务的先天知识无法扩展，那么就必须发展为父母服务的先天知识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这并不意味着，如果不能扩展为君王服务的先天知识，就必须发展为父母服务的先天知识。

text.ori_cn: 如此，又是脱却本原，著在支节上求了。
text.man_en: That would be departing from the root and looking for it in twigs and branches.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In this way, we are again stripped of the original principle, and we seek in the branches and knots.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In this way, we are getting rid of the origin and focusing on the details.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, once again departing from the root, we focus on the branches.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那就是离开根本，在树枝和树杈上寻找根本。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是从根本出发，在细枝末节中寻找它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就像舍本逐末一样。

text.ori_cn: 良知只是一个，随他发见流行处，当下具足，更无去来，不须假借。
text.man_en: There is only one innate knowledge. In its manifestation and universal operation, it is then and there selfsufficient. It comes from nowhere and goes nowhere. It depends on nothing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Conscientiousness is only one, and as he sees where it is popular, he has it at the present moment, and there is no more going or coming, and there is no need to pretend.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Conscience is just one thing. It can be found wherever it is popular. It is present at the moment. There is no need to come or go, and there is no need to borrow money.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Conscience is but one; wherever it manifests and operates, it is fully present at that very moment, without coming or going, requiring no external aid.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先天知识只有一个。在它的显现和普遍运作中，它是自给自足的。它不知从何而来，也不知从何而去。它不依赖于任何事物。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有一种与生俱来的知识。就其表现形式和普遍运作而言，它是自给自足的。它无处而来，无处可去。它不依赖于任何东西。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 先天的知识只有一个。在它的表现和普遍运作中，它自始至终自足。它无处而来，无处而去。它不依靠任何东西。

text.ori_cn: 然其发见流行处，却自有轻重厚薄，毫发不容增减者，所谓天然自有之中也。
text.man_en: However, in its manifestation and universal operation, there are degrees of importance and intensity to and from which not the slightest amount can be added or subtracted. This is what is called “the equilibrium that is selfexistent in everything. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, the popularity of its hair, but its own weight, thickness, hair can not be increased or decreased, the so-called natural own also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, where it is popular, it has its own weight and thickness, and cannot be increased or decreased at all. This is what is called nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nevertheless, when it is revealed and propagated, it possesses its own variations in weight and thickness, which cannot tolerate the slightest increase or decrease. This is what is referred to as the natural inherent quality.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 然而，在它的表现和普遍运行中，其重要性和强度是有度的，不能有丝毫增减。这就是所谓的 "万物自存的平衡"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 然而，在其表现和普遍运作中，重要性和强度是有一定程度的，不能有丝毫的增加或减少。这就是所谓的“万物自存的平衡”。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然而，在其表现和普遍运作中，有着不同程度的重要性和强度，这些都无法增加或减少丝毫。这就是所谓的“万物中自存的平衡”。

text.ori_cn: 虽则轻重厚薄，毫发不容增减，而原又只是一个：虽则只是一个，而其间轻重厚薄，又毫发不容增减：若可得增减，若须假借，即已非其真诚恻怛之本体矣；此良知之妙用，所以无方体，无穷尽，语大天下莫能载，语小天下莫能破者也。
text.man_en: Although there are degrees of importance and intensity to and from which not the slightest amount can be added or subtracted, at bottom it is only one. And although it is only one, its degrees of importance and intensity cannot be altered in the least. If it can be altered or if it depends on anything, it will no longer be the original substance of true sincerity and commiseration. This is why the wonderful functioning of innate knowledge has neither spatial restriction nor physical form and is unlimited. If one speaks of its greatness, nothing in the world can contain it, and if one speaks of its smallness, nothing in the world can split it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Although it is light and heavy, thick and thin, hair can not be increased or decreased, and the original is only one: although it is only one, and between the light and heavy, thick and thin, and hair can not be increased or decreased: if it can be increased or decreased, if it is necessary to pretend, that is not its sincere compassionate nature; this is the wonderful use of conscience, so there is no square body, infinity, the language of the world can not be loaded, the language of the world can not break the small one also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although it is only one, its weight and thickness cannot be increased or decreased at all. If it can be increased or decreased, if it must be borrowed, it is no longer the true nature of its sincere compassion. This wonderful function of conscience has no square shape and is infinite. It cannot be contained in the big world, and it cannot be broken in the small world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Although its weight, thickness, and thinness allow no tolerance for even a hair's breadth of alteration, its essence remains singular: though it is singular, within it, the weight, thickness, and thinness also allow no tolerance for even a hair's breadth of alteration. If it could be altered, if it required borrowed means, then it would no longer be the true, genuine essence of compassionate sympathy; this is the wondrous function of innate knowledge, hence it has no fixed form, no end. Speaking of it in grand terms, the world cannot contain it; speaking of it in minute terms, the world cannot break it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽然它的重要性和强烈程度不容丝毫增减，但归根结底它只有一个。虽然只有一个，但其重要性和强度却丝毫不能改变。如果它可以被改变，或者如果它依赖于任何东西，那么它就不再是真正的真诚和同情的原始实质。这就是为什么先天知识的奇妙功能既没有空间限制，也没有物理形式，而且是无限的。言其大者，天下莫能容；言其小者，天下莫能裂。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 虽然重要性和强度有一定的程度，不能加减任何一点，但归根结底只有一个。尽管它只是其中之一，但它的重要性和强度是丝毫不能改变的。如果它可以改变，或者取决于什么，它就不再是真正的真诚和慈悲的本质了。因此，先天知识的奇妙作用，既不受空间限制，也不受物质形态的限制，是无限的。言其大，则天下无物能容；言其小，则天下无物能分。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然重要性和强度各有程度，且不能加减丝毫，但其本质只有一个。而且虽然只有一个，其重要性和强度也不能稍有改变。如果可以改变或依赖于任何事物，它就不再是真诚和同情的原始本质。这就是为什么先天知识的奇妙功能没有空间限制，也没有物理形态，并且是无限的。如果说它的伟大，世上没有什么能够包含它，如果说它的微小，世上没有什么能够分裂它。

text.ori_cn: 〔13〕孟氏“尧舜之道，孝弟而已”者，使就人之良知发见得最真切笃厚、不容蔽昧处提省人，于人于事君、处友、仁民、爱物、与凡动静语默间，皆只是致他那一念事亲、从兄真诚恻怛的良知，即自然无不是道。
text.man_en: (13) Mencius said, “The Way of Yao and Shun was simply that of filial piety and brotherly respect. ” He said so because he wanted to call people's attention to the point where the manifestation of innate knowledge is the most genuine and earnest and in which no obscuration can be allowed, so that in their serving the ruler, living with friends, being humane to all people and kind to creatures, and in all their activities and tranquillity, and speech and silence, they will only extend the truly sincere and commiserate innate knowledge which is expressed in the single desire to serve one's parents and obey one's elder brother. Then everything will naturally be in accord with the Way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [13] Meng's "The Way of Yao and Shun is only filial piety and brotherhood" is to make people's conscience the most sincere and profound, and not to be obscured, to serve the king, to deal with friends, to be kind to the people, to love things, and to move, speak and silence, all just to his conscience that is sincere and compassionate to serve his relatives and brothers, that is, naturally, everything is the Way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔13〕 Meng's "The way of Yao and Shun is just to be filial to one's younger brother", which makes people's conscience the most sincere and sincere, and does not allow people to be obscured. It treats people in serving the king, being friends, benevolent to the people, and loving things. All the movements, silences, and silences are just to express his conscience of caring for one another and being sincere and compassionate to his brothers, which is the way of nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mencius's assertion 'The way of Yao and Shun lies only in filial piety and brotherly respect' means that one should bring forth the truest, most sincerely earnest and unshakable part of one's innate knowledge to contemplate upon. Whether it be in one's dealings with the ruler, with friends, in benevolence towards the people, love for all living things, or in every movement, stillness, speech, and silence, all should be rooted in that single, genuine and empathetic thought of serving one's parents and respecting one's elder brothers. This, naturally, is nothing but the Way.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (13）孟子说："尧舜之道，孝悌而已矣。"孟子之所以这样说，是因为他想让人们注意到先天之知的表现是最真实、最恳切的，不允许有丝毫的朦胧，这样，人们在侍奉君主、与朋友相处、与人为善、善待生物，以及在一切活动和安宁、言语和沉默中，都只会把真正真诚、恳切的先天之知表现在侍奉父母、服从兄长的单一愿望中。这样，一切自然就合乎大道了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (13) 孟子曰：“尧、舜之道，无非是孝悌之道。 ”他这样说，是想叫人们注意，先天知识的表现是最真挚的，不容有任何遮蔽，从而侍奉君主、与朋友相处、仁爱他人。一切人，善待众生，一切动与静，言与静，都只会表现出真正的真诚和慈悲的本性知识，这种知识表现在侍奉父母和服从兄长的单一愿望中。那么一切自然就符合道了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孟子说：“尧舜之道无他，孝弟而已矣。”他这么说是因为他想引起人们的注意，让他们认识到天赋知识发露的地方是最真诚和恳切的，不能有任何遮蔽，这样在事君、与朋友相处、仁爱所有人、善待生物，以及所有活动与静止、言语和沉默之时，他们只会延伸那种在事父母、顺从兄长时所表现出的真诚恻隐之心。如此一来，一切自然都与道相合。

text.ori_cn: 盖天下之事虽千变万化，至于不可穷诘，而但惟致此事亲，从兄一念真诚恻怛之良知以应之，则更无有遗缺渗漏者，正谓其只有此一个良知故也。
text.man_en: Although there is an infinite amount of change and variety in the world, so much so that it is impossible to investigate all of them, if one responds to them by merely extending this truly sincere and commiserate innate knowledge expressed in the single desire to serve one's parents and obey one's elder brother, nothing will be left out of its operation. This is because there is only one innate knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Covering the world, although the world's affairs are changing, to the inexhaustible, but only to this matter pro, from the brother of a sincere compassionate conscience to respond to, there is no lack of leakage, it is said that it is only this a conscience, so also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although the affairs of the world are ever-changing and cannot be questioned endlessly, as long as this is a close relationship and a conscience of sincerity and compassion is used to respond to it, there will be no omissions or leaks. This is why it is said that there is only one conscience. .
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Although the affairs of the world may change and evolve endlessly and cannot be fully fathomed, if one responds to them with the true and compassionate conscience of a brother, nothing will be left out or missed. This is because there is only this one genuine conscience at work.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽然世间变化万千，无穷无尽，无法一一探究，但只要将这种真正真诚的、惺惺相惜的先天之知扩展开来，表现为 "事父母，顺兄长 "这一个愿望，就不会有任何遗漏。这是因为先天知识只有一个。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尽管世界上存在无限多的变化和多样性，以至于不可能对所有这些变化和多样性进行研究，但如果一个人仅仅通过扩展这种真正真诚和富有同情心的内在知识来回应它们，这种知识表达在服务于一个人的单一愿望中。孝顺父母，服从兄长，其运作不会有任何遗漏。这是因为只有一种先天知识。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽然世界上有无穷无尽的变化和多样性，以至于不可能全部调查，但如果只是通过将这种真正诚挚和同情的天赋知识扩展到单一愿望上，即服务父母和服从兄长的愿望来回应它们，那么它的运作就不会遗漏任何东西。这是因为只有一种天赋的知识。

text.ori_cn: 事亲、从兄一念良知之外，更无有良知可致得者。
text.man_en: Outside of this innate knowledge expressed in the single desire to serve one's parents and to obey one's elder brother, there is no other innate knowledge that can be extended.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no conscience that can be attained apart from the conscience of serving one's relatives and one's brother.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Apart from having a close conscience and following your brother, there is no one who can achieve this without a conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Aside from filial piety towards parents and brotherly respect, there is no other moral consciousness to be pursued.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 除了 "侍奉父母 "和 "孝顺兄长 "这两种与生俱来的知识之外，没有其他先天知识可以延伸。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 除了这种以侍奉父母和服从兄长的单一愿望所表达的先天知识之外，没有其他先天知识可以扩展。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 除了这种体现在侍奉父母和服从兄长这一单一愿望中的天性知识外，没有其他可以扩展的天性知识。

text.ori_cn: 故曰：“尧舜之道，孝弟而已矣。”
text.man_en: Therefore Mencius said, “The Way of Yao and Shun was simply that of filial piety and brotherly respect. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, he said, "The way of Yao and Shun is just filial piety and brotherhood."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is said: "The way of Yao and Shun is just to be filial to your younger brother."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore it is said: 'The way of Yao and Shun is nothing more than filial piety and brotherly respect.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所以孟子说："尧舜之道，孝悌而已矣。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故孟子曰：“尧、舜之道，无非是孝悌之道。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，孟子说：“尧舜之道只不过是孝顺父母和兄弟友爱。”

text.ori_cn: 此所以为“惟精惟一”之学，放之四海而皆准，“施谐后世而无朝夕”者也。
text.man_en: This is why it is the learning of refinement and singlemindedness, and will be correct when expanding in all four directions and timeless when applied to later generations.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is why the "only fine but one" of the study, universally applicable, "Shi Harmonisation of future generations and no day and night" also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is why it is a "refined and unique" study, which is applicable to all countries and is "to harmonize future generations without a day or night".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is the study of 'utmost precision and singularity', universally applicable and enduring throughout all times.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所以说，它是精进之学、一心之学，放之四海而皆准，用之于后世则永恒不变。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故此为精专之学，四通而正，施于后世而永恒。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是为什么它是精炼和专注的学习，在四个方向上扩展时是正确的，在应用于后代时是永恒的。

text.ori_cn: 文蔚云：“欲于事亲、从兄之间，而求所谓良知之学。”
text.man_en: You say that you desire to seek the learning of innate knowledge in serving your parents and obeying your elder brother.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Wen Wei said, "I want to seek the so-called study of conscience between serving my relatives and my brother."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wen Weiyun said: "If you want to be close to relatives and follow brothers, you should seek the so-called knowledge of conscience."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wen Wei Yun said, 'I wish to seek the so-called knowledge of good conscience between serving my parents and following my elder brother.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你说你希望在侍奉父母和服从兄长的过程中学习先天知识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你说你想在侍奉父母、服从兄长中寻求先天知识的学习。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你说你希望通过在事奉父母和服从兄长中寻求先天知识的学习。

text.ori_cn: 就自己用功得力处如此说，亦无不可：若曰致其良知之真诚恻怛以求尽夫事亲，从兄之道焉，亦无不可也。
text.man_en: From the point of view of efficiency in your own effort, it is not wrong to say so. It is also all right if you say that one extends the true sincerity and commiseration of innate knowledge in order to practice the way of serving one's parents and obeying one's elder brother to the fullest.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: On their own efforts to say so, there is no problem: if said to the conscience of the sincere compassion in order to do everything to serve their parents, from the brother's way, there is no problem.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is not wrong to say this in terms of one's own efforts. If it is said that one should show sincere compassion to his conscience in order to serve his husband as a family, it is also not wrong to follow the brother's way.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is also acceptable to say this about one's own diligent efforts: if one aims to achieve the utmost filial piety and adhere to the ways of serving one's parents and following the elder brother, by exerting the genuine sincerity and compassion of one's innate knowledge, this too can be considered commendable.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从自身努力的效率来看，这样说并没有错。如果说，一个人将先天知识的真挚和恻隐之心发扬光大，以践行尽孝父母、顺从兄长之道，也是可以的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从自己努力的效率来看，这样说并没有错。你说发发真知慈悲，以尽孝父母顺兄之道，也可以。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从自身努力的效率角度来说，这样说没有错。也可以说是将良知的真诚和同情心发扬光大，以尽孝尽弟为目标来实践。

text.ori_cn: 明道云：“行仁自孝、弟始。
text.man_en: Ch'eng Mingtao [Ch'eng Hao] said, “The practice of humanity begins with filial piety and brotherly respect. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ming Dao said, "The practice of benevolence begins with filial piety and discipleship.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ming Dao says: “Being benevolent begins with filial piety and brotherhood.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mingdao said, 'Practicing benevolence starts with filial piety and brotherly respect.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 钱明涛[钱镠]说："人道之行，始于孝悌。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 程明涛说：“行人之道，始于孝悌。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 程明道（程颢）说：“仁的实践始于孝顺父母和兄弟间的尊重。”

text.ori_cn: 孝、弟是仁之一事，谓之行仁之本则可，谓是仁之本则不可。”
text.man_en: Filial piety and brotherly respect are items in the practice of humanity. It is all right to say that they are the root of the practice of humanity but not all right to say that they are the root of humanity itself. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Filial piety and discipleship are one of the things of benevolence; it is permissible to call them the essence of the practice of benevolence, but it is not permissible to call them the essence of benevolence."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Filial piety and brotherhood are things of benevolence. It is okay to say that it is the basic principle of benevolence, but it is not possible to say that it is the basic principle of benevolence. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Filial piety and fraternal duty are aspects of benevolence; calling them the foundations of practicing benevolence is appropriate, but calling them the essence of benevolence is not.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 孝悌是人道实践的项目。说它们是人道实践的根基可以，但说它们是人道本身的根基则不尽然。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 孝悌是人性的实践。说它们是人类实践的根源可以，但说它们是人类本身的根源就不行了。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 孝悌是仁的实行项目。说它们是仁的实行的根本是可以的，但说它们是仁本身的根本是不可以的。

text.ori_cn: 其说是矣。
text.man_en: What is said is correct.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is said to be true.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: That's right.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is said so.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所言非虚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所说的是正确的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所说的是正确的。

text.ori_cn: 闲有搀搭处，则前已言之矣。
text.man_en: As I have said before, you are not entirely free from forcing extraneous ideas upon things or mixing them with other elements.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If there is a place where there is an adulteration, it has already been said.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you have time to help me, I've already said that.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If you have some spare time for an addition, it has already been mentioned earlier.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正如我之前所说的，你并不能完全避免将不相干的想法强加于事物或将它们与其他元素混合在一起。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 正如我之前所说，你并不能完全摆脱将无关的想法强加于事物或将它们与其他元素混合的情况。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正如我之前所说，你还没有完全摆脱强加无关的想法或将它们与其他元素混杂在一起。

text.ori_cn: 惟浚之言，亦未为不是。
text.man_en: What Weichun said is not wrong.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: But Joon's words are not wrong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wei Chun's words are not wrong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nonetheless, Jun's words were not entirely incorrect.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 魏春说的没有错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 伟春说的并没有错。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 魏纯说的没错。

text.ori_cn: 在文蔚须有取于惟浚之言而后尽，在惟浚又须有取于文蔚之言而后明：不然，则亦未免各有倚着之病也。
text.man_en: On your part, you need to take in his words before yours can be fully stated, and on his part he needs to take in your words before his can be made clear. Otherwise, each of you will have the defect of relying on and clinging to your own viewpoint.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the case of Wen Wei, it is necessary to take the words of Wen Wei before they are exhausted, and in the case of Wen Wei, it is necessary to take the words of Wen Wei before they are clear: if not, they will not be free from the disease of leaning on each other.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In Wen Wei, one must draw from Wei Chun's words and then explain them, and in Wei Chun, one must draw from Wen Wei's words and then clarify them. Otherwise, it is inevitable that each one will suffer from the disease of relying on others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wenwei must draw on Weijun's words to fully comprehend, and Weijun must similarly draw on Wenwei's words to gain clarity; otherwise, they would each inevitably suffer from partiality.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 就你而言，你需要吸收他的话，然后才能完整地表达你的观点；就他而言，他需要吸收你的话，然后才能清楚地表达他的观点。否则，你们每个人都会有依赖和坚持自己观点的缺陷。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你要先听懂他的话，才能把你的话说清楚；他也要听懂你的话，才能把他的话说清楚。否则，你们每个人都会有依赖、坚持自己观点的毛病。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 就你而言，你需要在充分表达自己之前先听取他的话；就他而言，他需要在说清楚自己的话之前先听取你的意见。否则，你们每个人都会有依赖并固守自己观点的缺陷。

text.ori_cn: 舜察迩言而询刍荛，非是以迩言当察，刍荛当询，而后如此，乃良知之发见流行，光明圆莹，更无挂碍遮隔处，此所以谓之大知；才有执着意必，其知便小矣。
text.man_en: Emperor Shun examined the simple words of others and asked questions of grass and reed cutters. He did not do so because simple words should be examined and grass and reed cutters should be questioned. Rather, his behavior was the manifestation and universal operation of his innate knowledge which was clear and perfect, without any obstruction or obscuration. This is why it is called great knowledge. As soon as there is any clinging to arbitrariness of opinion or dogmatism, knowledge becomes small.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Shun's observation of the dead and enquiry of the mowers was not based on the fact that the dead were to be observed and the mowers were to be enquired about, but on the fact that the conscience was so bright and clear that there was no obstacle to it, which is why it is called a great knowledge, but if one is obsessed with the idea, one's knowledge is small.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Shun observed what was said and asked about it, not because the words should be examined and the words should be inquired. This was the result of the wisdom's discovery and popularization. It was bright and clear, and there were no obstacles to cover the gap. This is why it is called great knowledge. Only when you have persistence, your knowledge will be small.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Shun examined nearby opinions and consulted with the common people, not because nearby opinions must be examined and common people must be consulted, but rather because this represented the manifestation and circulation of innate knowledge, clear and unobstructed. This is why it is called great wisdom; once there is an attachment to a fixed idea, that wisdom becomes limited.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 舜帝察言观色，问草问苇。他之所以这样做，并不是因为简单的言语就应该被考证，草和芦苇就应该被询问。相反，他的行为是他与生俱来的知识的体现和普遍运行，这种知识清晰而完美，没有任何障碍或遮蔽。这就是它被称为 "大知 "的原因。一旦执着于武断的观点或教条主义，知识就会变得渺小。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 舜帝审视别人的简单言语，向割草的人询问问题。他没有这样做，因为应该检查简单的单词，应该质疑割草和芦苇的人。相反，他的行为是他先天知识的表现和普遍运作，它清晰而完美，没有任何阻碍或遮蔽。这就是为什么它被称为大知识。一旦执着于任意意见或教条主义，知识就会变得渺小。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 舜帝审视他人的简短言辞，并询问草芥之人。他这样做并不是因为简短言辞需要审视，草芥之人需要被询问。而是因为他的行为是他天赋知识的表现和普遍运用，这种知识清晰而完美，没有任何阻碍或遮蔽。这就是所谓的大智。一旦有了任何固执己见或教条主义的执着，知识就变得渺小。

text.ori_cn: 讲学中自有去取分辨，然就心地上着实用工夫，却须如此方是。
text.man_en: Naturally, in the course of discussion, distinctions and adjustments will be made. However, for the mind to be engaged in a genuine and earnest task, one must proceed in this manner.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a way to differentiate between lectures, but this is the only way to make a real effort on the heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a need for discernment in teaching, but it is necessary to put practical skills into practice.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In academic endeavors, there are naturally distinctions to be made and preferences to be discerned, but when it comes to truly applying oneself wholeheartedly, it must be done in this manner.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当然，在讨论过程中，会有区别和调整。然而，要想真正认真地进行思考，就必须这样做。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当然，在讨论过程中也会有所区分和调整。然而，为了让头脑从事一项真正而认真的任务，一个人必须以这种方式进行。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 自然地，在讨论的过程中，会有区分和调整。然而，若要心智投入到一个真正且认真的任务中，就必须以这种方式进行。

text.ori_cn: 〔15〕“尽心”三节，区区曾有“生知、学知、困知”之说，颇已明白，无可疑者。
text.man_en: (15) With reference to the three sections on exerting one's mind to the utmost [preserving one's mind, and not allowing any doublemindedness], I have elaborated on the ideas that some people are born with knowledge [and can exert their minds to the utmost], some learn through study [and can preserve their minds], and some learn through hard work [and can allow no doublemindedness]. My exposition was quite clear and should not be questioned.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [15] "Diligence" three sections, the district had a "born to know, learning to know, difficult to know" said, quite understandable, there is no doubt.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔15〕 In the three sections of "devoting one's heart", there has been a saying of "generating knowledge, learning knowledge, and struggling to know". It is quite clear and there is no doubt about it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [15] In the three passages of 'Exerting the Mind,' Zhu Xi once mentioned the concepts of 'innate knowledge, learned knowledge, and struggling knowledge.' This is quite clear and beyond doubt.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (15) 关于 "尽心""存心""不二心 "三节，我阐述了 "天生我材必有用""读书破万卷""下笔如有神""学而时习之""勤学苦练""不二心 "等观点。我的阐述非常清楚，不应受到质疑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: (15)我以尽心三节，阐述有的人生而有知，能尽心。 ]，有的人通过学习来学习[可以保存心]，有的人通过努力学习[并且可以不容许有二心]。我的阐述已经很清楚了，不应该受到质疑。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 关于尽心尽力的三个方面（保持心灵，不允许有二心），我详细说明了一些人生而知之（并且能够尽心尽力），一些通过学习而知之（并且能够保持心灵），一些通过努力而知之（并且能够不允许有二心）。我的阐述相当清楚，不应有任何疑问。

text.ori_cn: 盖尽心、知性、知天者，不必说存心、养性，事天，不必说夭寿不贰、修身以俟，而存心、养悾与修身以俟之功已在其中矣：存心、养性、事天者，虽未到得尽心、知天的地位，然已是在那里做个求到尽心、知天的工夫，更不必说夭寿不贰，修身以俟，而夭寿不贰，修身己俟之功已在其中矣。
text.man_en: For one who exerts his mind to the utmost, knows his nature, and knows Heaven, there is no need to talk about preserving the mind, nourishing the nature, and serving Heaven, or about not allowing any doublemindedness regardless of longevity or brevity of life and about cultivating one's personal life while waiting for the mandate of Heaven to take its own course, for what he does already involves these efforts. Although he who preserves his mind, nourishes his nature, and serves Heaven has not attained the position of exerting the mind to the utmost and knowing Heaven, yet in so doing he has already found the task of exerting the mind to the utmost and of knowing Heaven. v There is no need to talk about having no double mindedness regardless of longevity or brevity of life and about cultivating the personal life while waiting for the mandate of Heaven to take its own course, for what he does already involves these efforts.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Covering the heart, know the nature, know the sky, do not have to say that the heart, nourish the nature, the matter of the sky, do not have to say that the early life is not two, cultivate the body in order to wait, and the heart, nourish the simple-minded and the cultivation of the body in order to wait for the work has been in it: the heart, nourish the nature, the matter of the sky, although not to get the heart, know the position of the sky, but it is already there to do the work of a seek to do the heart, know the sky, and do not need to say that the early life is not two, cultivate the body in order to wait for the time, and the life is not two, cultivate the body in order to wait for the work has been in it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To cover the heart, intellectual nature, and knowledge of heaven, we don’t need to talk about cultivating the heart, nourishing the nature, and serving heaven. We don’t need to talk about longevity and cultivating the body as soon as possible. The merits of cultivating the mind, cultivating the nature, and cultivating the body as soon as possible are already in it: cultivating the mind, nourishing the nature, and doing things. Although the heavenly beings have not yet reached the stage of perfecting their hearts and understanding heaven, they have already made efforts to seek and fully understand heaven. Not to mention that they will not have to live long to cultivate their bodies, but they will not have to live long to cultivate themselves. The merits of Qi are already in it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who fully commit their hearts, understand their nature, and comprehend the way of Heaven do not need to explicitly talk about preserving their hearts, nurturing their nature, or serving Heaven; nor do they need to emphasize unwavering longevity or cultivating themselves in preparation, as the effort of preserving one's heart, nurturing one's nature, and cultivating oneself is already encompassed within. Likewise, those who preserve their hearts, nurture their nature, and serve Heaven, although not yet reaching the level of fully committing their hearts and understanding Heaven, are already engaging in the work that leads to fully committing their hearts and understanding Heaven. Therefore, mentioning unwavering longevity and cultivating oneself in preparation is unnecessary, because the effort of unwavering longevity and self-cultivation is already embedded within.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 对于尽心、知性、知天的人来说，根本不需要谈什么存心、养性、奉天，也不需要谈什么长生久视、一心不乱，更不需要谈什么修身养性、听天由命，因为他所做的已经包含了这些努力。存心养性，事天者，虽未至于尽心知天之境，然已得尽心知天之要矣。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尽心而知性而知天者，不言存心养性事天，不言长短不二心。以及在等待天命的同时修养自己的个人生活，因为他所做的事情已经涉及到这些努力。守心、养性、事天者，虽未达到尽心知天的境界，但已然找到了尽心知天的任务。天堂。 v 不必讲生命的长短不二心，待天命而修养个人生活，因为他所做的事情已经包含了这些努力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 对于一个全力以赴、了解自己的本性和了解天命的人来说，不需要谈论保持心志、培养本性和事奉天命，以及不论生命长短都不允许有任何三心二意，并在等待天命的同时修养身心，因为他所做的已经包含了这些努力。虽然保持心志、培养本性和事奉天命的人还没有达到全力以赴和知天命的境地，但是在实践中他们已经找到了全力以赴和知天命的任务。不需要谈论在生命的长短面前没有双重心志，并在等待天命的同时修养身心，因为他的所作所为已经包含了这些努力。

text.ori_cn: 譬之行路，尽心、知天者，如年力壮健之人，既能奔走往来于数千里之间者也：存心、事天者，如童稚之年，使之学习步趋于庭除之间者也。
text.man_en: This may be compared to walking. He who exerts his mind to the utmost and knows Heaven is like a strong adult who is able to run back and forth for thousands of li. He who preserves his mind and serves Heaven is like a child who is being taught to walk and stride in the vestibule.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For example, if we walk on the road, if we know the sky with all our heart, we are like a person who is strong and healthy and can walk between thousands of miles: if we keep our heart and work for the sky, we are like a child who learns how to walk between the courts.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For example, when traveling on the road, those who devote their minds to heaven are like those who are strong and healthy, who can travel thousands of miles; those who are dedicated and serve heaven are like children in their childhood, making their learning steps easy to achieve. Those in between.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Consider it like traveling; those who understand the heavens with all their heart are like strong, able-bodied people who can easily journey thousands of miles. Meanwhile, those who have the intention and respect towards the heavens, but not yet the understanding, are like children learning to walk within their courtyard.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这可以比作走路。尽其心而知天者，犹成人之壮，能往返奔走千里。存心事天者，如孩提之学步也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这可以与步行进行比较。竭心而知天者，如壮人，能来回奔走千里。守心事天的人，就像小孩子在门廊里被教走路一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这可以比作走路。竭尽全力并了解天道的人就像是一个健壮的成年人，能够来回奔跑数千里。保持心性并侍奉天道的人就像是一个正在学习走路并在前厅迈步的孩子。

text.ori_cn: 夭寿不贰、修身以俟者，如襁褓之孩，方使之扶穑傍壁，而惭学起立移步者也。
text.man_en: He who does not allow any doublemindedness regardless of longevity or brevity of life, but cultivates his personal life while waiting for the mandate of Heaven to take its own course, is like an infant who has just been allowed to support himself against the wall and gradually is learning to stand and to take a step.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who live young and cultivate their bodies are like children in swaddling clothes, who are ashamed to learn how to stand up and move around when they are in the vicinity of the wall.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are young and do not live long enough to cultivate their moral character are like those who are swaddling their children and leaning against the wall, but are ashamed to learn how to stand up and move around.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who ceaselessly cultivate their moral character and wait in anticipation, like a swaddled infant needing support, would feel ashamed when compared to those who have already learned to stand and walk.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一个人无论长寿还是短命，都不允许有任何二心，而是一边修身养性，一边等待天命的安排，就像一个婴儿，刚开始让他靠着墙壁支撑自己，慢慢地就学会了站立和迈步。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不论生命的长短，不容许有任何二心，而修养自己的生活，等待天命的安排，就像婴儿刚被允许靠在墙上，渐渐地正在学习站立和迈出一步。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个不论生活长短都不允许任何犹豫不决的人，他在等待天命自行发展的同时，培养自己的个人生活，就像一个刚被允许靠着墙站立并逐渐学会站立和迈步的婴儿。

text.ori_cn: 既已能奔走往来于数千里之间者，则不必更使之于庭除之间而学步趋，而步趋于庭除之间，自无弗能矣。
text.man_en: Since an individual is already able to run back and forth for several thousand li, it is unnecessary to have him learn to walk or stride in the vestibule, for he is already able to do so.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Since it has been able to run between thousands of miles, it is not necessary to make it between the court and learn to tend to step, and tend to step between the court, since no can carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person is already able to run back and forth across thousands of miles, there is no need to make him learn to walk between courts.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Since one can already travel thousands of miles, it is unnecessary to make them practice walking in the courtyard; for if they can traverse vast distances, they can surely manage a short walk in the courtyard.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既然一个人已经能够来回奔跑数千里，就没有必要让他学习在前庭行走或大步流星，因为他已经能够做到这一点。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 既然人已经能跑来回几千里了，就不用再让他在前庭里学走、跨步了，他已经能了。

text.ori_cn: 既已能步趋于庭除之间，则不必更使之扶墙傍壁而学起立移步，而起立栘步自无弗能矣。
text.man_en: If he is able to walk and stride in the vestibule, there is no need to have him support himself against the wall and learn to stand or to take a step, for he is already able to do so.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you can already walk in the courtyard, you don't need to hold the wall and learn how to stand up and move, but you can do so by standing up and walking during the shadows.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Now that he can walk between the courtyard and the courtyard, there is no need to make him support the wall while he learns to stand up and move. It is impossible for him to stand up and walk.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Since one can already walk around the courtyard, there is no need to make them learn to stand and move by leaning against walls, as they will naturally be able to stand and walk without difficulty.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果他能够在前庭行走和迈步，就没有必要让他靠墙站立或迈步，因为他已经能够这样做了。

text.ori_cn: 然学起立移步，便是学步趋庭除之始，学步趋庭除，便是学奔走往来于数千里之基，固非有二事，但其工夫之难易则相去悬绝矣。

They are surely not two different things, but the difference in the difficulty or easiness in the task is very, very wide.

There are two different things, but the difficulty and ease of the skills are completely different from each other. That’s it.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，学会站立和迈步，是学会在前庭行走和迈步的开始，而学会在前庭行走和迈步，则是来回奔跑几千里的基础。这肯定不是两码事，但在任务的难易程度上，差别却非常非常大。

text.ori_cn: 心也，性也，天也，一也。

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Heart, nature, heaven, unity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mind, nature, heaven—all are one.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 心、性、天三者合一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心、自然与天是一体的。

text.ori_cn: 故及其知之成功则一。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，当人们最终了解到这一点时，他们的成功是一样的。

text.ori_cn: 然而三者人品力量，自有阶级，不可躐等而能也。
text.man_en: But for the three types of people there are naturally different steps according to their capability or ability, which should not be skipped over.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, the power of the three characters, their own class, can not step across and can also.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, the moral quality and strength of these three inherently differ in rank, and it is impossible to achieve beyond one's station.
