text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但对于这三类人来说，根据其能力或能力的不同，自然有不同的步骤，这是不应该跳过的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但对于这三类人来说，根据他们的能力或本事，自然有不同的步骤，这些步骤不应被跳过。

text.ori_cn: 细观文蔚之论，其意以恐尽心、知天者，废却存心、修身之功，而反为尽心、知天之病：是盖为圣人忧工夫之或间断，而不知为自己忧工夫之未真切也。
text.man_en: In carefully examining your ideas, Wenyii, it seems to me that you are afraid that he who exerts his mind to the utmost and knows Heaven neglects the effort of preserving the mind and cultivating the personal life, and thus creates trouble for the task of exerting the mind and knowing Heaven. This is to worry for the sage lest his task might be interrupted without knowing how to worry for yourself lest your effort is not yet genuine and concrete.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The purpose of Wen Wei's argument is to fear that those who are devoted to the heart and to the knowledge of heaven will waste their efforts to preserve the heart and to cultivate the body, but will instead become sick of being devoted to the heart and to the knowledge of heaven: they are worried for the sages about the interruptions in their efforts, but they do not know that they are worried about their own efforts, which are not yet genuine.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A closer look at Wen Wei's theory shows that those who are afraid of exhausting one's mind and knowing Heaven will abandon the merits of cultivating one's mind and self-cultivation, and instead become a disease of exhausting one's heart and knowing Heaven. This is the result of worrying about the work of a sage or intermittent, but not knowing how to worry about oneself. The work is not clear yet.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Upon close examination of Wen Wei's arguments, it becomes apparent that he fears that those who exhaust their minds and understand the heavens might neglect the cultivation of their hearts and the practice of self-cultivation, turning these virtues into shortcomings. This concern is directed at the sage's potential interruption of effort rather than at the individual's lack of genuine effort.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 闻一多，仔细推敲你的观点，我觉得你似乎是担心尽心知天的人忽略了存心修身的努力，从而给尽心知天的任务带来麻烦。这是为圣人担心，怕他的任务被打断，却不知道为自己担心，怕自己的努力还不真切、不具体。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 文义，仔细审视你的想法，我觉得你是怕用尽心性而知天的人，忽视了保存心性和修身养性的功夫，从而给用功的任务带来了麻烦。心而知天。这是为圣人担心，以免他的任务被中断，而不知如何为自己担心，以免自己的努力还不够真诚和具体。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在仔细审视你的想法时，文义，我觉得你担心那些尽力用心并懂得天道的人会忽视保养心性和修身养性的努力，从而为尽心知天的任务制造麻烦。这是为圣人担心，担心他的任务可能被打断，却不知道如何担心自己，担心自己的努力还不够真实和具体。

text.ori_cn: 吾侪用工，却须专心致志，在夭寿不贰、修身以俟上做，只此便是做尽心、知天工夫之始：正如学起立移步，便是学奔走千里之始。
text.man_en: In making efforts, we should have a concentrated mind and a fixed purpose and devote ourselves to the task of not allowing any doublemindedness but cultivating our personal lives while waiting for the mandate to take its own course. This is the beginning of the effort to exert the mind and to know Heaven, just as learning to stand and to take a step is the beginning of learning to run for a thousand li.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When I work, I must concentrate on my life, and cultivate my body, and this is the beginning of my work: just as learning to stand up and move around is the beginning of learning to walk for thousands of miles.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When we work, we must concentrate on our work, and do it before we live long enough to cultivate ourselves. This is the beginning of working hard to understand the sky: just as learning to stand up and move is the beginning of learning to run a thousand miles.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In our labor, we must be focused and dedicated, maintaining the same resolve through both short and long life spans, cultivating ourselves while awaiting higher directives. This itself marks the beginning of the effort to fulfill our duties and understand the workings of heaven: just as learning to stand and take a step initiates the journey of running a thousand miles.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在努力的过程中，我们应该凝心聚力，目标明确，专心致志，不存二心，修身养性，以待天命。这就是 "发愤识天 "的开始，就像 "学立定 "是 "学千里 "的开始一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在努力中，我们要心神集中，目标明确，一心一意，不三心二意，修好自己的生活，等待任务的落实。此乃用心知天之始，犹如学立迈步，学跑千里之始。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在努力过程中，我们应该心无旁骛，有明确的目标，全身心地投入任务，不允许三心二意，同时在等待天命的自然而然之时修身养性。这就是致力于锻炼心志和了解天命的开始，就像学习站立和迈步是学习奔跑千里的开始一样。

text.ori_cn: 文蔚识见本自超绝迈往，而所论云然者，亦是未能脱去旧时解说文义之习，是为此三段书分疏比合，以求融会贯通，而自添许多薏见缠绕，反使用功不专一也；近时悬空去做勿忘、勿助者，其意见正有此病，最能耽误人，不可不涤除耳。
text.man_en: Wenyii, basically your knowledge is advancing vigorously. The way you deliberate, however, shows that you have not been able to rid yourself of the old habit of textual explanation and literal interpretation. Thus you have written these three sections, separating, analyzing, comparing, and combining [the three different steps of exerting the mind, preserving the mind, and not allowing any doublemindedness] with the hope of blending the steps together and harmonizing them. However, you have added many complicating ideas of your own which prevent you from concentrating your effort. This is precisely the defect of the view of recent scholars who try in a vacuum not to forget their objective or to help their mind grow. It is a most serious handicap and most harmful and should be gotten rid of.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Wen Wei knowledge of this from the superlative to the past, and the theory of the cloud, but also failed to get rid of the old interpretation of the text of the habits of the three paragraphs of the book is divided into sparsely than the combination, in order to integrate, and add a lot of Job winding, and counter-use of the work is not focused on also; in recent times, hanging in the air to do do not forget, do not help the views of people who have this disease, the most delayed people, can not not be cleaned up ear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wen Wei's knowledge and understanding has always been a step towards transcendence, but what he discussed is that he has not been able to get rid of the old habit of explaining the meaning of literature. For this reason, the three sections of the book were separated and compared in order to integrate them, and he added a lot of opinions. Wrapping around means that you are not focused on using your skills; those who are hanging in the air recently to do "Don't Forget" and "Don't Help" have this disease in their opinions, which can delay people the most, so they must be cleaned up.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wen Wei's insights were originally extraordinary and unprecedented. However, those who agree with him still remain trapped in the conventional interpretation habits of the past. Thus, this segmentation and comparison of the three sections aim to integrate them seamlessly. Yet, this approach results in the addition of numerous entwined perceptions, causing a lack of focused effort. Recently, this tendency to engage in activities like 'do not forget' and 'do not assist' without a concrete basis demonstrates the same issue. It is highly misleading and must be eliminated.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 文井，基本上你的知识正在蓬勃发展。然而，从你斟酌的方式来看，你还未能摆脱照本宣科和字面解释的旧习。因此，你写了这三个部分，将[发心、守心、不二心]这三个不同的步骤分开、分析、比较、组合，希望将这些步骤融合在一起，使它们和谐一致。然而，你自己却添加了许多复杂的想法，使你无法集中精力。这正是近代学者的观点缺陷，他们试图在真空中不忘记自己的目标或帮助自己的思想成长。这是最严重的缺陷，也是最有害的，应该加以摒弃。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: Wenyii，基本上你的知识正在蓬勃发展。但从你的思考方式来看，你还没有能够摆脱文本解释和字面解释的旧习惯。所以你写了这三段，分别、分析、比较、结合（用心、存心、不二心的三个不同步骤），希望这些步骤能够融合在一起，协调起来。然而，你自己添加了许多复杂的想法，使你无法集中精力。这正是近代学者的观点的缺陷，他们试图在真空中不忘记他们的目标或帮助他们的思想成长。这是最严重的障碍，也是最有害的，应该消除。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 文怡，你的知识基本上在迅速增长。然而，你推敲问题的方式表明你还没有摆脱旧有的文本解释和字面解释的习惯。因此，你将这三部分分开、分析、比较和结合（用心、存心、不容双心的三个不同步骤），希望能将它们融合在一起并加以协调。然而，你添加了许多自己的复杂想法，这些想法妨碍了你的集中努力。这正是近年来学者们试图在空谈中不忘目标或帮助心智成长的缺陷。它是一个非常严重的障碍，并且非常有害，应该予以摒弃。

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is not a hidden and difficult truth. People may have different opinions, but there is still a subtle shadow lurking in their conscience. If this subtle shadow is removed, everything will become clear to them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This principle is not obscure and esoteric. For those whose opinions differ, it is because their conscience still has a slight veil obscuring it. If this veil is removed, the truth will become perfectly clear.

text.ori_cn: 〔1〕古之教者，教以人伦：后世记诵词章之习起，而先王之教亡。
text.man_en: In education the ancients taught the fundamental principles of human relations. As the habits of memorization, recitation, and the writing of flowery compositions of later generations arose, the teachings of ancient kings disappeared.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [1] In ancient times, those who taught were taught to be humane: in later times, the habit of reciting words and chapters arose, but the teachings of the former kings died.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [1] The ancient teachers taught human ethics: the practice of memorizing and reciting poems and chapters began in later generations, but the teachings of the previous kings died.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In ancient times, education was about teaching human relationships; later generations developed a habit of memorizing literary phrases, and the teachings of the former kings were lost.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在教育方面，古人传授的是人际关系的基本原则。随着后世背诵、吟诵和撰写华丽文章的习惯兴起，古代君王的教诲也随之消失。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 古人在教育中教导人伦的基本原则。随着后世背诵、写华章的习惯的产生，古代帝王的教诲就消失了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在教育方面，古人传授了人际关系的基本原则。随着后世背诵、朗读和写作华丽文章的习惯兴起，古代圣贤的教诲逐渐消失了。

text.ori_cn: 今教童子，惟当以孝弟忠信礼义廉耻为专务；其栽培涵养之方，则宜诱之歌诗以发其志意，导之习礼以肃其威仪，讽之读书以开其知觉。
text.man_en: In educating young boys today, the sole task should be to teach filial piety, brotherly respect, loyalty, faithfulness, propriety, righteousness, integrity, and the sense of shame. The ways to raise and cultivate them are to lure them to singing so their will will be roused, to direct them to practice etiquette so their demeanor will be dignified, and to urge them to read so their intellectual horizon will be widened.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nowadays, children should be taught that filial piety, brotherhood, loyalty, propriety, righteousness, honesty, and shame are the special duties; the cultivation of the cultivation of the method, it is appropriate to induce the song and poem in order to develop their will, to guide the practice of etiquette in order to solemnise their authority, and to satirise the reading of the book in order to open up their knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Today's teaching of children should only focus on filial piety, loyalty, propriety, justice, integrity and shame; in order to cultivate them, it is advisable to induce them to sing poems to inspire their aspirations, guide them to practice etiquette to maintain their dignity, and satirize them to read books to open their consciousness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In educating children today, the primary focus should be on instilling filial piety, brotherly love, loyalty, faith, propriety, righteousness, integrity, and a sense of shame. As for the methods of nurturing and developing these virtues, it is appropriate to inspire their aspirations through the recitation of poetry, guide them in practicing etiquette to cultivate their dignified behavior, and encourage them to read in order to enhance their awareness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 今之少年，惟孝、悌、忠、信、礼、义、廉、耻之教也。养育和培养的方法是引他们唱歌，以唤起他们的意志；引导他们练习礼仪，以端庄他们的仪态；督促他们读书，以拓宽他们的知识视野。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 现在教育少年，唯一的任务就是教孝、悌、忠、信、礼、义、廉、耻。养育之道，是引其歌声，以振奋其意志；引导其行礼，以使其风度端庄；劝其读书，以开阔其知识视野。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在当今教育年轻男孩时，唯一的任务应该是教导孝道、兄弟尊重、忠诚、信义、礼节、正义、诚信和廉耻。培养和造就他们的方法是引导他们唱歌以激发他们的意志，指导他们练习礼仪以使他们的行为端正，并敦促他们阅读以扩展他们的知识领域。

text.ori_cn: 大抵童子之情，乐嬉游而惮拘检，如草木之始萌芽，舒畅之则条达，摧挠之则衰痿。
text.man_en: Generally speaking, it is the nature of young boys to love to play and to dislike restriction. Like plants beginning to sprout, if they are allowed to grow freely, they will develop smoothly. If twisted and interfered with, they will wither and decline.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For the most part, the child's feelings, happy to play and scrupulous inspection, such as the beginning of the sprouting of grass and trees, soothing the line, the destruction of the impotence of the decline.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Most of the time, the emotions of a child are happy to play but fearful of being detained, just like the beginning of a plant's sprouting. If it is relaxed, it will become well-organized, and if it is scratched, it will become weak.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Generally, the nature of children is to enjoy play and resent restraint; like the budding of plants, they thrive when allowed to flourish freely but wither when repressed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一般来说，喜欢玩耍、不喜欢受约束是男孩子的天性。就像刚开始发芽的植物，如果让它们自由生长，它们就会顺利发展。如果受到扭曲和干扰，它们就会枯萎和衰败。

After that, each student can return to their seat to continue their studies.

text.ori_cn: 〔3〕凡歌诗须要整容定气，清朗其声音，均审其节调，毋躁而急，毋荡而嚣，毋馁而慑；久则精神宣畅，心气和平矣。
text.man_en: In singing, let the pupils be tidy in appearance and calm in expression. Let their voices be clear and distinct. Let their rhythm be even and exact. Let them not be hasty or hurried. Let them not be reckless or disorderly. 6 And let them not sound feeble or timid. 7 In time their spirits will be free and their minds will be peaceful.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [3] All songs and poems must be calm, clear their voices, and review their rhythm, not impatient, not swinging and clamouring, not discouraged and deterred; for a long time, the spirit of the spirit is smooth, and the mind is at peace.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [3] All songs and poems need to be calmed down, the sound should be clear, and the rhythm must be checked. Don't be impatient and anxious, don't be arrogant and noisy, don't be discouraged and frightened. Over time, the spirit will be relaxed and the heart will be peaceful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for singing and poetry, one must organize and calm oneself, clear the voice, and balance the rhythm. Do not be hasty and frantic, do not be reckless and loud, do not be weak and intimidated; over time, the spirit will be invigorated, and the mind will be peaceful.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在唱歌时，学生们要仪表整洁，表情平静。让他们的声音清晰、鲜明。节奏要均匀准确。不要急躁或匆忙。不要鲁莽，也不要杂乱无章。6 声音不要软弱或胆怯。7 久而久之，他们的精神就会自由，心境就会平和。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 歌唱时，要让学生仪表整洁，表情平静。让他们的声音清晰明确。让他们的节奏均匀、准确。让他们不要仓促或仓促。让他们不要鲁莽或无序。 6 不要让他们听起来软弱或胆怯。 7 假以时日，他们的精神就会自由，心智就会平静。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在歌唱时，让学生们仪容整洁，表情镇定。让他们的声音清晰而分明。让他们的节奏均匀而准确。不要让他们仓促或急躁。不要让他们鲁莽或无序。不要让他们的声音虚弱或胆怯。久而久之，他们的精神会变得自由，心灵会变得平和。

text.ori_cn: 每学量童生多寡分为四班。

text.man_en: In rotation each class sings on one day, while the others sit down to listen respectfully with serious expression. Every five days all the four classes will sing one after another in their own school assembly.

text.ori_cn: 〔4〕凡习礼需要澄心肃虑，审其仪节，度其容止，毋忽而惰，毋沮而怍，毋径而野，从容而不失之迂缓，修谨而不失之拘局。
text.man_en: In the practice of etiquette, let the pupils be clear in their minds and serious in their thoughts. Let them be careful with details and correct in demeanor. Let them not be negligent or lazy. Let them not be lowspirited or disconcerted. And let them not be uncontrolled or rough. 6 Let them be leisurely but not to the point of being dilatory and be serious but not to the point of being rigid.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [4] All the practice of etiquette needs to clarify the mind, examine its etiquette, measure its manners, not to be neglected and lazy, not to be frustrated and subterfuge, not to be wild, not to lose the pedantry, and not to lose the constraints of cultivation and rigour.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [4] When practicing etiquette, one needs to be clear-minded and careful, scrutinize the etiquette, and measure the appearance and restraint. Do not be careless and lazy, do not be discouraged and hesitate, do not go straight and wild, be calm but not slow, and be prudent without losing restraint. bureau.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In all matters of practicing ritual, one must clear one's mind and be focused. Examine the ceremonies, gauge one's demeanor, and never be careless or lazy, disheartened or shamed, nor hasty and casual. Remain composed without being overly slow, and be meticulous without being overly rigid.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在礼仪实践中，让学生头脑清醒，思想严肃。要注意细节，举止端庄。不疏忽，不懒惰。不卑不亢，不慌不忙。不可放纵或粗暴。6 悠闲而不拖沓，严肃而不刻板。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在礼仪实践中，让学生头脑清醒，思想认真。让他们注意细节并端正举止。让他们不要疏忽或懒惰。让他们不要情绪低落或惊慌失措。并且不要让他们失控或粗暴。 6、要从容而不至于拖沓，要严肃但不至于僵化。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在礼仪的实践中，要让学生头脑清晰，思想严谨。要他们注重细节，举止端正。不要粗心大意或懒散。不要情绪低落或心神不定。不要放纵或粗鲁。要他们从容不迫，但不过于拖延；要他们认真严肃，但不过于僵化。

text.ori_cn: 久则礼貌习熟，德性坚定矣。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 假以时日，他们的外表和行为将变得自然，他们的道德本性也将牢固确立。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 久而久之，他们的外表和行为就会变得自然，他们的道德本性就会牢固地建立起来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 随着时间的推移，他们的外貌和行为会变得自然，他们的道德本性也会牢固地建立起来。

text.ori_cn: 〔5〕凡授书不在徒多，但贵精熟，量其资禀，能二百字者止可挼以一百字，常使精神力量有余，则无厌苦之患，而有自得之美。
text.man_en: In reading, the value does not lie in the amount but in learning the material well. Reckoning the pupils' natural endowments, if one can handle two hundred words, teach him only one hundred so that he always has surplus energy and strength and then he will not suffer or feel tired but will have the beauty of being at ease with himself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [5] Where the teaching of the book is not in the apprentice more, but the most important thing is to be familiar with, measure their endowment, can be two hundred words can not come to a hundred words, often make the spiritual strength of the surplus, then there is no boredom and suffering, but the beauty of the self-acquisition.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [5] Teaching does not mean that students have too many books, but that they are proficient and proficient. Measure their talents. Those who can only use 200 words can only use 100 words. If the mental strength is always more than enough, then there will be no fear of suffering, and there will be the beauty of self-satisfaction. .
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In teaching, it is not about the quantity of books, but about the quality and thorough understanding. Assess the student's capacity; if he can handle 200 characters, then only give him 100 to practice. Always ensure that he has more energy than necessary, so he will not feel overwhelmed or resentful, but rather find a sense of accomplishment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 阅读的价值不在于数量，而在于学好教材。考虑到学生的先天条件，如果一个人能读两百个单词，那就只教他一百个单词，这样他就始终有剩余的精力和体力，这样他就不会感到苦和累，反而会有一种自在的美感。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 阅读的价值不在于数量，而在于学好材料。就学生的天赋而言，如果能讲两百个字，就只教他一百个，使他时时有余力，不苦不累，而有自在之美。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在阅读中，价值不在于数量而在于把材料学好。考虑到学生的天资，如果一个学生能掌握两百个字，就只教他一百个字，这样他总是有多余的精力和力量，那么他就不会感到痛苦或疲惫，而是会感受到自在的美好。

text.ori_cn: 讽诵之际；务令专心一志，口诵心惟，字字句句紬绎反复，抑扬其音节，宽虚其心意，久则义礼浃洽，聪明日开矣。
text.man_en: While reciting the pupils must be concentrated in mind and united in purpose. As they recite with their mouths, let them ponder with their minds. Every word and every phrase should be investigated and gone over again and again. The voice and rhythm should go up and down and their thoughts should be relaxed and empty. In time they will be in harmony with propriety and righteousness and their intelligence will gradually unfold.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When reciting, make sure that you concentrate, recite orally and communicate word by word and sentence over and over again, suppressing the syllables and spreading the mind, then you will be soaked in righteousness and propriety, and you will be smart and open up.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When reciting satire, be sure to concentrate on one purpose, recite with a sincere heart, recite every word and every sentence over and over again, accentuate the syllables, and be tolerant of your thoughts. Over time, the righteousness and etiquette will be harmonious, and your wisdom will develop.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When reciting, it is essential to concentrate fully, reciting with the mouth and reflecting with the heart, carefully deliberating each word and sentence. Modulate the intonation, maintain an open and calm mind; over time, the meaning and propriety will become thoroughly comprehended, and wisdom will progressively emerge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 背诵时，学生们必须精神集中，目标一致。在用嘴背诵的同时，让他们用心思考。每一个字、每一句话都要反复琢磨、反复推敲。声音和节奏要抑扬顿挫，思想要放松空灵。久而久之，他们就会与礼义相合，智慧也会逐渐展现。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 学生朗诵时，必须精神集中，意念一致。当他们用嘴背诵的时候，让他们用心去思考。每一个单词、每一个短语都应该反复研究和检查。声音和节奏要上下，思想要放松、空虚。久而久之，就会合乎礼义，其聪明才智就会逐渐显现。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 学生在诵读时必须集中思想，专心致志。在用口诵读时，让他们用心思考。每一个字，每一句话都应该反复探讨和推敲。声音和节奏应该高低起伏，思绪应当放松和空灵。久而久之，他们将与礼义相合，智慧也会逐渐展现。

text.ori_cn: 〔6〕每日工夫，先考德，次背书诵书，次习礼或作课仿，次复诵书讲书，次歌诗。
text.man_en: In the daily work first examine the pupils' moral conduct. Next let them repeat their old lessons and recite new ones. Then comes the practice of etiquette or composition, then repeating and recitation again, and finally singing.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔6〕Every day, one should first take a moral test, then memorize and recite books, then practice rituals or imitate lessons, next recite books and lectures, and then sing poems.

text.ori_cn: 意未有悬空的，必着事物，故欲诚意，则随意所在某事而格之，去其人欲而归于理，则良知之在此事者，无蔽而得致矣。
text.man_en: The will never exists in a vacuum. It is always connected with some thing or event. Therefore if one wants to make his will sincere, he should rectify it right in the thing or event to which the will is directed, get rid of selfish human desires, and return to the Principle of Nature. Then in connection with this thing or event the innate knowledge will be free from obscuration and can be fully extended.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no intention of hanging in the air, must be in things, so I want to be sincere, then randomly located in something and the grid, to go to its human desire and return to the reason, then the conscience of the person in this matter, no cover and get to be carried forward.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the intention is not hanging in the air, it must be focused on things. Therefore, if you want to be sincere, you can find something at will and check it. Get rid of people's desires and return it to reason. Then if your conscience is on this matter, it will be achieved without concealment.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Intention must not be void but attached to something; therefore, to make one's intention sincere, one must investigate the matter to which the intention pertains, remove personal desires, and return to reason. Thus, the innate knowledge within this matter will be unobstructed and fully realized.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 意志从不存在于真空之中。它总是与某些事物或事件联系在一起。因此，如果一个人想让自己的意志变得真诚，他就应该在意志所指向的事物或事件中纠正它，摆脱人类的私欲，回归自然的原则。这样，与生俱来的知识就会摆脱蒙昧，得到充分的发挥。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 意志永远不存在于真空中。它总是与某些事物或事件有关。所以，要想使自己的意志真诚，就应该在意志所指向的事物或事件上加以纠正，去掉人的私欲，回归自然的法则。然后，与此事物或事件有关的固有知识将不受遮蔽，并且可以充分扩展。

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 〔4〕Further asked: 'When I sit quietly and focus on my practice, I do feel my mind becoming more contained; however, when faced with a situation, my thoughts become scattered again. I then reflect on the situation, and once it's over, I try to return to my previous practice. Yet, I still feel a separation between the internal and external, unable to unify them into one.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我还说："在潜心静坐时，我在某种程度上感觉到我的思想是集中的、专注的。然而，当一些事情发生时，我的注意力就会被打断。于是，我下定决心去研究那件事。当事情结束后，我又回到之前的静坐状态。尽管如此，我仍然觉得内心和外在并没有融为一体。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我又说：“在专心打坐的过程中，我感到自己的心有一定的集中和集中。然而，当发生一些事情时，注意力就会被打断。然后我就下定决心去考察一下那件事。当这一切结束后，我又回到之前的静坐冥想的任务。但我仍然觉得心的内在和外在并没有融为一体。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我进一步说道：“当我专心致志于打坐时，感觉到我的心思某种程度上是收敛和集中的。然而，当遇到某件事情时，这种集中力就会被打断。然后我下定决心要仔细分析这件事。当事情结束后，我又回到打坐的状态。不过，我还是觉得心思的内外面没有融合为一体。”

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“此‘格物’之说未透。

text.ori_cn: 这听讲说时专敬，即是那静坐时心。
text.man_en: When you are talking and your mind concentrates on being serious, it is the same mind as when you are engaged in sitting in meditation.

text.ori_cn: 人须在事上磨练做功夫乃有益：若只好静，遇事便乱，终无长进。
text.man_en: One must be trained and polished in the actual affairs of life. Only when the effort is made that way will it be beneficial. If one merely likes tranquility, he will get confused whenever anything happens and will never progress.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is beneficial for people to hone their skills in doing things: if they can only be quiet, they will be confused when things happen, and there will be no progress.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: One must train and hone skills through real-life experiences: if one only seeks tranquility, chaos will ensue when challenges arise, leading to no progress in the long run.

text.ori_cn: 后在洪都，复与于中国裳论内外之说，渠皆云物自有内外，但要内外并着功夫，不可有间耳，以质先生。
text.man_en: Later in Hungtu I again discussed the theory of the internal and the external with Wang Yiichung and Shu Kuoshang. Both of them said that things naturally have their internal and external aspects, but that one's effort should be directed to both of them without making any distinction between them. I asked the Teacher about this
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Later, in Hongdu, with China Shang on the inside and outside of the said, the drainage of all things have their own inside and outside, but to inside and outside of the work, there can not be between the ear, to the quality of the gentleman.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Later in Hongdu, the theory of internal and external aspects of Chinese clothing was revived. It was said that everything has its own internal and external aspects, but both internal and external aspects must be combined, and there must be no gap or quality.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Later in Hongdu, I discussed the concept of internal and external with Zhongguo Shang. He stated that all things inherently possess both internal and external aspects, but one must exert effort on both without any interruption, to respectfully consult the teacher.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 后来在鸿图，我又与王逸中和舒国相讨论了内外之说。他们都说，事物自然有内外之分，但人的努力方向应该是内外兼修，不分彼此。我问老师
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 后来在《洪都》中，我又与王以中、舒阔尚讨论了内外之说。两人都说，事物自然有其内在和外在的一面，但应该向内和外在的方向努力，而不应该区分它们。我问过老师这个问题
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 后来在洪涂我又和王一中、舒国尚讨论了内外之论。他们两个都说事物自然有其内外两方面，但人的努力应同时兼顾，不应作内外之分。我向老师请教这个问题。

text.ori_cn: 曰：“功夫不离本体，本体原无内外：只为后来做功夫的分了内外，先其本体了，如今正要讲明功夫不要有内外，乃是本体功夫：”是日俱有省。
text.man_en: and he said, “The task should never depart from the original substance, and the original substance from the beginning makes no distinction between the internal and the external. Only because in their devotion to the task people of later generations make such a distinction do they lose their original substance. It is now necessary to explain that only that kind of task which makes no distinction between the internal and the external can be the task devoted to the original substance. ” On that day all of us realized some new truth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Said: "kung fu is not separate from the body, the body originally no inside and outside: only for the later to do kung fu divided into inside and outside, the first of its body, and now is just about to say kung fu do not have inside and outside, is the body of kung fu:" is the day all have province.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He said: "Kung Fu is not separated from the essence, and the essence has no inside and outside. It is only for those who do Kung Fu later to distinguish the inside and outside, and the essence comes first. Now I am about to explain that Kung Fu does not have an inside and outside, but is the essence of Kung Fu:" This is a day of understanding.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He said, 'Kung Fu is inseparable from the essence, and the essence originally has no distinction between inner and outer: it's only because later practitioners of Kung Fu have made a distinction between inner and outer, putting the essence behind. Now we need to clarify that Kung Fu should have no inner or outer distinctions, as it is the essence of Kung Fu:' That day, everyone had an epiphany.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他说："任务永远不能脱离本体，而本体从一开始就没有内外之分。只是因为后人在献身于任务时作了这样的区分，他们才失去了本体。现在有必要解释一下，只有那种不分内外的任务才是献身于本原的任务。"在那一天，我们所有人都认识到了一些新的真理。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他说：“任务永远不能脱离本来的本质，本来的本质从一开始就没有什么内在和外在之分。后人只因着力于这种区分，才失去了原有的实质。现在需要说明的是，只有那种不分内在和外在的任务，才是致力于原始实质的任务。 ” 那天我们所有人都意识到了一些新的事实。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他说：“任务决不能偏离原本的本质，原本的本质从一开始就不分内外。只是因为后代的人在专注于任务时作了这样的划分，他们才失去了原本的本质。现在有必要解释一下，只有那种不分内外的任务才是专注于原本本质的任务。” 那天我们所有人都领悟到了一些新的道理。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰；“濂溪、明道之后，还是象山：只是粗些。”

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said, 'After Lianxi and Mingdao, it is still Xiangshan; it's just a bit rough.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："从莲社、明涛时代起，就只有陆象山了。但他还是有些粗糙。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“自连西、明道以来，只有陆象山。但他还是有些粗鲁。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 教師說：“自從濂溪和明道以來，只有陸象山。但他還是有些粗糙。”

text.ori_cn: 九川曰：“看他论学，篇篇说出骨髓，句句似针膏肓，却不见他粗。”
text.man_en: I said, “In his elucidations, every chapter reveals the innermost fundamentals and every sentence seems to attack the underlying causes. He does not seem to be crude. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Jiu Chuan said: "Look at his theory of learning, piece of speech out of the bone marrow, sentence like a needle anointed, but do not see him coarse."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Jiuchuan said: "Looking at his discussion, he talks about the bone marrow in every chapter, and every sentence is like a needle, but he is not thick."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Jiu Chuan said, 'When he discusses scholarship, every piece reveals profound insights, and each sentence is as sharp as a needle hitting a vital spot, yet it never seems heavy-handed.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我说："在他的阐释中，每一章都揭示了最根本的东西，每一句话似乎都在抨击深层的原因。他似乎并不粗糙。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我说：“他的阐述，每一章都揭示了根本，每一句话都似乎是在攻击根本原因。他看起来并不粗鲁。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我说：“在他的阐述中，每一章都揭示了最内在的基础，每一句话似乎都在攻击根本原因。他似乎并不粗俗。”

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“然他心上用过功夫，与揣摹依仿、求之文义自不同，但细看有粗处。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："他在思想上下了功夫，当然不同于那些模仿别人、依赖别人或只追求字面意思的人。但是，如果你仔细研究他的学说，就会发现其中也有粗糙之处。

text.ori_cn: 〔6〕庚辰往虔州再见先生，问：“近来功夫虽若稍知头脑，然难寻个稳当快乐处。”

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔6〕 Gengchen went to Qianzhou to see his husband again and asked: "Although I have a little bit of brain power these days, it is difficult to find a stable and happy place."

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 成德十五年，我去钱州，再次见到我们的老师。我说："在我最近的努力中，虽然我似乎知道了一些基础，但我发现很难有安全感和喜悦感。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 成德十五年，我到钱州，又见到了老师。我说：“在我最近的努力中，虽然我似乎知道了一些基础，但我发现很难有任何安全感和喜悦感。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 成德十五年，我去钳州再次见到老师。我说：“我最近的努力，虽然似乎在某种程度上有所了解，但我发现很难有任何安全感或喜悦感。”

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“尔却去心上寻个天理，此正所谓理障。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “But you go to your mind to seek the Principle of Nature. This is what the Buddhists call ‘obscuration by principle. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman said: "You but go to the heart to find a heavenly reason, this is called the reason barrier.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The teacher said: "You should search for the truth in your heart. This is the so-called mental disorder.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said: 'You seek for the heavenly principle within your heart, which is precisely what is called an obstruction by principle.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："但你却用你的心去寻求自然的原理。这就是佛家所说的'原理遮蔽'。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“而你入心求自然理。这就是佛家所说的“理障”。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说道：“但是你去你的心中寻找自然的本质。这就是佛教徒所说的‘被原则所迷惑’。”

text.ori_cn: 此间有个诀窍。”

text.ori_cn: 曰：“只是致知。”
text.man_en: “It is nothing but the extension of knowledge. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He said, "It's just Zhi Zhi Zhi."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He said: "It's just for knowledge."

text.ori_cn: 曰：“如何致知。”
text.man_en: “How does one extend knowledge?”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He said, "How to know."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Said: "How to gain knowledge."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He said, 'How does one attain knowledge?'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "如何扩展知识？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “如何扩展知识？”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如何扩展知识？

text.ori_cn: 曰：“尔那一点良知，是尔自家底准则。
text.man_en: “Your innate knowledge is your own standard.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He said, "Your little conscience is your own code.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He said: "The little bit of conscience you have is the standard of your own family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is said, 'That bit of conscience you possess is your own guiding principle.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "你与生俱来的知识就是你自己的标准。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “你与生俱来的知识就是你自己的标准。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 你的天赋知识是你自己的标准。

text.ori_cn: 尔意念着处，他是便知是，非便知非，更瞒他一些不得。
text.man_en: When you direct your thought your innate knowledge knows that it is right if it is right and wrong if it is wrong. You cannot keep anything from it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you think about it, he will know what is right and what is wrong, and he will know what is wrong, and he will not be able to hide it from you.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wherever you put your mind, he will know what is right and what is wrong, and you can even hide some things from him.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In your thoughts, if it's right, he knows it's right; if it's wrong, he knows it's wrong. You can't deceive him in the slightest.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当你引导你的思想时，你与生俱来的知识会知道，如果它是对的，它就是对的；如果它是错的，它就是错的。你无法对它隐瞒任何事情。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当你引导你的思想时，你的内在知识知道如果它是对的，它就是对的，如果它是错的，它就是错的。你无法阻止任何事情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当你指引你的思维时，如果是对的，你本能的知识会知道它是对的；如果是错的，你本能的知识会知道它是错的。你无法对它隐瞒任何事情。

text.ori_cn: 尔只不要欺他，实实落落依着他做去，善便存，恶便去，他这里何等稳当快乐；此便是‘格物’的真诀，‘致知’的实功。
text.man_en: Just don't try to deceive it but sincerely and truly follow it in whatever you do. Then the good will be preserved and evil will be removed. What security and joy there is in this! This is the true secret of the investigation of things and the real effort of the extension of knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: You just don't deceive him, and really follow him to do, good will exist, evil will go, how stable and happy he is here; this is the true secret of 'Grasping Things', the real work of 'Zhi Zhi Zhi'.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As long as you don't deceive him, just follow his actions, and the good will remain and the bad will go away. He will be so safe and happy here; this is the true secret of "investigating things" and the real power of "achieving knowledge".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Just do not deceive him, follow him sincerely and earnestly; good will remain, evil will depart, and he will be so stable and joyful here. This is the true secret of 'investigating things' and the real effort of 'extending knowledge.'

text.man_en: The Teacher further discoursed, “No matter what man does, innate knowledge is in him and cannot be destroyed. Even a thief realizes in himself that he should not be a thief. If you call him a thief, he will still blush. ” Yiichung said, “One's innate knowledge can only be obscured by material desires. 6 It is within him and can never be lost. 7 Similarly clouds may of course obscure the sun but the sun is never lost. ”8 The Teacher said, “How brilliant is Yiichung! 9 Others do not see it so clearly. ”

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He also said, "Conscience is in a person, and it cannot be extinguished no matter what you do. Even a thief knows that he should not be a thief. If you call him a thief, he will still feel guilty." Yu Zhong said: "It's just material desires that cover it up. Conscience is inside, so it won't be lost. text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师进一步论述道："无论人做了什么，与生俱来的知识就在他心中，无法摧毁。即使是一个小偷，他自己也意识到他不应该做小偷。如果你说他是小偷，他还是会脸红。"易中天说："人的先天之知只能被物质欲望所掩盖。6 它就在人的内心深处，永远不会丢失。7 同样，乌云当然会遮住太阳，但太阳永远不会消失。"8老师说："义中是多么聪明啊！9 别人看得不那么清楚。"

text.ori_cn: 〔8〕先生曰：“这些子看得透彻，随他千言万语是非诚伪，到前便明，合得的便是，合不得的便非，如佛家说‘心印’相似，真是个试金石，指南针。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “If you see this little thing clearly, no matter how much and how eloquently one may talk, all right and wrong, sincerity and insincerity in what he says are manifested right in front of it. What is in accord with it is right and what is not in accord with it is wrong. It is like what the Buddhists call the‘spiritual seal. ' It is truly a goldtesting stone and a compass. ”

If they come up, they will understand. If they are compatible, they will be wrong. If they are not compatible, they will be wrong. It is similar to what the Buddhists say about the 'heart seal'. It's really A touchstone, a compass.”

What aligns is right and what doesn't is wrong, much like the 'seal of the mind' in Buddhism. It is truly a touchstone, a compass.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："如果你看清了这个小东西，无论一个人说得多么天花乱坠，多么滔滔不绝，他所说的一切是与非、诚与不诚，都会在它面前显现出来。符合它的就是对的，不符合它的就是错的。这就像佛家所说的 "精神印记"。它是真正的试金石和指南针。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“你看清这个小东西，无论讲多少、讲得多雄辩，所说的一切对与错、真诚与不真诚，都表现在它的面前。符合它的就是对的，不符合它的就是错的。这就像佛教徒所说的‘精神印’。 ’这确实是一块验金石和一个指南针。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“如果你清楚地看见这件小事，无论别人说得再多、再好，他所说的一切对错、真伪都显现在它面前。符合它的就是对的，不符合它的就是错的。这就像佛教徒所说的‘心印’。它确实是一块试金石和指南针。”

text.ori_cn: 〔9〕先生曰：“人若知这良知诀窍，随他多少邪思枉念，这里一觉，都自消融；真个是灵丹一粒，点铁成金。”

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“人如果知道了这个先天知识的真正秘密，那么无论有多少恶念、错误的欲望，一旦明白了，它们都会自行消失。真是一剂特效良药，一触即化铁为金。 ”

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“何言之易也，再用功半年看如何，又用功一年看如何。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“可知是体来与听讲不同。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “From this we can know that knowledge acquired through personal realization is different from that acquired through listening to discussions.

text.ori_cn: 我初与讲时，知尔只是忽易，未有滋味；只这个要妙再体到深处，日见不同，是无穷尽的。”
text.man_en: When I first lectured on the subject, I knew you took it lightly and were not interested. However, when one goes further and realizes this essential and wonderful thing personally to its very depth, he will see that it becomes different every day and is inexhaustible. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When I first spoke with them, I knew that they were just easy, and had no taste; but this is the only thing that can be learnt from the depths of the body, and the difference is endless."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When I first started teaching it, I knew it was just a temporary change and had no taste. It is just that this wonderful thing can be experienced deeply again, and the differences will be seen day by day, which is endless. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When I first spoke with you, I knew you were merely changing superficially and lacked depth; only when you delve deeper into this subtlety, you will find something new every day, boundlessly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当我第一次就这一主题发表演讲时，我知道你们对此掉以轻心，不感兴趣。然而，当一个人更进一步，亲身体会到这一重要而奇妙的东西的深刻内涵时，他就会发现，它每天都会变得不同，而且取之不尽，用之不竭。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当我第一次讲这个主题时，我知道你们对此不以为然并且不感兴趣。然而，当一个人进一步深入，亲身体会到这一本质而美妙的东西时，就会发现它每天都在变化，而且取之不尽，用之不竭。 ”

text.ori_cn: 〔13〕又曰：“知来本无知，觉来本无觉，然不知则遂沦埋。”
text.man_en: The Teacher further said, “In reality knowledge and realization come without our knowing or realizing. However, if we don't know this, we will be lost. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [13] It is also said, "Knowledge comes from no knowledge, awareness comes from no awareness, but not knowing then falls into burial."

text.ori_cn: 〔14〕先生曰：“大凡朋友须箴规指摘处少，诱掖奖劝意多，方是。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “In general, among friends there should be little admonishing and faultfinding, but much directing and encouraging. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr [14] said, "All friends must have fewer words of criticism and more words of encouragement and exhortation."

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mr. said: 'In general, one should offer fewer criticisms and admonitions to friends, and give more encouragement and guidance. This is the right way.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："一般来说，朋友之间应该少一些告诫和指责，多一些引导和鼓励。"

text.ori_cn: 后又戒九川云：“与朋友论学，须委曲谦下，宽以居之。”
text.man_en: Later he further cautioned me, saying, “In discussing learning with friends, one should be accommodating, be humble, and dwell broadmindedly in what one has learned. ”

text.man_en: But innate knowledge speaks through the same mouth and acts through the same body. How can it get outside material force and have another organ with which to speak or act ? Therefore it has been said, Tt would be incomplete to talk about the nature of man and things without including material force and unintelligible to talk about material force without including the nature. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: However, conscience is only a matter of the mouth and the body, and it is not possible for the qi to go out and do or say anything else: therefore it is said, 'On sex regardless of qi, it is not ready: on qi regardless of sex, it is not clear.'
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: However, the conscience is just a mouthful. How can you get Qi from the outside by doing this? There is no one else to do it and say it: Therefore, it is said: "When discussing Qi, regardless of Qi, it is unprepared; when discussing Qi, regardless of nature, it is unclear." ’
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: But conscience is precisely this spoken word, this bodily action. How can it be separated from qi (vital energy) and have a separate entity to act and speak? Thus it is said: 'Discussing nature without discussing qi is incomplete; discussing qi without discussing nature is unclear.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，先天知识通过同一个嘴巴说话，通过同一个身体行动。它怎么可能脱离物质力量而拥有另一个说话或行动的器官呢？因此，有人说："不包括物质力量而谈论人和物的本质是不完整的，不包括本质而谈论物质力量是不可理解的。'

text.ori_cn: 〔7〕又曰：“诸君功夫，最不可‘助长’。

text.ori_cn: 上智绝少，学者无超入圣人之理。

text.ori_cn: 一起一伏，一进一退，自是功夫节次。

text.ori_cn: 不可以我前日用得功夫了，今却不济，便要矫强做出一个没破绽的模样，这便是‘助长’，连前些子功夫都坏了。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 例如，当一个人走在路上不小心跌倒时，他应该爬起来继续走，而不应该装作没有跌倒来欺骗别人。

text.ori_cn: 诸君只要常常怀个‘遁世无闷，不见是而无闷’之心，依此良知忍耐做去，不管人非笑，不管人毁谤，不管人荣辱，任他功夫有进有退，我只是这致良知的主宰不息，久久自然有得力处，一切外事亦自能不动。”
text.man_en: You gentlemen should always cherish the mind that can retreat from the world without being troubled and can face disapproval without being troubled. Follow the dictate of innate knowledge and proceed patiently and pay no attention to people's ridicule, slander, praise, or humiliation. Whether the task advances or recedes, remain the master that extends the innate knowledge. Act like this without cease, and in time the effort will be effective and no external things can disturb you. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: As long as you always have a 'recluse without boredom, do not see is without boredom' heart, according to this conscience patience to do, regardless of people non-smile, regardless of people slandering, regardless of people honour and disgrace, let his work has to be in and out, I am only the master of this conscience unceasingly, for a long time, naturally have the power to do, and all the external affairs can be immobilised."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As long as you always have the heart of "there is no boredom in escaping from the world, and there is no boredom when you don't see the truth", and do it patiently according to your conscience, no matter what people are laughing at, no matter what people slander, no matter people's honor or disgrace, let them advance or retreat in their efforts, I am just this As long as the control of conscience continues, it will naturally be effective for a long time, and all external affairs will be able to do nothing. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As long as you often keep a mindset of 'seclusion without worry, seeing nothing and remaining carefree,' and persevere with this conscientiousness regardless of others' mockery, slander, honor, or disgrace—whether progress in your efforts ebbs or flows—I remain steadfast in upholding this conscientiousness. Over time, you will naturally find strength, and all external matters will also be unaffected.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诸君当常怀退而不忧、迎而不诤之心。遵从先天知识的指引，耐心前行，不理会他人的嘲笑、诽谤、赞美或羞辱。无论任务是前进还是后退，都要保持先天知识的主人翁姿态。如是而行，久久为功，外物无扰。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 诸位君子，应常怀一颗退世而不烦恼、面对非议而不烦恼的心。遵循先天知识的指挥，耐心地前进，不理会人们的嘲笑、诽谤、赞扬或羞辱。无论任务前进还是后退，扩展先天知识的主人仍然存在。如此不断地做，到时候努力就会有效果，任何外在的事物都无法打扰你。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 诸君应当常保能从容退居世外而不烦恼，能面对非议而不烦恼的心态。遵循天理行事，耐心进行，不在乎人们的嘲笑、诽谤、赞美或羞辱。不论事情进展或退却，始终保持发扬天理的主人。如此行事不止，时间一久，努力便会见效，外物也就无法扰乱你了。

text.ori_cn: 尔之见性，常在人之心神。
text.man_en: Your way of seeing nature is always directed to the human mind, 1 only to its active occupation with what can be seen or heard 2 and not to its concrete effort concerning what is not seen or heard.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Er's seeing is always in one's mind and heart.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 你看待自然的方式始终是针对人类的心灵，1 只是针对它对可视可听之物的积极投入，2 而不是针对它对不可视不可听之物的具体努力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 你看待自然的方式总是针对人类心灵，1仅针对其对可见或听到的事物的积极关注2，而不是针对其对未见或未闻事物的具体努力。

text.ori_cn: 只在有睹有闻上驰骛。

text.ori_cn: 不在不睹不闻上着实用功。

text.ori_cn: 盖不睹不闻，实良知本体。
text.man_en: But the original substance of innate knowledge consists in what is not seen or heard and 1the effort to extend innate knowledge consists in the mind's being cautious [over things one does not see] and apprehensive [over things one does not hear].
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the essence of conscience that we do not see or hear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It cannot be seen or heard, but it is the true nature of conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Indeed, to neither see nor hear is the essence of true knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，先天知识的本原在于看不见、听不到的东西，而扩展先天知识的努力在于心灵的谨慎（对看不见的东西）和忧虑（对听不到的东西）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但先天知识的本体在于未见未闻，而扩展先天知识的努力在于心的谨慎（未见的事物）和恐惧（未闻的事物）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但良知的原始实质在于那些看不见或听不见的东西，扩展良知的努力在于心对那些看不见的东西保持谨慎，对那些听不见的东西保持忧虑。

text.ori_cn: 戒慎恐惧，是致良知的功夫。
text.man_en: Being cautious and fearful is the way to develop conscience.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be cautious and fearful is the work of conscience.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Being cautious and fearful is the way to develop conscience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Cautiousness and vigilance are the practices of attaining moral knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 谨慎和敬畏是培养良知的途径。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 谨慎和恐惧是培养良心的方法。

text.ori_cn: 学者时时刻刻常睹其所不睹，常闻其所不闻，功夫方有个实落处。
text.man_en: The student must at all times and at every moment see what he does not see and hear what he does not hear and then his effort can be concrete and sincere.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Scholars always see what they don't see and hear what they don't hear, and only then will there be a real place for kung fu.

text.ori_cn: 久久成熟后，则不须着力，不待防检，而真性自不息亦。
text.man_en: When after a long time he has mastered the task, he does not need to exert energy, and without any caution or control the true nature will naturally operate without cease.

text.ori_cn: 〔15〕问：“先儒谓鸢飞鱼跃，与‘必有事焉”，同一活泼泼地。”
text.man_en: I said, “A former scholar said that the flying of the hawk, the leaping of fishes, and the feeling that one must always be doing something are all very lively and dynamic in the same way. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [15] Q. "The first Confucian says that the kite flies and the fish leaps, and 'there must be something in it', the same lively ground."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [15] Question: "The ancient Confucians said that the kite flies and the fish leaps, which is the same as "something must happen", which is the same as lively. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [15] Question: 'The ancients said that the soaring of the kite and the leaping of the fish are just as lively as 'there must be something in it.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我说："以前有位学者说过，鹰的飞翔、鱼的跃动，以及人总要做些什么的感觉，都是非常活泼灵动的。"

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“亦是。

text.ori_cn: 天地间活泼泼地，无非此理，便是吾良知的流行不息，‘致良知”便是‘必有事”的工夫。
text.man_en: The whole universe is very lively and dynamic because of the same principle. It is the unceasing universal operation of one's innate knowledge. To extend innate knowledge is the task of always doing something.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is the reason why the world is alive and well, and this is the prevalence of my conscience, and "to know one's conscience" is the work of "something must be done".

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 整个宇宙之所以生机勃勃、充满活力，也是因为这个原理。这就是一个人的先天知识不间断的普遍运作。扩展先天知识就是一直在做事。

text.ori_cn: 〔16〕先生曰：“诸公在此，务要立个必为圣人之心，时时刻刻须是一棒一条痕，一掴一掌血，方能听吾说话，句句得力。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “Here, gentlemen, all of you must have your minds determined to become sages. At all times and at every moment, your effort must be so earnest and strong that ‘Every beating on the body will leave a scar and every slap on the face will fill the palm with blood. ' Only then can every sentence of mine be effective as you listen to me.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr [16] said: "gentlemen here, be sure to set up a must be a saint's heart, at all times must be a stick a trace, a slap a palm blood, in order to listen to my words, every sentence is powerful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔16〕 The Master said: "Everyone here, you must have a heart that you must be a saint. You must make a mark with a stick and draw blood with a slap at all times, so that you can listen to my words and make every word effective.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mr. [16] said, 'Gentlemen, being here, you must establish a resolute determination to become sages. You must constantly strive with utmost effort, bearing marks of each strike and the blood of each slap, only then will you truly grasp the essence of my words and gain strength from every sentence.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："在这里，先生们，你们都必须下定决心成为圣贤。无论何时何地，你们的努力都必须如此认真和强烈，以至于'每一次殴打都会留下伤疤，每一巴掌都会让掌心充血。'只有这样，我的每一句话你们听了才会有效果。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“在此，诸位先生，皆当立志成圣。无论何时何地，你的努力必须如此认真和强烈，以至于“身上每打一次都会留下疤痕，脸上每打一巴掌都会流血”。 ’只有这样，你听我说的时候，我的每句话才有效。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“这里，先生们，你们都必须下定决心成为圣人。在所有的时间里，每时每刻，你们的努力都必须如此认真而强烈，以至于‘每次敲击身体都会留下伤痕，每次耳光都会充满鲜血。’只有这样，当你们听我说话，每一句话才会对你们有效。

text.ori_cn: 〔18〕一友自叹：“私意萌时，分明自心知得，只是不能使他即去。”
text.man_en: A friend sighed and said, “When a selfish desire begins to emerge, one clearly knows it in his own mind but cannot immediately get rid of it. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [18] A friend sighed to himself, "When his private thoughts sprang up, he clearly knew it in his own heart, but he could not make him go."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔18〕A friend sighed to himself: "When selfish thoughts arise, I clearly know them in my heart, but I can't make them go away immediately."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [18] A friend once sighed, 'When selfish thoughts arise, I clearly feel it in my heart, but I simply cannot make them go away.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一位朋友叹了口气说："当私欲开始涌现时，一个人自己心里清楚，却无法立即摆脱它。"

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“你萌时，这一知处便是你的命根，当下即去消磨，便是立命工夫。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “As the desire emerges, your knowledge of it is your very fife. Right then and there go ahead and erase the desire. That is the task of establishing ones' destiny. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman said: "When you are budding, this place of knowledge is the root of your life, and it is the work of establishing a life to be consumed at the present moment."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The teacher said: "When you are young, this place of knowledge is your life root. Spending it right now is your life-establishing skill."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The scholar said, 'When you are enlightened, this understanding becomes your lifeline. To immediately act and cultivate it is the essence of establishing one's life.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："当欲望出现时，你对它的了解就是你的生命。就在此时此地，去消除欲望吧。这就是建立自己命运的任务。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“当欲望出现时，你对它的了解就是你的生命。就在那时，就去消除欲望吧。这就是决定一个人命运的任务。 ”

text.ori_cn: 〔19〕“夫子说“性相近’，即孟子说“性善’，不可专在气质上说。
text.man_en: +[sci][The Teacher said, ] “Confucius' doctrine, ‘By nature men are alike [but through practice they have become far apart], '‘is the same as Mencius' doctrine that human nature is originally good, and should not be understood solely in terms of physical nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [19] "When Fu Zi said that "nature is similar", or Mencius said that "nature is good", he could not speak exclusively in terms of temperament.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [19] "The Confucius said that "natures are similar," which means Mencius said that "natures are good." It cannot be said exclusively in terms of temperament.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果从物理性质上讲，强者和弱者是对立的。他们怎么可能相同呢？人只有在本性上是相同的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果我们从物质本质上讲，那么强者和弱者是相互对立的。他们怎么可能相似呢？人只有本善，才是相同的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果我们从物理本性来讲，那么强与弱是对立的，比如说。他们怎么可能相同呢？唯有在他们的本善上，人们才是一样的。

text.ori_cn: 人生初时善，原是同的，但刚的习于善则为刚善，习于恶则为刚恶，柔的习于善则为柔善，习于恶则为柔恶，便日相远了。”
text.man_en: When people are born, they are the same in original goodness. When those who are strong practice the good, they become strength that is good, and when they practice evil, they become strength that is evil. When those who are weak practice good, they become weakness that is good, and when they practice evil, they become weakness that is evil. Consequently, they become farther and farther apart. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In the beginning of life goodness is the same, but when the strong are accustomed to goodness they are strong and good, and when they are accustomed to evil they are strong and evil, and when the soft are accustomed to goodness they are soft and good, and when they are accustomed to evil they are soft and evil, and then they are far apart from each other day by day."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the beginning of life, kindness is the same, but if you get used to good, you will become strong and good, if you get used to evil, you will become hard and evil, if you get used to good, you will become soft and kind, if you get used to evil, you will become soft and evil, and they will become far apart over time. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Human nature is initially good, and it is the same for all. However, the firm, when accustomed to good, become firmly good, and when accustomed to evil, become firmly evil. The gentle, when accustomed to good, become gently good, and when accustomed to evil, become gently evil. Thus, they diverge further and further.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人之初，性本善。强者行善，便成为善的强者；行恶，便成为恶的强者。弱者行善，则成为善的弱者；行恶，则成为恶的弱者。因此，他们之间的距离越来越远。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人一出生，本性都是一样的。强者行善时，就会成为善的力量；行恶时，就会成为恶的力量。当弱者行善时，他们就成为善的弱点；当他们行恶时，他们就成为恶的弱点。结果，他们的距离越来越远。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人之初性本善。强者为善则为善之强，为恶则为恶之强。弱者为善则为善之弱，为恶则为恶之弱。由此，便渐行渐远。

text.ori_cn: 〔20〕先生尝语学者曰：“心礼上着不得一念留滞，就如眼着不得些子尘沙，些子能得几多；满眼便昏天黑地了。”

text.ori_cn: 〔16〕九川问：“自省念虑，或涉邪妄，或预料理天下事，思到极处，井井有味，便缱绻难屏，觉得早则易觉迟则难，用力克治，愈觉扞格，惟稍迁念他事，则随两忘。
text.man_en: I said, “In my selfexamination and deliberations, I sometimes drift into depraved and erroneous thoughts and sometimes imagine various ways and means of managing the affairs of the world. When these thoughts reach the highest point, they come in orderly succession and are most absorbing, and then I am bound by them and cannot get rid of them. If I realize the situation early, it is easy to dispel them, but if I realize it late, it is difficult. The more I apply my strength to overcoming them, the greater the obstacles seem to be. But to some extent if I shift my thoughts to other things, then both will be forgotten.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [16] Jiu Chuan asked: "Self-examination of thoughts, or involved in the evil, or anticipate the world, think to the extreme, well taste, will be in love and difficult to screen, think early is easy to feel late is difficult to use force to cure, the more I feel defied, but a little move to think of other things, then with the two forget.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [16] Jiuchuan asked: "When you think about yourself, you may be involved in evil delusions, or you may be preoccupied with the world's affairs. If you think about it to the extreme, you will feel something in the well, and you will be obsessed with it. If you feel it early, it will be easy to realize it, but if it is late, it will be difficult. Use force to overcome it. The more I feel confused, the more I think about other things, then I forget them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Jiuchuan asked, 'When introspecting, if my thoughts become erroneous or involve planning worldly matters, I ponder deeply and find them orderly and interesting, which makes it hard to let go. I feel that when thoughts arise early, they are easy to detect, but later they become more difficult. Efforts to control them only make it worse. Only by slightly diverting my attention to other matters do these thoughts gradually fade away.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我说："在自我审视和思考的过程中，我有时会陷入堕落和错误的想法，有时会想象各种管理世事的方法和手段。当这些想法达到最高点时，它们就会有序地接踵而至，最能吸引我，然后我就会被它们束缚住，无法摆脱。如果我觉悟得早，驱散它们就容易，但如果我觉悟得晚，驱散它们就很难。我越是用力去克服它们，障碍似乎就越大。但在某种程度上，如果我把心思转移到其他事情上，那么两者都会被遗忘。

text.ori_cn: 如问一词讼，不可因其应对无状，起个怒心：不可因他言语圆转，生个喜心：不可恶其嘱托，加意治之：不可因其请求，屈意从之：不可因自己事务烦冗，随意苟且断之；不可因旁人谮毁罗织，随人意思处之：这许多意思皆私，只尔自知，须精细省察克治，惟恐此心有一毫偏倚，杜人是非，这便是格物致知。
text.man_en: For instance, when you interrogate a litigant, do not become angry because his replies are impolite or become glad because his words are smooth; do not purposely punish him because you hate his effort to solicit help from your superiors; do not bend your will and yield to him because of his pleading; do not decide the case carelessly on the spur of the moment because you are too busy with your own trifling affairs; and do not settle it according to the opinions of others because people on the side praise you, criticize you, or are building up a case against you. To do any of these is selfish. You need only follow what you know yourself. You must carefully examine yourself and control yourself, lest your mind become in the least prejudiced and destroy the truth as to who is right and who is wrong. This is the investigation of things and t he extension of knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are asked about a lawsuit, you must not be angry because of the lack of response: you must not be happy because of the roundness of his words: you must not be disgusted by his wishes and treat him with extra care: you must not yield to his requests: you must not be arbitrary because of your own redundancy; you must not be slandered by others and dealt with according to their own wishes: all these meanings are private, and only you yourself know them, and you must be careful to observe and control them, lest you should have the slightest bias in your heart, and do others wrong or right; this is the way to understand things. This is the way to achieve knowledge of material things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For example, if you are asking about a lawsuit, you should not be angry because of the lack of response to it; you should not be happy because of his smooth words; you should not hate his instructions and try to deal with them; you should not give in to his requests; and you should not be tempted by yourself. Things are complicated and complicated, and you should cut them off casually; you should not let others criticize you and do whatever they want: many of these ideas are private, and you only know it yourself, so you must carefully examine and manage them, lest there is any bias in your mind, and no one will be right or wrong. It is to study things and gain knowledge.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If you inquire about a lawsuit, do not become angry because the person's response is inappropriate; do not become delighted because their words are eloquent; do not treat them harshly because you dislike their requests; do not yield to their demands because they plead; do not make hasty decisions because of your own affairs; do not handle matters based on others' slander and intrigues. All these intentions are private and only you are aware of them. You must observe and control them meticulously, fearing any slight bias in your heart. This is what it means to extend one's knowledge through investigation of things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 例如，当你审问一个诉讼当事人时，不要因为他的回答不礼貌而生气，也不要因为他的言辞顺畅而高兴；不要因为讨厌他向你的上司寻求帮助而故意惩罚他；不要因为他的恳求而屈服于他；不要因为忙于自己的琐事而一时冲动，草率地决定案件；也不要因为旁人赞扬你、批评你或在制造不利于你的案件，就按照别人的意见来解决。这样做都是自私的。你只需遵循你自己的认识。你必须仔细审视自己，控制自己，以免你的思想产生丝毫偏见，破坏谁是谁非的真相。这就是对事物的调查和知识的扩展。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 比如，当你讯问当事人时，不要因为他的回答不礼貌而生气，也不要因为他的言语圆滑而高兴；不要因为你讨厌他向你的上级寻求帮助而故意惩罚他；不要因他的恳求而屈服于他；不要因为忙于自己的琐事而草率地决定案件；不要因为旁人称赞你、批评你、或者对你立案，就按照别人的意见来解决。做任何这些都是自私的。你只需要遵循你自己所了解的。你一定要仔细审视自己，控制自己，免得你的思想带有丝毫的偏见，破坏了谁对谁错的真理。这是对事物的考察，是知识的延伸。

text.man_en: As I was leaving Ch'ienchou to go home, I wrote a poem to bid our Teacher farewell, which read:Innate knowledge has nothing to do with hearing much. At the time of mysterious union the root was already planted. If we follow it in our likes and dislikes, that is the learning of the Sage. When we do not lean forward or backward to accommodate things, there is the Principle of Heaven.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [19] Pious state will return, there is a poem to say goodbye to Mr. Yun: "good knowledge of what is the Department of much heard, wonderful together at that time has been planted hate, good and bad from the sacred learning, will welcome nowhere is Qianyuan".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [19] When Qianzhou was about to return, there was a poet who said: "What is the good knowledge? It is due to many hearings. At that time, hatred was already planted in the wonderful union. Likes and dislikes were followed as holy knowledge. Qianyuan will be everywhere in the future."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [19] Before returning to Qianzhou, I wrote a farewell poem for you, sir, saying: 'Why should true knowledge be linked with extensive learning? Harmonious unity already sows the seeds of resentment at the time. Embracing likes and dislikes as the way of the sages, there is no place to find the primordial force.'

text.ori_cn: 曰︰“这良知人人皆有，圣人只是保全无些障蔽，兢兢业业，亹亹翼翼，自然不息，便也是学，只是生的分数多，所谓之‘生知、安行’；众人自孩提之童，莫不完具此知，只是障蔽多，然本体之知自难泯息，虽问学克冶，也只凭他，只是学的分数多，所以谓之‘学知、利行’。”
text.man_en: He said, “All people have this innate knowledge. Only the sage preserves it completely and keeps it free from the least obscuration. He is cautious, careful, tirelessly diligent, and of course never stops in these efforts. This is already study. Only because with him the product of inborn knowledge is greater, he is therefore said to be born with knowledge and to practice it naturally and easily. 6 Ordinary people possess this innate knowledge in total from infancy, except that it is much obscured. But the knowledge of the original substance cannot be obliterated. 7 Even study and selfcontrol depend on it. 8 Because with ordinary people the proportion of knowledge acquired through study is greater, they are therefore said to learn through study and to practice it for its advantage. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He said: "This conscience everyone has, the saint is just to protect without some obstacles, conscientious, diligently, diligently wing, natural, it is also learning, just born of the score more, the so-called 'born of knowledge, safe line'; all people from the child of the child, all have this knowledge, just more obstacles, but the knowledge of the body from the difficult to die out of the rest, although the ask Even though one learns and learns, it is only by virtue of him that one learns more, which is why it is called 'learning to know and benefiting to act'."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Said: "Everyone has this kind of conscience. The sage just keeps it clear of any obstacles, works conscientiously, is careful, and never stops naturally. This is also learning, but the score of students is more. The so-called 'knowledge and safety'; everyone has it since childhood. "Children, we all have this knowledge, but there are many obstacles, but it is difficult to lose the original knowledge. Even if we ask and learn, we can only rely on him, but we only learn a lot, so it is called 'learning to know and benefiting from practice'."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is said, 'This innate knowledge is something everyone possesses. A sage merely preserves it without any obstructions, diligently and cautiously, continuously and tirelessly. They do not cease naturally, and this is also learning, only with a larger portion of what is born, termed as 'knowing from birth and acting accordingly'; ordinary people, from their infancy, all completely possess this knowledge. It is just that there are more obstructions. However, the inherent knowledge is difficult to extinguish. Even through inquiry and self-cultivation, it still relies on this, only with a larger portion of learned knowledge, hence termed as 'acquired knowledge and beneficial actions'.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他说："所有人都有这种与生俱来的知识。只有圣人才能完全保存它，使其不受丝毫蒙蔽。他谨慎、小心、孜孜不倦，当然，这些努力从未停止。这已经是学习了。只是因为他与生俱来的知识产物更多，所以才说他与生俱来就有知识，并能自然而然、轻而易举地实践知识。6 普通人从婴孩时期起就完全拥有这种与生俱来的知识，只是这种知识非常模糊。但是，原始物质的知识是无法抹去的。7 甚至学习和自我控制都依赖于它。8 由于普通人通过学习获得的知识所占比例较大，因此可以说他们是通过学习和实践来获得知识的。"

text.man_en: The original substance of the mind contains everything. In reality it is the whole heaven. Only because it is hidden by selfish desires is the original substance of heaven lost. text.ori_cn: 乃指天以示之曰：“比如面前见天，是昭昭之天，四外见天，也只是眧眧之天。
text.man_en: Thereupon he pointed to heaven, saying, “For instance, we see heaven in front of us. It is bright and clear heaven. If we see heaven outside the house, it is the same bright and clear heaven.

text.ori_cn: 于此便见一节之知即全体之知，全体之知即一节之知，总是一个本体。”

text.ori_cn: 〔2〕先生曰：“圣贤非无功业气节：但其循着这天理则便是道，不可以事功气节名矣。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “Sages and worthies are not without achievements or moral integrity. But since they are in accord with the Principle of Nature, they represent the Way itself. Therefore their fame does not rest merely in achievements or moral integrity. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr [2] said: "Sage is not without merit and temperament: but it follows this heavenly principle is the way, can not be the name of merit and temperament."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔2〕The teacher said: "Sages are not without merit and integrity: but they follow the laws of heaven and that is the Tao, and they cannot be called merit and integrity."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The master said, 'Sages are not without achievements and integrity; however, their adherence to the natural order itself is the Way, and it cannot be simply named as merit or integrity.'

text.ori_cn: 〔4〕先生曰：“我辈致知，只是名随分限所及；今日良知见在如此，只随今日所知扩充到底，明日良知又有开悟，便从明日所知扩充到底，如此方是精一功夫。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “In the extension of knowledge, we should do so according to our capacity. Here is our innate knowledge today. We should extend it to the utmost according to what we know today. As our innate knowledge is further developed tomorrow, we should extend it to the utmost according to what we know then. Only this can be said to be the task of refinement and singlemindedness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr [4] said: "My generation to know, just name with the limit of the branch; today's conscience to see in so, only with today's knowledge to expand to the end, tomorrow's conscience and enlightenment, will be from tomorrow's knowledge to expand to the end, so that is the essence of a kung fu.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔4〕The teacher said: "My generation's knowledge is only limited by the name. Today's conscience sees it like this, and only expands it to the end based on what it knows today. Tomorrow, its conscience will be enlightened again, so it will expand it to the end based on what it knows tomorrow. This is how it is. Work hard.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mr. said, 'Our pursuit of knowledge is limited by our capabilities; today, our inherent knowledge is as it is, and we must fully extend what we know today. Tomorrow, when we gain new understanding, we shall extend our knowledge further. This is the true essence of dedicated effort.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："在扩展知识时，我们应该量力而行。这是我们今天与生俱来的知识。这就是我们今天的先天知识，我们应该根据我们今天所知道的将其扩展到极致。明天，我们的先天知识有了进一步的发展，我们就应该根据那时的知识将其扩展到极致。这才是精益求精、一心一意的任务。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“知识的延伸，要量力而行。这是我们今天与生俱来的知识。我们应该按照我们今天所知道的最大限度地扩展它。当我们的先天知识明天进一步发展时，我们应该根据我们当时所知道的来最大限度地扩展它。唯此，才可以说是精益求精、一心一意的任务。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“在扩展知识的时候，我们应该根据自己的能力去做。这是我们今天的先天知识。我们应该根据今天所知道的将其发挥到极致。随着我们的先天知识在明天进一步发展，我们应该根据当时所知道的将其发挥到极致。只有这样，才可以说是精进和专一的任务。”

text.ori_cn: 与人论学，亦须随人分限所及；如树有这些萌芽，只把这些水去灌溉，萌芽再长，便又加水，自拱把以至合抱，灌溉之功皆是随其分限所及，若些小萌芽，有一桶水在，尽要倾上，便浸坏他了。”
text.man_en: In discussing learning with others we should also do so according to their capacity. For instance, when the tree has sprouted only a little, give it a little water. As the sprout grows, give it more water. From the time that the tree stem can be encircled by the fingers of one hand and then by those of two hands to the time when it can be encircled by both arms, the watering should be done according to its capacity to absorb. Suppose there is but a small sprout and here is a pail of water. 6 If all the water is poured over it, it will be drenched to death. ”

The irrigation work is within the scope of their limitations. , if there is a bucket of water in some small sprouts, it will be soaked if it is poured up. "

If you have a small bud and pour an entire bucket of water on it, it will drown.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在与他人讨论学习时，我们也应量力而行。例如，当树刚刚发芽时，给它一点水。随着新芽的生长，给它更多的水。从一只手的手指可以环抱树干，到两只手的手指可以环抱树干，再到两只手臂可以环抱树干，浇水应该根据树干的吸收能力来进行。假设只有一棵小树苗，这里有一桶水。6 如果把所有的水都浇在它身上，它就会被淋死。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与人讨论学习，也要量力而行。例如，当树只发芽了一点点时，就给它一点水。随着豆芽的生长，给它更多的水。从用一只手的手指环住树干，再用两只手的手指环住树干，到双臂能环住树干时，应根据其吸收能力浇水。假设只有一粒小芽，这里有一桶水。 6 如果所有的水都倒在上面，它就会被淹死。 ”
