text.ori_cn: 〔5〕问知行合一。
text.man_en: I asked about the unity of knowledge and action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [5] asked about the unity of knowledge and action.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [5] Ask about the unity of knowledge and action.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [5] Questioning the unity of knowledge and action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我问的是知行合一。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我问知行合一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我询问了知行合一的问题。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“此须识我立言宗旨，今人学问，只因知、行分作两件，故有一念发动，虽是不善，然却未曾行，便不去禁止。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “You need to understand the basic purpose of my doctrine. In their learning people of today separate knowledge and action into two different things. Therefore when a thought is aroused, although it is evil, they do not stop it because it has not been translated into action.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr said: "This must know my purpose of speech, today's learning, only because of the knowledge, line divided into two pieces, so there is a thought to start, although it is not good, but has not been done, they do not go to prohibit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Master said: "You must understand the purpose of my statement. Today's knowledge is only divided into two parts: knowledge and action. Therefore, if a thought arises, although it is not good, but it has not been done, there is no need to stop it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said: 'It is crucial to understand the guiding principle of my discourse. The modern approach to learning separates knowledge and action into two distinct entities. As a result, when a single thought arises, even if it is not virtuous, one does not intervene to stop it as long as it has not yet manifested in action.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："你们需要了解我的学说的基本目的。今天的人们在学习中把知识和行动割裂开来。因此，当一个念头被唤起时，尽管它是邪恶的，他们也不会阻止它，因为它还没有转化为行动。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老师说：“你们要了解我教义的基本目的。当今人们在学习中将知识和行动分成两个不同的事物。因此，当一个念头生起时，虽然它是恶的，但他们并不阻止它，因为它还没有转化为行动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“你们需要理解我的教义的基本目的。今天的人们在学习中将知识和行动分成两件不同的事情。因此，当一个念头产生时，虽然它是邪恶的，他们并不会阻止它，因为它还没有转化为行动。

text.ori_cn: 我今说个‘知、行合一’，正要人晓得一念发动处，便即是行了；发动处有不善，就将这不善的念克倒了，须要彻根彻底不使那一念不善潜伏在胸中：此是我立言宗旨。”
text.man_en: I advocate the unity of knowledge and action precisely because I want people to understand that when a thought is aroused it is already action. If there is anything evil when the thought is aroused, one must overcome the evil thought. One must go to the root and go to the bottom and not allow that evil thought to lie latent in his mind. This is the basic purpose of my doctrine. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I now say that 'knowledge and action are one', and I want people to know where a thought is initiated, then it is action; where there is badness, the bad thought will be knocked down, and the root of the bad thought must not be lurked in the chest: this is the purpose of my speech."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Now I am talking about "the unity of knowledge and action". I want people to know where a thought originates, and then it is done. If there is an unwholesome thought in the origin, then the unwholesome thought must be overcome. It is necessary to completely prevent that unwholesome thought. Lurking in my chest: This is the purpose of my speech. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Now I speak of the unity of knowledge and action, aiming for people to understand that the moment a thought arises, it is already an action. If the thought is unrighteous, it should be immediately subdued, ensuring thoroughly that no unrighteous thought is allowed to linger in the heart. This is the principle of my teachings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我主张知行合一，正是因为我希望人们明白，当一个念头被唤起时，它就已经是行动了。如果起心动念时有什么恶念，就必须克服恶念。人必须追根溯源，不能让邪恶的思想潜伏在心中。这就是我的学说的基本目的。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我主张知行合一，正是因为我想让人们明白，当一个想法被唤起时，它就已经是行动了。如果一念头有什么恶念，就必须克服恶念。一定要追根溯源，追根究底，不让那个邪念在心里潜伏。这就是我的学说的基本目的。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我主张知行合一，正是因为我希望人们明白，当一个念头被激起时，它已经是行动了。如果在念头激起时有任何恶念，人们必须战胜邪恶的念头。必须追根究底，深入到底，不允许那邪恶的念头潜伏在心中。这就是我的学说的基本目的。

text.ori_cn: 〔6〕“圣人无所不知，只是知个天理：无所不能，只是能个天理。
text.man_en: [6] “The sage knows everything, but only knows the laws of heaven; he is omnipotent, but knows the laws of heaven.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [6] "The sage knows nothing, but knows a heavenly principle: he is omnipotent, but is capable of a heavenly principle.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [6] “The sage knows everything, but only knows the laws of heaven; he is omnipotent, but knows the laws of heaven.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [6] 'The sage has all-encompassing knowledge, but it is solely the knowledge of natural law; he has unlimited capabilities, but it is solely the capability of adhering to natural law.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: [6] "圣人无所不知，唯知天道；圣人无所不能，唯知天道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: [6]“圣人无所不知，惟知天理；圣人无所不知，惟知天理；他无所不能，却知晓天道法则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人无所不知，但只知道天道的规律；他无所不能，但了解天道的法则。

text.ori_cn: 圣人本体明白，故事事知个天理所在，便去尽个天理：不是本体明后，却于天下事物都便知得，便做得来也。
text.man_en: The original substance of the mind of the sage is clear and therefore in all things he knows where the Principle of Nature lies and forthwith carries it out to the utmost. It is not that after the original substance of his mind becomes clear he then knows all the things in the world and is able to carry all of them out.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saint understands the nature of the body, and when he knows where the Divine Principle is, he goes to do the Divine Principle: it is not that after the nature of the body has been made clear, he knows and can do all things under the sun.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sage understands the original body, knows the laws of nature in stories and things, and then fulfills the laws of heaven. It is not that the true body is clear, but he knows everything in the world and can do it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sage understands the essence of things, and by recognizing the underlying principles in the stories and affairs, he acts in accordance with these principles. It is not that he knows everything in worldly matters from the beginning, but rather he comprehends and accomplishes things through his innate clarity and wisdom.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人心智的本体是清明的，因此他对万事万物都能知晓自然之理的所在，并将其发挥到极致。这并不是说，在他的心灵本体变得清明之后，他就能知道世间万物，并能将它们全部付诸实施。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人的心本原是清楚的，所以知道一切事物的自然法则在哪里，并且立即去实行。并不是他的心本体明了之后，他就知道了世间的一切事情，并且能够做到一切。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人的心性本质是清明的，因此在所有事情上他都知道自然的道理所在并立即将其贯彻得淋漓尽致。并不是他的心性本质变得清明之后，才了解世间万物而能够将其一一实施。

text.ori_cn: 天下事物，如名物度数、草木鸟兽之类，不胜其烦，圣人须是本体明了，亦何缘能尽知得。
text.man_en: Things in the world, such as the names, varieties, and systems, and plants and animals, are innumerable. Although the original substance of the sage is very clear, how can he know everything?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The things of the world, such as the names and numbers of things, grass, trees, birds and animals, and so on, are too numerous to be understood by the saint, who must be clear about the nature of the body, and how can he know it all.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Things in the world, such as names, objects, plants, birds, and beasts, are endless. A sage must understand their true nature and why they can understand them all.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The myriad things under the heavens, such as names, measures, plants, and animals, are beyond exhaustive enumeration. A sage must grasp their fundamental essence, but how can one possibly know them all in their entirety?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世间万物，名目、种类、制度、动植物，数不胜数。虽然圣人的本体非常清楚，但他怎么可能无所不知呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 世间之物，其名、种、制、动植物，数不胜数。圣人的本体虽然很清楚，但他又怎么可能知道一切呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 世间万物，如名目、品种、制度，动物与植物，不计其数。虽然圣人的原本心性很清明，他又怎能知道一切呢？

text.ori_cn: 但不必知的，圣人自不消求知，其所当知的，圣人自能问人：如‘子入太庙，每事问’之类。
text.man_en: What is not necessary to know, he does not have to seek to know. What he should know, he naturally asks others, like Confucius, who, when he entered the grand temple, asked about everything.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: But what need not be known, the sage need not seek to know, and what he ought to know, the sage can ask: as in the case of 'The son enters the temple and asks about everything' and the like.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: But there is no need to know, and the sage does not need to seek knowledge. What he should know, the sage can ask others: "When you enter the Ancestral Temple, you will ask about everything."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: However, there are things one does not need to know, and a sage does not need to seek knowledge actively. For what he ought to know, a sage can always ask others, just like 'When the Master entered the Grand Temple, he inquired about everything.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不需要知道的，他不必去了解。该知道的，他自然会问别人，就像孔子进入大庙后，什么都要问。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不需要知道的事情，他不必寻求知道。他该知道的，自然就去问别人，就像孔子一样，进了大殿，什么都问。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不必要知道的东西，他不必去追求了解。他应该知道的东西，他自然会向他人询问，就像孔子，当他进入大庙时，问了关于一切的事情。

text.ori_cn: 先儒谓‘虽知亦问，敬谨之至’；此说不可通。
text.man_en: A former scholar said that the fact that although Confucius knew he still asked shows he was perfectly serious and careful. Such an interpretation is absurd.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The former Confucian said, 'Although I know, I also ask, respect and rigour to'; this saying is not understandable.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Pre-Confucianism said, "Even if you know something, ask questions, and be extremely respectful." This statement cannot be understood.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The former scholars said, 'Even if you know, still ask; utmost reverence and prudence.' This statement is unreasonable.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 以前有位学者说，孔子明知故问，说明他是非常认真和谨慎的。这种解释是荒谬的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一位曾经的学者说，孔子虽然知道，但仍然问，这表明他是非常认真和谨慎的。这样的解释是荒谬的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一位前学者说，尽管孔子知道他仍然问问题的事实表明他非常认真和谨慎。这种解释是荒谬的。

text.ori_cn: 圣人于礼乐名物，不必尽知，然他知得一个天理，便自有许多节文度数出来，不知能问，亦即是天理节文所在。”
text.man_en: A sage does not have to know all the names and varieties of ceremonies and music. But since he knows the Principle of Nature, all measures, regulations, and details can be deduced from it. The fact that when he did not know he asked shows how the measure and pattern of the Principle of Nature operates. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saint in the rites and music and famous things, do not have to know all, but he knows a heavenly reason, there are many sections of the degree out, do not know can ask, that is, the heavenly reason section of the text is located."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A sage does not need to know everything about rituals, music, names, and objects. However, if he knows a heavenly principle, he will have many verses and verses to calculate them. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A sage does not necessarily need to know all the rites, music, and names of objects, but when he understands a single principle of Heaven, many norms and measures will naturally emerge. If he does not know, he can ask, and that itself is where the norms and measures of the Heavenly principle reside.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人不必知道仪式和音乐的所有名称和种类。但是，既然他知道自然的原理，那么所有的措施、规定和细节都可以从中推导出来。当他不知道时，他就去问，这说明了自然原理的尺度和模式是如何运作的。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人不必知道礼乐的所有名称和种类。但既然他知道自然之理，那么一切措施、规定、细节都可以从中推导出来。当他不知道时他问的事实表明了自然原理的尺度和模式是如何运作的。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人不必知道所有礼乐的名称和种类。但由于他知道天理，所有的措施、规章和细节都可以从中推导出来。当他不知道时他便询问，这表明了天理的法度和规律是如何运作的。

text.ori_cn: 〔7〕问：“先生尝谓善、恶只是一物。
text.man_en: I asked, “Sir, you once said that good and evil are one thing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [7] Q.: "Mr. Taste said that good and evil are just one thing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [7] Question: "Sir, you have said that good and evil are just one thing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Q: 'Sir, you once said that good and evil are but one and the same.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我问道："先生，您曾经说过，善与恶是一回事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我问：“先生，您曾经说过，善恶是一回事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我问：“先生，您曾经说过善与恶是一体的。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“至善者，心之本体。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “The highest good is the original substance of the mind.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman said, "The most good is the essence of the heart.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Master said: “The supreme good is the essence of the heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Master said, 'The Supreme Good is the fundamental nature of the mind.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："至善是心灵的本源。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 子曰：“至善者，心本体也。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说，“至善是心的本质。”

text.ori_cn: 本体上才过当些子，便是恶了；不是有一个善，却又有一个恶来相对也。
text.man_en: When one deviates a little from this original substance, there is evil. It is not that there is a good and there is also an evil to oppose it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And when the body of the man is in excess, it is evil; there is not one good, but there is another evil in opposition to it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there are too many things in essence, it is evil; instead of having a good thing, there is also an evil to match it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when one exceeds moderation does it become bad; it is not that there is one good against which there is another bad in opposition.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当人稍稍偏离这个本源，就会产生恶。并不是有善就有恶，有恶就有善。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 稍微偏离这个本来的本质，就会有邪恶。并不是说有善，也有与它相对的恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当一个人稍微偏离这种原始物质时，就会有邪恶。这并不是说有善，同时也有与之对立的恶。

text.ori_cn: 故善、恶只是一物。”
text.man_en: Therefore good and evil are one thing. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore good and evil are just one thing."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, good and evil are just one thing. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, good and evil are merely one and the same.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，善与恶是一回事。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以善与恶是一回事。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，善与恶是一体的。

text.ori_cn: 直因闻先生之说，则知程子所谓“善固性也，恶亦不可不谓之性。”
text.man_en: Having heard our Teacher's explanation, I know that we can no longer doubt Master Ch'eng Hao's sayings, “Man's nature is of course good, but it cannot be said that evil is not his nature” 1 and “Good and evil in the world are both the Principle of Nature. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Because I heard what you said, I know what Cheng Zi said, "Goodness is also nature, and evil cannot be called nature."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: After hearing what Mr. Zhiyin said, we knew that Cheng Zi said that "goodness is a fixed nature, and evil cannot be ignored."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only upon hearing Mr. Zhi's words did I understand what Mr. Cheng meant by 'Goodness is indeed inherent in human nature, but evil cannot be said not to be a part of it as well.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 听了老师的讲解，我知道我们不能再怀疑澄怀大师的 "人之初性本善，性本恶 "1 和 "世间善恶，本乎自然 "2 的说法了。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 听了师父的讲解，我知道我们不能再怀疑程豪大师的一句话：“人性固然是善的，但不能说恶不是他的本性”1和“人间有善有恶”。两者都是自然法则。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 听了老师的解释，我知道我们不能再怀疑程颢大师的说法：“人的本性当然是善的，但不能说恶就不是他的本性”和“世界上的善与恶都是自然之理”。

text.ori_cn: 又曰：“善、恶皆天理。
text.man_en: He also said: “Good and evil are both natural principles.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is also said, "Good and evil are all the laws of heaven.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He also said: “Good and evil are both natural principles.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is also said, 'Both good and evil are inherent in the natural order.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他还说"善与恶都是自然原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他又说：“善恶，皆是自然之理。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他还说：“善恶都是自然的原则。”

text.ori_cn: 谓之恶者，本非恶，但于本性上过与不及之间耳。”
text.man_en: What is called evil is not originally evil. It becomes evil only because of deviation from the mean. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who calls it evil is not evil, but is between over and under in nature."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: What is called evil is not evil in nature, but it is somewhere between fault and inferiority in nature. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What is called evil is not inherently evil; it is merely a matter of excess or deficiency in its nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所谓邪恶，原本并不邪恶。它之所以成为邪恶，只是因为偏离了平均值。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所谓恶，本来就不是恶。仅仅因为偏离了中庸之道，它才变得邪恶。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所谓的邪恶本来就不是邪恶。只有因为偏离了中庸，它才成为邪恶。

text.ori_cn: 其说皆无可疑。
text.man_en: None of his statements are doubtful.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no doubt about any of them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: None of his statements are doubtful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is no doubt about what they said.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他的发言没有一句是可疑的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他的陈述没有一个值得怀疑的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他的陈述没有任何疑点。

text.ori_cn: 〔8〕先生尝谓“人但得好善如好好色，恶恶如恶恶臭，便是圣人。”
text.man_en: The Teacher once said that to be a sage one simply has to love good as he loves beautiful colors and hate evil as he hates a bad smell.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr. [8] said, "A man is a saint if he is as good as a good colour and as evil as a bad smell."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔8〕 The teacher once said, "A person is a saint if he likes good things as much as he likes sex, and hates evil as much as he hates bad smells."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mr. once said, 'If a person could love virtue as much as they love beauty, and hate vice as much as they hate foul odors, then they would be a sage.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师曾经说过，一个人要成为圣贤，就必须像喜爱美丽的颜色一样喜爱善，像讨厌难闻的气味一样讨厌恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老师曾经说过，要成为圣人，就必须好善如好色，恶恶如恶臭。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 曾经有人说道，成为圣人只需要像爱美丽的色彩那样去爱善，像厌恶难闻的气味那样去恨恶。

text.ori_cn: 直初闻之，觉甚易，后礼验得来，此个功夫着实是难。
text.man_en: When I first heard it, I felt it was very easy. But as I proceeded to realize it through personal experience, I found this task to be really difficult.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When I first heard about it, I thought it was very easy, but later I learnt from my experience that it is really difficult to do this.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When I heard it for the first time, I thought it was very easy, but later I learned it through etiquette. This skill is really difficult.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At first, it seemed very easy, but after empirical verification, I realized that this skill is indeed difficult.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当我第一次听到这句话时，我觉得非常容易。但当我通过亲身经历去体会时，我发现这项任务真的很难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当我第一次听到它时，我觉得这很容易。但随着我的亲身经历，我发现这个任务非常困难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当我第一次听到它时，我觉得它很容易。但是当我通过亲身体验来实现它时，我发现这项任务真的很难。

text.ori_cn: 如一念虽知好善、恶恶，然不知不觉，又夹杂去了。
text.man_en: For instance, although in an instant of thought I know that I should love good and hate evil, yet unconsciously the thought gets mixed and impure.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If one thought knows good and good and evil, and then, without realising it, it is mixed up again.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It's like a thought that knows what is good and what is bad, but it gets mixed up again without realizing it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Although one may momentarily understand and appreciate goodness and detest evil, without consciously realizing it, these thoughts become intermixed and dissipate.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 例如，虽然在一瞬间我知道自己应该爱善恨恶，但不知不觉中思想就变得混杂不纯了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 比如，虽然一念之间我知道自己应该好善恶恶，但不知不觉间，思想就变得杂乱、不纯了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 例如，尽管在一瞬间我知道应该爱善恶恶，但不自觉间，这个念头就会变得混杂而不纯净。

text.ori_cn: 才有夹杂，便不是好善如好好色、恶恶如恶恶臭的心。
text.man_en: As soon as it is mixed and impure, the mind is no longer that which loves good as it loves beautiful colors and hates evil as it hates a bad smell.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is only when there is intermingling that it is not a mind that is as good as a good colour and as evil as a bad smell.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a mixture, which is not a mind that loves good as much as it loves sex, and hates evil as much as it hates stench.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when there is a mixture, it is not a heart that loves goodness like one loves beautiful colors, or hates evil like one hates foul odors.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 一旦混杂不纯，心灵就不再像爱美丽的颜色那样爱美好，也不再像讨厌难闻的气味那样讨厌邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一旦杂乱不纯，心就不再是爱善如爱色，恨恶如恨恶臭的心了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一旦它被混杂和不纯净，心灵就不再像爱美丽的颜色一样爱善良，也不再像讨厌难闻的气味一样憎恶邪恶。

text.ori_cn: 善能实实的好，是无一念不善矣：恶能实实的恶，是无念及恶矣。
text.man_en: If one really and earnestly loves good, then all his thoughts will be good, and if one really and earnestly hates evil, then none of his thoughts will approach evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When good can be truly good, there is no thought that is not good enough: when evil can be truly evil, there is no thought that is not good or evil enough.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If good can be truly good, then there is no thought of it being bad; if evil can be true, if there is no evil, then there is no thought of evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: True goodness manifests when not a single thought is unkind; true wickedness is when not a single thought is righteous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人真心诚意地爱善，那么他的所有想法都会是善的；如果一个人真心诚意地憎恶恶，那么他的所有想法都不会接近恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果一个人真心实意地喜爱善，那么他的思想就全部是善的；如果一个人真心实意地憎恶邪恶，那么他的思想就不会走向邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人真正且诚挚地热爱善良，那么他所有的思想都会是善良的；如果一个人真正且诚挚地憎恨邪恶，那么他的思想中将不会有任何邪恶的成分。

text.ori_cn: 故圣人之学，只是一诚而已。
text.man_en: Therefore to learn to become a sage requires sincerity and sincerity only.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the learning of the saints is just one sincerity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the learning of saints is nothing but sincerity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The learning of the sage is simply a matter of sincerity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，学习成为圣贤需要真诚，也只有真诚才能成为圣贤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故学成圣人，唯有诚心，唯有诚心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，要成为圣人，只需真诚和真诚。

text.ori_cn: 〔9〕问“修道说”言“率性之谓道”属圣人分上事，“修道之谓教”属贤人分上事。
text.man_en: [9] When asked about "Cultivating the Way", it is said that "what is known as the Tao" is the priority of saints, and "cultivation of the Tao is called teaching" is the priority of sages.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [9] The question "Cultivation of the Way" says that "the nature of the Way" is a matter for the sages, and "the cultivation of the Way" is a matter for the sages.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [9] When asked about "Cultivating the Way", it is said that "what is known as the Tao" is the priority of saints, and "cultivation of the Tao is called teaching" is the priority of sages.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [9] When asked about the 'doctrine of cultivating the Way,' it is said that 'following one's nature is called the Way,' which pertains to the domain of sages, whereas 'cultivating the Way is called teaching,' which pertains to the domain of virtuous people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: [9] 问 "修道"，则谓 "是谓道 "为圣人之先，"修道谓之教 "为圣人之先。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: [9]问“修道”时，说“所谓道”是圣人的首要，“修道称为教”是圣人的首要。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当被问及“修道”时，据说“所谓道，是圣人的优先”，而“修道称为教，是贤人的优先”。

text.ori_cn: 先生日 ：﹁众人亦率性也，但率性在圣人分上较多，故﹃率性之谓道﹄属圣人事；圣人亦修道也，但修道在贤人分上多，故“修道之谓教”属贤人事。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “Ordinary people also fulfill their nature. But fulfilling nature is more the function of a sage. Therefore ‘To fulfill our nature is called the Way' refers to the function of the sage. The sage also cultivates the Way. But cultivating the Way is more the function of the worthy. Therefore ‘The cultivation of the Way is called education' refers to the function of the worthy. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr. Theo said: "All people also have a high rate of sex, but what would be a high rate of sex is more for the saints, so what would be a high rate of sex is the way of the saints, and the saints also cultivate the way of the saints, but the way of the saints is more for the saints, so what would be a high way of cultivating the way of the saints is the way of the saints."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The teacher said: "Everyone is also candid, but the self-willedness is more common among saints, so "being self-willed is called Tao" is a matter for saints; saints also practice Tao, but practicing Tao is more common among virtuous people, so "cultivation is called Tao" "Teaching" virtuous people. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mr. Sun said: 'All people are naturally endowed, but sages have a greater share in this natural endowment, therefore the saying 'To follow one's nature is the way' pertains to sages. Sages also cultivate the way, but the cultivation of the way is more the domain of the virtuous, hence the saying 'To cultivate the way means teaching' pertains to the virtuous.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："普通人也会顺应天性。但成性更多的是圣人的功能。所以'尽性谓之道'指的是圣人的功能。圣人也修道。但 "修道 "更多的是圣人的功能。因此，'修道谓之教'指的是有为者的功能。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“凡夫也尽其性。但成全自然更多的是圣人的职责。故“成性谓之道”，是指圣人的作用。圣人亦修道。但修道更多的是贤人的作用。故‘修道谓之教’，是指贤人之用。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“普通人也实现他们的本性。但实现本性更多是圣人的功能。因此，‘实现我们的本性称为道’是指圣人的功能。圣人也修道。但修道更多是贤者的功能。因此，‘修道称为教育’是指贤者的功能。”

text.ori_cn: 又日 ：“《中庸》一书，大抵皆是说修道的事：故后面凡说君子，说颜渊，说子路，皆是能修道的；说小人，说贤、知、愚不肖，说庶民，皆是不能修道的；其它言舜、文、周公、仲尼，至诚至圣之类，则又圣人之自能修道者也。”
text.man_en: He further said, “Generally speaking, the entire Doctrine of the Mean talks about the cultivation of the Way. Therefore when it later talks about the superior man, about Yen Hui, and about Tzulu, it deals with those who could cultivate the Way. When it talks about the inferior man, about those who are wise or stupid, worthy or unworthy, and about the common folk, it deals with those who are unable to cultivate the Way. And aside from these, when it talks about Emperor Shun, King Wen, Duke Chou, Confucius, and those who are perfectly sincere and perfectly sagely, it deals with sages who can naturally cultivate the Way. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Another day: "The Book of the Mean is, in general, all about the cultivation of Taoism: therefore, all those who speak of the gentleman, of Yan Yuan, and of Zi Lu, are able to cultivate Taoism; those who speak of the little man, of the virtuous, the knowledgeable, the foolish, and the unworthy, and those who speak of the common people, are not able to cultivate Taoism; and those who speak of the Shun, the Man, the Duke of Zhou, and the Chung-ni, and so on, as being most sincere and most saintly, are also the ones whom the saints can cultivate by themselves."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Another day: "The book "The Doctrine of the Mean" mostly talks about cultivating the Tao. Therefore, whenever we talk about gentlemen, Yan Yuan, or Zi Lu, they are all capable of cultivating the Tao; when talking about villains, we talk about the virtuous, knowledgeable, and foolish, and we talk about common people. , are all incapable of cultivating the Tao; others such as Shun, Wen, Zhou Gong, Zhongni, and the Most Sincere and Holy Saints are all saints who can cultivate the Tao."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 'The Book of the Doctrine of the Mean generally discusses the matters of self-cultivation: hence, whenever it mentions the gentleman, Yan Yuan, and Zilu in the later sections, it refers to those capable of self-cultivation; when it talks about the petty person, the wise, the knowledgeable, the foolish, and the common people, it refers to those incapable of self-cultivation; as for the mentions of figures like Shun, King Wen, the Duke of Zhou, and Confucius, who are supremely sincere and holy, these are the sages who are inherently capable of self-cultivation.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他还说："一般来说，《中庸》全篇都是讲修道的。所以后来讲到上人、颜回、子路，都是讲那些能够修道的人。至于 "下人"、"智愚"、"有为"、"无为"、"庶人"，则是指不能修道的人。除此以外，说到舜帝、文王、周公、孔子，说到至诚至圣的人，说的都是能够自然修道的圣人。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他又说：“一般而言，整个《中庸》都是讲修道的。所以后来讲君子、讲颜回、讲子鲁，都是讲能修道的人。讲小人，讲智愚，讲贤不讲，讲平民，讲的是不能修道的人。除此之外，谈到舜帝、文王、周公、孔子，以及至诚至圣的人，都是讲自然能修道的圣人。 ”

text.ori_cn: 且如出外见人相斗，其不是的，我心亦怒：然虽怒，却此心廓然，不曾动些子气。

text.ori_cn: 〔15〕先生尝言：“佛氏不着相，其实着了相，吾儒着相，其实不着相。”
text.man_en: The Teacher once said, “Buddhism claims to be free from attachment to phenomenal things but actually the opposite is the case. We Confucians seem to be attached to phenomenal things but in reality the opposite is true. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr [15] tasted: "The Buddha does not look at phases, but actually looks at phases; our Confucianism looks at phases, but actually does not look at phases."

text.ori_cn: 曰：“佛怕父子累，却逃了父子，怕君臣累，却逃了君臣，怕夫妇累，却逃了夫妇，都是为个君臣、父子、夫妇着了相，便须逃避。
text.man_en: He said, “The Buddhists are afraid of the burden in the relationship between father and son and therefore escape from it. They are afraid of the burden in the relationship between ruler and minister and therefore escape from it. They are afraid of the burden in the relationship between husband and wife and therefore escape from it. In all cases, because the relationships between ruler and minister, father and son, and husband and wife involve attachment to phenomena, they have to escape from them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He said, "The Buddha is afraid that the father and the son will be tired, but he has escaped the father and the son; he is afraid that the ruler and the minister will be tired, but he has escaped the ruler and the minister; he is afraid that the couple will be tired, but he has escaped the couple.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Said: "The Buddha was afraid that the father and son would be tired, but he ran away from the father and son, he was afraid that the king and his ministers were tired, but he ran away from the king and his ministers, he was afraid that the couple was tired, but he ran away from the couple. They are all concerned about the king, ministers, father and son, and husband and wife, so they have to escape.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He said, 'The Buddha fears the burden of parenthood, so he escapes it; he fears the burden of ruler and subject, so he escapes it; he fears the burden of marriage, so he escapes it. All these fears arise from the attachments to these roles, which necessitate evasion.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他说："佛教徒害怕父子关系中的负担，因此逃避这种关系。他们害怕君臣关系中的负担，因此逃避。他们害怕夫妻关系中的负担，因此逃避。在所有情况下，由于君臣关系、父子关系和夫妻关系都涉及对现象的执着，所以他们不得不逃避。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他说：“佛教徒害怕父子关系中的负担，因此逃避它。他们害怕君臣关系中的负担，因而逃避。他们害怕夫妻关系中的负担，因此逃避它。在所有情况下，由于君臣、父子、夫妻之间的关系都涉及对现象的执着，所以他们必须摆脱它们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他说：“佛教徒害怕父子关系中的负担，因此逃避它。他们害怕君臣关系中的负担，因此逃避它。他们害怕夫妻关系中的负担，因此逃避它。在所有情况下，因为君臣、父子和夫妻的关系涉及到对事物的执着，所以他们必须逃避。”

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“既去恶念，便是善念，便复心之本体矣：譬如日光被云来遮蔽，云去光已复矣。

text.ori_cn: 〔3〕先生曰：“吾教人‘致良知’，在‘格物’上用功，却是有根本的学问；日长进一日，愈久愈觉精明。

text.ori_cn: 世儒教人事事物物上去寻讨，却是无根本的学问；方其壮时，虽暂能外面修饰，不见有过，老则精神衰迈，终须放倒；譬如无根之树，移栽水边，虽暂时鲜好，终久要憔悴。”
text.man_en: Famous but mediocre scholars, on the other hand, teach people to search for the principles of each and every thing. Their learning is entirely without foundation. It is like a tree without a root. 6 When it is transplanted to a place near water, although temporarily it looks fresh and beautiful, in time it will finally wither. ”

But when you get older, your spirit will decline and you will eventually have to put it down. It is like a tree without roots, which needs to be transplanted. By the water, although it is fresh and good for a while, it will eventually become haggard. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The scholars of the world teach people to seek everything from external objects, which is ultimately a superficial learning; during one's prime, although one may temporarily adorn oneself outwardly and appear faultless, as one ages and the spirit weakens, one will ultimately fall. It is like a tree without roots transplanted by the water; although it may remain fresh for a while, it will eventually wither.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 另一方面，著名但平庸的学者却教导人们去探寻每一件事的原理。他们的学问完全没有基础。一个人年轻的时候，可以暂时装出一副好样子，似乎并没有错。但人老了，精神就会衰退，最终就会垮掉。这就像一棵没有根的树。6 当它被移栽到水边时，虽然暂时看起来清新美丽，但久而久之，终将枯萎。"

text.man_en: “Take for instance building this house. Setting your will on the Way means setting the mind constantly on selecting the plot, collecting the material, planning and completing this small house. Having a firm grasp on virtue means that the completed plan can firmly be grasped. Relying on humanity means always to five in this small house without leaving, and finding recreation in the arts means to add decorations to the house to beautify it.

The 'Yoyi' is to add some paintings to beautify the mansion.

When you are in the district house, you will not leave; the "entertainment" is to add some painting style to beautify the district house.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: "以建造这座房子为例。立志于道，就是要不断地把心思放在选择地块、收集材料、规划和完成这座小房子上。立德，就是要牢牢把握已完成的规划。以人为本，就是要经常五体投地地呆在这所小房子里，不离开它；从艺术中寻找娱乐，就是要为房子增添装饰，美化它。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “以建造这座房子为例。定志在路上意味着不断地下定决心选择地块、收集材料、规划和完成这座小房子。牢牢把握德，就可以牢牢把握完成的计划。依靠人文，就是在这个小房子里永远五个人不离不弃，在艺术中寻找休闲，就是给房子增添装饰，美化它。

text.ori_cn: 艺者义也，理之所宜者也。

text.ori_cn: 且如读书时，良知知得强记之心不是，即克去之，有欲速之心不是，即克去之，有夸多斗靡之心不是，即克去之：如此亦只是终日与圣贤印对，是个纯乎天理之心。
text.man_en: Take this matter of reading. Innate knowledge knows that it is wrong to try to force oneself to memorize, and when there is such an intention it immediately overcomes it and gets rid of it. It knows that impatience is wrong, and if there is such an intention it immediately overcomes it and gets rid of it. It knows that to strive for plenty and to boast about excess is wrong, and if there is such an intention it immediately overcomes it and gets rid of it. Thus one is in perfect accord with sages and worthies at all times, and his mind becomes completely identified with the Principle of Nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: And such as reading, the conscience knows that the strong memory of the heart is not, that is, grams to go, there is a desire to speed of the heart is not, that is, grams to go, there are exaggerated more than the heart of the fight is not, that is, grams to go: so it is only all the time with the sages and sages printed on the right, it is purely the heart of the Divine Principle.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: And just like when reading, if you have a good conscience and know that the desire to memorize is not right, then overcome it; if you have the desire to haste, you should overcome it; if you have the intention of boasting and fighting, then overcome it: this is just the same thing all day long. If you have the right seal of sages, you have a pure heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: And when reading, if the mind knows that the intent to memorize strongly is wrong, then it should be eliminated; if the desire for quick success is wrong, then it should be eliminated; if the mind is inclined to show off one's extensive knowledge, then it should also be eliminated. I have heard that prominence in public life or obscurity depend on fate. People with the highest intelligence probably do not care for civil service examinations. But I, unworthy one, am a slave to fame and profit and am willing to do this. I only bring sorrow to myself.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He said: "Although I have been enlightened, my qualifications are mediocre, and it is inevitable that I will be tired. I have heard that the poor have a destiny, and the wise people may despise this dishonor and interfere with their fame and fortune, so they are willing to live in pain for this."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He said, 'Although I have been enlightened by your teachings, given my mediocre talent, I find it truly hard to avoid difficulties. I have heard that prosperity and decline are predestined. Such wisdom, I fear, is scorned by the truly intelligent, who disdain being swayed by fame and fortune, and willingly endure hardships for it.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我说："您虽然开导了我，可惜我能力有限，实在难以避免这种麻烦。我听说，出人头地还是默默无闻，要看命运的安排。聪明绝顶的人可能不屑于参加公务员考试。而我，不肖之人，名利的奴隶，甘愿如此。我只会给自己带来悲哀。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我说：虽然你开导了我，但可惜我的能力低下，确实很难避免这样的麻烦。我听说在公共生活中显赫或默默无闻取决于命运。智力最高的人可能不关心公务员考试。而我，一个不配的人，一个名利的奴隶，却甘愿这么做。我只会给自己带来悲伤。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“此事归辞于亲者多矣；其实只是无志。

text.ori_cn: 志立得时，良知千事万事只是一事。
text.man_en: If one's purpose is established, so far as innate knowledge is concerned, one's thousand acts and tens of thousands of deeds are only one.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the will is established, the conscience knows that a thousand things are but one thing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When determination is achieved, conscience knows that everything is just one thing.

text.ori_cn: 又曰“人若着实用功随人毁谤，随人欺慢，处处得益，处处是进德之资；若不用功，只是魔也，终被累倒。”
text.man_en: He again said, “If one is genuinely and earnestly devoted to his task, let people slander him and let them insult him. He will gain in everything and everything will become for him material for the advancement of virtue. If he does not exert effort, everything will have an evil effect on him and he will ultimately be ruined. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He also said, "If people really use their efforts with others to slander, with others to deceive, everywhere benefit, everywhere is the capital of virtue; if not use their efforts, but only the devil, and ultimately be exhausted."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He also said, "If a person uses his practice and follows others to slander and bully him, he will benefit from everything, and it will be a source of virtue; if he does not practice, he is just a demon and will eventually be exhausted."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is also said, 'If one truly applies oneself diligently, despite slander and arrogance from others, one will benefit everywhere, and every encounter will be an opportunity to advance in virtue. If one does not apply oneself, these will merely be obstacles, eventually leading to downfall.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他又说："如果一个人真心诚意地献身于他的事业，任凭人们诽谤他，任凭人们侮辱他。他将获得一切，一切都将成为他提升美德的材料。如果他不努力，一切都会对他产生恶果，他最终会毁灭。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他又说：“如果一个人真心实意地做事，就让人们诽谤他，让人们侮辱他。他会得到一切，一切都会成为他提升德行的材料。如果他不努力，一切都会对他产生不好的影响，最终他会被毁掉。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他又说，“如果一个人真诚而认真地致力于他的任务，让人们诽谤他、侮辱他吧。他将在一切方面获益，一切都会成为他提升美德的材料。如果他不努力，一切都会对他产生邪恶的影响，最终他将被毁灭。”

text.ori_cn: 范兆期在旁曰：“此只是有根。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“卜筮是理，理亦是卜筮。

text.ori_cn: 不知今之，师友问答，博学、审问、慎思、明辨、笃行之类，皆是卜筮。

text.ori_cn: 人只贵于自修，若自己实实落落是个圣贤，纵然人都毁他，也说他不着；却若浮云掩日如何损得日的光明。
text.man_en: The important thing is for a man to cultivate his own virtue. If one is truly and definitely a sage or a worthy, even if people slander him, it will not affect him. It is like floating clouds obscuring the sun. How can they hurt its brilliance ?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People are only precious to self-cultivation, if they are really a sage, even if people are ruining him, they can't say anything about him; but if the floating clouds cover the sun how to damage the brightness of the day.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People only value self-cultivation. If you are truly a sage, even if others slander you, you will say that you are useless. But if clouds cover the sun, how can you damage the brightness of the sun?

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 重要的是一个人要修养自己的德行。如果一个人真正地、绝对地成为圣贤或有价值的人，即使别人诽谤他，也不会影响到他。这就像浮云遮住了太阳。岂能伤其光辉？
