text.ori_cn: 曰：“我不是要打做一个，如曰“夫道一而已矣。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “I do not lump them together as one. It has been said, ‘The Way is one and only one. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He said, "I am not going to fight to make one, such as said, "The road one is just carry on.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Said: "I don't want to make one, just like, "The husband's way is just one."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He said, 'I am not trying to make anything, yet the Way is simply one and only one.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："我没有把它们混为一谈。有人说：'道是唯一的。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“我不把它们混为一谈。俗话说：‘道是唯一的。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说，“我不把它们归为一类。有人说，'道只有一个，且仅此一个。'

text.ori_cn: ’又曰“其为物不二，则其生物不测。”
text.man_en: It is also said, ‘ [Heaven and earth] are without any doubleness and so they produce things in an unfathomable way. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: ' It is also said, "If it is not two things, then its creatures are unpredictable."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: ’ He also said, “It is a non-dual thing, so its creatures are unpredictable.”
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is also said, 'Since it is singular and unparalleled, its ability to create things is beyond measure.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 又曰：'[天地]无双，故生万物，深不可测。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 又曰：‘天地无二，故生万物莫测。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 还说，‘[天地]无任何二心，所以他们以不可测的方式创造万物。’

text.ori_cn: 〔7〕“心不是一块血肉，凡知觉处便是心；如耳目之知视听，手足之知痛痒，此知觉便是心也。”
text.man_en: [7] "The heart is not a piece of flesh and blood. Every place of perception is the heart. For example, the ears and eyes know sight and hearing, and the hands and feet know pain and itching. This perception is the heart. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [7] "The heart is not a piece of flesh and blood, but wherever there is perception it is the heart; as the ears and eyes know sight and hearing, and the hands and feet know pain and itch, so this perception is the heart."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [7] "The heart is not a piece of flesh and blood. Every place of perception is the heart. For example, the ears and eyes know sight and hearing, and the hands and feet know pain and itching. This perception is the heart."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: "The mind is not merely flesh and blood; wherever there is perception, there is the mind. For instance, the ear and eye perceive sight and sound, and the hands and feet perceive pain and itching. This perception is the mind."
text.man_en2dpl_cn: [7] "心不是一块血肉。每个感知的地方都是心。例如，耳目知视听，手足知痛痒。这种感知就是心。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: [7]“心不是一块血肉，每一个感知处都是心。比如耳朵、眼睛知道视觉和听觉，手脚知道疼痛和痒。这个感知就是心。” ”。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 心不单单是血肉之驱。每一个知觉的地方都是心。例如，耳朵和眼睛感知到视觉和听觉，手和脚感知到疼痛和痒。这种知觉就是心。

text.ori_cn: 〔8〕以方问曰：“先生之说“格物”，凡《中庸》之“慎独”及“集义”“博约”等说，皆为‘格物”之事。”
text.man_en: I said, “According to your doctrine of the investigation of things, when the Doctrine of the Mean teaches people to be watchful over themselves when alone, when [Mencius taught people to] accumulate righteous deeds, and when [Confucius taught] the extensive study of literature and restraining oneself with the rules of propriety, they are each teaching different ways of investigating things. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [8] to Fang asked: "Mr. said, "Ge thing", where the "Zhongyong" of the "prudence" and "set righteousness" and so on are 'Ge thing'". Bojiao" and so on, all for the 'Ge Shi' thing."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔8〕Yifang Wen said: "The teacher's talk about "investigating things", and all the "Shendu", "Jiyi" and "Boyue" in "The Doctrine of the Mean" are all matters of "investigating things". "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: [8] The inquirer asked: Sir, regarding your discourse on the investigation of things, do the concepts of cautiousness in solitude and the extensive collection of righteous and broad learning as mentioned in the Doctrine of the Mean all pertain to the investigation of things?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我说："按照你们的考察事物的学说，《中庸》教人独处时要警惕自己，[孟子]教人要积累义行，[孔子]教人要博览群书，用礼法约束自己，它们分别教人考察事物的不同方法。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我说：“按照你的格物论，中庸教人独处的时候，积累正义的时候，博学的时候文与礼的节制，都在教授着不同的格物之道。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我说：“按照你的格物致知学说，当《中庸》教导人们在独处时要谨慎自守，当《孟子》教导人们积善行而成德，当《论语》教导人们博学于文，约之以礼，他们分别是在教导不同的格物方法。”

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“非也，格物即慎独，即戒惧；至于‘集义’‘博约’，工夫只一般，不是以那数件都做‘格物’底事。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “This is not true. The investigation of things is the same as being watchful over oneself when alone. It is the same as being cautious and apprehensive. From these efforts to the accumulation of righteous deeds, the extensive study of literature, and restraining oneself with the rules of propriety, the task is the same. They are not to be considered as several and separate ways of investigating things. ”

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："不是这样的。对事物的探究与独处时对自己的警惕是一样的。这与谨慎和忧虑是一样的。从积德行善、博览群书到以礼节约束自己，都是一样的。它们不应被视为几种不同的探究事物的方法。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老师说：“这不是真的。对事物的考察，就像独处时的自我警醒一样。这与谨慎和忧虑是一样的。从这些努力到积累义行、博学文献、克制礼法，任务都是一样的。它们不应被视为调查事物的几种不同的方式。 ”

text.ori_cn: 〔9〕以方问“尊德性”一条。

text.ori_cn: 问“致广大”二句。

text.ori_cn: 曰：“念虑之精微，即事理之精微也。”

text.ori_cn: 〔21〕问：“人心与物同体，如吾身原是血气流通的，所以谓之同体：若于人便异体了，禽、兽、草、木益远矣。
text.man_en: I said, “The human mind and things form the same body. In the case of one's body, blood and the vital force in fact circulate through it and therefore we can say they form the same body. In the case of men, their bodies are different and differ even more from those of animals and plants.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [21] asked: "The human heart and things with the same body, such as my body is originally the circulation of blood and gas, so it is called the same body: if in the human body will be different, birds, animals, grass, wood, more far away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [21] Question: "The human heart and things are of the same body. For example, my body is originally a blood-flowing body, so it is said to be of the same body. If it were a different body for humans, birds, beasts, grass, and trees would be far away."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Q[21]: 'The human heart and the material world are of the same essence, just as my own body circulates blood and energy, thus they are called the same essence. But when it comes to other people, they are considered different essences, and the distance grows even larger with animals, plants, and trees.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我说："人的思想和事物构成同一个身体。就人的身体而言，血液和生命力实际上在其中循环，因此我们可以说它们构成了同一个身体。而人的身体则不同，与动物和植物的身体差别更大。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我说：人心与物同体。就人的身体而言，血液和元气实际上是在其中循环的，因此可以说它们是同一个身体。就人类而言，他们的身体不同，而且与动植物的身体不同。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我说：“人心与物同体。就身体而言，血液和活力实际上在体内循环，因此我们可以说它们是同一个体。在人的情况下，他们的身体是不同的，并且与动物和植物的身体差别更大。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“你只在感应之几上看；岂但禽、兽、草、木，虽天、地也与我同体的，鬼、神也与我同体的。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “Just look at the matter from the point of view of the subtle incipient activating force of their mutual influence and response. Not only animals and plants, but heaven and earth also, form the same body with me. Spiritual beings also form the same body with me. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman said, "Thou seest only in the several of the senses; not only the fowls, the beasts, the grass, and the wood, but also the heaven and the earth, though they be one with me, and the ghosts, and the gods, are also one with me."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The teacher said: "You only see it through the induction. Not only the birds, beasts, grass, and trees, but also the sky and the earth are of the same body with me. Ghosts and gods are also of the same body with me."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said, 'You merely observe from the vantage point of sensation; not only are birds, beasts, plants, and trees of the same essence as I am, but even heaven and earth, as well as spirits and deities, share this same essence with me.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："只要从它们相互影响、相互反应的微妙萌发激活力的角度来看问题就可以了。不仅是动物和植物，天地也与我同体。灵物亦与我同体。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“只要从它们相互影响、反应的微妙的原始动力来看问题就可以了。不仅动物、植物，连天地也与我同体。神灵也与我同体。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“只要从他们相互影响和回应的微妙初始激活力的角度来看。不仅动物和植物，甚至天地也与我同体。 灵性存在也与我同体。”

text.ori_cn: 请问。
text.man_en: I asked the Teacher kindly to explain.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Please ask.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Excuse me.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Excuse me.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我恳请老师解释一下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 请老师解释一下。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我恳请老师解释。

text.ori_cn: 对曰：“尝闻人是天地的心。”
text.man_en: He said to him, "Taste and hear that people are the heart of heaven and earth. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The response was, "I have heard that man is the heart of heaven and earth."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He said to him, "Taste and hear that people are the heart of heaven and earth."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He replied, 'I have heard that humans are the heart of heaven and earth.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他对他说："尝一尝，听一听，人是天地之心。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对他说：“尝听，人是天地之心。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他说：“尝一尝，听一听，人乃天地之心。”

text.ori_cn: 对曰：“只是一个灵明。”
text.man_en: He replied: "It's just a spiritual being. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The response was, "It's just a Spiritual Mind."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He replied: "It's just a spiritual being."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The answer was: 'It is simply a clear mind.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他回答说"那只是一种精神存在"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他回答说：“这只是一个精神存在。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他回答道：“那只是一个灵体。”

text.ori_cn: “可知充天塞地中间，只有这个灵明。
text.man_en: “We know, then, in all that fills heaven and earth there is but this clear intelligence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: "You may know that in the middle of the sky-filling and stuffed earth, there is only this Spiritual Light.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "You know, in the midst of the vast world, there is only this bright light.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is evident that in the vast universe, there is only this clarity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "那么，我们知道，在天地万物中，只有这种清晰的智慧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “那么，我们知道，在充满天地的万物中，只有这种清晰的智慧。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，我们知道，无论是充满天地的一切，还是清晰的智慧，都是相同的。

text.ori_cn: 人只为形体自间隔了。
text.man_en: It is only because of their physical forms and bodies that men are separated.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Man has spaced himself only for the form.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Man is separated from himself only by his body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Humans are only separated by their physical forms.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只是因为他们的外形和身体，人类才被分开。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只是因为他们的身体形态和身体，人们才被分开。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正是因为他们的身体形态和肉体，人们才被分开。

text.ori_cn: 我的灵明，便是天、地、鬼、神的主宰。
text.man_en: My clear intelligence is the master of heaven and earth and spiritual beings.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: My Spiritual Mind is the Lord of Heaven, Earth, Ghosts and Gods.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: My spirit is the master of heaven, earth, ghosts, and gods.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: My enlightened spirit is the master of heaven, earth, ghosts, and gods.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我的清明智慧是天地灵物的主宰。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我的清明智慧，是天地灵物的主宰。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我的聪明智慧是天地和灵性生物的主宰。

text.ori_cn: 天、地、鬼、神、万物，离却我的灵明，便没有天、地、鬼、神、万物了；我的灵明，离却天、地、鬼、神、万物，亦没有我的灵明。
text.man_en: Separated from my clear intelligence, there will be no heaven, earth, spiritual beings, or myriad things, and separated from these, there will not be my clear intelligence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, or all things apart from my spiritual illumination; nor is there my spiritual illumination apart from heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, or all things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, and all things are separated from my spirit, there will be no heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, and all things. If my spirit is separated from heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, and all things, there will be no me. of wisdom.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, all things—without my enlightenment, there would be no heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, or all things; without heaven, earth, ghosts, gods, and all things, there would be no my enlightenment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 离开了我的清明智慧，就没有天地灵物和万物；离开了天地灵物和万物，就没有我的清明智慧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 离了我的清明，就没有天、地、灵体万物，离了这些，也就没有我的清明。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 离开了我的明智，就没有天、地、神灵和万物，离开了这些，也没有我的明智。

text.ori_cn: 〔22〕先生起行征思田，德洪与汝中追送严滩，汝中举佛家实相幻相之说。
text.man_en: Our Teacher began his journey to Ssuen and T'ienchou to subdue the rebellion. Wang Juchung and I [Ch'ien Tehung] followed after him and saw him off at Yent'an. Juchung raised the question of the Buddhist doctrine of the true state of dharmas [elements of existence] and illusory state of dharmas.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr [22] started his journey to conquer Sida, Dehong and Ruzhong pursued Yan Tan, and Ruzhong cited the Buddhist doctrine of the illusion of reality.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔22〕The gentleman set out to conquer Sitian. Dehong and Ruzhong pursued Yantan, and Ruzhong raised the Buddhist theory of reality and illusion.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mr. (surname) embarked on his journey to Sitian, accompanied by Dehong and Ruzhong who escorted him to Yantan. Ruzhong raised the Buddhist concepts of ultimate reality and illusory appearances.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我们的老师开始前往宣州和汀州平叛。王居中和我[钱德洪]追随其后，在延安为他送行。居中提出了佛教教义中 "诸法（存在的要素）的真实状态 "和 "诸法的虚幻状态 "的问题。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我们的老师开始了他前往春和田州镇压叛乱的旅程。我与王居忠（钱德宏）尾随其后，到盐安送行。竹琼提出了佛教教义中的真实法境和虚幻法境的问题。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我們的老師開始了他的旅程，前往祅和天竺以平定叛亂。王居中與我（錢德宏）跟隨他，並在燕潭為他送行。居中提出了有關佛教真實法界和幻法界的問題。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“有心俱是实，无心俱是幻；无心俱是实，有心俱是幻。”
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “Wherever the [original] mind is, there is the true state. Wherever the [original] mind is not, there is the illusory state. At the same time, wherever the [subjective] mind is not, there is the true state, and wherever the [subjective] mind is, there is the illusory state. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman said, "All minds are real, and no minds are illusory; all minds are real, and all minds are illusory."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Master said: "Everything with a heart is real, and everything without a heart is an illusion; everything without a heart is real, and everything with a heart is an illusion."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The master said: 'When the mind is involved, everything is real; when the mind is detached, everything is illusion. When the mind is detached, everything is real; when the mind is involved, everything is illusion.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："哪里有[本]心，哪里就是真境。哪里没有[本]心，哪里就是幻境。同时，哪里没有[主观]之心，哪里就有真实之境；哪里有[主观]之心，哪里就有虚幻之境。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老师说：“心在哪里，哪里就有真实的境界。凡是没有心的地方，就有虚幻的境界。同时，凡没有心的地方，就有真实的境界；凡有心的地方，就有虚幻的境界。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“原心所在之处，即是真实状态。原心不在之处，即是虚幻状态。同时，主观心不在之处，即是真实状态，主观心所在之处，即是虚幻状态。”

text.ori_cn: 汝中曰：“有心俱是实，无心俱是幻，是本体上说工夫：无心俱是实，有心俱是幻，是工夫上说本体。”
text.man_en: Juchung said, “When you say ‘Wherever the mind is, there is the true state and wherever the mind is not, there is the illusory state, ' you are talking about the task from the point of view of the original substance of the mind, and when you say, ‘Wherever the mind is not, there is the true state, and wherever the mind is, there is the illusory state, ' you are talking about the original substance from the point of view of the task. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ruzhong said, "To have a mind that is all real, and to have no mind that is all illusory, is to speak of work on the body: to have no mind that is all real, and to have a mind that is all illusory, is to speak of work on the body."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ru Zhong said: "With a mind, everything is real, without a mind, everything is an illusion. This is the essence of Kung Fu. Without a mind, everything is real. With a mind, everything is an illusion. This is the essence of the Kung Fu."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ru Zhong said, 'When there is intention, all is real; when there is no intention, all is illusion. This speaks of the practice from the perspective of the essence: When there is no intention, all is real; when there is intention, all is illusion. This speaks of the essence from the perspective of the practice.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 居中说："说'有心处即是真境，无心处即是幻境'，是从心的本体角度谈任务；说'无心处即是真境，有心处即是幻境'，是从任务角度谈本体。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 居忠说：“当你说‘心在哪里，就有真实的境界；心不在哪里，就有虚幻的境界’，你是从心的本来本体的角度来谈论这项任务。 ，当你说“心不在的地方就是真实的境界，心在的地方就是幻的境界”时，你是从任务的角度谈论本体。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 巨冲说：“当你说‘心之所在，即是真实状态，而心之不在，即是虚幻状态’时，你是从心的本体角度讨论任务；当你说‘心之不在，即是真实状态，而心之所在，即是虚幻状态’时，你是从任务的角度讨论心的本体。”

text.ori_cn: 先生然其言。

text.ori_cn: 洪于是时尚未了达，数年用功，始信本体、工夫合一。

text.ori_cn: 〔23〕尝见先生送二三耆宿出门，退坐于中轩，若有忧色。
text.man_en: I once saw our Teacher bid farewell to two or three elderly gentlemen at the gate. He withdrew and sat in the vestibule and appeared to be sad.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [23] I have seen Mr. sent two or three seniors out, retired to sit in the middle, if there is a worried look.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔23〕I saw Mr. seeing two or three elders out and retreated to sit in the middle pavilion, looking worried.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I once saw the gentleman sending off two or three elderly guests at the door, then returning to sit in the central hall, appearing somewhat worried.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有一次，我看到我们的老师在门口向两三位老先生告别。他退了出来，坐在前厅里，显得很悲伤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有一次我看到师父在门口告别了两三位老先生。他退了出去，坐在前厅里，看上去很悲伤。

text.ori_cn: 德洪趋进请问。
text.man_en: I walked quickly forward to ask what the matter was.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Dehong tends to come in and ask questions.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Dehong Chijin, please ask.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Dehong, may I ask you something?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我快步上前询问是怎么回事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我快步走上前去询问到底是怎么回事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我快步走上前去问是什么事。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰：“顷与诸老论及此学，真圆凿方柄。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “I have just discussed learning with these elders. Like trying to put a square into a circle, I got nowhere with them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr said: "ha and all the old discuss this learning, really round chisel square handle.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The Master said: "I was discussing this study with other elders, and it was like a round chisel with a square handle.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said, 'In my recent discussions with the elders about this study, it truly felt like trying to fit a round peg into a square hole.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："我刚刚和这些长者讨论了学习问题。就像把正方形放进圆圈一样，我和他们毫无进展。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先生说：“我刚刚和这些长辈讨论了学问。就像试图把一个正方形变成一个圆圈一样，我毫无进展。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“我刚刚和这些长辈讨论了学习问题。就像试图把方块放进圆圈里一样，我没能与他们达成共识。”

text.ori_cn: 德洪退谓朋友曰：“先生诲人，不择衰朽，仁人悯物之心也。”
text.man_en: I withdrew and told friends, “In teaching people our teacher does not prefer others to the senile. His is the mind of a humane man with compassion toward things. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Dehong retired and said to his friend, "Mr Teach, do not choose to decay, benevolent and compassionate heart."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Dehong Tui said to his friend: "Sir, when you teach people, you should not choose decay, and you have a benevolent heart and compassion for things."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Dehong stepped back and said to his friends, 'The teacher instructs without discriminating against the old and frail; it is the benevolent heart of a compassionate person.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我退了出来，对朋友们说："在教书育人方面，我们的老师并不偏爱他人，而偏爱老年人。他是一个对事物怀有同情心的人。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我退了出去，对朋友们说：“老师教人，不喜欢别人，不喜欢老人。他的心是慈悲万物的仁人之心。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我退了出来，告诉朋友们：“在教导人方面，我们的老师不偏爱年轻人。他的心肠是仁慈的，对所有事物都充满了同情心。”

text.ori_cn: 〔24〕先生曰：“人生大病，只是一傲字。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, “A great defect in life is pride.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mr [24] said: "Life's big disease, just a word of pride.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 〔24〕The teacher said: "A serious illness in life is just a word of pride.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Mister said, 'The gravest ailment in life is but a single word: arrogance.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："人生的一大缺陷就是骄傲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老师说：“人生最大的缺陷就是骄傲。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“人生中一个很大的缺陷是骄傲。”

text.ori_cn: 为子而傲必不孝，为臣而傲必不忠，为父而傲必不慈，为友而傲必不信。
text.man_en: The proud son is sure not to be filial, nor the proud minister loyal, nor the proud father affectionate, nor the proud friend faithful.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be proud of a son is to be unfilial, to be proud of a minister is to be unfaithful, to be proud of a father is to be unkind, and to be proud of a friend is to be untrustworthy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To be proud of a son is unfilial; to be proud of a minister is unfaithful; to be proud of a father is unkind; to be proud of a friend is untrustworthy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Pride in being a child leads to unfilial conduct, pride in being a subject leads to disloyalty, pride in being a father leads to unkindness, and pride in being a friend leads to untrustworthiness.

text.ori_cn: 诸君常要体此人心本是天然之理，精精明明，无纤介染着，只是一无我而已：胸中切不可有，有即傲也。
text.man_en: You gentlemen should always realize this personally: the human mind is in fact the natural principle. It is refined and clear without an iota of defilement or selfish attachment. It is just a nonego. One must not harbor any egoism in the mind. To do so means to have pride.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: You must always understand that the human heart is a natural principle, shrewd and clear, without any fiber or taint, it is just selfless: it must not be in your chest, for if you have it, you are proud.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: You should always understand that the human mind is inherently natural, clear and bright without the slightest taint; it is merely devoid of self: there must be nothing in the heart, for having anything means arrogance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先生们，你们应该始终亲自认识到这一点：人类的心灵其实是自然的原则。它精致而清晰，没有一丝污秽或自私的执着。它只是一个非自我。人的心中不能有任何自我。这样做意味着骄傲。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 诸君必须亲自体悟到这一点：人心其实就是自然之道。它是纯净清澈的，没有一丝一毫的污染或自私的执着。它就是无我。心中不可存有任何的自我主义。那样就是骄傲。

text.man_en: The Teacher said, “Innate knowledge is the same as changes. ‘As the Way, it changes frequently. It changes and moves without staying in one place, flowing about into any one of the six places of the hexagram. It ascends and descends without any constancy, and its elements of strength (yang) and weakness (yin) interchange. It cannot be considered as an invariable standard. 6 It changes to suit the circumstances. '

text.ori_cn: 此道本无穷尽，问难愈多，则精微愈显。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 嘉庆七年冬天，我和王久忠赶去参加老师的葬礼。当我们到达宽信寺时，我们向所有同门发出了讣告，并邀请他们在三年内收集和记录我们老师的说法。

text.ori_cn: 非鬼迷也，心自迷耳。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who is in the Way, has the knowledge of birth and safe conduct, and the knowledge of learning and beneficial conduct; and he who is underneath, must be a man one and a hundred, and a man ten and a thousand.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the Tao, one knows how to live and practice safely, and learns and knows how to benefit from practice. Those who are inferior to him must be a hundred people for one person, and a thousand people for ten people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Regarding the Way: some are born with knowledge and act with ease; some learn to gain knowledge and act efficiently. For those who are less talented, they must put in a hundredfold effort to match others' one, and a thousandfold to match others' ten.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 关于圣人的学说，有些人与生俱来就懂得，自然而然就能践行，而有些人则是通过学习而懂得，并为自己的利益而践行。低于平均水平的人必须付出百倍的努力，而其他人则付出十倍的努力；低于平均水平的人必须付出千倍的努力，而其他人则付出万倍的努力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对于圣人的教义，有的人是天生就有知识，可以自然而然地实践的；有的人是通过学习而学到的，并为自己的利益而实践。低于平均水平的人必须在别人努力一的地方努力一百，在别人努力十的地方努力一千。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 参考圣人的教义，有些人生而知之，能自然轻松地实践，而另一些人则通过学习知之并为己所用。那些资质平庸者需要付出百倍他人的努力，千倍他人的辛劳。

text.ori_cn: 〔14〕侃问:"先儒以心之静为体，心之动为用。

text.ori_cn: 体当自家心体，常要鉴空衡平，这便是未发之中”。
text.man_en: Realize the substance of the mind through personal experience at all times and see to it that it is as clear as a mirror and as even as a balance. Then you will find the equilibrium before the feelings are aroused. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the body is the body of one's own mind, it is always necessary to identify the empty space and balance the level, and this is the middle of the undeveloped".
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The body should be its own mind and body, and it must always be aware of the emptiness and balance, which is the undeveloped state."

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 通过亲身经历，时刻领悟心灵的实质，让它像镜子一样清晰，像天平一样平衡。这样，你就能在情感唤起之前找到平衡。"

text.ori_cn: 〔26〕正之问:"戒惧是己所不知时工夫。
text.man_en: Huang Chengchih asked, "When one does not know a thing, his task is to be apprehensive.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [26] Masayuki asked, "Fear is a practice when you do not know what you are doing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: [26] Zhengzhi asked: "Being wary of fear is a matter of time and effort when you don't know what you don't know."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Zheng Zhi asked: ‘Caution and fear are the efforts made when one is unaware.’
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 黄承赤问："人不知而不愠，其为人也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 黄成志问道：“当一个人不知道一件事时，他的任务就是惶恐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 黃成志問道：“當一個人不知道某件事情時，他的任務是要感到擔憂。”

text.ori_cn: 慎独是己所独知时工夫。
text.man_en: When one alone knows it, his task is to be watchful over himself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Being prudent is an endeavour when you know only what you are doing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Being cautious is the time and effort of knowing what one knows.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Prudent solitary reflection is the practice of self-awareness in solitude.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当只有一个人知道这一点时，他的任务就是警惕自己。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当一个人知道这一点时，他的任务就是警惕自己。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当只有一个人知道时，他的任务就是时刻警惕自己。

text.ori_cn: 先生曰:"只是一个工夫。
text.man_en: The Teacher said, "Both are the same task.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman said: "It's just a work in progress.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The teacher said: "It's just a matter of time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The gentleman said, 'It's just a matter of time.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 老师说："两者是相同的任务。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老师说：“两者是同一个任务。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 老师说：“这两项任务是一样的。”

text.ori_cn: 无事时固是独知。
text.man_en: When nothing happens, of course [what is going on in one's mind] is privately known to him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When there is nothing going on, it is certainly a unique knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When nothing happens, he is alone.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When there is nothing, it is known only to oneself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当什么都没发生时，[一个人心里在想什么]当然是他自己知道的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 没事的时候，当然是他私下里知道的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当什么都没有发生时，[一个人心里在想什么]当然是他自己私下知道的。

text.ori_cn: 有事时亦是独知。
text.man_en: But when things do happen, it is also privately known to him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When something is wrong, it is also known alone.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When something happens, he knows it alone.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When something arises, only you know it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但是，当事情发生时，他也会私下知道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但当事情真的发生的时候，他也是私下里知道的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但当事情发生时，他自己也是私下知道的。

text.ori_cn: 人若不知于此独知之地用力，只在人所共知处用功，便是作伪，便是‘见君子而后厌然’。
text.man_en: If people do not exert effort toward what is privately known to them and exert it only toward what is publicly known, this is to act hypocritically and to ‘disguise themselves when they see a superior man. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a man does not know how to exert himself in this place of exclusive knowledge, but only in the place of common knowledge, he is a hypocrite, and is 'disgusted at the sight of a gentleman'.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person does not know how to exert force in this unique place and only uses it in a place that is known to everyone, he is being hypocritical and "seeing a gentleman and then becoming disgusted with it."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one does not exert effort in this exclusive domain of knowledge, but only works in the realm of common understanding, it is deceitful, akin to being insincere only after meeting a noble person.

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果人们不在私下里努力，并且只在公开场合努力，这就是虚伪的行为，是‘见到君子而假装自己’。

text.ori_cn: 此独知处便是诚的萌芽。
text.man_en: This condition of private knowledge is the root of sincerity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This unique knowledge is the germ of sincerity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This unique knowledge is the germ of sincerity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This alone, being aware of it, is the budding of sincerity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这种私人知识的条件是真诚的根源。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这种私人知识的条件是真诚的根源。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这种私密知识的状态是真诚的根源。

text.ori_cn: 此处不论善念恶念，更无虚假。
text.man_en: Hence all thoughts, whether good or evil, are genuine.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no falsehood here regardless of good or bad thoughts, much less falsehood.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There are no good or bad thoughts here, let alone falsehood.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Here, neither good nor evil thoughts exist, and there is no falsehood.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，所有思想，无论善恶，都是真实的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，一切念头，无论是善念还是恶念，都是真实的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，所有的思想，无论善恶，都是真实的。

text.ori_cn: 一是百是，一错百错。
text.man_en: If one step is correct here, all the following steps will be correct, but if one mistake is made here, a hundred mistakes will follow.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: One is a hundred, and one is wrong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: One thing is right and a hundred things are right, one thing is wrong and a hundred things are wrong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A single truth leads to all truths; a single mistake leads to a hundred errors.

text.ori_cn: 正是王霸义利诚伪善恶界头。
text.man_en: It is the point of departure between the kingly way of moral principles and the despotic way of power, between righteousness and profit, between sincerity and insincerity, and between good and evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the head of the world of king and bully, of righteousness and sincerity, of goodness and evil.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is Wang Ba, justice, profit, honesty, hypocrisy, good and evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Indeed, this is the threshold between the rule of kings and hegemony, righteousness and profit, sincerity and falsehood, good and evil.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 它是道德原则的王道与权力的专制之间、义与利之间、诚与不诚之间、善与恶之间的出发点。

text.ori_cn: 于此一立立定，便是端本澄源，便是立诚。
text.man_en: If at this point one makes a firm stand, then the foundation will be correct and the source will be pure. This means that sincerity has been established.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To establish one's determination at this point is to establish the original source and to establish sincerity.

text.ori_cn: 〔27〕志道问:"荀子云:‘养心莫善于诚’。
text.man_en: Chihtao69 asked, "Hsiin Tzu [fl. 298238b. c. ] said that ‘to nourish the mind there is nothing better than sincerity. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [27] Zhidao asked: "Xunzi Yun: 'Nurturing the heart is not better than sincerity'.

text.ori_cn: 〔33〕马子莘问:"修道之教，旧说谓圣人品节吾性之固有，以为法于天下，若礼乐刑政之属。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: [33] Ma Zixin asked: "Cultivation of the teachings, the old saying is that the saint character section of our nature of the inherent, as the law in the world, such as rituals and music, the genus of criminal justice.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 马祖辛问道：“对于教育在于修道的学说，传统的解释是圣人调节和限制他本来的本性。他的天赋使他成为世界的典范，他的规定和限制导致了仪式、音乐、法律和政府措施等。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 马子信问：“关于‘教育在于培养道’的学说（如《中庸》所述），传统解释是圣人调节和限制他所赋予的天性，以便他可以成为世界的典范，他的调节和限制导致了礼仪、音乐、法律和政府措施等事物。”

text.ori_cn: 若在他人，须告以为政在人，取人以身，修身以道，修道以仁，达道九经，及诚身许多工夫，方始做得这个，方是万世常行之道。
text.man_en: With others, it would be necessary to tell them that the conduct of government depends on man, that the right men are obtained by means of the ruler's personal character, that to cultivate his personal character the ruler must follow the Way, and that the cultivation of the Way is to be done through cherishing humanity. It is also necessary to tell them about the universal path of human relations and the nine universal standards and the many tasks of making the will sincere. Only then can this [the fundamental way of government] be achieved. And only then can we have the system to be followed for ten thousand generations.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If in others, must tell to the politics in people, take people to body, cultivate body to the road, cultivate the road to benevolence, up to the road of the nine scriptures, and sincere body many work, only to do this, only is the way of the world to always do.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 对于其他人，有必要告诉他们，政府的行为取决于人，正确的人是通过统治者的个人品格获得的，要修养个人品格，统治者必须遵循 "道"，而 "道 "的修养是通过珍视人性来实现的。还必须告诉他们人与人之间关系的普遍之道、九种普遍标准以及使意志真诚的诸多任务。只有这样，才能做到这一点（治国的根本之道）。也只有这样，我们才能拥有万代遵循的制度。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 对别人来说，就要告诉他们：政事在人，贤人靠君子的品德而得之，君子修身必须遵循道，修身养性。道之道，乃以仁爱而行。还要告诉他们人伦的普遍道路和九项普遍标准以及使意志真诚的许多任务。只有这样，才能做到这一点。只有这样，我们才能有万代遵循的制度。
